English: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Jêrêmi kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia. Sư minh lăm lu 'bok soi oei tơ pơlei Anathôt, lăm char Bênjamin.

English: to whom the word of the LORD came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ sư lăm sơnăm mơjĭt-pêng kơplah Jôsia, kon drŏ-nglo Ammôn pơgơ̆r pơm pơtao đe Juđa.

English: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan kơ sư dơ̆ng lăm chăl Jêhôiakim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơm pơtao đe Juđa, dĭng truh tơ khei pơđăm sơnăm mơjĭt-mônh chăl pơtao Sêđekia kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơm pơtao đe Juđa, kơplah noh mă đe rôp kon pơlei Jêrusalem pơm bơnă.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; Before you were born I sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet to the nations.”
Bahnar: “Inh băt kơ ih adrol kơ Inh pơjing ih lăm klak mĕ ih; adrol kơ đe tơpŭ kơ ih, Inh rơih iŏk ih, Inh wă ăn kơ ih jing bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơ jơ̆p teh đak.”

English: Then said I: “Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, I cannot speak, for I am a youth.”
Bahnar: Inh tơl: “Ơ Kră Yang! Inh ưh kơ băt wă pơma kiơ, yua kơ inh oei 'lơ̆p.

English: But the LORD said to me: “Do not say, ‘I am a youth,’ For you shall go to all to whom I send you, And whatever I command you, you shall speak.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ inh: 'Nĕ pơma khan inh oei 'lơ̆p;” yua kơ ih gô năm tơ jơ̆p-jang anih tơ yơ mă Inh wơh ih, ih gô pơma roi dôm nơ̆r mă Inh đei tơbăt ăn kơ ih pơma.

English: Do not be afraid of their faces, For I am with you to deliver you,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “'Nĕ hli kơ lu sư ôh, yua kơ Inh oei hơdai ih wă dŏng pơklaih ih.” Kră Yang khan.

English: Then the LORD put forth His hand and touched my mouth, and the LORD said to me: “Behold, I have put My words in your mouth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yơ̆r ti Sư pel 'bơ̆r inh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Âu, Inh dan boih nơ̆r Inh lăm 'bơ̆r ih.”

English: See, I have this day set you over the nations and over the kingdoms, To root out and to pull down, To destroy and to throw down, To build and to plant.”
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu Inh pôk ih pơm yŏng kơ đĭ kon pơlei pơla păng đĭ kơ dêh char, ih gơh buch păng hŭt lê̆, dah pơrăm păng pơlôch dah man tơiung păng pơtăm ming.

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?” And I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh dơ̆ng: “Ơ Jêrêmi, ih 'bôh kiơ?” Inh tơl: “Inh 'bôh minh pôm dơng 'long hơđơ̆r.”

English: Then the LORD said to me, “You have seen well, for I am ready to perform My word.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ih 'bôh trŏ boih, Inh hơđơ̆r wă pơsĭt nơ̆r Inh khan.”

English: And the word of the LORD came to me the second time, saying, “What do you see?” And I said, “I see a boiling pot, and it is facing away from the north.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh wơ̆t mă 'bar: “Ih 'bôh kiơ?” Inh tơl: “Inh 'bôh minh pôm gŏ oei blôk 'bơ̆r sư grê đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Then the LORD said to me: “Out of the north calamity shall break forth On all the inhabitants of the land.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m gô đei tơdrong gleh truh kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm teh âu.”

English: For behold, I am calling All the families of the kingdoms of the north,” says the LORD; “They shall come and each one set his throne At the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, Against all its walls all around, And against all the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô krao lu adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng dêh char gah yă-nơ̆m,” Lu sư gô truh, rim 'nu lu sư kư̆m gô pơdơ̆ng anih pơtao lu sư tơ 'măng jang pơlei Jêrusalem; wă pơrăm dur tăp dăr kơ pơlei păng pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei lăm char Juđa.

English: I will utter My judgments Against them concerning all their wickedness, Because they have forsaken Me, Burned incense to other gods, And worshiped the works of their own hands.
Bahnar: Inh gô sek tơlang kon pơlei Inh, yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm, lu sư achăng lê̆ Inh, soh 'long 'bâu phu ăn kơ yang nai păng kơkuh kơ yang mă đơ̆ng ti lu sư pơm kơdih.

English: “Therefore prepare yourself and arise, And speak to them all that I command you. Do not be dismayed before their faces, Lest I dismay you before them.
Bahnar: Gah ih, tơ̆n bĕ tơlei tơ̆n, iung bĕ păng khan tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong mă Inh đei tơbăt ăn kơ ih boih. 'Nĕ kơ hli kơ lu sư, kơnh hli kơ Inh pơm kơ ih hli 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: For behold, I have made you this day A fortified city and an iron pillar, And bronze walls against the whole land— Against the kings of Judah, Against its princes, Against its priests, And against the people of the land.
Bahnar: Âu, năr 'nâu, Inh ăn kơ ih thoi minh pôm pơlei kơjăp, jrăng hăm mam, man dur hăm kong, wă tơblah hăm đĭ-đăng lu dêh char, hăm lu pơtao dêh Juđa, hăm lu 'bok soi, hăm lu kon pơlei pơla.

English: They will fight against you, But they shall not prevail against you. For I am with you,” says the LORD, “to deliver you.”
Bahnar: Lu sư gô tơblah hăm ih; mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ kĕ kơ ih ôh, yua kơ Inh oei hơdai ih, dŏng pơklaih ih, Kră Yang khan.a

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Go and cry in the hearing of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “I remember you, The kindness of your youth, The love of your betrothal, When you went after Me in the wilderness, In a land not sown.
Bahnar: “Năm roi bĕ tơ lăm đon kon pơlei Jêrusalem: ‘Inh 'blŏk kơ iĕm kơplah iĕm oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆, iĕm oei hơyuh 'mêm kơ Inh kơjăp thoi mŏ mai iĕm kiơ̆ Inh lăm char 'blach, tơ teh mă ưh kơ đei rei pơtăm.

English: Israel was holiness to the LORD, The firstfruits of His increase. All that devour him will offend; Disaster will come upon them,” says the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Isơrael boih minh adrĕch adrung 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'măn kơ Kră Yang, plei blŭng-a đơ̆ng tơdrong jang Sư. Na bơngai bu mă luăn sa kon pơlei noh gô jô̆ yoch; tơdrong răm gô truh tơ lu sư.’ ” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Hear the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob and all the families of the house of Israel.
Bahnar: “Ơ adrĕch Jakôp păng đĭ kon sâu Isơrael mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan”

English: Thus says the LORD: “What injustice have your fathers found in Me, That they have gone far from Me, Have followed idols, And have become idolaters?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Yă 'bok lu iĕm đei 'bôh tơdrong kiơ mă ưh kơ tơpăt lăm Inh dĭng mah lu sư weh ataih đơ̆ng Inh Kiơ̆ lu yang kơnê̆ păng jing bơngai ưh kơ yua kiơ?

English: Neither did they say, ‘Where is the LORD, Who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, Who led us through the wilderness, Through a land of deserts and pits, Through a land of drought and the shadow of death, Through a land that no one crossed And where no one dwelt?’
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă jet khan: ‘Tơ yơ Kră Yang Sư boih mă pơklaih tơlĕch bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ păng chông ba bơ̆n rok lăm char glă, 'bĕnh-'bang kơ sơlŭng, lăm char teh hrĕng kro păng măng mu tơdrong lôch, lăm teh đak mă ưh kơ đei bu rok păng ưh kơ đei bu oei.’

English: I brought you into a bountiful country, To eat its fruit and its goodness. But when you entered, you defiled My land And made My heritage an abomination.
Bahnar: Inh chông ba iĕm mơ̆t lăm teh đak mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng, ăn kơ iĕm yua sa plei 'long păng yua iŏk lu tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng. Mă-lei lăp 'nao truh lu iĕm pơm pơ'mê̆ hloi kơ teh đak Inh, pơm kơ dôm tơdrong Inh pơjing đe lăng krưp.

English: The priests did not say, ‘Where is the LORD?’ And those who handle the law did not know Me; The rulers also transgressed against Me; The prophets prophesied by Baal, And walked after things that do not profit.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh pă jet: ‘Tơ yơ Kră Yang?’ Lu 'bok bơtho khôi juăt ưh pă băt kơ Inh dơ̆ng. Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r blah Inh. Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol yua anăn yang Baal na khan lê̆ adrol, kiơ̆ lu yang nai ưh kơ đei yua kiơ.

English: “Therefore I will yet bring charges against you,” says the LORD, “And against your children’s children I will bring charges.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Thoi noh na Inh jô̆ lu iĕm yoch păng truh tơ sâu se lu iĕm mơ̆n.

English: For pass beyond the coasts of Cyprus and see, Send to Kedar and consider diligently, And see if there has been such a thing.
Bahnar: Yak bĕ rok bŏl Kitim na lăng! Ăn bĕ kơ bơngai năm truh tơ Kêdar wă lăng hơlen, lăng lăng hăm đei layơ tơdrong truh trŏ 'blep thoi noh ưh.

English: Has a nation changed its gods, Which are not gods? But My people have changed their Glory For what does not profit.
Bahnar: Hăm đei teh đak ayơ tơplih boih yang lu sư, mă khan yang noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ yang tơpă? Mă-lei kon pơlei Inh tơplih boih tơdrong ư-ang Inh hăm tơdrong ưh kơ yua kiơ!

English: Be astonished, O heavens, at this, And be horribly afraid; Be very desolate,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ lu tăl plĕnh lăng krưp bĕ kơ tơdrong 'nâu, hli tơtơ̆ păng hli krưp bĕ,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “For My people have committed two evils: They have forsaken Me, the fountain of living waters, And hewn themselves cisterns—broken cisterns that can hold no water.
Bahnar: “Kon pơlei Inh đei pơm boih 'bar tơdrong yoch kơnê̆. Lu sư achăng lê̆ Inh, jơ̆ tu đak tơdrong arih păng chă sir sơlŭng mong đak kơdih, tơpă sơlŭng noh hơđang, ưh kơ gơh mong đak.

English: “Is Israel a servant? Is he a homeborn slave? Why is he plundered?
Bahnar: Isơrael hăm trŏ kơ đĭch đam dah bơngai jang mă tơpŭ lăm hnam yŏng tơ'ngla sư? Yua kơ kiơ lu sư jing tơmam đe plah iŏk?

English: The young lions roared at him, and growled; They made his land waste; His cities are burned, without inhabitant.
Bahnar: Dăm-brang ôr grĕnh, hơnganh bruh tơ sư. Pơm ăn kơ teh đak sư jing juơ. Lu pơlei tih sư đe soh pơrăm ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: Also the people of Noph and Tahpanhes Have broken the crown of your head.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lu bơngai Memphis păng Tahpanhes mă pơm kơ kơ̆l 'ngok iĕm pơchah boih.

English: Have you not brought this on yourself, In that you have forsaken the LORD your God When He led you in the way?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ lu iĕm pŭ iŏk kơdih dôm tơdrong noh, yua kơ iĕm achăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm kơplah Sư oei chông iĕm rok trong sơ̆?

English: And now why take the road to Egypt, To drink the waters of Sihor? Or why take the road to Assyria, To drink the waters of the River?
Bahnar: Dang ei liơ iĕm jur tơ dêh Êyiptơ nhă đak Krong Nil. Iĕm năm tơ dêh Asiri nhă đak Krong Ơphrat, đei yua kiơ?

English: Your own wickedness will correct you, And your backslidings will rebuke you. Know therefore and see that it is an evil and bitter thing That you have forsaken the LORD your God, And the fear of Me is not in you,” Says the Lord GOD of hosts.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch iĕm gô phak bơtho iĕm, tơdrong ih achăng Kră Yang gô chrih kơ iĕm. Athei băt nhen. Achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih păng ưh pă băt hli yom kơ Inh, noh boih minh tơdrong kơnê̆ tơpă păng răm dêh.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “For of old I have broken your yoke and burst your bonds; And you said, ‘I will not transgress,’ When on every high hill and under every green tree You lay down, playing the harlot.
Bahnar: “Sơ̆ đunh boih iĕm gơ̆ lê̆ 'long ăt păng hrĕch lê̆ tơlei đơ̆ng chô̆ iĕm, Iĕm khan: ‘Nhôn ưh kơ wă chu kiơ̆ Ih.’ Tơpă, tơ rim groi kơjung, tơ ala tơm 'long iĕm drap kơkuh kơ rup yang thoi ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: Yet I had planted you a noble vine, a seed of highest quality. How then have you turned before Me Into the degenerate plant of an alien vine?
Bahnar: Inh pơtăm boih thoi minh tơnơm hơmu 'lơ̆ng Inh rơih iŏk, tă kơ găr adrĕch 'lơ̆ng ngăl. Na liơ iĕm tơplih lê̆ jing tơm hơmu bri kơnê̆?

English: For though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap, Yet your iniquity is marked before Me,” says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Mă iĕm yua 'bŏng 'bâu phu dah yua đak 'long Sôđa hum 'nhao akâu iĕm ră, mă-lei tơdrong mơgrĭ yoch iĕm oei klep đom 'bơ̆t anăp Inh,” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan.

English: “How can you say, ‘I am not polluted, I have not gone after the Baals’? See your way in the valley; Know what you have done: You are a swift dromedary breaking loose in her ways
Bahnar: “Liơ ih gơh khan: ‘Nhôn ưh kơ đei 'mê̆-'mach. Inh ưh kơlah kiơ̆ yang Baal ôh?’ Lăng lăng bĕ trong gơlong iĕm pơm lăm thŭng; ăn kơ iĕm băt iĕm đei pơm kiơ boih, iĕm thoi lăk-đa thông đai kư̆ kă tơ âu tơ to

English: A wild donkey used to the wilderness, That sniffs at the wind in her desire; In her time of mating, who can turn her away? All those who seek her will not weary themselves; In her month they will find her.
Bahnar: thoi aseh bri akăn juăt kơ tơ anih glă, chă 'bâu hiup tơno. Bu kĕ găn kơplah sư oei chhônh? Lu tơno ưh kơ ngĕ chơchă ôh truh bơyan sư gô đei tơ'bơ̆p akăn noh.

English: Withhold your foot from being unshod, and your throat from thirst. But you said, ‘There is no hope. No! For I have loved aliens, and after them I will go.’
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơlap jơ̆ng gleh păng dĭng hơlŏng iĕm rơhing! Mă-lei iĕm khan. ‘Măk ai kiơ̆ boih; nhôn hơyuh wă kơ yang nai păng nhôn gô kiơ̆ lu sư?’

English: “As the thief is ashamed when he is found out, So is the house of Israel ashamed; They and their kings and their princes, and their priests and their prophets
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi lu bơngai tơtông mưh đe rôp, mơlâu pă kĕ, na adrĕch Isơrael; mă pơtao mă yŏng pơgơ̆r, mă lu 'bok soi, mă lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kư̆m gô mơlâu thoi noh.

English: Saying to a tree, ‘You are my father,’ And to a stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’ For they have turned their back to Me, and not their face. But in the time of their trouble They will say, ‘Arise and save us.’
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ 'long, ‘Ih boih 'bă inh,’ khan kơ tơmo, Ih boih pơjing kơ inh. Lu sư tơwih rŏng kơ Inh, ưh kơ tơwih gah muh măt; Mă-lei kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong rŭng răng, lu sư khan: ‘Iung na pơklaih nhôn bĕ!’

English: But where are your gods that you have made for yourselves? Let them arise, If they can save you in the time of your trouble; For according to the number of your cities Are your gods, O Judah.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na tơ yơ yang mă lu iĕm đei pơm kơdih noh? Lê̆ lu yang noh năm pơklaih iĕm bĕ, kơplah iĕm đei tơdrong gleh, yua kơ lu yang iĕm lơ kư̆m dang dôm pơlei iĕm, ơ Juđa.

English: “Why will you plead with Me? You all have transgressed against Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ iĕm jŏk kơ Inh? Đĭ-đăng lu iĕm pơm yoch blơ̆ inh boih,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “In vain I have chastened your children; They received no correction. Your sword has devoured your prophets Like a destroying lion.
Bahnar: “Inh đei teh bơtho boih kon sâu lu iĕm ưh kơ yua kiơ. Lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ wă chu Inh bơtho hơmet. Đao lu iĕm kơdih đei pơlôch boih lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol iĕm thoi dăm-brang oei kăp sa.”

English: “O generation, see the word of the LORD! Have I been a wilderness to Israel, Or a land of darkness? Why do My people say, ‘We are lords; We will come no more to You’?
Bahnar: Ơ lu iĕm lăm jơhnơr 'nâu mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: “Inh hăm trŏ kơ char glă dah teh đak măng mu kơ bơngai Isơrael? Lei na liơ kon pơlei Inh khan: ‘Lu nhôn rơngei boih, lu nhôn ưh pă wă năm tơ Ih dơ̆ng.’

English: Can a virgin forget her ornaments, Or a bride her attire? Yet My people have forgotten Me days without number.
Bahnar: Kon adruh hăm hiơt kơ tơmam pơguăng sư, mŏ mai hle hăm trŏ kơ sư hiơt kơ hơbĕn ao pơkong sư? Mă-lei kon pơlei Inh hiơt kơ Inh đunh boih pă kĕ jô̆ dang yơ.

English: “Why do you beautify your way to seek love? Therefore you have also taught The wicked women your ways.
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm hrăn chă trong wă chă lu bơngai iĕm hưch! Dĭng mah lu iĕm bơtho lu bơngai drŏ-kăn kơnê̆ kiơ̆ trong iĕm.

English: Also on your skirts is found The blood of the lives of the poor innocents. I have not found it by secret search, But plainly on all these things.
Bahnar: Tơ tơdrơi ao lu iĕm đei 'bôh boih pham lu bơngai dơnuh hin ưh kơ yoch, Mă iĕm ưh kơ đei rôp lu sư teh 'măng wă mơ̆t tơtông, Mă khan đei hĭ tơdrong noh bưh.

English: Yet you say, ‘Because I am innocent, Surely His anger shall turn from me.’ Behold, I will plead My case against you, Because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
Bahnar: ‘Lu iĕm oei khan nhôn ưh kơ đei yoch, Kră Yang huay hil kơ nhôn. 'Nâu yua kơ iĕm khan nhôn ưh kơ đei yoch kiơ.’ Inh gô sek tơlang kơ iĕm.

English: Why do you gad about so much to change your way? Also you shall be ashamed of Egypt as you were ashamed of Assyria.
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm tơplih trong lu iĕm 'bônh dêh? Lu bơngai Êyiptơ pơm kơ iĕm mơlâu kư̆m thoi lu bơngai Asiri pơm kơ iĕm sơ̆.

English: Indeed you will go forth from him With your hands on your head; For the LORD has rejected your trusted allies, And you will not prosper by them.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô mơlâu kuăr ti tơ kơ̆l, lĕch đơ̆ng char noh, Yua kơ Kră Yang achăng boih lu bơngai mă iĕm gơnang, Lu sư ưh pă đei tơgŭm kiơ boih kơ lu iĕm.”

English: “They say, ‘If a man divorces his wife, And she goes from him And becomes another man’s, May he return to her again?’ Would not that land be greatly polluted? But you have played the harlot with many lovers; Yet return to Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơdah đei drŏ-nglo achăng lê̆ akăn sư, akăn sư weh đơ̆ng sư chă klo plơ̆ng, klo so sư hăm pă gơh hơlơ̆k oei kơ akăn so sư dơ̆ng? Teh đak noh ưh kơ kơnê̆ 'mê̆ krưp dêh tơpă hă? Mă-lei iĕm ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lơ bơngai mă ih hưch, Khan oei wă wih brŏk tơ Inh dơ̆ng hă?” Kră Yang khan.

English: “Lift up your eyes to the desolate heights and see: Where have you not lain with men? By the road you have sat for them Like an Arabian in the wilderness; And you have polluted the land With your harlotries and your wickedness.
Bahnar: “Ngơk lăng bĕ tơ kơpal groi, hăm đei anih ayơ mă lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pơm pơyô? Iĕm ngôi cheng trong wă răp gô lu pơyô iĕm, thoi bơngai Arâpa chă răp lăm char glă; Iĕm đei pơm pơ'mê̆ boih kơ teh âu hăm tơdrong pơm pơyô krưp dêh.

English: Therefore the showers have been withheld, And there has been no latter rain. You have had a harlot’s forehead; You refuse to be ashamed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh pơgăn lê̆ đak 'mi, đak 'mi kư̆m pă đei lăm bơyan rei pơtăm. Lei ră ih ưh kơ đei mơlâu pơm 'mơng thoi drŏ-kăn ngôi kư̆ kă.

English: Will you not from this time cry to Me, ‘My Father, You are the guide of my youth?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ iĕm oei krao Inh: ‘Ơ 'Bă nhôn, Ih boih buăl nhôn đơ̆ng nhôn oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆.

English: Will He remain angry forever? Will He keep it to the end?’ Behold, you have spoken and done evil things, As you were able.”
Bahnar: Ih oei hil mĭl ling-lang hă? Ih oei blĕk khŏm khŏm hă?’ 'Nâu, mă iĕm pơma, mă-lei iĕm pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ̆ thoi iĕm wă.”

English: The LORD said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: “Have you seen what backsliding Israel has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and there played the harlot.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh, lăm chăl Jôsia pơm pơtao: “Ih hăm 'bôh dôm tơdrong bơngai Isơrael đei pơm boih, lu sư chă tŏk tơ jơ̆p kơ groi păng jơ̆p kơ yơ̆p tơm 'long hla hơmŭl; na pơm pơyô kư̆ kă tơ noh.

English: And I said, after she had done all these things, ‘Return to Me.’ But she did not return. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
Bahnar: Inh ngeh khan đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư pơm đĭ dôm tơdrong noh sư gô wih tơ Inh. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ wih. Oh drŏ-kăn 'blal sư noh Juđa, 'bôh boih.

English: Then I saw that for all the causes for which backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a certificate of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah did not fear, but went and played the harlot also.
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh boih yua kơ tơdrong luĕl 'blal lu bơngai Isơrael pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă. Na Inh achăng lê̆ sư pơm hla bơar hrĕch păng puh tơweh sư. Mă-lei oh sư bơngai Juđa ưh kơ hli ôh, kư̆m wang pơm pơyô kư̆ kă noh.

English: So it came to pass, through her casual harlotry, that she defiled the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư tơchĕng khan pơm pơyô kư̆ kă huay kơ yoch kơnê̆, na pơm ăn kơ dêh char jing 'mê̆-'mach, ngôi kư̆ kă hăm tơmo hăm 'long.

English: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not turned to Me with her whole heart, but in pretense,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, đơ̆ng tơdrong noh, oh sư bơngai Juđa pơm kơnê̆, sư kư̆m ưh kơ wih brŏk tơ Inh đĭ jơhngơ̆m, chă hơlĕnh đĕch, Kră Yang khan.

English: Then the LORD said to me, “Backsliding Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ih pơting lăng tơdrong Isơrael pơm kơnê̆ oei dă 'biơ̆ kơ Juđa

English: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: ‘Return, backsliding Israel,’ says the LORD; ‘I will not cause My anger to fall on you. For I am merciful,’ says the LORD; ‘I will not remain angry forever.
Bahnar: Năm bĕ tơ gah yă-nơ̆m ră roi tơdrong 'nâu: Kră Yang khan: ‘Ơ Isơrael bơngai mă ưh kơ tơpăt, brŏk bĕ! Inh lăng tơ iĕm muh măt Inh huay pă thoi 'maih hil boih, yua kơ Inh băt 'mêm mơnat: Inh ưh pă hil ling-lang dơ̆ng boih,’ Kră Yang khan.

English: Only acknowledge your iniquity, That you have transgressed against the LORD your God, And have scattered your charms To alien deities under every green tree, And you have not obeyed My voice,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: ‘Kư̆ mă ih chu pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch. Tơdrong mă iĕm blah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; iĕm chă hưch kơ lu yang nai ala tơm 'long hla hơmŭl, păng ưh pă chu yom kơ nơ̆r Inh,’ ” Kră Yang khan.

English: “Return, O backsliding children,” says the LORD; “for I am married to you. I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Wih brŏk bĕ! Ơ lu kon sâu ưh kơ tơpăt, yua kơ Inh boih yŏng lu iĕm. Inh gô rơih iŏk lu iĕm minh 'nu đơ̆ng rim pơlei 'bar 'nu đơ̆ng adrĕch păng Inh gô năm ba lu iĕm brŏk tơ pơlei Siôn!

English: And I will give you shepherds according to My heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm lu bơngai wei-lăng kiơ̆ thoi Inh lăp; lu sư gô wei rong chông anhăk lu iĕm hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei hlôh wao.”

English: “Then it shall come to pass, when you are multiplied and increased in the land in those days,” says the LORD, “that they will say no more, ‘The ark of the covenant of the LORD.’ It shall not come to mind, nor shall they remember it, nor shall they visit it, nor shall it be made anymore.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Mưh lu iĕm chek lar rai lơ lăm teh đak ưh pă bu 'blŏk kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang dơ̆ng! Ưh pă đei bu tơ'blŏk, ưh pă tơchĕng dơ̆ng lăm kơ̆l 'ngok ưh pă đei bu roi gah Hom pơgơ̆p, ưh pă đei bu 'mêm hmach păng ưh pă đei bu pơm plơ̆ng dơ̆ng.

English: “At that time Jerusalem shall be called The Throne of the LORD, and all the nations shall be gathered to it, to the name of the LORD, to Jerusalem. No more shall they follow the dictates of their evil hearts.
Bahnar: Kơplah lăm năr noh đe gô krao pơlei Jêrusalem jơ̆ tăng dŏ pơtao Kră Yang păng rim kơ adrĕch adrung gô akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm anăn Kră Yang. Ưh pă đei bu arăng kơ̆l kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: “In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given as an inheritance to your fathers.
Bahnar: Truh tơ năr noh adrĕch Juđa gô pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm adrĕch Isơrael, lu sư gô yak hơdai weh đơ̆ng teh đak gah yă-nơ̆m na brŏk tơ dêh mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ 'bok yă lu iĕm jang sa.”

English: “But I said: ‘How can I put you among the children And give you a pleasant land, A beautiful heritage of the hosts of nations?’ “And I said: ‘You shall call Me, “My Father,” And not turn away from Me.’
Bahnar: Gah Inh hơpơi: “Rŏ kơ Inh lăng iĕm thoi kon drŏ-nglo Inh, Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm dêh char 'lơ̆ng, teh jang sa 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu char nai! Inh hơpơi wă kơ iĕm krao Inh ‘'Bă’ Păng ưh pă weh achăng lê̆ Inh.

English: Surely, as a wife treacherously departs from her husband, So have you dealt treacherously with Me, O house of Israel,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ adrĕch Isơrael, lu iĕm thoi minh 'nu drŏ-kăn pơm kơnê̆ achăng lê̆ klo sư, lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ hăm Inh boih,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: A voice was heard on the desolate heights, Weeping and supplications of the children of Israel. For they have perverted their way; They have forgotten the LORD their God.
Bahnar: Đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r tơ kơpal kông groi: Noh nơ̆r lu kon pơlei Isơrael nhơ̆m hmoi păng ôr krao, yua kơ lu sư yak kiơ̆ trong glăi, hiong hiơt boih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: “Return, you backsliding children, And I will heal your backslidings.” “Indeed we do come to You, For You are the LORD our God.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu kon pơlei ưh kơ tơpăt, brŏk bĕ! Inh gô pơklaih tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm.” “Âu, lu nhôn gô brŏk tơ Ih, Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: Truly, in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, And from the multitude of mountains; Truly, in the LORD our God Is the salvation of Israel.
Bahnar: Tơpă tơdrong dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng groi lăp chă hơlĕnh, ôr krao dơ̆ng kông chă pơhlŭ đĕch; sĭt tơpă tơdrong dŏng pơklaih bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: For shame has devoured The labor of our fathers from our youth— Their flocks and their herds, Their sons and their daughters.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu nhôn oei 'lơ̆p, tơdrong mơlâu sa pơrăm lê̆ đĭ, dôm tơdrong jang đei đơ̆ng 'bok yă lu nhôn, lu triu, rơmo, kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn lu sư.

English: We lie down in our shame, And our reproach covers us. For we have sinned against the LORD our God, We and our fathers, From our youth even to this day, And have not obeyed the voice of the LORD our God.”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ nhôn oei 'bĭch lăm tơdrong mơlâu lu nhôn păng pŭ iŏk tơdrong đe pơjăm lu nhôn! Lu nhôn păng 'bok yă lu nhôn đei pơm yoch boih hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei; lu nhôn ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.”

English: “If you will return, O Israel,” says the LORD, “Return to Me; And if you will put away your abominations out of My sight, Then you shall not be moved.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ Isơrael, tơdah ih wă wih brŏk tơ Inh, wih brŏk tơ Inh bĕ, Tơdah ih hŭt lê̆ dôm tơmam kơkuh kơ yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng anăp Inh, Păng ih huay pă weh tơ nai dơ̆ng.

English: And you shall swear, ‘The LORD lives,’ In truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; The nations shall bless themselves in Him, And in Him they shall glory.”
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm pơkă sĭt hăm tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, tơdrong trŏ thoi Kră Yang arih sĭt lei teh đak gô đei pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng Sư, Păng lu sư gô ư-ang kơ Kră Yang,”

English: For thus says the LORD to the men of Judah and Jerusalem: “Break up your fallow ground, And do not sow among thorns.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ bơngai Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem thoi âu: “Hơmet bĕ jơhngơ̆m iĕm thoi choh mir chŭn mă đêl lê̆ bri 'nĕ kơ rei, pơtăm lăm jơla.

English: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, And take away the foreskins of your hearts, You men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem, Lest My fury come forth like fire, And burn so that no one can quench it, Because of the evil of your doings.”
Bahnar: Kăt tơdra akar iĕm bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, ơ kon drŏ-nglo Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem, Kăt bĕ akar jơhngơ̆m iĕm. Kơnh hli kơ tơdrong Inh hil iung thoi ŭnh sa, ưh kơ đei bu kĕ pĭt, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu iĕm pơm boih.”

English: Declare in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say: “Blow the trumpet in the land; Cry, ‘Gather together,’ And say, ‘Assemble yourselves, And let us go into the fortified cities.’
Bahnar: “Roi tơbăt bĕ tơ lăm dêh char Juđa păng lăm pơlei Jêrusalem khan: ‘Hlôm bĕ keng tơ jơ̆p lăm char.’ Krao ôr mă kơtang păng khan: ‘Akŭm băl bĕ. Bĕ bơ̆n năm mơ̆t tơ lăm lu pơlei kơjăp.’

English: Set up the standard toward Zion. Take refuge! Do not delay! For I will bring disaster from the north, And great destruction.”
Bahnar: Pơdơ̆ng bĕ hla-kơ tơ gah Siôn! Kơdâu ôn bĕ tơ anih hơđơ̆ng 'nĕ pă dơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh gô ăn tơdrong pơrăm truh đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m, minh tơdrong pơrăm tih.

English: The lion has come up from his thicket, And the destroyer of nations is on his way. He has gone forth from his place To make your land desolate. Your cities will be laid waste, Without inhabitant.
Bahnar: Dăm-brang lĕch boih đơ̆ng anih sư, lu bơngai chă pơrăm dêh char đe, pơtơm lĕch đơ̆ng anih lu sư boih wă pơrăm pơm ăn kơ teh âu jing bri brah, Lu pơlei tih iĕm jing juơ, pă đei bơngai oei.

English: For this, clothe yourself with sackcloth, Lament and wail. For the fierce anger of the LORD Has not turned back from us.
Bahnar: Na su bĕ 'bi, nhơ̆m hmoi, yua kơ tơdrong Kră Yang hil oei tam mă weh đơ̆ng bơ̆n.”

English: “And it shall come to pass in that day,” says the LORD, “That the heart of the king shall perish, And the heart of the princes; The priests shall be astonished, And the prophets shall wonder.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh. Lu pơtao păng lu kră pơgơ̆r jơhngơ̆m lu sư rŭng răng; lu 'bok soi hli tơrơ, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gô kơmăp lăl.”

English: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! Surely You have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, Saying, ‘You shall have peace,’ Whereas the sword reaches to the heart.”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Ơ Kră Yang! Tơpă Ih đei hơlĕnh boih kơ lu kon pơlei âu păng pơlei Jêrusalem Ih khan: Lu iĕm gô đei hiôk-hian! Mă-lei pla đao 'bơm tơ hơko nhôn boih.”

English: At that time it will be said To this people and to Jerusalem, “A dry wind of the desolate heights blows in the wilderness Toward the daughter of My people— Not to fan or to cleanse
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, đe gô khan kơ kon pơlei âu păng pơlei Jêrusalem: “Kial tơtŏ đơ̆ng kơpal kông lăm char glă tơthu bah tơ lu kon pơlei Inh, ưh kơ sĭ wă pơliĕng dah wă kơ goh ôh.

English: A wind too strong for these will come for Me; Now I will also speak judgment against them.”
Bahnar: Kial rai kơtang hloh kơ lu tơdrong noh đơ̆ng Inh, 'nâu Inh gô sek phak lu sư.

English: “Behold, he shall come up like clouds, And his chariots like a whirlwind. His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us, for we are plundered!”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Sư truh thoi hơmơ̆l, gre aseh sư thoi kial hơbŭt, aseh sư kơdâu kuăng hloh kơ klang. Răm-'băm tơpă kơ lu bơ̆n, lôch răm đĭ!

English: O Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, That you may be saved. How long shall your evil thoughts lodge within you?
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Jêrusalem ôp mă rơgoh bĕ jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ iĕm, wă kơ iĕm gơh đei dŏng pơklaih. Lu iĕm răk mong tơdrong kơnê̆ tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm dĭng dang yơ?

English: For a voice declares from Dan And proclaims affliction from Mount Ephraim
Bahnar: To đei nơ̆r đe roi đơ̆ng tơring Đan, nơ̆r tơbăt tơdrong truh răm đơ̆ng kông Êphraim.

English: “Make mention to the nations, Yes, proclaim against Jerusalem, That watchers come from a far country And raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ rim dêh char! Roi ăn kơ pơlei Jêrusalem băt: Lu bơngai ayăt đơ̆ng tơring ataih truh boih wang tăp dăr Lu sư jreo tơkĕch wă tơblah hăm lu pơlei Juđa.

English: Like keepers of a field they are against her all around, Because she has been rebellious against Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư wang pơlei Jêrusalem kơjăp đơ̆ng puăn pah thoi đe wei mir chŭn; Yua kơ pơlei âu iung blah Inh,” Kră Yang khan.

English: “Your ways and your doings Have procured these things for you. This is your wickedness, Because it is bitter, Because it reaches to your heart.”
Bahnar: “Tơdrong iĕm oei arih sa păng iĕm đei pơm; ba tơdrong noh. 'Nâu đei truh kơ ih pơmat tơpă. Đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ih pơm! Tơdrong noh 'bet jĭ jơhngơ̆m iĕm.”

English: O my soul, my soul! I am pained in my very heart! My heart makes a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, Because you have heard, O my soul, The sound of the trumpet, The alarm of war.
Bahnar: Ô! Răm, inh chhŭr nuih, inh jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m, jơhngơ̆m inh rŭng răng, ô plei nuih inh 'bôm dĕnh, inh ưh pă kĕ chơ̆n boih. Inh kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng roi tơbăt, tơdrong ôr tơblah wă truh.

English: Destruction upon destruction is cried, For the whole land is plundered. Suddenly my tents are plundered, And my curtains in a moment.
Bahnar: Tơdrong đe pơrăm, truh pơrăm rai dêh, Jơ̆p kơ char pơrăm đĭ boih 'biao pă tam băt bơsŭn inh anih inh răm đĭ.

English: How long will I see the standard, And hear the sound of the trumpet?
Bahnar: Inh gô 'bôh hla-kơ lu linh ayăt păng kơtơ̆ng keng re tơbăt, pă băt dĭng truh dang yơ?

English: “For My people are foolish, They have not known Me. They are silly children, And they have no understanding. They are wise to do evil, But to do good they have no knowledge.”
Bahnar: “Tơpă kon pơlei Inh bơlŭk, lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ Inh. Lu sư oei 'lơ̆p nge kơhlôh, lu sư ưh kơ wao, lu sư nŏng kơ pơm kơnê̆, mă ưh kơ băt pơm minh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.

English: I beheld the earth, and indeed it was without form, and void; And the heavens, they had no light.
Bahnar: Inh lăng tơ teh, răm đĭ ưh pă đei kiơ, hoh-hoy. Inh lăng dơ̆ng tơ plĕnh ti; kư̆m ưh pă 'bôh đei hơdah tơ yơ.

English: I beheld the mountains, and indeed they trembled, And all the hills moved back and forth.
Bahnar: Inh lăng tơ lu kông; kông pơpơ̆ tơdrŏ ngăl, lu groi kư̆m tơdrŏ.

English: I beheld, and indeed there was no man, And all the birds of the heavens had fled.
Bahnar: Inh lăng ưh pă đei 'bôh bu; lu sem păr đĭ weh tơ nai

English: I beheld, and indeed the fruitful land was a wilderness, And all its cities were broken down At the presence of the LORD, By His fierce anger.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh mir chŭn teh mơ̆r jing char glă. Đĭ-đăng pơlei jing rơ̆m rĕk. 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang đơ̆ng tơdrong Sư hil mĭl.

English: For thus says the LORD: “The whole land shall be desolate; Yet I will not make a full end.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đĭ kơ dêh char gô juơ tơtŭng mă-lei Inh ưh tam pơrăm đĭ ôh.

English: For this shall the earth mourn, And the heavens above be black, Because I have spoken. I have purposed and will not relent, Nor will I turn back from it.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, teh đak âu gô ơh sơ'ngon, plĕnh gô măng mu, yua kơ Inh đei khan, Inh đei pơkă, ưh pă tơplih, ưh pă gơh hơmet nơ̆r dơ̆ng.”

English: The whole city shall flee from the noise of the horsemen and bowmen. They shall go into thickets and climb up on the rocks. Every city shall be forsaken, And not a man shall dwell in it.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng jơwa re lu linh hao gre aseh păng lu linh chĕp hră, rim pơlei kơdâu ôn, mơ'nah chă ôn tơ lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng, mơ'nah chă mơ̆t lăm hơgơp tơmo. Rim pơlei achăng đĭ, ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: “And when you are plundered, What will you do? Though you clothe yourself with crimson, Though you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold, Though you enlarge your eyes with paint, In vain you will make yourself fair; Your lovers will despise you; They will seek your life.
Bahnar: Bĭ iĕm, ơ bơngai mă oei wă pơrăm. Iĕm pơm kiơ mă hrŭk ao 'brê hơhĭm, pơguăng hăm maih se, Iŏk 'long chih chhơ̆ gơnur măt, pơguăng wă kơ 'lơ̆ng liĕm, kư̆m đĭ pă yua: Bơngai mă hơyuh kơ iĕm kư̆m achăng lê̆ iĕm, kư̆m wă chă pơlôch ih.

English: “For I have heard a voice as of a woman in labor, The anguish as of her who brings forth her first child, The voice of the daughter of Zion bewailing herself; She spreads her hands, saying, ‘Woe is me now, for my soul is weary Because of murderers!’
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr thoi drŏ-kăn tơpŭ, ôr hơdrăi thoi bơngai adruh tơpŭ kon blŭng-a. Noh nơ̆r ôr lu kon Adruh Siôn, ôr tơngưih plaih ti na khan răm dêh kơ inh, “inh lôch hơngơ̆t bơih, 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai chă pơlôch inh!”

English: “Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem; See now and know; And seek in her open places If you can find a man, If there is anyone who executes judgment, Who seeks the truth, And I will pardon her.
Bahnar: “Kơdâu chă lăng bĕ jơ̆p kơ trong lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem Athei chă lăng păng răk lăm đon, Chă lăng tơ jơ̆p anih đe juăt adrŭm. Chă lăng hăm đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, 'maih chă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, wă kơ Inh mơnat ăn kơ pơlei tih Jêrusalem?

English: Though they say, ‘As the LORD lives,’ Surely they swear falsely.”
Bahnar: Mă lu sư khan: Tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih sĭt.” Noh kư̆m pơkă hơlĕnh.

English: O LORD, are not Your eyes on the truth? You have stricken them, But they have not grieved; You have consumed them, But they have refused to receive correction. They have made their faces harder than rock; They have refused to return.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Hăm trŏ kơ măt Ih chă lăng jơhngơ̆m tơpăt sĭt? Ih teh boih lu sư, lu sư ưh kơ băt jĭ, ih pơrăm lu sư boih, mă-lei lu sư oei kơchu kơ tơdrong Ih teh bơtho noh. Lu sư pơrơ̆ng pơm kơ muh măt lu sư arăng hơrăk thoi tơmo. Lu sư ưh kơ wă tơbral tơdrong yoch.

English: Therefore I said, “Surely these are poor. They are foolish; For they do not know the way of the LORD, The judgment of their God.
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng khan: “'Nâu lăp lu bơngai dơnuh hin, kơhlôh kơwao đĕch, lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ trong Kră Yang. Khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: I will go to the great men and speak to them, For they have known the way of the LORD, The judgment of their God.” But these have altogether broken the yoke And burst the bonds.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh gô năm tơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, roi ăn kơ lu sư băt hơđăl. Tơpă lu sư băt trong gơlong Kră Yang, khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư. Mă-lei lu sư 'nâu gơ̆ lê̆ 'long ăt păng wă hrĕch lê̆ tơlei boih!

English: Therefore a lion from the forest shall slay them, A wolf of the deserts shall destroy them; A leopard will watch over their cities. Everyone who goes out from there shall be torn in pieces, Because their transgressions are many; Their backslidings have increased.
Bahnar: Lei na dăm-brang lĕch đơ̆ng bri năm châu sa lu sư, kŏ-so đơ̆ng char glă gô kăp pơlôch lu sư, djrang oei răp tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei ti wă châu hek sa lu đe bu mă lĕch tơ 'nguaih pơlei, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư lơ dêh, tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư lơlap.

English: “How shall I pardon you for this? Your children have forsaken Me And sworn by those that are not gods. When I had fed them to the full, Then they committed adultery And assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
Bahnar: Liơ Inh gơh mơnat lĕ? Kon sâu iĕm achăng lê̆ Inh boih, Lu sư pao anăn lu yang nai, na pơkă mă ưh kơ trŏ kơ yang tơpă. Mă khan Inh 'me rong lu sư phĭ jơnap, mă lu sư rai pơm pơyô kư̆ ka, akŭm băl 'bĕnh lăm hnam bơngai đi.

English: They were like well-fed lusty stallions; Every one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi aseh tơno rong bek chă kiơ̆ akăn đe nai.”

English: Shall I not punish them for these things?” says the LORD. “And shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lei na Inh ưh kơ hil kơ lu sư yua kơ tơdrong noh hă? Hăm adrĕch adrung thoi noh na Inh wă ưh kơ pơm tơdrong tơpăt hă?

English: “Go up on her walls and destroy, But do not make a complete end. Take away her branches, For they are not the LORD’s.
Bahnar: Năm rok pơgar hơmu koh pơrăm bĕ lu sư, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ kăl pơđĭ, chre hŭt lê̆ lu tơmơ̆ng dơng 'nao bluh, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ gah Kră Yang ôh.

English: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah Have dealt very treacherously with Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Adrĕch Isơrael păng adrĕch Juđa, oei sa ưh kơ tơpăt hăm Inh ôh,” noh Kră Yang khan

English: They have lied about the LORD, And said, “It is not He. Neither will evil come upon us, Nor shall we see sword or famine.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơlĕnh khan: Kră Yang. Ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ kơ lu bơ̆n ôh, Lu bơ̆n huay kơ 'bôh tơdrong răm truh ôh. Kŭm huay kơ tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong răm kơ đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt.

English: And the prophets become wind, For the word is not in them. Thus shall it be done to them.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh thoi kial. Lu sư ưh pă đei nơ̆r Kră Yang wă khan lê̆ adrol dơ̆ng, tơdrong lu sư pơma lê̆ 'bơm lu sư.”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD God of hosts: “Because you speak this word, Behold, I will make My words in your mouth fire, And this people wood, And it shall devour them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh khan: “Yua kơ lu sư pơma tơdrong noh, 'Nâu, Inh gô tah nơ̆r pơma Inh tơ lăm 'bơ̆r thoi ŭnh, kon pơlei âu thoi 'long ŭnh na ŭnh gô sa lu sư.”

English: Behold, I will bring a nation against you from afar, O house of Israel,” says the LORD. “It is a mighty nation, It is an ancient nation, A nation whose language you do not know, Nor can you understand what they say.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, Inh gô ăn đei minh adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng dêh ataih năm blah iĕm, Adrĕch adrung pran kơtang oei tơ âu đunh boih. Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt ưh kơ hlôh nơ̆r lu sư. Kŭm ưh kơ hlôh lu sư pơma kiơ.

English: Their quiver is like an open tomb; They are all mighty men.
Bahnar: Jŏ lu sư 'bĕnh kơ 'brơ̆m hơkăm thoi đe pơih bơsat; đĭ-đăng lu sư tă kơ pran kơtang ngăl.

English: And they shall eat up your harvest and your bread, Which your sons and daughters should eat. They shall eat up your flocks and your herds; They shall eat up your vines and your fig trees; They shall destroy your fortified cities, In which you trust, with the sword.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô luăn sa phe 'ba lu iĕm, luăn sa lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn iĕm, lu sư gô 'buh sa triu păng rơmo lu iĕm. Gô phĕ sa plei hơmu păng plei hơra lu iĕm. Lu sư gô iŏk đao koh pơrăm lu pơlei tih kơjăp mă lu iĕm gơnang hơđơ̆ng.”

English: “Nevertheless in those days,” says the LORD, “I will not make a complete end of you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Mă khan lei lăm noh Inh kư̆m huay kơ pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu iĕm ôh.

English: And it will be when you say, ‘Why does the LORD our God do all these things to us?’ then you shall answer them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve aliens in a land that is not yours.’
Bahnar: ‘Layơ kon pơlei ih jet: Liơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n pơm kơ lu bơ̆n thoi âu?’ Ih gô tơl lu sư: ‘Lu iĕm đei achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, na bơ̆jang kơ lu yang nai lăm dêh char iĕm thoi yơ, lu iĕm gô bơ̆jang kơ lu yang nai lăm tơring tơmoi mă ưh kơ trŏ kơ char iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n.’

English: “Declare this in the house of Jacob And proclaim it in Judah, saying
Bahnar: Tơbăt bĕ tơdrong 'nâu kơ adrĕch Jakôp. Tơbăt bĕ tơdrong 'nâu tơ lăm char Juđa.

English: ‘Hear this now, O foolish people, Without understanding, Who have eyes and see not, And who have ears and hear not
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ tơdrong 'nâu, ơ kon pơlei bơlŭk păng kơhlôh kơwao. Đei măt ră mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh, đei đon ră mă-lei ưh kơtơ̆ng.

English: Do you not fear Me?’ says the LORD. ‘Will you not tremble at My presence, Who have placed the sand as the bound of the sea, By a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass beyond it? And though its waves toss to and fro, Yet they cannot prevail; Though they roar, yet they cannot pass over it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hăm trŏ lu iĕm athei hli kơ Inh hă? Hăm trŏ lu iĕm athei tơtơ̆ tơrơ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh? Inh boih Tơ'ngla iŏk chuơh bơ̆ găn hơdral đak dơsĭ, Pơm bơnơ̆ hơdral ling-lang, Đak dơsĭ ưh kơ kĕ lĕch ro hlôi, Poh-yă tih tŭn kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ pơchah. Mă khan lu sư blŭng kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ klĕch hlôi.

English: But this people has a defiant and rebellious heart; They have revolted and departed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei âu arăng kơ̆l păng đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih tơblah; lu sư tơklah trong pha, na weh kiơ̆ kơdih.

English: They do not say in their heart, “Let us now fear the LORD our God, Who gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season. He reserves for us the appointed weeks of the harvest.”
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei khan ôh lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư: ‘Lu bơ̆n athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, Tơ'ngla mă ăn đak 'mi trŏ kơ bơyan sư. Bơyan 'mi păng bơyan puih, Ăn kơ bơ̆n kư̆m oei bơwei năr giĕng lăm bơyan kĕch yuă.’

English: Your iniquities have turned these things away, And your sins have withheld good from you.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm pơm boih kơ lu iĕm pă đei tơdrong âu; Tơdrong yoch lu iĕm găn boih tơdrong pŭn hiôk 'mi prăng truh tơ lu iĕm.

English: ‘For among My people are found wicked men; They lie in wait as one who sets snares; They set a trap; They catch men.
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei hơdai lăm lu kon pơlei Inh, lu sư thoi bơngai răp dăng hơnhuăl kơ sem, lu sư đăk hơđong wă rôp bơngai.

English: As a cage is full of birds, So their houses are full of deceit. Therefore they have become great and grown rich.
Bahnar: Hnam lu sư 'bĕnh kơ tơmam hơlĕnh, kư̆m thoi hơdrŭng 'bĕnh kơ sem. Thoi noh na lu sư jing mơdrŏng tih, kĕ pran.

English: They have grown fat, they are sleek; Yes, they surpass the deeds of the wicked; They do not plead the cause, The cause of the fatherless; Yet they prosper, And the right of the needy they do not defend.
Bahnar: Lu sư bek plên, bơbling bơblang. Lu sư pơm kơnê̆ dêh ưh kơ tôch ôh; lu sư sek tơlang ưh kơ dŏng lu kon mơti, lu sư ưh kơ sek tơpăt ôh kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin.”

English: Shall I not punish them for these things?’ says the LORD. ‘Shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lei na Inh ưh kơ sek tơlang phak lu sư kơ tơdrong noh hă? Hăm kon pơlei thoi noh lei na Inh ưh kơ sek tơpăt hă?

English: “An astonishing and horrible thing Has been committed in the land
Bahnar: Đei minh tơdrong hlĭch păng kơnê̆ dêh truh boih tơ lăm char âu.

English: The prophets prophesy falsely, And the priests rule by their own power; And My people love to have it so. But what will you do in the end?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơma hơlĕnh, lu 'bok soi pơgơ̆r kiơ̆ thoi lu sư gơh kơdih, lu kon pơlei Inh lăp dêh kơ tơdrong thoi noh. Mă-lei truh năr tôch kơnh lu iĕm gô pơm thoi yơ?”

English: “O you children of Benjamin, Gather yourselves to flee from the midst of Jerusalem! Blow the trumpet in Tekoa, And set up a signal-fire in Beth Haccerem; For disaster appears out of the north, And great destruction.
Bahnar: Kơdâu bĕ tơ anih hơđơ̆ng, Ơ kon pơlei Bênjamin; Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem. Hlôm bĕ keng roi tơbăt tơ pơlei Têkôa, Soh ŭnh pơm tơdra tơ pơlei Bêt Hakarem; yua kơ đei tơdrong kơnê̆ wă truh pơrăm tih dêh, lĕch boih đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: I have likened the daughter of Zion To a lovely and delicate woman.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm adruh 'lơ̆ng kơeng pơlei Siôn.

English: The shepherds with their flocks shall come to her. They shall pitch their tents against her all around. Each one shall pasture in his own place.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei triu hăm khŭl triu sư năm pơm kơ pơlei Siôn, lu sư gô pơm bơsŭn tăp dăr kơ pơlei, ba triu lu sư sa 'nhĕt lăm anih mă đei 'măn lê̆ kơ lu sư.

English: “Prepare war against her; Arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe to us, for the day goes away, For the shadows of the evening are lengthening.
Bahnar: “Hơmet bĕ wă tơblah hăm sư! Iung bĕ! Blah drŭt kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng. Răm-'băm tơpă kơ bơ̆n; năr wă kơsơ̆, yơ̆p măng truh boih rai să.

English: Arise, and let us go by night, And let us destroy her palaces.”
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n iung năm blah kơmăng, Pơrăm lu anih kơđông kơjăp sư!

English: For thus has the LORD of hosts said: “Cut down trees, And build a mound against Jerusalem. This is the city to be punished. She is full of oppression in her midst.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan: Kăl bĕ 'long, tuh teh bơ̆ dur na blah pơlei Jêrusalem! 'Nâu boih pơlei tih trŏ kơ phak bơtho sư; lăm pơlei tă kơ đei bơngai pơjuă pơđep ngăl

English: As a fountain wells up with water, So she wells up with her wickedness. Violence and plundering are heard in her. Before Me continually are grief and wounds.
Bahnar: Thoi đak sơlŭng lĕch thoi yơ, tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư kư̆m lĕch thoi noh. Kơtơ̆ng đei tơdrong kơnê̆ păng pơrăm tơ lăm pơlei noh, tơdrong jĭ jăn, rơka rơkĕch oei 'bơ̆t anăp Inh ling-lang.

English: Be instructed, O Jerusalem, Lest My soul depart from you; Lest I make you desolate, A land not inhabited.”
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei Jêrusalem mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r chrih bơtho, kơnh Inh achăng lê̆ iĕm, Kơnh pơm ăn kơ iĕm jing bri juơ, ưh kơ đei bu oei.

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “They shall thoroughly glean as a vine the remnant of Israel; As a grape-gatherer, put your hand back into the branches.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Đe gô dônh pơpôi đĭ lu kon pơlei Isơrael mă oei oei thoi đe dônh plei hơmu. Chro ti 'mơn phĕ hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng bĕ, thoi đe phĕ plei hơmu.”

English: To whom shall I speak and give warning, That they may hear? Indeed their ear is uncircumcised, And they cannot give heed. Behold, the word of the LORD is a reproach to them; They have no delight in it.
Bahnar: Inh gô roi păng tơbăt kơ bu, wă kơ lu sư mơ̆ng Inh? 'Nâu, đon lu sư chĭt lê̆ boih, lu sư ưh pă kơtơ̆ng boih. Nơ̆r Kră Yang lu sư pơjăm, lu sư ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD. I am weary of holding it in. “I will pour it out on the children outside, And on the assembly of young men together; For even the husband shall be taken with the wife, The aged with him who is full of days.
Bahnar: Gah inh, Kră Yang hil 'bĕnh kơ inh, inh ưh kơ kĕ kơ dơ̆ng ôh. “Tuh bĕ tơdrong noh tơ lu bơngai hơ'lơ̆p tơ rok trong pơlei, Tơ lu bơngai tơdăm oei akŭm băl; tơ klo hăm akăn, tơ lu kră păng lu kră jơnei.

English: And their houses shall be turned over to others, Fields and wives together; For I will stretch out My hand Against the inhabitants of the land,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Hnam lu sư gô jao kơ đe nai; Hơdai hăm mir pơgar păng akăn lu sư hai. Kơplah Inh gô yơ̆r ti, phak lu kon pơlei lăm dêh 'nâu,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Because from the least of them even to the greatest of them, Everyone is given to covetousness; And from the prophet even to the priest, Everyone deals falsely.
Bahnar: “Iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai kơhlôh truh tơ bơngai hơgei, tă kơ chă lơi ngăl. Đơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol truh tơ lu 'bok soi kư̆m sa pơgâm.

English: They have also healed the hurt of My people slightly, Saying, ‘Peace, peace!’ When there is no peace.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơmet rơka kon pơlei Inh 'bơ'biơ̆ đĕch na khan hiôk-hian hiôk-hian; mă tơpă ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian ôh.

English: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No! They were not at all ashamed; Nor did they know how to blush. Therefore they shall fall among those who fall; At the time I punish them, They shall be cast down,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm yoch kơnê̆ dêh hăm mơlâu ưh? Lu sư ưh kơ đei mơlâu ôh, muh măt lu sư ưh kơ đei layơ đum rak mơlâu. Kŭm ưh kơ băt mơlâu noh kiơ. Lei na lu sư gô pơ̆k hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă pơ̆k huŏng; truh năr Inh phak pơmat lu sư, lu sư gô hraih đang.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Stand in the ways and see, And ask for the old paths, where the good way is, And walk in it; Then you will find rest for your souls. But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Dơ̆ng bĕ tơ rok trong na răp lăng; Chă jet trong so, trong ayơ 'lơ̆ng yak kiơ̆ bĕ trong noh, Na chă ăn kơ bơhngol lu iĕm pơdơh hiôk.” Mă-lei lu sư khan: “Lu nhôn ưh kơ yak kiơ̆ ôh trong noh.”

English: Also, I set watchmen over you, saying, ‘Listen to the sound of the trumpet!’ But they said, ‘We will not listen.’
Bahnar: Inh 'măn boih lu bơngai gak wei-lăng tăp dăr kơ iĕm păng khan; ‘Pơgling đon lu iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ keng re.’ Mă-lei lu sư khan: “Lu nhôn ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh.”

English: Therefore hear, you nations, And know, O congregation, what is among them.
Bahnar: “Thoi ei, ơ lu dêh char, mơ̆ng bĕ, Ơ lu bơngai pơm kơdranh, athei băt. Lu tơdrong Inh gô pơm wă phak lu sư!

English: Hear, O earth! Behold, I will certainly bring calamity on this people— The fruit of their thoughts, Because they have not heeded My words Nor My law, but rejected it.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ ơ đĭ-đăng teh đak. Âu Inh ba tơdrong răm truh kơ lu kon pơlei pơla âu, noh boih lĕch đơ̆ng tơdrong lu sư đei pơm boih, Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ wă pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, păng sơngah boih kơ khôi juăt Inh.

English: For what purpose to Me Comes frankincense from Sheba, And sweet cane from a far country? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable, Nor your sacrifices sweet to Me.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm soh pơyơ̆r kơ Inh 'long 'bâu phu đơ̆ng char Seba, dah tơmam 'bâu phu đơ̆ng dêh ataih wă pơm kiơ? Inh ưh kơ iŏk ôh tơmam soi 'buh lu iĕm, tơmam soi mă iĕm pơyơ̆r kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơhiôk kơ Inh mơ̆n!”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will lay stumbling blocks before this people, And the fathers and the sons together shall fall on them. The neighbor and his friend shall perish.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô găn anăp lu sư wă kơ lu sư pơ̆k. 'Bă păng kon drŏ-nglo lu sư gô răm; buăl juăt rông 'bôt lu sư gô lôch hiong đĭ.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Behold, a people comes from the north country, And a great nation will be raised from the farthest parts of the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu, đei minh adrĕch kon pơlei đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m truh, jơ̆ minh adrĕch tih pran, iung blah năm đơ̆ng tôch kơ plei teh.

English: They will lay hold on bow and spear; They are cruel and have no mercy; Their voice roars like the sea; And they ride on horses, As men of war set in array against you, O daughter of Zion.”
Bahnar: Lu sư chĕp hră păng tơju, lu sư minh adrĕch kơnê̆ nuih kơtang, ưh kơ đei băt mơnat, jơwa jơ̆ng lu sư yak nhen thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă; lu sư hao aseh, lu sư săp pơrĕng thoi minh khŭl wă năm blah ih, Ơ kon adruh Siôn.”

English: We have heard the report of it; Our hands grow feeble. Anguish has taken hold of us, Pain as of a woman in labor.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn kơtơ̆ng ang boih gah lu sư, kơkŏng ti lu nhôn đĭ rơdu; Tơdrong hli gơhret lu nhôn, Jơhngơ̆m lu nhôn jĭ tuĕnh thoi drŏ-kăn wă tơpŭ.

English: Do not go out into the field, Nor walk by the way. Because of the sword of the enemy, Fear is on every side.
Bahnar: “'Nĕ kơ lĕch năm tơ mir chŭn, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ yak rok trong tih, yua kơ lu bơngai ayăt chĕp đao, tơdrong hli krưp tơ jơ̆p puăn pah.

English: O daughter of my people, Dress in sackcloth And roll about in ashes! Make mourning as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; For the plunderer will suddenly come upon us.
Bahnar: Ơ kon drŏ-kăn pơlei Inh, tơ̆n bĕ 'bi tơ kơiĕng, tơglăng akâu tơ lăm tơnuh. Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ, thoi đe sơ'ngon kơ kon dăm lôch, nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon bĕ, yua kơ lu bơngai wă pơrăm blư bla truh blah lu bơ̆n.”

English: “I have set you as an assayer and a fortress among My people, That you may know and test their way.
Bahnar: “Inh ăn kơ ih jing bơngai 'buh pơlong mam. Ih pơlong lăng kon pơlei Inh, wă kơ ih băt kơnăl, lăng hơlen trong lu sư.

English: They are all stubborn rebels, walking as slanderers. They are bronze and iron, They are all corrupters
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư pơm kơnê̆, chă pơma sơlam băl. Hơrăng kơ̆l nhen thoi mam, thoi kong, lu sư pơm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: The bellows blow fiercely, The lead is consumed by the fire; The smelter refines in vain, For the wicked are not drawn off.
Bahnar: Hơtuh tơthu rai dêh, ŭnh pơm kơ bơlơ̆k lek, lu bơngai 'buh dơ̆ng wă kơ rơgoh ưh kơ yua ôh; lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei tam mă tuh hŭt.

English: People will call them rejected silver, Because the LORD has rejected them.”
Bahnar: Đe krao lu sư thoi iă hu đe tŭk, yua kơ Kră Yang achăng lê̆ lu sư boih.”

English: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Stand in the gate of the LORD’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who enter in at these gates to worship the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: “Dơ̆ng bĕ 'bơ̆t 'măng jang hnam Kră Yang, roi tơdrong 'nâu: ‘Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan 'nâu: Ơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch Juđa lu bơngai mă mơ̆t trong 'măng jang 'nâu wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.’ ”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan thoi âu: “Hơmet tơplih ming bĕ trong tơdrong arih lu iĕm păng tơdrong jang lu iĕm; lei na Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm oei oei lăm anih 'nâu.

English: Do not trust in these lying words, saying, ‘The temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD are these.’
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ lui gơnang kơ nơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh khan: ‘'Nâu boih hnam Kră Yang hnam Kră Yang hnam Kră Yang!’ ”

English: “For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if you thoroughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbor
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm tơplih ming trong arih păng tơdrong jang lu iĕm tơpă, tơdah lu iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt tơduă lu iĕm mă tơpă.

English: if you do not oppress the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place, or walk after other gods to your hurt
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm huay kơ pơjuă pơđep lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti, lu drŏ-kăn adro păng huay kơ pơlôch tuh pham lăm anih âu păng kư̆m huay kơ kiơ̆ kơkuh kơ yang nai wă pơrăm kơ iĕm kơdih

English: then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.
Bahnar: na Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm oei arih tơ lăm anih 'nâu lăm dêh char mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ 'bok yă iĕm đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ ning-mônh hloi.

English: “Behold, you trust in lying words that cannot profit.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lu iĕm oei lui gơnang kơ nơ̆r hơlĕnh ưh kơ đei yua ôh.

English: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods whom you do not know
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ lu iĕm tơtông, pơlôch bơngai, pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, pơkă hơlĕnh, soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ yang Baal, kiơ̆ yang nai mă iĕm ưh kơ băt

English: and then come and stand before Me in this house which is called by My name, and say, ‘We are delivered to do all these abominations’?
Bahnar: Păng đơ̆ng noh năm dơ̆ng kơkuh kơ Inh, tơ hnam âu, anih mă đe krao Anăn Inh, păng khan: “Lu bơ̆n klaih hiôk boih.” Hiôk oei wă pơm dôm tơdrong Inh areh noh?

English: Has this house, which is called by My name, become a den of thieves in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lei lu iĕm lăng hnam âu, anih Anăn Inh, thoi anih tơtông klĕ hă? Âu Inh, Inh 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong noh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “But go now to My place which was in Shiloh, where I set My name at the first, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.
Bahnar: “Thoi noh, năm bĕ tơ Silô anih Inh oei sơ̆, anih mă Anăn Inh oei blŭng-a na lăng Inh đei pơm kiơ kơ sư boih yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai Isơrael Inh

English: And now, because you have done all these works,” says the LORD, “and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you did not hear, and I called you, but you did not answer
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ lu iĕm đei pơm boih tôm tơdrong noh mă Inh lơ wơ̆t khan kơ lu iĕm, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng; Inh krao lu iĕm mă-lei lu iĕm kuă kơ tơl nơ̆r Inh.

English: therefore I will do to the house which is called by My name, in which you trust, and to this place which I gave to you and your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong kiơ Inh đei pơm boih kơ pơlei Silô Inh gô pơm kơ hnam âu, hnam krao Anăn Inh, hnam mă lu iĕm gơnang Inh gô pơm lei-lăi kơ anih mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ lu iĕm păng lu 'Bok yă iĕm.

English: And I will cast you out of My sight, as I have cast out all your brethren—the whole posterity of Ephraim.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơpuh lu iĕm đơ̆ng anăp Inh, kư̆m thoi Inh đei pơpuh boih 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm, đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch kon sâu Êphraim.

English: “Therefore do not pray for this people, nor lift up a cry or prayer for them, nor make intercession to Me; for I will not hear you.
Bahnar: Bĭ gah ih, 'nĕ pă krao khan ăn kơ adrĕch adrung 'nâu; kư̆m 'nĕ kơ ôr krao apinh yua kơ lu đe âu, ih kư̆m 'nĕ krao lung Inh, yua kơ Inh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ih ôh.

English: Do you not see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ 'bôh ôh hă tơdrong lu sư pơm tơ pơlei Juđa păng tơ rok trong pơlei tih Jêrusalem?

English: The children gather wood, the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead dough, to make cakes for the queen of heaven; and they pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke Me to anger.
Bahnar: Lu hơ'lơ̆p dônh 'long ŭnh, 'bă tơkuh ŭnh, lu drŏ-kăn jrâu tơpŭng pơm 'bĕng pơyơ̆r kơ pơtao Drŏ-kăn tơ Plĕnh ti; păng lu sư kư̆m tuh pơyơ̆r tơmam huch kơ lu yang nai, pơm wă Inh klai.

English: Do they provoke Me to anger?” says the LORD. “Do they not provoke themselves, to the shame of their own faces?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hăm trŏ lu sư tơblĕk Inh? Hăm trŏ lu sư pơjĭ lu sư kơdih, pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu kơdih?”

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, My anger and My fury will be poured out on this place—on man and on beast, on the trees of the field and on the fruit of the ground. And it will burn and not be quenched.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô tuh tơdrong Inh hil tơ lăm dêh char âu, tơ lu kon bơngai tơ lu sem dơrong tơ lu 'long plei lăm mir păng plei yua đơ̆ng teh. Tơdrong Inh hil gô soh pơđĭ, ŭnh gô sa ưh kơ đei păt.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat meat.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “Thim bĕ tơmam soi 'buh kơ tơmam soi nai, sa bĕ 'nhĕm noh!

English: For I did not speak to your fathers, or command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices.
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh chông tơlĕch lu 'bok yă iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ sơ̆, Inh ưh kơ đei pơma, dah tơtă kơ lu sư gah tơmam soi 'buh dah tơmam soi ôh.

English: But this is what I commanded them, saying, ‘Obey My voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be My people. And walk in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well with you.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'nâu tơdrong Inh tơtă kơ lu sư. ‘Chu bĕ kơ nơ̆r Inh, Inh gô jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Inh. Arih yak kiơ̆ bĕ lăm rim trong Inh đei tơtă, wă kơ lu iĕm đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.’

English: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but followed the counsels and the dictates of their evil hearts, and went backward and not forward.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh kư̆m kuă kơ pơgling đon mơ̆n, lu sư arih kiơ̆ kơdih wă kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆, arăng kơ̆l, lu sư kơdŭn tơ rŏng ưh kơ năm tơ anăp.

English: Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have even sent to you all My servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng năr 'bok yă iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ dang ei, Inh oei chơ̆n wơh đĭch đam Inh, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ lu sư.

English: Yet they did not obey Me or incline their ear, but stiffened their neck. They did worse than their fathers.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh, kư̆m ưh kơ wă pơgling đon mơ̆n, lu sư rai pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu 'bok yă sư.

English: “Therefore you shall speak all these words to them, but they will not obey you. You shall also call to them, but they will not answer you.
Bahnar: Kơplah Ih pơma dôm tơdrong 'nâu, lu sư ưh kơ mơ̆ng ih. Ih krao, mă-lei lu sư kuă kơ tơl.

English: “So you shall say to them, ‘This is a nation that does not obey the voice of the LORD their God nor receive correction. Truth has perished and has been cut off from their mouth.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ lu sư: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, kư̆m ưh kơ wă hơmet ming glăi. Tơdrong sĭt tơpă hiong đĭ boih; 'bơ̆r lu sư ưh pă pơma tơdrong noh dơ̆ng.

English: Cut off your hair and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the desolate heights; for the LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.’
Bahnar: Hơkôih bĕ sŏk kơ̆l lu iĕm păng klơ̆m lê̆ mă ataih; ôr nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ tơ kơpal groi, yua kơ Kră Yang sơngah hŭt lê̆ boih adrĕch adrung mă Sư hil mĭl 'nâu.’ ”

English: For the children of Judah have done evil in My sight,” says the LORD. “They have set their abominations in the house which is called by My name, to pollute it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Bơngai Juđa pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, lu sư pơm boih rup yang mă Inh lăng krưp lăm hnam Anăn Inh, pơm kơ hnam noh 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I did not command, nor did it come into My heart.
Bahnar: Lu sư man dơ̆ng anih kơjung tơ Tôphet, lăm Thŭng Ben Hinôm, wă 'buh pơyơ̆r kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn lăm ŭnh; tơdrong noh Inh ưh kơ đei bơtho tơtă, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ tơchĕng mơ̆n tơdrong noh.

English: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “when it will no more be called Tophet, or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter; for they will bury in Tophet until there is no room.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan; Yua kơ thoi noh na truh tơ ei kơnh đe ưh pă krao boih Tôphet păng Thŭng Ben Hinôm, mă-lei krao Thŭng Tơkoh tơ'bet băl; yua kơ lu sư gô 'bŭ bơngai lôch tơ Tôphet dĭng mah anih pă đei.

English: The corpses of this people will be food for the birds of the heaven and for the beasts of the earth. And no one will frighten them away.
Bahnar: Akâu kon pơlei lôch jing tơmam sa kơ lu sem păr păng lu sem bri brah; ưh kơ đei bu puh lu sư.

English: Then I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah and from the streets of Jerusalem the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride. For the land shall be desolate.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtôch ưh pă đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r hiĕk chơt hiôk năr pơkong klo kăn, tơ lăm pơlei tih Juđa păng tơ rok trong tih pơlei Jêrusalem yua kơ lăm dêh char răm đĭ jing juơ.”

English: “At that time,” says the LORD, “they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of its princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Kơplah noh, đe gô kôch kơting lu pơtao đe Juđa, kơting lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu 'bok soi, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng đĭ-đăng kơting lu kon pơlei oei pơlei Jêrusalem đơ̆ng lăm bơsat.

English: They shall spread them before the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven, which they have loved and which they have served and after which they have walked, which they have sought and which they have worshiped. They shall not be gathered nor buried; they shall be like refuse on the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Đe gô sơ̆k kơting noh tơ tŏ măt 'năr măt khei păng lu sơnglŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh ti, noh tơmam mă lu sư 'mêm kơeng, chơchă kơkuh awih awăn, kiơ̆. Lu kơting noh đe ưh pă đei dônh pơpôi, ưh pă 'bŭ dơ̆ng; gô jing thoi mơ̆r kơpal teh.

English: Then death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of those who remain of this evil family, who remain in all the places where I have driven them,” says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă oei đei đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung bơngai kơnê̆ âu, lăm đĭ-đăng anih mă Inh đei pơpuh lê̆ boih lu sư 'maih chă lôch hloh kơ 'maih wă arih,” noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan.

English: “Moreover you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Will they fall and not rise? Will one turn away and not return?
Bahnar: “Ăn kơ ih roi bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘'Nâu Kră Yang khan: ‘Bơngai pơ̆k hăm pă iung dơ̆ng? Bơngai jrok hăm wơ̆t brŏk dơ̆ng?

English: Why has this people slidden back, Jerusalem, in a perpetual backsliding? They hold fast to deceit, They refuse to return.
Bahnar: Lei liơ kon pơlei âu jrok hloi? Liơ kon pơlei Jêrusalem wơ̆l jrok ling-lang? Lu sư rôp kơjăp tơdrong hơlĕnh, sơngah kuă kơ wih brŏk.

English: I listened and heard, But they do not speak aright. No man repented of his wickedness, Saying, ‘What have I done?’ Everyone turned to his own course, As the horse rushes into the battle.
Bahnar: Inh pơgling đon păng oei mơ̆ng, mă-lei lu sư pơma ưh kơ tơpăt ôh. Ưh kơ đei bu tơbral tơdrong yoch sư, na khan: “Tơdrong kiơ inh đei pơm boih?” Rim 'nu yak kiơ̆ trong lu sư kơdih, thoi aseh hrơ̆t năm tơpăt tơ anăp wă tơblah.

English: “Even the stork in the heavens Knows her appointed times; And the turtledove, the swift, and the swallow Observe the time of their coming. But My people do not know the judgment of the LORD.
Bahnar: Klang kok tơ rơwơ̆ng kư̆m băt kơ bơyan, păng sem kơtơp, sem pleng păng sem chơgơi, kư̆m băt kơ khei 'năr brŏk; mă-lei kon pơlei pơla Inh ưh kơ băt ôh khôi juăt Kră Yang.

English: “How can you say, ‘We are wise, And the law of the LORD is with us’? Look, the false pen of the scribe certainly works falsehood.
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm gơh khan: “Lu nhôn hơgei boih, lu nhôn đei khôi juăt Kră Yang? Mă-lei âu, lu bơngai chih hla bơar chih hơlĕnh. Pơm pơglăi lê̆ kơ khôi juăt Inh

English: The wise men are ashamed, They are dismayed and taken. Behold, they have rejected the word of the LORD; So what wisdom do they have?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơgei gô mơlâu, hli tơrơ păng đe gô rôp lu sư; 'Nâu, lu sư sơngah boih kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang, lei lu sư wă đei hơgei liơ dơ̆ng?

English: Therefore I will give their wives to others, And their fields to those who will inherit them; Because from the least even to the greatest Everyone is given to covetousness; From the prophet even to the priest Everyone deals falsely.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh gô ăn kơ đe nai iŏk akăn lu sư, chŭn mir lu sư kư̆m ăn kơ đe nai jang. Iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm iĕ truh tơ lu bơngai pơm tih, tă kơ chă lơi kơdih ngăl. Đơ̆ng lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol truh tơ lu 'bok soi, rim 'nu kơ lu sư tă kơ sa pơgâm ngăl.

English: For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of My people slightly, Saying, ‘Peace, peace!’ When there is no peace.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơmet rơka kon pơlei pơla Inh, chă yôk yak đĕch khan: Hiôk-hian, 'lơ̆ng rŏ!’ ” Tơpă ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian.

English: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No! They were not at all ashamed, Nor did they know how to blush. Therefore they shall fall among those who fall; In the time of their punishment They shall be cast down,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Trŏ kơ lu sư mơlâu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt mơlâu, Kŭm ưh kơ băt hlơ̆l lĕm. Thoi noh na lu sư gô huŏng pơ̆k hơdai lu bơngai mă pơ̆k huŏng; truh năr wă phak lu sư gô pơ̆k răm,” noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “I will surely consume them,” says the LORD. “No grapes shall be on the vine, Nor figs on the fig tree, And the leaf shall fade; And the things I have given them shall pass away from them.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơpă Inh gô iŏk lê̆ đĭ mir pơgar lu sư, tơm hơmu ưh pă đei plei; tơm hơra kư̆m ưh pă plei; hla lu sư gô kro hơlŭng, Dôm tơmam mă Inh đei ăn kơ lu sư boih, Inh gô pơdrâu iŏk đơ̆ng ti lu sư!”

English: “Why do we sit still? Assemble yourselves, And let us enter the fortified cities, And let us be silent there. For the LORD our God has put us to silence And given us water of gall to drink, Because we have sinned against the LORD.
Bahnar: “Liơ lu bơ̆n hơ-oei tơ âu? Bĕ bơ̆n akŭm băl! Bĕ bơ̆n kơdâu ôn mơ̆t oei tơ lăm lu pơlei tih kơjăp noh păng lôch tơ noh, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă pơlôch pơrăm bơ̆n! Sư ăn boih kơ bơ̆n nhă đak bơnhŭl yua kơ bơ̆n pơm yoch boih hăm Sư.

English: “We looked for peace, but no good came; And for a time of health, and there was trouble!
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n oei chang wă kơ đei hiôk-hian, mă-lei ưh kơ đei tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong hiôk. Bơ̆n chang wă kơ klaih, mă-lei tă kơ đei tơdrong hli hlơt krưp truh.

English: The snorting of His horses was heard from Dan. The whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of His strong ones; For they have come and devoured the land and all that is in it, The city and those who dwell in it.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơring Đan, đe kơtơ̆ng aseh hmoi; wă kơtơ̆ng aseh ôr, đĭ-đăng jơ̆p kơ teh đak pơpơ̆; Lu sư truh wă pơrăm teh hăm lu tơmam lăm noh, lu pơlei tih hăm lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei noh.”

English: “For behold, I will send serpents among you, Vipers which cannot be charmed, And they shall bite you,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “'Nâu, Inh gô ăn 'bih truh tơ lu iĕm, 'Bih dong ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơlung sư, Sư gô choh lu iĕm,” noh Kră Yang khan.

English: I would comfort myself in sorrow; My heart is faint in me.
Bahnar: Tơdrong chơt hiôk inh pă đei boih, a tơdrong pơmat pơm kơ inh, jơhngơ̆m inh đĭ rơdu rơmơ̆n.

English: Listen! The voice, The cry of the daughter of my people From a far country: “Is not the LORD in Zion? Is not her King in her?” “Why have they provoked Me to anger With their carved images— With foreign idols?”
Bahnar: Ei, mơ̆ng bĕ, lu kon pơlei Inh nhơ̆m hmoi đơ̆ng char ataih, “Kră Yang ưh pă oei lăm Siôn boih hă? Pơtao ưh pă oei lăm noh boih hă?” “Liơ lu sư pơ̆n tơblĕk Inh yua rup yang man, hăm rup yang traih ưh kơ yua đơ̆ng dêh tơmoi?”

English: “The harvest is past, The summer is ended, And we are not saved!”
Bahnar: Bơyan yuă 'ba hloh boih, Bơyan phang đĭ boih, Mă-lei bơ̆n ưh tam mă đei dŏng pơklaih?

English: For the hurt of the daughter of my people I am hurt. I am mourning; Astonishment has taken hold of me.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh pơchah yua kơ 'mêm mơnat kơ kon pơlei inh pơmat, Inh nhơ̆m sơ'ngon, lăm jơhngơ̆m inh pă sŭk boih.

English: Is there no balm in Gilead, Is there no physician there? Why then is there no recovery For the health of the daughter of my people?
Bahnar: Lăm dêh Gileat hăm pă đei 'long pơgang pơklaih rơka ưh? Hăm pă đei 'bok pơgang tơ noh? Liơ mă rơka lu kon pơlei inh ưh kơ klaih?

English: Oh, that my head were waters, And my eyes a fountain of tears, That I might weep day and night For the slain of the daughter of my people!
Bahnar: Ô! Rŏ kơ kơ̆l inh jing đak mơlĕch, măt inh jing tu đak măt! Wă kơ inh kĕ nhơ̆m hmoi prăt năr prăt măng kơ lu kon pơlei inh mă lôch boih!

English: Oh, that I had in the wilderness A lodging place for travelers; That I might leave my people, And go from them! For they are all adulterers, An assembly of treacherous men.
Bahnar: Ô! Rŏ kơ inh đei minh anih pơm anih pơdơh lăm char glă, thoi anih kơ lu bơngai tơmoi drong găn, wă kơ inh gơh weh lê̆ ataih păng achăng lê̆ kon pơlei inh; Yua kơ lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, minh khŭl bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: “And like their bow they have bent their tongues for lies. They are not valiant for the truth on the earth. For they proceed from evil to evil, And they do not know Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Lu sư gŭt hơpiĕt thoi gŭt hră. Wă prah tơlĕch nơ̆r hơlĕnh pơdăr. Lu sư jing gơh pơgơ̆r lăm char đơ̆ng tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr. Ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong sĭt tơpă. Lu sư pơm yoch 'nâu pơm yoch plơ̆ng dơ̆ng. Păng đĭ ưh pă băt kơ Inh,” noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Everyone take heed to his neighbor, And do not trust any brother; For every brother will utterly supplant, And every neighbor will walk with slanderers.
Bahnar: “Ăn kơ rim 'nu kơchăng kơ rông 'bôt sư, 'nĕ kơ lui gơnang kơ lu 'nhŏng oh; yua kơ 'nhŏng noh gô hơlĕnh pơdăr kơ 'nhŏng oh sư. Lu rông 'bôt chă pơma kơnê̆ sơlam băl.

English: Everyone will deceive his neighbor, And will not speak the truth; They have taught their tongue to speak lies; They weary themselves to commit iniquity.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu gô chă hơlĕnh pơdăr băl. Ưh kơ đei bu pơma tơpăt ôh; Lu sư pơjuăt boih hơpiĕt lu sư pơma hơlĕnh. Lu sư hrăn nŏng pơm tơdrong kơnê̆. Đĭ lap kơdih akâu.

English: Your dwelling place is in the midst of deceit; Through deceit they refuse to know Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ih oei lăm tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr. Đơ̆ng tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr noh na lu sư sơngah kuă kơ băt kơ Inh,” Kră Yang khan.

English: Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: “Behold, I will refine them and try them; For how shall I deal with the daughter of My people?
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Âu Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư rơgoh hăm ŭnh wă pơlong lu sư, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư Inh ưh kơ gơh wă pơm kiơ nai kơ kon pơlei Inh?

English: Their tongue is an arrow shot out; It speaks deceit; One speaks peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth, But in his heart he lies in wait.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt lu sư jing brơ̆m hơkăm, pơma lĕch nơ̆r hơlĕnh pơdăr; lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư, bu bu kư̆m khan hiôk-hian hăm lu rông 'bôt sư, mă-lei lăm jơhngơ̆m sư, răp wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ buăl sư.

English: Shall I not punish them for these things?” says the LORD. “Shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh ưh kơ phak lu sư hă kơ tơdrong âu? Na Inh ưh iung kơting hă kơ lu dêh char thoi âu?”

English: I will take up a weeping and wailing for the mountains, And for the dwelling places of the wilderness a lamentation, Because they are burned up, So that no one can pass through; Nor can men hear the voice of the cattle. Both the birds of the heavens and the beasts have fled; They are gone.
Bahnar: “Inh gô nhơ̆m hmoi kơ kông, nhơ̆m hmoi kơ tơmăn 'nhĕt lăm char glă, đe pơrăm lê̆ lu sư boih: ‘Ô dĭng mah pă đei bơngai yak găn rok noh. Tơ noh kư̆m pă đei kơtơ̆ng lu kon rơmo hmoi, Mă lu sem păr kư̆m pă kơtơ̆ng asi, lu sem bri kư̆m kơdâu đĭ tơ nai.’

English: “I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a den of jackals. I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ pơlei Jêrusalem jing anih rơ̆m rĕk. Jing anih kơ lu kŏ bri oei; păng kơ char Juđa jing juơ, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu gơh oei.”

English: Who is the wise man who may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the LORD has spoken, that he may declare it? Why does the land perish and burn up like a wilderness, so that no one can pass through?
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơh hơgei kĕ băt hlôh kơ tơdrong 'nâu? Bơngai bu mă Kră Yang pơhrăm boih wă kơ sư tơblang tơdrong 'nâu? Liơ mă dêh char pơrăm đĭ jing juơ rơhiăng thoi lăm char glă, dĭng mah pă đei bơngai bu yak rok noh?

English: And the LORD said, “Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not obeyed My voice, nor walked according to it
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ boih khôi juăt Inh mă đei tơbăt, kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh păng kư̆m kuă kơ arih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Inh.

English: but they have walked according to the dictates of their own hearts and after the Baals, which their fathers taught them,”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư yak kiơ̆ jơhngơ̆m arăng lu sư kơdih, na kiơ̆ lu yang Baal, kiơ̆ thoi 'bok yă lu sư bơtho ăn boih kơ lu sư.”

English: therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will feed them, this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael khan: “'Nâu Inh gô 'me rong kon pơlei 'nâu hăm 'long tăng păng ăn kơ lu sư nhă đak hơkăm bơnhŭl.

English: I will scatter them also among the Gentiles, whom neither they nor their fathers have known. And I will send a sword after them until I have consumed them.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơpuh lu sư tơklah tơklang năm tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai, mă lu sư dah 'bok yă lu sư tam biơh băt, Inh gô ăn kơ đe druh pơlôch lu sư hăm đao gưm, dĭng Inh pơrăm đĭ lu sư.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Consider and call for the mourning women, That they may come; And send for skillful wailing women, That they may come.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lăng bĕ, krao bĕ lu drŏ-kăn hmoi ăn, athei chă krao lu bơngai drŏ-kăn hmoi hơgei truh tơ âu

English: Let them make haste And take up a wailing for us, That our eyes may run with tears, And our eyelids gush with water.
Bahnar: Athei lu sư mă kuăng jah nhơ̆m hmoi kơ bơ̆n, Wă kơ măt lu bơ̆n kư̆m lĕch đak măt ăn kơ kon-ngai lăm măt lu bơ̆n đei đak măt ro.

English: For a voice of wailing is heard from Zion: ‘How we are plundered! We are greatly ashamed, Because we have forsaken the land, Because we have been cast out of our dwellings.’ ”
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi lăm pơlei Siôn: ‘Răm boih hiong đĭ boih chăl arih nhôn. Bơ̆n mơlâu tih dêh, Bơ̆n athei achăng lê̆ teh đak âu! Anih hnam bơ̆n oei đe pơrăm đĭ.’

English: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O women, And let your ear receive the word of His mouth; Teach your daughters wailing, And everyone her neighbor a lamentation.
Bahnar: Ơ lu drŏ-kăn mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang; Pơih đon lu iĕm mơ̆ng iŏk bĕ nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư pơma. Bơtho pơhrăm bĕ kơ lu kon drŏ-kăn iĕm tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi, bơtho băl hmoi jô̆.
