English: For death has come through our windows, Has entered our palaces, To kill off the children— no longer to be outside! And the young men— no longer on the streets!
Bahnar: Tơdrong lôch tŏk tơ 'măng-'mŏk bơ̆n boih, Mơ̆t truh boih tơ lu anih kơjăp bơ̆n; Pơlôch boih lu hơ'lơ̆p tơ rok trong tih, pơlôch boih kon tơdăm bơ̆n tơ lăm cham pơlei.”

English: Speak, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Even the carcasses of men shall fall as refuse on the open field, Like cuttings after the harvester, And no one shall gather them.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Akâu lu bơngai lôch pơ̆k boih tơ lăm chŭn, thoi đe tuh mơ̆r kơ teh, thoi hơie 'ba huŏng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe yuă, ưh kơ đei bu wă dônh akŭm lu sư.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, Let not the mighty man glory in his might, Nor let the rich man glory in his riches
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Bơngai hơgei 'nĕ pă pơang kơ sư hơgei, bơngai pran 'nĕ pă pơang kơ sư pran. Bơngai mơdrŏng kư̆m 'nĕ pă pơang kơ sư mơdrŏng

English: But let him who glories glory in this, That he understands and knows Me, That I am the LORD, exercising lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness in the earth. For in these I delight,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu wă pơang, pơang bĕ kơ kơdih tơdrong 'nâu, pơang kơ tơdrong sư đei đon hơgei băt kơ Inh. Băt Inh boih Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla 'mêm mơnat ưh kơ tơplih, Tơ'ngla mă pơm tơdrong tơpăt, tơdrong trŏ lăm teh đak âu; na Inh hiôk lăm tơdrong noh,” noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “that I will punish all who are circumcised with the uncircumcised
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu năr gô truh, Inh wă phak lu bơngai kăt tơdra akar, gah sĕch akar đĕch.

English: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the people of Ammon, Moab, and all who are in the farthest corners, who dwell in the wilderness. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-nglo Êyiptơ, bơngai Juđa, bơngai Eđôm, lu bơngai Ammôn, bơngai Môap păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei lăm char glă hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch sơ'ngon, yua kơ lu kon pơlei noh hăm đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch Isơrael ưh tam mă kăt tơdra akar lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư.”

English: Hear the word which the LORD speaks to you, O house of Israel.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng bĕ Kră Yang khan kơ lu iĕm.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Do not learn the way of the Gentiles; Do not be dismayed at the signs of heaven, For the Gentiles are dismayed at them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nĕ kơ arih kiơ̆ trong lu bơngai dêh nai, 'nĕ kơ hli mă đei tơdra tơ plĕnh, mă khan lu sư bơngai dêh nai ngăl hli kơ tơdra noh.

English: For the customs of the peoples are futile; For one cuts a tree from the forest, The work of the hands of the workman, with the ax.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong juăt lu sư noh tơdrong kơ đei. Đe kăl 'long lăm bri, yua ti thơ̆ traih hơmet hăm sung.

English: They decorate it with silver and gold; They fasten it with nails and hammers So that it will not topple.
Bahnar: Đe pơgong pơrŏ 'long noh hăm hu hăm maih; iŏk mut kơđĭnh pơ̆ng kơjăp, wă huay kơ păk.

English: They are upright, like a palm tree, And they cannot speak; They must be carried, Because they cannot go by themselves. Do not be afraid of them, For they cannot do evil, Nor can they do any good.”
Bahnar: Rup yang lu sư nhen thoi ngu hơtol kơ sem lăm pơgar pia mơkai; Ưh kơ gơh pơma; đe tung đĕch, yua kơ ưh kơ gơh nơnăm. 'Nĕ kơ hli kơ lu rup yang noh, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơrăm bơ̆n ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ bơ̆n mơ̆n.

English: Inasmuch as there is none like You, O LORD (You are great, and Your name is great in might)
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei yang kiơ thoi Ih ơ Kră Yang. Ih boih Kră Yang Tih Dêh, Ih mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang hloh.

English: Who would not fear You, O King of the nations? For this is Your rightful due. For among all the wise men of the nations, And in all their kingdoms, There is none like You.
Bahnar: Bu mă ưh kơ hli yom kơ Ih, ơ Pơtao kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char! Ih trŏ tơpă thoi noh, lăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai hơgei rim adrĕch adrung kon bơngai, lăm jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char, ưh kơ đei bu thoi Ih.

English: But they are altogether dull-hearted and foolish; A wooden idol is a worthless doctrine.
Bahnar: Lu sư jing kơtul kơwao ngăl; rup yang hăm 'long đe traih bơtho lu sư

English: Silver is beaten into plates; It is brought from Tarshish, And gold from Uphaz, The work of the craftsman And of the hands of the metalsmith; Blue and purple are their clothing; They are all the work of skillful men.
Bahnar: Đe chĕp ba hu tơtang hơtăng đơ̆ng pơlei Tarsis, păng maih đơ̆ng char Uphas. Noh tơdrong jang lu thơ̆ hơjơ̆m, hăm ti thơ̆ hling maih, sĭt sôr pơgong lăm ao che jơk hơhĭm, noh đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai thơ̆ hơgei tanh.

English: But the LORD is the true God; He is the living God and the everlasting King. At His wrath the earth will tremble, And the nations will not be able to endure His indignation.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei sĭt; Sư jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih; Pơtao ling-lang. Mưh Sư hil teh đak pơpơ̆; đĭ-đăng dêh char ưh kơ kĕ pŭ iŏk ôh dôm tơdrong Sư hil mĭl.”

English: Thus you shall say to them: “The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth shall perish from the earth and from under these heavens.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, khan bĕ kơ lu sư: Lu yang âu ưh kơ pơjing plĕnh teh ôh. Lu sư gô hiong tôch ala plĕnh kơpal teh âu đĕch.”

English: He has made the earth by His power, He has established the world by His wisdom, And has stretched out the heavens at His discretion.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang boih pơjing teh âu hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư; Sư tơiung pơdơ̆ng hăm tơdrong hơgei Sư, bơyar boih plĕnh hăm tơdrong hlôh wao Sư.

English: When He utters His voice, There is a multitude of waters in the heavens: “And He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain, He brings the wind out of His treasuries.”
Bahnar: Mưh Sư ăn grơ̆m, lu tu đak re jơwa lăm plĕnh. Sư ăn tŭk hơyuh đak tŏk đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak. Sư ăn kơmlat đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l 'mi, păng kial lĕch đơ̆ng anih hnam Sư.

English: Everyone is dull-hearted, without knowledge; Every metalsmith is put to shame by an image; For his molded image is falsehood, And there is no breath in them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai jing kơtul kơwao păng ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong kiơ. Rim 'nu bơngai thơ̆ hling rup yang mơlâu yua kơ rup yang lu sư, yang lu sư hling noh chă hơlĕnh đĕch, ưh kơ gơh dui jơhngơ̆m.

English: They are futile, a work of errors; In the time of their punishment they shall perish.
Bahnar: Lu rup yang ưh kơ đei yua kiơ, chă hơlĕnh đĕch, Truh năr sek tơlang kơnh gô pơrăm đĭ.

English: The Portion of Jacob is not like them, For He is the Maker of all things, And Israel is the tribe of His inheritance; The LORD of hosts is His name.
Bahnar: Tơmam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn kơ Jakôp ưh kơ trŏ thoi noh ôh, yua kơ Sư boih pơjing kơ đĭ-đăng tôm tơmam, mă bơngai Isơrael kư̆m adrĕch adrung Sư; Kră Yang Tih Hloh noh anăn Sư.

English: Gather up your wares from the land, O inhabitant of the fortress!
Bahnar: Kon Pơlei mă đe oei wang, Iŏk pơpôi bĕ mŭk tơmam iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char âu.”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will throw out at this time The inhabitants of the land, And will distress them, That they may find it so.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr âu Inh gô pơpuh lu bơngai mă oei lăm char âu, Inh gô ăn tơdrong truh, wă kơ đe rôp lu sư pơm bơnă.”

English: Woe is me for my hurt! My wound is severe. But I say, “Truly this is an infirmity, And I must bear it.”
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ inh yua kơ inh jĭ rơka! Rơka inh ưh kơ gơh klaih. Inh khan: “'Nâu lăp tơdrong jĭ đĕch, na inh athei pŭ tơdrong noh.”

English: My tent is plundered, And all my cords are broken; My children have gone from me, And they are no more. There is no one to pitch my tent anymore, Or set up my curtains.
Bahnar: Bơsŭn inh răm đĭ boih, Tơlei chô̆ bơsŭn kơtĕch đĭ boih; Lu đe kon inh weh boih đơ̆ng inh, ưh pă đei 'bôh lu sư boih, Ưh pă đei bu boih tơgŭm pơdơ̆ng ming bơsŭn inh. Kŭm ưh pă đei pĕng che anih inh oei.

English: For the shepherds have become dull-hearted, And have not sought the LORD; Therefore they shall not prosper, And all their flocks shall be scattered.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai yŏng kơhlôh. Ưh kơ đei apinh Kră Yang ôh na lu sư răm đĭ, Na kon pơlei lu sư tơklah tơklang.

English: Behold, the noise of the report has come, And a great commotion out of the north country, To make the cities of Judah desolate, a den of jackals.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ, đei tơdrong 'nao truh! Đei tơdrong rŭng răng đơ̆ng char gah yă-nơ̆m, Wă pơm ăn kơ pơlei tih Juđa jing juơ, Jing anih kŏ bri oei.

English: O LORD, I know the way of man is not in himself; It is not in man who walks to direct his own steps.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Inh băt kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơm yŏng kơ sư kơdih, Kŭm ưh kơ gơh bơwei kơnao yak lu sư kơdih mơ̆n.

English: O LORD, correct me, but with justice; Not in Your anger, lest You bring me to nothing.
Bahnar: Hơmet inh bĕ, ơ Kră Yang, mă-lei kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong trŏ lăp, 'Nĕ kơ phak inh kiơ̆ tơdrong Ih hil. Kơnh hli kơ Ih pơrăm inh.

English: Pour out Your fury on the Gentiles, who do not know You, And on the families who do not call on Your name; For they have eaten up Jacob, Devoured him and consumed him, And made his dwelling place desolate.
Bahnar: Tuh bĕ tơdrong Ih hil mĭl kơ lu dêh char, Lu dêh char mă ưh kơ băt kơ Ih, Păng lu adrĕch adrung mă ưh kơ krao khan hăm anăn Ih. Yua kơ lu sư pơrăm boih Jakôp, Lu sư pơlôch pơrăm sư, Lu sư pơrăm dêh char sư.

English: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi thoi âu

English: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem
Bahnar: “Mơ̆ng bĕ lu nơ̆r tơdrong pơgơ̆p âu, khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai lăm char Juđa păng lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: and say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD God of Israel: “Cursed is the man who does not obey the words of this covenant
Bahnar: Ih athei khan ăn kơ lu sư, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan thoi âu: ‘Hiap bĕ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơgơ̆p âu.

English: which I commanded your fathers in the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, ‘Obey My voice, and do according to all that I command you; so shall you be My people, and I will be your God,’
Bahnar: Inh đei tơtă boih hăm lu 'bok yă iĕm kơplah Inh chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, lĕch đơ̆ng tơnuh kơdơ̆r đe rơ̆ mam.’ Inh khan: ‘Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh tơtă kơ lu iĕm păng pơm kiơ̆ bĕ dôm nơ̆r Inh đei bơtho tơtă, lei na lu iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, na Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: that I may establish the oath which I have sworn to your fathers, to give them ‘a land flowing with milk and honey,’ as it is this day.” ’ ” And I answered and said, “So be it, LORD.”
Bahnar: Na Inh wă pơsĭt nơ̆r Inh pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok yă iĕm, wă ăn kơ lu sư dêh char 'lơ̆ng đei ro thoi đak sut đak toh,’ char mă iĕm oei dang ei.” Inh tơl: “Ơ Kră Yang ăn đei bĕ thoi noh, A-men.”

English: Then the LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: ‘Hear the words of this covenant and do them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Roi bĕ đĭ dôm nơ̆r pơma âu tơ lăm đĭ-đăng pơlei lăm char Juđa hăm tơ rok trong tih lăm pơlei Jêrusalem: ‘Mơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆ bĕ nơ̆r pơgơ̆p âu.

English: For I earnestly exhorted your fathers in the day I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, until this day, rising early and exhorting, saying, “Obey My voice.”
Bahnar: Inh đei bơtho tơtă boih ăn kơ lu 'bok yă lu iĕm kơplah Inh chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ sơ̆ dĭng truh năr 'nâu, Inh ling-lang tơbăt kơ lu sư: “Chu kiơ̆ bĕ nơ̆r Inh.”

English: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but everyone followed the dictates of his evil heart; therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but which they have not done.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ chu ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, lu sư yak kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ arăng lu sư kơdih. Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh đei phak lu sư kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r pơgơ̆p âu, nơ̆r pơgơ̆p mă Inh đei tơtă boih kơ lu sư wă kơ pơm kiơ̆ mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ ôh.’ ”

English: And the LORD said to me, “A conspiracy has been found among the men of Judah and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh. Đei boih tơdrong pơjah lăm lu bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: They have turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers who refused to hear My words, and they have gone after other gods to serve them; the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken My covenant which I made with their fathers.”
Bahnar: Lu sư wơ̆t kiơ̆ pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi lu 'bok yă lu sư sơ̆, lu bơngai mă sơngah kuă kơ kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă. Lu sư kiơ̆ păng kơkuh kơ yang nai. Adrĕch Isơrael păng adrĕch Juđa pơm glăi boih kơ nơ̆r Inh pơgơ̆p hăm 'bok yă lu sư sơ̆.

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will surely bring calamity on them which they will not be able to escape; and though they cry out to Me, I will not listen to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh gô ăn tơdrong gleh răm truh, lu sư ưh kơ gơh klaih ôh, mă lu sư krao ôr apinh Inh, Inh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng lu sư ôh.

English: Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they offer incense, but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh jơ̆p-jang pơlei lăm dêh char Juđa păng đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơngai mă oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem gô tŏk năm krao kơkuh kơ lu yang mă lu sư oei soh 'long 'bâu phu, mă-lei yang noh ưh kơ gơh pơklaih lu sư ôh, kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong răm truh.

English: For according to the number of your cities were your gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem you have set up altars to that shameful thing, altars to burn incense to Baal.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei rup yang lơ dêh thoi iĕm đei pơlei, ơ bơngai Juđa; lu chơnang soi pơm kơ lu iĕm mơlâu, mă lu iĕm pơdơ̆ng anih boih wă soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ yang Baal lơ nhen thoi trong glung lăm pơlei Jêrusalem!”

English: “So do not pray for this people, or lift up a cry or prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry out to Me because of their trouble.
Bahnar: “Gah ih 'nĕ pă krao khan tơgŭm kon pơlei 'nâu, ih kư̆m 'nĕ yua kơ lu sư na krao apinh, yua kơ Inh ưh pă mơ̆ng boih mă lu sư krao apinh Inh kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong truh.

English: “What has My beloved to do in My house, Having done lewd deeds with many? And the holy flesh has passed from you. When you do evil, then you rejoice.
Bahnar: “Kon pơlei mă Inh 'mêm kơeng pơm kiơ boih lăm hnam Inh? Lu sư pơm yoch kơnê̆. Nơ̆r pơkă păng 'nhĕm tơmam soi hăm gơh găn tơdrong răm wă truh kơ lu iĕm ưh? Lu iĕm chơt hiôk kơplah noh ră?

English: The LORD called your name, Green Olive Tree, Lovely and of Good Fruit. With the noise of a great tumult He has kindled fire on it, And its branches are broken.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Kră Yang krao anăn iĕm 'long ôliwơ bluh hla hơdrih 'lơ̆ng păng đei plei trem. Mă-lei đei jơwa thoi kial hơbŭt kơtang, Kră Yang gô soh lê̆ hla sư, gơ̆ lê̆ dơng sư.

English: “For the LORD of hosts, who planted you, has pronounced doom against you for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke Me to anger in offering incense to Baal.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh boih Tơ'ngla mă pơtăm iĕm, na sư kư̆m đei khan wă pơrăm lu iĕm, yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ adrĕch Isơrael păng adrĕch Juđa pơm, bơhle tơblĕk Inh soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ yang Baal.

English: Now the LORD gave me knowledge of it, and I know it; for You showed me their doings.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei roi ăn boih kơ inh băt tơdrong noh păng inh băt boih; Kră Yang đei pơdah boih kơ inh tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư wă pơm.

English: But I was like a docile lamb brought to the slaughter; and I did not know that they had devised schemes against me, saying, “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be remembered no more.”
Bahnar: Gah inh, thoi minh pôm kon triu rơmơ̆n đe ba wă pơlôch, inh ưh kơ băt lu sư pơđâu wă pơlôch inh, khan: “Pơrăm bĕ đơ̆ng tơm truh tơ plei sư. Kăl klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ sư đơ̆ng teh đak lu bơngai arih, Wă kơ huay pă đei bu 'blŏk kơ anăn sư dơ̆ng.”

English: But, O LORD of hosts, You who judge righteously, Testing the mind and the heart, Let me see Your vengeance on them, For to You I have revealed my cause.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Tơ'ngla sek tơlang tơpăt, Tơ'ngla mă băt, lăm jơhngơ̆m păng lăm kơ̆l 'ngok tơchĕng, Ăn kơ inh 'bôh tơdrong Ih iung kơting kơ lu sư. Yua kơ inh jao boih tơdrong inh kơ Ih.

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your life, saying, ‘Do not prophesy in the name of the LORD, lest you die by our hand’
Bahnar: “Thoi noh Kră Yang khan gah kon pơlei Anathôt lu bơngai chơchă wă pơlôch ih khan: ‘Ih 'nĕ pă khan lê̆ adrol hăm anăn Kră Yang, dah ưh kơ chu ih gô lôch kơ ti nhôn.’

English: therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Behold, I will punish them. The young men shall die by the sword, their sons and their daughters shall die by famine
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô phak lu sư, lu tơdăm gô lôch kơ đao gưm; lu adruh tơdăm kư̆m gô lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt.

English: and there shall be no remnant of them, for I will bring catastrophe on the men of Anathoth, even the year of their punishment.’ ”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu klaih ôh. Yua kơ Inh gô ăn tơdrong gleh răm truh kơ kon pơlei Anathôt lăm sơnăm Inh phak lu sư.’

English: Righteous are You, O LORD, when I plead with You; Yet let me talk with You about Your judgments. Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are those happy who deal so treacherously?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih jơ̆ 'lơ̆ng tơpăt mưh inh roi tơdrong inh kơ Ih. Mă-lei inh oei wă pơma hăm Ih trŏ tơdrong tơpăt Ih: Liơ trong lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei hiôk-hian, liơ tơdrong jang lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr oei mơdrŏng?

English: You have planted them, yes, they have taken root; They grow, yes, they bear fruit. You are near in their mouth But far from their mind.
Bahnar: Ih pơtăm lu sư, lu sư chăt rơh, wơ̆ tih păng đei plei, 'bơ̆r lu sư jê̆ Ih, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m lu sư ataih đơ̆ng Ih.

English: But You, O LORD, know me; You have seen me, And You have tested my heart toward You. Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, And prepare them for the day of slaughter.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt boih kơ inh, Ih 'bôh inh, Ih pơlong lăng păng băt jơhngơ̆m inh hăm Ih, Apinh Ih dui lu sư tơ 'nguaih thoi đe dui triu wă 'bet pơlôch, Apinh Ih lê̆ lu sư pha 'măn kơ năr wă 'bet pơlôch!

English: How long will the land mourn, And the herbs of every field wither? The beasts and birds are consumed, For the wickedness of those who dwell there, Because they said, “He will not see our final end.”
Bahnar: Lăm char gô ơh sơ'ngon dĭng dang yơ? 'Nhĕt tơ chŭn mir gô jô kro dĭng dang yơ? Yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ kon pơlei oei lăm noh pơm, lu sem bri sem păr lôch đĭ. Đei lu sư khan: “Kră Yang ưh kơ 'bôh ôh tơdrong kiơ lu bơ̆n pơm.”

English: “If you have run with the footmen, and they have wearied you, Then how can you contend with horses? And if in the land of peace, In which you trusted, they wearied you, Then how will you do in the floodplain of the Jordan?
Bahnar: Tơdah ih kơdâu pơlong jơ̆ng hoh hăm đe boih, na jei đe, Liơ ih kĕ kơdâu pơlong hăm aseh lĕ? Kơplah lăm char oei hiôk-hian mă ih pơ̆k boih, liơ ih kĕ tŏk lăm bri brah đak Krong Jôrđăn?

English: For even your brothers, the house of your father, Even they have dealt treacherously with you; Yes, they have called a multitude after you. Do not believe them, Even though they speak smooth words to you.
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oh ih adrĕch adrung 'bă ih, mă lu sư kư̆m jreo tơkĕch wă pơm kơ ih. 'Nĕ kơ gơnang kơ lu sư, mă khan lu sư pơma hiôk hăm ih ră.

English: “I have forsaken My house, I have left My heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of My soul into the hand of her enemies.
Bahnar: Inh achăng boih hnam Inh, Inh lê̆ boih kon pơlei Inh; Inh jao boih kon pơlei mă Inh 'mêm lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: My heritage is to Me like a lion in the forest; It cries out against Me; Therefore I have hated it.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh pơm kơ Inh, thoi dăm-brang lăm bri. Sư hơrum wă pơm kơ Inh, thoi noh Inh areh achăng lê̆ lu sư.

English: My heritage is to Me like a speckled vulture; The vultures all around are against her. Come, assemble all the beasts of the field, Bring them to devour!
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh hăm trŏ thoi klang, Lu klang nai wang tăp dăr wă pơm kơ kon pơlei Inh hă? Akŭm bĕ đĭ-đăng lu sem bri, ba lu sư sa kon pơlei Inh.

English: “Many rulers have destroyed My vineyard, They have trodden My portion underfoot; They have made My pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei triu pơrăm boih mir hơmu Inh; Pơjuă gơhlơ̆r teh Inh jang sa; lu sư pơm kơ teh 'lơ̆ng Inh jing bri juơ.

English: They have made it desolate; Desolate, it mourns to Me; The whole land is made desolate, Because no one takes it to heart.
Bahnar: Đe pơm kơ anih noh jing juơ rơhiăng; đe pơrăm boih sư ôr 'bơ̆t anăp Inh. Jơ̆p kơ dêh char noh jing juơ, ưh kơ đei bu wă lăng.

English: The plunderers have come On all the desolate heights in the wilderness, For the sword of the LORD shall devour From one end of the land to the other end of the land; No flesh shall have peace.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wă pơrăm truh boih, tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ groi grôn kơjung tơ lăm tơmăn glă; yua kơ đao gưm Kră Yang oei pơrăm teh đơ̆ng teh âu dĭng tơ to; Ưh kơ đei kon bơngai dah Sem brem kiơ mă oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng.

English: They have sown wheat but reaped thorns; They have put themselves to pain but do not profit. But be ashamed of your harvest Because of the fierce anger of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Lu sư rei boih 'ba mi mă-lei kĕch iŏk găr jơla; lu sư jang hrat mă-lei ưh kơ yua kiơ. Gô mơlâu kơ kĕch iŏk tŏ sĕt, Yua kơ Kră Yang hil kơtang tơpă.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Against all My evil neighbors who touch the inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit—behold, I will pluck them out of their land and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Gah đĭ-đăng lu rông 'bôt Inh mă pơm kơnê̆, mơ̆t iŏk boih tơmam Inh mă ăn kơ lu kon pơlei Inh, Isơrael; 'nâu, Inh gô buch hiŏng lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng lăm char lu sư păng buch hiŏng lê̆ adrĕch Juđa đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu sư.

English: Then it shall be, after I have plucked them out, that I will return and have compassion on them and bring them back, everyone to his heritage and everyone to his land.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Inh buch lê̆ lu sư boih, Inh gô mơnat kơ lu sư dơ̆ng. Inh gô anhăk ba lu sư wih tơ char lu sư kơdih păng iŏk teh jang sa.

English: And it shall be, if they will learn carefully the ways of My people, to swear by My name, ‘As the LORD lives,’ as they taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be established in the midst of My people.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư pơnam hŏk pơhrăm iŏk kiơ̆ trong kon pơlei pơla Inh păng pơkă pơkăm hăm anăn Inh. ‘Tơpă Kră Yang arih,’ thoi sơ̆ lu sư kư̆m bơtho kon pơlei Inh pơkă hăm yang Baal, kơplah noh lu sư gô oei kơjăp lăm kon pơlei pơla Inh.

English: But if they do not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu kon pơlei ayơ kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, Inh gô buch hŭt lê̆ hloi kon pơlei noh, buch pơlôch lê̆ hloi” 'noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Thus the LORD said to me: “Go and get yourself a linen sash, and put it around your waist, but do not put it in water.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Năm răt bĕ che hơtăng tơ̆n kơiĕng ih, na tơ̆n 'bơ̆t kơiĕng ih mă-lei 'nĕ kơ tong lăm đak.”

English: So I got a sash according to the word of the LORD, and put it around my waist.
Bahnar: Inh răt che tơ̆n kơiĕng kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang athei, na inh tơ̆n sư tơ kơiĕng inh.

English: And the word of the LORD came to me the second time, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh wơ̆t mă 'bar dơ̆ng

English: “Take the sash that you acquired, which is around your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole in the rock.”
Bahnar: “Chĕp ba bĕ che tơ̆n kơiĕng mă ih răt, dang ei oei tơ̆n noh, iung năm bĕ tơ jê̆ đak Krong Ơphrat, na tah ôn bĕ che noh lăm tơmo hơđang.”

English: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the LORD commanded me.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh năm ôn lê̆ che noh tơ jê̆ đak Krong Ơphrat kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang athei inh.

English: Now it came to pass after many days that the LORD said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take from there the sash which I commanded you to hide there.”
Bahnar: Đunh năr 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Iung bĕ năm tơ đak Krong Ơphrat na iŏk dơ̆ng che tơ̆n kơiĕng mă Inh đei athei ih ôn tơ noh ki.

English: Then I went to the Euphrates and dug, and I took the sash from the place where I had hidden it; and there was the sash, ruined. It was profitable for nothing.
Bahnar: Na inh năm tơ đak Krong Ơphrat, sir dui iŏk che tơ̆n kơiĕng đơ̆ng anih mă inh ôn lê̆, lăng âu che tơ̆n kơiĕng noh bluch boih, ưh pă gơh yua dơ̆ng.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘In this manner I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Inh gô pơrăm tơdrong pơang lu bơngai Juđa păng tơdrong pơang pơlei tih Jêrusalem.

English: This evil people, who refuse to hear My words, who follow the dictates of their hearts, and walk after other gods to serve them and worship them, shall be just like this sash which is profitable for nothing.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei kơnê̆ âu sơngah boih kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh athei, arih pơm kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m arăng lu sư kơdih wă, kơkuh awih awăn kơ yang nai; na lu sư jing thoi che tơ̆n kơiĕng âu, ưh pă gơh wă yua pơm kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: For as the sash clings to the waist of a man, so I have caused the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah to cling to Me,’ says the LORD, ‘that they may become My people, for renown, for praise, and for glory; but they would not hear.’
Bahnar: Pơtih thoi che tơ̆n kơiĕng klep tơ kơiĕng rim 'nu bơngai thoi yơ, Inh gô ăn kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael, hăm adrĕch Juđa klep tơ Inh thoi noh, wă kơ lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, wă ư-ang, kơ Inh wă kơkuh bơnê kơ Inh. Mă-lei lu sư kuă kơ mơ̆ng Inh.”

English: “Therefore you shall speak to them this word: ‘Thus says the LORD God of Israel: “Every bottle shall be filled with wine.” ’ And they will say to you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every bottle will be filled with wine?’
Bahnar: Roi ăn bĕ kơ lu sư tơdrong 'nâu: “Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: ‘Rim kơdŭng akar sik athei tuh 'bĕnh sik hơmu.’ Tơdah lu sư khan kơ ih: ‘Rŏ kơ nhôn ưh kơ băt rim kơdŭng akar sik athei 'bĕnh kơ đak sik hơmu.”

English: “Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land—even the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem—with drunkenness!
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ lu sư. Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu, Inh gô tuh sik 'bĕnh kơ 'bơ̆r kon pơlei oei lăm dêh char âu, lu pơtao mă hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit, lu 'bok soi, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together,” says the LORD. “I will not pity nor spare nor have mercy, but will destroy them.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô hơtŭt lu sư, lu sư pơchah hơtŭt băl kon drŏ-nglo hăm 'bă sư, Inh ưh pă pơdơh ti, pă mơnat, ưh pă 'mêm kơ lu sư, kơplah Inh pơrăm lu sư.”

English: Hear and give ear: Do not be proud, For the LORD has spoken.
Bahnar: Pơgling đon iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ. 'Nĕ kơ pơang, Yua kơ Kră Yang khan boih.

English: Give glory to the LORD your God Before He causes darkness, And before your feet stumble On the dark mountains, And while you are looking for light, He turns it into the shadow of death And makes it dense darkness.
Bahnar: Ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, adrol kơ Sư wă ăn măng mu truh, adrol kơ jơ̆ng lu iĕm kơtơih 'bơm kông măng mu gueo. Kơplah lu iĕm chă hơdah ră, Sư tơplih tă tơ măng mu, Sư gô ăn kơ măng mu jing măng klăm hơ'bơ̆l gueo.

English: But if you will not hear it, My soul will weep in secret for your pride; My eyes will weep bitterly And run down with tears, Because the LORD’s flock has been taken captive.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng, inh gô nhơ̆m lăm to, yua kơ tơdrong lu iĕm pơang. Măt inh gô nhơ̆m ơh ol dêh, đak măt inh gô lĕch ro, yua kơ triu Kră Yang đe gô rôp pơm bơnă.

English: Say to the king and to the queen mother, “Humble yourselves; Sit down, For your rule shall collapse, the crown of your glory.”
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ pơtao păng mĕ pơtao: “Jur bĕ đơ̆ng tang-dŏ pơtao hơ-oei tơ teh, yua kơ môk pơtao ư-ang huŏng đơ̆ng kơ̆l boih.

English: The cities of the South shall be shut up, And no one shall open them; Judah shall be carried away captive, all of it; It shall be wholly carried away captive.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng pơlei lăm tơring Negewơ đe gô wang tăp, ưh kơ đei bu pơih gơh lĕch. Đĭ-đăng adrĕch Juđa đe gô rôp pơđĭ ưh pă đei bu klaih.

English: Lift up your eyes and see Those who come from the north. Where is the flock that was given to you, Your beautiful sheep?
Bahnar: Ngơk lăng bĕ; lu bơngai mă truh đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m to. Khŭl triu mă Inh ăn boih kơ ih, đĭ-đăng khŭl triu mă ih pơư tơ yơ boih.

English: What will you say when He punishes you? For you have taught them To be chieftains, to be head over you. Will not pangs seize you, Like a woman in labor?
Bahnar: Ih gô pơma liơ mưh Kră Yang ăn minh 'nu bơngai tơmoi pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r ih. Lu bơngai mă buăl juăt iĕm, lu bơngai mă lu iĕm đei bơtho pơhrăm lê̆ sơ̆? Ih ưh kơ jĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn hơiơch?

English: And if you say in your heart, “Why have these things come upon me?” For the greatness of your iniquity Your skirts have been uncovered, Your heels made bare.
Bahnar: Păng tơdah ih khan lăm jơhngơ̆m ih. “Yua kơ kiơ tơdrong 'nâu truh kơ inh?” Noh yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ih tih tơpă. Dĭng mah đe tưk hơbĕn ih, păng đe gô tơrôp pơm kơnê̆ kơ ih.

English: Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard its spots? Then may you also do good who are accustomed to do evil.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êthiôpi hăm gơh tơplih ming akar găm lu sư, djrang hăm gơh tơplih sŏk brông lu sư, lu iĕm kư̆m lei-lăi juăt kơ pơm yoch boih. Liơ iĕm gơh pơm 'lơ̆ng?

English: “Therefore I will scatter them like stubble That passes away by the wind of the wilderness.
Bahnar: “Inh gô pơpuh pơđông lu iĕm thoi kial bah đơ̆ng char glă pơđông hơkam 'ba.

English: This is your lot, The portion of your measures from Me,” says the LORD, “Because you have forgotten Me And trusted in falsehood.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong Inh 'măn lê̆ kơ iĕm, đei klah asong hơgăt lê̆ pha ăn kơ ih.” Noh Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ iĕm hiơt kơ Inh boih; na gơnang kơ rup yang hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: Therefore I will uncover your skirts over your face, That your shame may appear.
Bahnar: Inh gô plôh lê̆ hơbĕn iĕm truh tơ muh măt iĕm, na gô 'bôh tơdrong mơlâu iĕm.

English: I have seen your adulteries And your lustful neighings, The lewdness of your harlotry, Your abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe to you, O Jerusalem! Will you still not be made clean?”
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm pơm, Ih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, tơdrong luĕl 'blal. Pơm pơyô kư̆ kă tơ lăm groi dah tơ mir chŭn. Ơ Jêrusalem răm-'băm tơpă kơ iĕm! Iĕm ưh kơ wă hơmet rơgoh dĭng dang yơ?”

English: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi kơ tơdrong wă đei phang-ang.

English: “Judah mourns, And her gates languish; They mourn for the land, And the cry of Jerusalem has gone up.
Bahnar: “Char Juđa ơh sơ'ngon, lu pơlei tih sư kư̆m ơh ăk, kon pơlei nhơ̆m hmoi drap tơ teh, Kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr krao đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Their nobles have sent their lads for water; They went to the cisterns and found no water. They returned with their vessels empty; They were ashamed and confounded And covered their heads.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng tơ'ngla wơh lu đĭch đam sư năm chă đak, lu sư năm tơ sơlŭng đak mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bôh đak, lu sư wih brŏk ge hoh; lu yŏng tơ'ngla mơlâu hlơ̆l, gom lê̆ kơ̆l lu sư.

English: Because the ground is parched, For there was no rain in the land, The plowmen were ashamed; They covered their heads.
Bahnar: Teh kro hơđang đĭ, yua kơ ưh pă đei 'mi jur boih tơ teh, lu bơngai jang mir 'ba ơh sơ'ngon na gom kơ̆l lu sư.

English: Yes, the deer also gave birth in the field, But left because there was no grass.
Bahnar: Juei akăn 'nao tuh kon, kư̆m achăng lê̆ kon sư, yua kơ ưh kơ đei 'nhĕt wă sa.

English: And the wild donkeys stood in the desolate heights; They sniffed at the wind like jackals; Their eyes failed because there was no grass.”
Bahnar: Lu aseh bri oei dơ̆ng kơpal groi dui jơhngơ̆m mơhik thoi kŏ bri, măt lu sư hơlơp yua kơ ưh kơ đei 'nhĕt sa.”

English: O LORD, though our iniquities testify against us, Do it for Your name’s sake; For our backslidings are many, We have sinned against You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang mă khan tơdrong kơnê̆ lu nhôn plơ̆ tơbăt kơ lu nhôn, apinh Ih tơgŭm nhôn yua kơ anăn Ih! Tơpă lu nhôn pơm kơnê̆ tih dêh; lu nhôn pơm yoch hăm Ih boih.

English: O the Hope of Israel, his Savior in time of trouble, Why should You be like a stranger in the land, And like a traveler who turns aside to tarry for a night?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih boih tơ'ngla mă lu bơngai Isơrael chang hơmĕng. Tơ'ngla mă dŏng pơklaih kơplah năr đei tơdrong truh, liơ Ih nhen thoi bơngai tơmoi lăm char âu, Thoi bơngai chă yak găn weh 'bĭch kơmăng đĕch.

English: Why should You be like a man astonished, Like a mighty one who cannot save? Yet You, O LORD, are in our midst, And we are called by Your name; Do not leave us!
Bahnar: Liơ Ih nhen thoi bơngai đei tơdrong truh ưh kơ tam băt, nhen thoi bơngai nuih pran mă ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih bu? Mă-lei ơ Kră Yang, Ih oei oei hơdai nhôn, đe krao nhôn kon Ih, apinh Ih 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ lu nhôn.

English: Thus says the LORD to this people: “Thus they have loved to wander; They have not restrained their feet. Therefore the LORD does not accept them; He will remember their iniquity now, And punish their sins.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan gah kon pơlei 'nâu: “Lu sư 'maih kơdâu tơklah thoi noh, ưh kơ băt pơkơ̆ng jơ̆ng lu sư; Na Kră Yang ưh kơ sơng iŏk lu sư; Dang ei, Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư, Kră Yang wă phak lu sư đơ̆ng pơm yoch.”

English: Then the LORD said to me, “Do not pray for this people, for their good.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Ih 'nĕ krao khan apinh Kră Yang ăn tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei âu

English: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. But I will consume them by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.”
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa, Inh ưh kơ đei mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao khan ôh, mă khan lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh dah tơmam soi phe 'ba, Inh ưh kơ iŏk ôh; mă-lei Inh gô pơrăm lu sư hăm đao gưm, hăm tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt păng hăm tơdrong jĭ hơpoh.”

English: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, the prophets say to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, nor shall you have famine, but I will give you assured peace in this place.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ling-lang khan kơ lu sư, ‘Lu iĕm ưh kơ đei 'bôh đao gưm, kư̆m huay kơ đei pơngot rơwĕt truh mơ̆n, Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm đei rơnŭk rơnua ling-lang lăm dêh char âu.’ ”

English: And the LORD said to me, “The prophets prophesy lies in My name. I have not sent them, commanded them, nor spoken to them; they prophesy to you a false vision, divination, a worthless thing, and the deceit of their heart.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol yua anăn Inh na pơma hơlĕnh, Inh ưh kơ đei wơh lu sư ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơtă dah pơma athei lu sư mơ̆n. Lu sư khan lê̆ adrol kiơ̆ thoi lu sư chă pơm 'bôh ưh kơ tơpă, chă hlang pơpơn kư̆ kă wă pơhlŭ lu iĕm kiơ̆ kơ lu sư tơchĕng đon kơdih.”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name, whom I did not send, and who say, ‘Sword and famine shall not be in this land’—‘By sword and famine those prophets shall be consumed!
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan: “Gah lu bơngai mă khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh, lu sư yua anăn Inh na khan lê̆ adrol Inh ưh kơ đei wơh, mă-lei lu sư khan. ‘Đao gưm hăm pơngot rơwĕt ưh kơ truh tơ dêh char âu ôh.’ Lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh boih gô lôch kơ đao gưm păng pơngot rơwĕt.

English: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; they will have no one to bury them—them nor their wives, their sons nor their daughters—for I will pour their wickedness on them.’
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei mă mơ̆ng lu sư khan lê̆ adrol noh kư̆m lôch kơ đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt hơdai hăm akăn, hăm kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư. Akâu lu sư đe gô klơ̆m lê̆ hnơ̆k hnăk tơ rok trong pơlei Jêrusalem, ưh kơ đei bu 'bŭ. Inh gô tuh tơdrong kơnê̆ đêl lu sư pơm tơ kơ̆l lu sư.”

English: “Therefore you shall say this word to them: ‘Let my eyes flow with tears night and day, And let them not cease; For the virgin daughter of my people Has been broken with a mighty stroke, with a very severe blow.
Bahnar: Apinh ih khan kơ lu sư nơ̆r 'nâu: Ăn kơ măt inh lĕch đak măt ling-lang, Măng năr ưh kơ pơdơh, yua kơ kon adruh inh, kơ kon pơlei inh, răm-'băm jĭ rơka hơbur dêh, đe pơm jĭ pơmat dêh kơ lu sư.

English: If I go out to the field, Then behold, those slain with the sword! And if I enter the city, Then behold, those sick from famine! Yes, both prophet and priest go about in a land they do not know.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah inh năm tơ mir chŭn, to akâu lu bơngai lôch kơ đao gưm, tơdah inh mơ̆t tơ pơlei tih, to 'bôh lu bơngai jĭ jăn yua kơ pơngot rơwĕt! Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng lu 'bok soi. Chă yak năm lăm dêh char mă lu sư ưh kơ lah băt.

English: Have You utterly rejected Judah? Has Your soul loathed Zion? Why have You stricken us so that there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but there was no good; And for the time of healing, and there was trouble.
Bahnar: Lei Ih wă achăng lê̆ lu bơngai Juđa hă? Ih kư̆m areh kơ Siôn hă? Liơ ih teh tôn lu nhôn, dĭng mah rơka lu nhôn hơmet pă klaih? Lu nhôn hơmĕng rŏ kơ hiôk-hian, Mă-lei ưh kơ đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng; lu nhôn wă kơ gơh klaih, mă-lei rai tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong hli krưp.

English: We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness And the iniquity of our fathers, For we have sinned against You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang lu nhôn băt nhôn yoch kơnê̆, păng tơdrong yoch lu yă 'bok lu nhôn pơm; tơpă lu nhôn đei pơm yoch kơnê̆ boih hăm Ih.

English: Do not abhor us, for Your name’s sake; Do not disgrace the throne of Your glory. Remember, do not break Your covenant with us.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ lu nhôn; yua kơ anăn Ih, 'nĕ pơm kơ anih pơtao ư-ang Ih đe pơjăm, Apinh Ih 'blŏk bĕ nơ̆r Ih đei pơgơ̆p hăm lu nhôn păng 'nĕ kơ tŭk.

English: Are there any among the idols of the nations that can cause rain? Or can the heavens give showers? Are You not He, O LORD our God? Therefore we will wait for You, Since You have made all these.
Bahnar: Hăm đei lu yang kiơ gơh pơm đak 'mi ăn kơ kon bơngai? Đơ̆ng plĕnh hăm gơh tơjur kơdih đak 'mi tơ teh? Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, Ih đĕch gơh pơm. Thoi noh lu nhôn oei chang gô Ih, Yua kơ Ih boih pơjing kơ dôm tơdrong noh.

English: Then the LORD said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel stood before Me, My mind would not be favorable toward this people. Cast them out of My sight, and let them go forth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Mă khan Môis păng Samuel dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ mơnat kơ kon pơlei 'nâu. Pơpuh tơweh bĕ lu sư đơ̆ng anăp Inh.

English: And it shall be, if they say to you, ‘Where should we go?’ then you shall tell them, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Such as are for death, to death; And such as are for the sword, to the sword; And such as are for the famine, to the famine; And such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.” ’
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư apinh ih: ‘Lu nhôn gô năm tơ yơ?’ Ih khan kơ lu sư: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Bu Inh pơkă ăn kơ sư lôch kơ hơbuh, gô chu lôch kơ hơbuh, Bu Inh pơkă wă pơlôch hăm đao gưm, gô lôch kơ đao gưm. Bu Inh pơkă wă ăn kơ sư lôch pơngot rơwĕt, gô lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt. Bu Inh pơkă wă ăn pơm bơnă, sư gô pơm bơnă.”

English: “And I will appoint over them four forms of destruction,” says the LORD: “the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the heavens and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh wă phak đei puăn tơdrong: Wă pơlôch păng đao gưm, kŏ gô hek sa, sem grơ̆ păng lu sem bri gô kăp sa păng pơrăm đĭ lu sư.

English: I will hand them over to trouble, to all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for what he did in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ lu sư jing bơngai đĭ-đăng kơ dêh char lăm teh âu lăng krưp, yua kơ tơdrong yoch Manase, kon drŏ-nglo Hesekia pơtao đe Juđa, đei pơm yoch boih tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: “For who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? Or who will bemoan you? Or who will turn aside to ask how you are doing?
Bahnar: Bu gô mơnat kơ ih, ơ pơlei Jêrusalem? Bu gô hmoi kơ ih? Bu chă wơ̆t weh ngôi jet ih?”

English: You have forsaken Me,” says the LORD, “You have gone backward. Therefore I will stretch out My hand against you and destroy you; I am weary of relenting!
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ih sơngah achăng lê̆ Inh boih. Ih kư̆m oei kơdŭn tơ rŏng, Na Inh gô yơ̆r ti pơrăm ih; Inh ưh pă đei mơnat boih kơ ih.

English: And I will winnow them with a winnowing fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children; I will destroy My people, Since they do not return from their ways.
Bahnar: Inh gô um pơliĕng lu sư hăm kial 'bơ̆t lu 'măng jang pơlei lăm teh âu, Inh gô săi lê̆ lu sư tơ jơ̆p kơ pơlei, Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ kon pơlei pơla Inh, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng trong yoch, na wih tơ Inh.

English: Their widows will be increased to Me more than the sand of the seas; I will bring against them, Against the mother of the young men, A plunderer at noonday; I will cause anguish and terror to fall on them suddenly.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ drŏ-kăn adro rai lơ hloh kơ chuơh đak dơsĭ. Inh gô ăn bơngai năm pơrăm lu sư kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng, pơrăm lê̆ mĕ lu bơngai tơdăm. Inh gô tuh ăn tơdrong gleh truh kơ lu sư, jơhngơ̆m rŭng răng hli tơrơ.

English: “She languishes who has borne seven; She has breathed her last; Her sun has gone down While it was yet day; She has been ashamed and confounded. And the remnant of them I will deliver to the sword Before their enemies,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu mĕ tơpŭ kơ tơpơh 'nu kon, sư gô hơngơ̆t păng dui jơhngơ̆m, dĕnh Măt 'năr sư gô jing măng mu kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng, sư gô kơdơ̆ mơlâu. Lu bơngai mă oei arih Inh gô jao kơ lu ayăt pơlôch hăm đao gưm, noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Woe is me, my mother, That you have borne me, A man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent for interest, Nor have men lent to me for interest. Every one of them curses me.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm kơ inh ơ mĕ, yua kơ ih tơpŭ boih kơ inh, Jing minh 'nu bơngai wă pơjah pơjăng hăm bơngai lăm teh đak âu! Inh ưh kơ đei ăn bu mưng, inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei mưng đơ̆ng đe, mă-lei lu sư hiap inh.

English: The LORD said: “Surely it will be well with your remnant; Surely I will cause the enemy to intercede with you In the time of adversity and in the time of affliction.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơpă Inh gô dŏng pơklaih ih 'măn kơ tơdrong jang kăl. Inh gô ăn kơ lu ayăt kơ ih năm lung ih, kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong răm truh pơmat-tat.

English: Can anyone break iron, The northern iron and the bronze?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu kĕ gơ̆ bơsei dah kong đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m?

English: Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder without price, Because of all your sins, Throughout your territories.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong yoch lu iĕm pơm boih tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char, na Inh gô jao kơ đe plah tơgar iŏk đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam iĕm, ưh kơ đei bu 'mong kơ iĕm yă kiơ.

English: And I will make you cross over with your enemies Into a land which you do not know; For a fire is kindled in My anger, Which shall burn upon you.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm jang kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm, lăm dêh char mă lu iĕm ưh tam băt, yua kơ lăm tơdrong Inh hil thoi ŭnh khơ̆ng, Soh chhông sa lu iĕm.”

English: O LORD, You know; Remember me and visit me, And take vengeance for me on my persecutors. In Your enduring patience, do not take me away. Know that for Your sake I have suffered rebuke.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt đĭ boih, apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ inh păng wei-lăng inh, apinh iung kơting bĕ kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh. Hăm tơdrong Ih mơnat, 'nĕ kơ hŭt lê̆ inh. Ih kư̆m 'blŏk, yua kơ Ih na inh pŭ iŏk tơdrong đe pơjăm.

English: Your words were found, and I ate them, And Your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart; For I am called by Your name, O LORD God of hosts.
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r Ih, inh luăn sa boih; nơ̆r Ih pơma jing tơdrong pơhiôk lăm jơhngơ̆m inh, yua kơ inh gah Ih. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh.

English: I did not sit in the assembly of the mockers, Nor did I rejoice; I sat alone because of Your hand, For You have filled me with indignation.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ lah ngôi chơt hiôk hơdai hăm lu bơngai et sa kơnê̆ ôh, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ lah hiôk hơdai lu sư; Inh ngôi minh drô̆ inh yua kơ ti Ih dan kơpal inh, Ih kư̆m tuh kơ jơhngơ̆m inh 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong Ih hil mĭl.

English: Why is my pain perpetual And my wound incurable, Which refuses to be healed? Will You surely be to me like an unreliable stream, As waters that fail?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ tơdrong chhŭr nuih inh oei đei ling-lang, jĭ rơka lăm jơhngơ̆m inh rai dêh ưh kơ kĕ kơ klaih? Hăm trŏ Ih pơm kơ inh thoi thong đak ro ưh kơ tơpă, thoi tu đak hrĕng kro?

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: “If you return, Then I will bring you back; You shall stand before Me; If you take out the precious from the vile, You shall be as My mouth. Let them return to you, But you must not return to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'nâu Kră Yang khan: “Tơdah ih tơbral, Inh gô sơng iŏk ih, ăn kơ ih dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh; dah ih pơma nơ̆r sĭt ưh kơ chă pơma ngôi đĕch, ih gô jing thoi 'bơ̆r Inh pơma. Lê̆ lu kon pơlei pơla âu gô wih tơ ih, mă-lei ih 'nĕ wih tơ lu sư.

English: And I will make you to this people a fortified bronze wall; And they will fight against you, But they shall not prevail against you; For I am with you to save you And deliver you,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ ih thoi dur pơgăn kon pơlei pơla âu. Dur kơjăp pơm păng kong; lu sư gô tơblah hăm ih, mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ jei lu sư ôh, Yua kơ Inh oei hơdai ih, wă kơ dŏng pơklaih ih, ăn kơ ih rơngei.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked, And I will redeem you from the grip of the terrible.”
Bahnar: Inh gô dui iŏk ih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, păng gô pơklaih ih rơngei đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai wă pơrăm ih

English: The word of the LORD also came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “You shall not take a wife, nor shall you have sons or daughters in this place.”
Bahnar: “Ih 'nĕ kơ chă akăn, kư̆m 'nĕ pơjing kon hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn lăm anih âu.”

English: For thus says the LORD concerning the sons and daughters who are born in this place, and concerning their mothers who bore them and their fathers who begot them in this land
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan gah lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn mă tơpŭ tơ lăm dêh char âu păng kư̆m khan gah kơ lu mĕ 'bă mă tơpŭ kơ lu sư lăm char âu

English: “They shall die gruesome deaths; they shall not be lamented nor shall they be buried, but they shall be like refuse on the face of the earth. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, and their corpses shall be meat for the birds of heaven and for the beasts of the earth.”
Bahnar: “Lu sư gô lôch hơbuh krưp dêh; ưh kơ đei bu hmoi ưh kơ đei bu 'bŭ lu sư, akâu bơngai lôch jing mơ̆r kơ teh. Lu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm păng lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt. Akâu lôch lu sư gô ăn kơ sem păr păng sem bri sa.”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Do not enter the house of mourning, nor go to lament or bemoan them; for I have taken away My peace from this people,” says the LORD, “lovingkindness and mercies.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang khan: Ih 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam lôch; ih 'nĕ kơ năm ngôi hơpong păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơlung lu sư; yua kơ Inh pơdrâu lê̆ boih tơdrong hiôk tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Inh đơ̆ng kon pơlei âu.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Both the great and the small shall die in this land. They shall not be buried; neither shall men lament for them, cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them.
Bahnar: “Đĭ bơngai pơm tih păng bơngai hmă gô lôch lăm teh đak âu. Ưh kơ đei bu 'bŭ păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu nhơ̆m hmoi kơ lu sư. Ưh kơ đei bu raih akâu dah yuă sŏk yua kơ lu sư.

English: Nor shall men break bread in mourning for them, to comfort them for the dead; nor shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or their mother.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu chĕp por 'nhot năm sŏng sa hơdai pơlung yua kơ đei bơngai lôch, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu hling đak nhă pơlung lu sư sơ'ngon kơ mĕ dah 'bă lu sư lôch.

English: Also you shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and drink.”
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ et sa ngôi hơdai lu sư.”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will cause to cease from this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “'Nâu 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu iĕm, lăm chăl arih iĕm, Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ chơt hiôk lăm char âu. Kŭm ưh pă đei nơ̆r ŏng mai hiĕk chơt hiôk năr pơkong klo kăn dơ̆ng.

English: “And it shall be, when you show this people all these words, and they say to you, ‘Why has the LORD pronounced all this great disaster against us? Or what is our iniquity? Or what is our sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?’
Bahnar: Layơ ih roi ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei dôm tơdrong âu, tơpă lu sư gô jet ih: ‘Liơ Kră Yang roi tơbăt ăn wă đei tơdrong răm truh kơ lu nhôn? Lu nhôn pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ? Lu nhôn đei pơm tơdrong glăi kiơ hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn?’

English: then you shall say to them, ‘Because your fathers have forsaken Me,’ says the LORD; ‘they have walked after other gods and have served them and worshiped them, and have forsaken Me and not kept My law.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Kră Yang khan. Yua kơ yă 'bok lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Inh boih, na kiơ̆ lu yang nai, jang ăn păng drap kơkuh kơ lu yang noh. Lu sư achăng lê̆ Inh ưh pă wei răk dôm khôi juăt Inh.

English: And you have done worse than your fathers, for behold, each one follows the dictates of his own evil heart, so that no one listens to Me.
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm kư̆m yoch kơnê̆ hloh kơ lu yă 'bok lu iĕm sơ̆, yua kơ rim 'nu lu iĕm yak kiơ̆ trong jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ păng arăng kơ̆l lu iĕm, ưh pă wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh.

English: Therefore I will cast you out of this land into a land that you do not know, neither you nor your fathers; and there you shall serve other gods day and night, where I will not show you favor.’
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơpuh klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ lu iĕm đơ̆ng char âu, mơ̆t tơ lăm minh pôm char mă lu iĕm păng 'bok yă lu iĕm ưh kơ tam biơh băt. Tơ noh lu iĕm gô jang kơ lu yang nai măng năr; na Inh ưh pă mơnat kơ lu iĕm boih.

English: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “that it shall no more be said, ‘The LORD lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gô đei năr ưh pă đei bu pơma thoi âu dơ̆ng: ‘Tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih, Tơ'ngla mă chông anhăk kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ,’

English: but, ‘The LORD lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north and from all the lands where He had driven them.’ For I will bring them back into their land which I gave to their fathers.
Bahnar: mă-lei đe pơma khan: ‘Sĭt thoi Kră Yang arih, Tơ'ngla đei chông anhăk tơlĕch bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng char gah yă-nơ̆m păng đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng char mă đêl Sư pơpuh tơweh lu sư,’ yua kơ Inh gô ba lu sư brŏk tơ char lu sư, char mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ 'bok yă lu sư.”

English: “Behold, I will send for many fishermen,” says the LORD, “and they shall fish them; and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu, Inh gô wơh lơ bơngai traih ka, wă kơ chă traih rôp lu sư, đơ̆ng noh Inh gô wơh lơ bơngai lua wă kơ chă lua lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ kông groi dah lăm hơgơp tơmo.

English: For My eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from My face, nor is their iniquity hidden from My eyes.
Bahnar: Măt Inh oei kiơ̆ lăng trong lu sư yak; ưh kơ đei hlơp kơ Inh ôh. Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ gơh ôn đơ̆ng măt Inh.

English: And first I will repay double for their iniquity and their sin, because they have defiled My land; they have filled My inheritance with the carcasses of their detestable and abominable idols.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm 'mong kơ lu sư 'bar wơ̆t hloh, tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư pơm, yua kơ lu sư pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ teh đak păng tơdrong jang Inh 'bĕnh hăm akâu lôch lu tơmam Inh areh

English: O LORD, my strength and my fortress, My refuge in the day of affliction, The Gentiles shall come to You From the ends of the earth and say, “Surely our fathers have inherited lies, Worthlessness and unprofitable things.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih ăn kơ inh jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang, kơđông kơjăp inh. Anih mă inh kơ'nơp lăm năr pơmat-tat. Lu kon bơngai đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak gô năm kơkuh kơ Ih păng khan: “'Bok yă lu nhôn kơkuh kơ yang chă pơm, ưh kơ đei yua kiơ, ưh kơ đei tơgŭm kiơ.

English: Will a man make gods for himself, Which are not gods?
Bahnar: Kon bơngai hăm gơh pơm yang kơdih sư? Noh rup đĕch, ưh kơ yang ôh.”

English: “Therefore behold, I will this once cause them to know, I will cause them to know My hand and My might; And they shall know that My name is the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư băt, Inh tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư băt minh wơ̆t tôm boih, tơdrong mơsêh Inh; tơdrong pran kơtang Inh. Lu sư gô băt Anăn Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang.

English: “The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron; With the point of a diamond it is engraved On the tablet of their heart, And on the horns of your altars
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch bơngai Juđa đe chih răk boih hăm 'long chih bơsei, chhơ̆ hăm pla tơmo jơmŏng, tơ gơ'bang lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư, Păng chih tơ kơpal hơke tơ mum chơnang soi lu sư.

English: While their children remember Their altars and their wooden images By the green trees on the high hills.
Bahnar: Kon sâu lu sư kư̆m 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ chơnang soi păng lu gơ̆ng rup yang Asêra mă đêl lu sư pơm, Tơ yơ̆p 'long hơmŭl. Tơ grôn groi kơjung.

English: O My mountain in the field, I will give as plunder your wealth, all your treasures, And your high places of sin within all your borders.
Bahnar: Ơ Kông Inha kơpal teh dơnă, Inh gô ăn kơ lu linh ayăt tơgar iŏk đĭ, Lu hu maih păng mŭk tơmam gĭt hăm anih kơjung ih, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu iĕm đei pơm tơ jơ̆p-jang tơring.

English: And you, even yourself, Shall let go of your heritage which I gave you; And I will cause you to serve your enemies In the land which you do not know; For you have kindled a fire in My anger which shall burn forever.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô hiong mŭk tơmam mă đơ̆ng Inh ăn noh. Inh gô jao iĕm jang kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm, tăm minh pôm teh đak mă lu iĕm tam lah băt; yua kơ lu iĕm pơgơ̆p ŭnh tơdrong Inh hil rai dêh, ŭnh gô sa khơ̆ng ling-lang ưh kơ păt.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Cursed is the man who trusts in man And makes flesh his strength, Whose heart departs from the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hiap bĕ lu bơngai mă gơnang tơduă kon bơngai, hơđơ̆ng gơnang kơ sĕch akar pơm jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang. Lăm jơhngơ̆m achăng tŭk Kră Yang.

English: For he shall be like a shrub in the desert, And shall not see when good comes, But shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, In a salt land which is not inhabited.
Bahnar: Sư nhen thoi tơnơm 'long lăm bri, chăt tơ anih tơmo hơga lăm char glă. Lăm teh 'băt 'boh, ưh kơ đei bơngai oei. Bơngai noh ưh kơ đei 'bôh pŭn hiôk truh.

English: “Blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, And whose hope is the LORD.
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ bơngai bu mă lui gơnang kơ Kră Yang, Păng hơmĕng hơđơ̆ng kơ Kră Yang.

English: For he shall be like a tree planted by the waters, Which spreads out its roots by the river, And will not fear when heat comes; But its leaf will be green, And will not be anxious in the year of drought, Nor will cease from yielding fruit.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh nhen thoi tơm 'long pơtăm cheng đak, Chăt rơh cheng đak krong, mă khan tŏ phang ưh kơ hli, hla ưh kơ đei jô kro oei arih 'lơ̆ng. Mă tơ'bơ̆p hĭ bơyan tŏ phang kư̆m huay kơ tơtăm, oei plei hơnơ̆ng ưh kơ pơdơh.”

English: “The heart is deceitful above all things, And desperately wicked; Who can know it?
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr hloh kơ đĭ-đăng, păng kơnê̆ răm tơpă; Bu kĕ băt jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai?

English: I, the LORD, search the heart, I test the mind, Even to give every man according to his ways, According to the fruit of his doings.
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh lăng 'bôh lăm jơhngơ̆m, pơlong lăng jơhngơ̆m đon tơchĕng, wă pơm tơwih kơ rim 'nu kiơ̆ thoi trong lu sư arih, kiơ̆ 'blep thoi đêl tơdrong lu sư pơm.

English: “As a partridge that broods but does not hatch, So is he who gets riches, but not by right; It will leave him in the midst of his days, And at his end he will be a fool.”
Bahnar: Bơngai mă mơdrŏng đơ̆ng ưh kơ tơpăt, lu sư thoi sem trăk-tra 'nơ̆m kơtăp sem nai, đei cheh kon ưh kơ trŏ kon sư, ưh kơ đunh tơdrong mơdrŏng sư gô hiong đĭ, na tuch-luch đe jô̆ sư kơtul bơlŭk.

English: A glorious high throne from the beginning Is the place of our sanctuary.
Bahnar: Tang-dŏ Pơtao mă đe ư-ang đei pơjing boih đơ̆ng blŭng-a, noh anih rơgoh mă lu bơ̆n kơkuh pơyom.

English: O LORD, the hope of Israel, All who forsake You shall be ashamed. “Those who depart from Me Shall be written in the earth, Because they have forsaken the LORD, The fountain of living waters.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih anih hơmĕng tơm kơ bơngai Isơrael, lu bơngai bu achăng lê̆ Ih gô mơlâu! Bơngai bu weh đơ̆ng Inh, chih jô̆ anăn lu sư gah anih lôch, yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang mă tu đak glung arih ling-lang.

English: Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; Save me, and I shall be saved, For You are my praise.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang apinh Ih ming pơklaih inh, na inh gơh klaih; apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh na inh gơh klaih: Ih boih mă Tơ'ngla inh bơnê ư-ang.

English: Indeed they say to me, “Where is the word of the LORD? Let it come now!”
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r đe oei khan kơ inh: ‘Tơ yơ nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan? Pơsĭt bĕ âu!’

English: As for me, I have not hurried away from being a shepherd who follows You, Nor have I desired the woeful day; You know what came out of my lips; It was right there before You.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ sơngah păng kơdâu đơ̆ng tơdrong jang wei-lăng kon triu Ih. Inh ưh kơ wă Ih tuh ăn tơdrong pơmat, Ih băt boih dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh pơma 'bơ̆t anăp Ih ngăl.

English: Do not be a terror to me; You are my hope in the day of doom.
Bahnar: Ih boih jơ̆ anih mă inh kơ'nơp năr đei tơdrong pơmat-tat truh, 'Nĕ pă pơm kơ inh hli tơrơ!

English: Let them be ashamed who persecute me, But do not let me be put to shame; Let them be dismayed, But do not let me be dismayed. Bring on them the day of doom, And destroy them with double destruction!
Bahnar: Apinh Ih pơm kơ lu bơngai rôp pơmat inh mơlâu, mă-lei 'nĕ ăn kơ inh mơlâu; ăn kơ lu sư hli tơrơ, mă-lei 'nĕ ăn kơ inh hli tơrơ! Ăn kơ năr gleh pơmat truh kơ lu sư; apinh Ih pơrăm lu sư hloh kơ 'bar wơ̆t.”

English: Thus the LORD said to me: “Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, by which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Năm bĕ, dơ̆ng tơ 'măng jang kon pơlei, 'măng jang lu pơtao Juđa ngăl mơ̆t lĕch păng tơ rim 'măng jang pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: and say to them, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, who enter by these gates.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư: ‘Ơ lu pơtao đe Juđa, hăm đĭ bơngai Juđa păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, lu bơngai yak rok mơ̆t; lĕch trong 'nâu, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.’ ”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the Sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Tơdah lu iĕm wă arih lu iĕm athei kơchăng, 'nĕ pă tung, pŭ tơmơ̆t trong 'măng dur pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm năr Sa'bat.

English: nor carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day, nor do any work, but hallow the Sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
Bahnar: Lăm năr Sa'bat, 'nĕ kơ pŭ dah tung tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng lăm hnam iĕm, dah 'nĕ kơ jang kiơ; mă-lei athei 'măn năr Sa'bat jing năr giĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, thoi Inh đei tơtă khan kơ lu 'bok yă iĕm sơ̆.

English: But they did not obey nor incline their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear nor receive instruction.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng; ưh kơ wă pơgling đon; arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng păng kư̆m ưh kơ wă chu Inh bơtho.”

English: “And it shall be, if you heed Me carefully,” says the LORD, “to bring no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but hallow the Sabbath day, to do no work in it
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơdah lu iĕm 'maih mơ̆ng Inh, tơdah iĕm ưh pă đei pŭ dah tung tơmam rok trong 'măng jang pơlei âu lăm năr Sa'bat, mă-lei lu iĕm 'măn lê̆ năr Sa'bat noh jing năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, ưh kơ jang tơdrong kiơ lăm năr noh

English: then shall enter the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their princes, accompanied by the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain forever.
Bahnar: lei na lu pơtao hơ-oei tơ tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit gô hao gre aseh hao aseh hơdai hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu bơngai Juđa hăm lu kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem mơ̆t trong 'măng dur pơlei 'nâu; păng pơlei 'nâu oei đei bơngai oei ling-lang.

English: And they shall come from the cities of Judah and from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin and from the lowland, from the mountains and from the South, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and incense, bringing sacrifices of praise to the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai gô truh đơ̆ng lu pơlei Juđa păng truh đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang pơlei iĕ tăp dăr kơ pơlei Jêrusalem, đơ̆ng lăm char Bênjamin, đơ̆ng tơnăp groi, gah bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng kông groi, đơ̆ng char glă gah gơal, wă chĕp tơmam soi 'buh, lu tơmam soi thoi phe, 'ba, tơmam 'bâu phu păng tơmam soi bơnê tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: “But if you will not heed Me to hallow the Sabbath day, such as not carrying a burden when entering the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng Inh, ưh kơ 'măn năr Sa'bat pơm năr giĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng pŭ tung tơmam kiơ yak rok trong 'măng jang pơlei Jêrusalem, lei Inh gô dan ŭnh 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei tih, ŭnh noh gô sa pơrăm lu hnam tih kơjăp lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem, ưh kơ đei layơ gơh păt.”

English: The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Arise and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause you to hear My words.”
Bahnar: “Iung bĕ, ih jur năm tơ hnam bơngai thơ̆ man gŏ teh sŭng, tơ noh Inh gô ăn kơ ih kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh khan.”

English: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and there he was, making something at the wheel.
Bahnar: Inh jur năm hloi tơ hnam bơngai thơ̆ man gŏ teh ei, sư oei man kơpal gơ'bang tơroi dăr.

English: And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the potter; so he made it again into another vessel, as it seemed good to the potter to make.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm bô̆i sư oei man hăm lơ̆n mă-lei glăi lăm ti thơ̆ man, na sư iŏk lơ̆n noh man dơ̆ng bô̆i kiơ̆ thoi sư wă man.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “O house of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter?” says the LORD. “Look, as the clay is in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel!
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, Inh hăm lu iĕm, Inh hăm gơh pơm thoi thơ̆ man gŏ teh noh dah ưh? Ơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, teh lơ̆n lăm ti bơngai man thoi yơ, na lu iĕm lăm tơpang ti Inh kư̆m thoi noh.

English: The instant I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up, to pull down, and to destroy it
Bahnar: Tơdah Inh pơma 'bơm kơ minh adrĕch adrung noh gô buch hŭt, pơrăm lê̆, pơlôch lê̆.

English: if that nation against whom I have spoken turns from its evil, I will relent of the disaster that I thought to bring upon it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah adrĕch adrung mă Inh roi noh achăng lê̆ tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih, lei Inh gô tơplih đon Inh mă wă pơrăm lu sư noh.

English: And the instant I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it
Bahnar: Păng tơdah Inh pơma 'bơm kơ minh pôm, adrĕch adrung Inh wă man pơdơ̆ng, oei wă pơtăm ming sư

English: if it does evil in My sight so that it does not obey My voice, then I will relent concerning the good with which I said I would benefit it.
Bahnar: Tơdah adrĕch adrung noh pơm yoch ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, na Inh kư̆m tơplih tơdrong Inh pơkă khan wă tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư noh.

English: “Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I am fashioning a disaster and devising a plan against you. Return now every one from his evil way, and make your ways and your doings good.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Na dang ei, khan bĕ kơ bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem, Kră Yang khan: ‘'Nâu, Inh wă iung pơrăm lu iĕm, Inh hơmet wă pơrăm lu iĕm. Rim 'nu athei weh đơ̆ng trong kơnê̆, hơmet ming tơdrong arih sa păng tơdrong pơm kơdih!’

English: And they said, “That is hopeless! So we will walk according to our own plans, and we will every one obey the dictates of his evil heart.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư oei khan: ‘Măk ai kơ nhôn. Lu nhôn oei kiơ̆ kơ đon nhôn kơdih, rim 'nu kư̆ kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m đon arăng kơnê̆ kơdih.’ ”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: “Ask now among the Gentiles, Who has heard such things? The virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.
Bahnar: Lei na, Kră Yang khan: “Apinh lăng bĕ lăm lu teh đak, Bu mă kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong thoi noh? Bơngai Isơrael 'lơ̆ng rơgoh pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp.

English: Will a man leave the snow water of Lebanon, Which comes from the rock of the field? Will the cold flowing waters be forsaken for strange waters?
Bahnar: Kông Liban. Hăm đei layơ prĕl ưh kơ gom? Đak tơngiĕt ro rok tơmo cheng kông hăm đei oei ro khan hrơ̆ đĭ hă?

English: “Because My people have forgotten Me, They have burned incense to worthless idols. And they have caused themselves to stumble in their ways, From the ancient paths, To walk in pathways and not on a highway
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Inh hiơt kơ Inh; Soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ rup yang kư̆ kă. Sơ̆ lu sư kiơ̆ trong so, mă-lei pơ̆k huŏng yua kơ rup yang, Na weh kiơ̆ trong nai, lu trong tam mă hơmet.

English: To make their land desolate and a perpetual hissing; Everyone who passes by it will be astonished And shake his head.
Bahnar: Na teh đak lu sư jing bri juơ, pơm kơ đe hiĕk ling-lang; lu bơngai yak rok ei lăng chrơp, Na tơtreh kơ̆l.

English: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will show them the back and not the face In the day of their calamity.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư kơdâu tơklah tơklang 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai ayăt, thoi kial bah đơ̆ng hơlĕch; Inh gô tơwih rŏng, ưh pă tơwih muh măt, lăm năr lu sư tơ'bơ̆p pơmat-tat.”

English: Then they said, “Come and let us devise plans against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come and let us attack him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan: “Năm bĕ, chă đon blah Jêrêmi. Yua kơ bơ̆n oei đei 'bok soi bơtho khôi juăt oei đei lu bơngai hơgei, chă pơđâu, oei đei lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol bơtho nơ̆r Kră Yang kơ lu bơ̆n. Bĕ bơ̆n chă sư pơma glăi păng 'nĕ pă mơ̆ng nơ̆r sư pơma kiơ kiơ.”

English: Give heed to me, O LORD, And listen to the voice of those who contend with me!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, mơ̆ng inh bĕ. Apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh pơma.

English: Shall evil be repaid for good? For they have dug a pit for my life. Remember that I stood before You To speak good for them, To turn away Your wrath from them.
Bahnar: Đe pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm trŏ apah tơdrong kơnê̆? Lei liơ lu sư sir boih sơlŭng wă tơhuŏng inh. Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ inh ngăl dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Ih apinh Ih ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, apinh Ih 'nĕ pă hil kơ lu sư.

English: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, And pour out their blood By the force of the sword; Let their wives become widows And bereaved of their children. Let their men be put to death, Their young men be slain By the sword in battle.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ăn kơ kon sâu sư pơngot rơwĕt, ăn kơ lu sư lôch kơ đao gưm. Lê̆ lu drŏ-kăn hiong kon, sư păng adro po, Klo lu sư lôch hơbuh, ăn kơ lu kon tơdăm lu sư lôch kơ đao hơlă tơ anih tơblah.

English: Let a cry be heard from their houses, When You bring a troop suddenly upon them; For they have dug a pit to take me, And hidden snares for my feet.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi đơ̆ng hnam lu sư, Kơplah Ih ăn bơngai năm blah lu sư ưh kơ tam băt. Yua kơ lu sư sir boih sơlŭng wă kơ rôp inh, Pơm boih hơđong kơ jơ̆ng inh.

English: Yet, LORD, You know all their counsel Which is against me, to slay me. Provide no atonement for their iniquity, Nor blot out their sin from Your sight; But let them be overthrown before You. Deal thus with them In the time of Your anger.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih băt boih, đĭ lu sư chă đon wă pơlôch inh. Apinh Ih 'nĕ pă mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư, apinh Ih 'nĕ sut tơdrong yoch lu sư đơ̆ng anăp Ih. Apinh Ih ăn kơ lu sư pơ̆k 'bơ̆t anăp Ih. Apinh Ih phak lu sư lăm năr Ih hil!

English: Thus says the LORD: “Go and get a potter’s earthen flask, and take some of the elders of the people and some of the elders of the priests.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ih năm răt bĕ ge teh tơ anih đe man. Ih chông ba minh 'bar 'nu lu kră lăm kon pơlei păng kră đơ̆ng lăm khŭl 'bok soi năm hơdai ih.

English: And go out to the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the Potsherd Gate; and proclaim there the words that I will tell you
Bahnar: Năm tơ lăm Thŭng Ben Hinôm, jê̆ trong mơ̆t tơ 'Măng Jang Ge Pơchah, athei roi tơbăt lu nơ̆r mă Inh gô ăn kơ ih tơ noh.

English: and say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will bring such a catastrophe on this place, that whoever hears of it, his ears will tingle.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan: ‘Ơ lu pơtao Juđa păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang. Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael khan thoi âu: Âu, Inh gô ăn tơdrong răm pơmat truh kơ anih 'nâu, dah bơngai bu kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'nâu kư̆m jĭ đon.

English: “Because they have forsaken Me and made this an alien place, because they have burned incense in it to other gods whom neither they, their fathers, nor the kings of Judah have known, and have filled this place with the blood of the innocents
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ Inh boih, pơm ăn kơ anih 'nâu jing 'mê̆-'mach, hăm tơdrong lu sư soh nhang pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ lu yang nai, mă lu sư, đe yă 'bok lu sư, lu pơtao đe Juđa tam lah băt, pơm kơ anih 'nâu 'bĕnh kơ pham lu bơngai ưh kơ yoch.

English: (they have also built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings to Baal, which I did not command or speak, nor did it come into My mind)
Bahnar: Lu sư man pơdơ̆ng anih kơjung kơ yang Baal; 'buh kon hơ'lơ̆p pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r ăn kơ yang Baal, noh tơdrong mă Inh ưh kơ đei bơtho athei lu sư, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơchĕng.’ ”

English: therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “that this place shall no more be called Tophet or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu năr gô truh, kơplah noh anih âu ưh pă krao Tôphet, kư̆m ưh pă krao Thŭng Ben Hinôm dơ̆ng, gô krao anih thŭng tơdrong tơkoh tơ'bet băl.

English: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place, and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hands of those who seek their lives; their corpses I will give as meat for the birds of the heaven and for the beasts of the earth.
Bahnar: Lăm anih âu Inh gô tơhiong lê̆ dôm tơdrong lu bơngai Juđa hăm lu bơngai pơlei Jêrusalem chă đon wă pơm. Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei lu sư lôch kơ đao 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai 'maih pơrăm tơdrong arih lu sư; Inh gô jao ăn kơ kon sem bri sem păr sa akâu lôch lu sư.

English: I will make this city desolate and a hissing; everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its plagues.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ pơlei âu jing juơ; ăn kơ đe gô che bơle; bơngai bu yak rok noh gô lăng krưp păng hiĕk kơ tơdrong răm noh.

English: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and everyone shall eat the flesh of his friend in the siege and in the desperation with which their enemies and those who seek their lives shall drive them to despair.” ’
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư 'buh sa lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư kơdih, lu sư gô 'buh sa băl tơduă, lăm năr đe wang lăm năr pơmat-tat, kơplah 'bơ̆t lu bơngai mă wă pơrăm tơdrong arih lu sư.’

English: “Then you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who go with you
Bahnar: Ih athei teh pơchah bĕ ge 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai năm hơdai ih.

English: and say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Even so I will break this people and this city, as one breaks a potter’s vessel, which cannot be made whole again; and they shall bury them in Tophet till there is no place to bury.
Bahnar: ‘Na khan kơ lu sư: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh gô teh pơchah lê̆ kon pơlei păng pơlei âu kư̆m thoi Jêrêmi teh pơchah ge noh mơ̆n, ưh pă gơh pơklep dơ̆ng. Lu sư gô 'bŭ hơtâu bơngai lôch tơ Tôphet, dĭng mă anih 'bŭ pă đei.’ ”

English: Thus I will do to this place,” says the LORD, “and to its inhabitants, and make this city like Tophet.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô ăn kơ anih âu păng kon pơlei sư thoi noh, Inh gô pơm kơ pơlei âu thoi Tôphet.

English: And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be defiled like the place of Tophet, because of all the houses on whose roofs they have burned incense to all the host of heaven, and poured out drink offerings to other gods.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng hnam lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng hnam pơtao Juđa, đĭ-đăng lu hnam ayơ mă tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam noh đei soh tơmam 'bâu phu kơ lu sơnglŏng tơ kơpal plĕnh păng kư̆m đei tuh ăn tơmam huch sa pơyơ̆r kơ lu yang nai, kư̆m 'mê̆-'mach thoi Tôphet.”

English: Then Jeremiah came from Tophet, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the Lord’s house and said to all the people
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Jêrêmi brŏk đơ̆ng Tôphet anih mă Kră Yang wơh sư năm khan lê̆ adrol, sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cham hnam Kră Yang păng khan tơbăt kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will bring on this city and on all her towns all the doom that I have pronounced against it, because they have stiffened their necks that they might not hear My words.’ ”
Bahnar: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘'Nâu, Inh gô ăn tơdrong răm truh kơ pơlei 'nâu hăm lu pơlei jum dăr thoi Inh khan lê̆, yua kơ lu sư arăng kơ̆l, kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh.”

English: Now Pashhur the son of Immer, the priest who was also chief governor in the house of the LORD, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
Bahnar: Phashur 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Immer, pơm tih lăng hnam akŭm Kră Yang, đei kơtơ̆ng Jêrêmi pơma khan lê̆ adrol lu tơdrong noh.

English: Then Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Phashur rôp teh tôn Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, hơnuh lê̆ jơ̆ng sư 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang kơpal Bênjamin gah hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: And it happened on the next day that Pashhur brought Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD has not called your name Pashhur, but Magor-Missabib.
Bahnar: Pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng Phashur plôh Jêrêmi đơ̆ng sư hơnuh, Jêrêmi khan kơ sư: “Kră Yang ưh pă krao ih Phashur dơ̆ng, gô krao anăn ih Magor Misabip.a

English: For thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes shall see it. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon and slay them with the sword.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô pơm ăn kơ ih đei tơdrong hli tơrơ ih kơdih păng kơ bôl buăl ih hai. Lu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm lu bơngai ayăt tơm măt ih. Inh gô jao lu kon pơlei Juđa lăm ti pơtao char Babilôn, pơtao gô rôp anhăk lu sư pơm đĭch tơ char Babilôn dah yua đao gưm pơlôch hloi lu sư.”

English: Moreover I will deliver all the wealth of this city, all its produce, and all its precious things; all the treasures of the kings of Judah I will give into the hand of their enemies, who will plunder them, seize them, and carry them to Babylon.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m gô jao dôm lu mŭk tơmam pơlei âu, mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng lu sư chă jang sa, tơmam gĭt mă đei dang ei, tơpă, Inh gô jao ăn dôm lu hu maih pơtao Juđa lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt, gô tơgar iŏk na chĕp ba tơ Babilôn.

English: And you, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house, shall go into captivity. You shall go to Babylon, and there you shall die, and be buried there, you and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied lies.’ ”
Bahnar: Ơ Phashur, ih kơdih hăm lu bơngai mă oei lăm hnam ih, đĭ-đăng gô pơm bơnă. Ih gô năm tơ Babilôn gô lôch păng 'bŭ hloi tơ noh, hơdai hăm lu bôl buăl ih, wă khan lu bơngai mă ih đei pơma khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh kơ lu sư.

English: O LORD, You induced me, and I was persuaded; You are stronger than I, and have prevailed. I am in derision daily; Everyone mocks me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih pơhlŭ inh boih, inh chu iŏk boih dôm tơdrong Ih pơgŏ, Ih pơjuă pơđep inh păng jei Ih boih. Inh arih pơm kơ đe hiĕk ăr kơ inh prăt năr. Rim bơngai hiĕk pơjăm inh.

English: For when I spoke, I cried out; I shouted, “Violence and plunder!” Because the word of the LORD was made to me A reproach and a derision daily.
Bahnar: Mưh wă inh pơma, inh athei ôr kơtang. Inh khan: “Rŭng răng dêh tăm 'băm dêh.” Tơpă nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm boih kơ inh mơlâu păng đe hiĕk ăr kơ inh prăt năr.

English: Then I said, “I will not make mention of Him, Nor speak anymore in His name.” But His word was in my heart like a burning fire Shut up in my bones; I was weary of holding it back, And I could not.
