Bahnar: Tơdah inh khan: “Inh ưh pă pơma roi gah nơ̆r Sư boih, inh ưh pă đei yua anăn Sư na pơma roi dơ̆ng,” nơ̆r Sư lăm jơhngơ̆m inh thoi ŭnh soh chhông, Nơ̆r Sư chĭt lê̆ lăm kơting inh, na jơhngơ̆m inh rơmơ̆n lap, ưh pă kĕ ĕnh boih.’

English: For I heard many mocking: “Fear on every side!” “Report,” they say, “and we will report it!” All my acquaintances watched for my stumbling, saying, “Perhaps he can be induced; Then we will prevail against him, And we will take our revenge on him.”
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng lơ bơngai pơma mơmơnh, “Tơdrong tơhli tăp tang. Roi tơbăt bĕ lu bơ̆n athei roi tơbăt tơdrong glăi sư!” Đĭ-đăng buăl juăt inh chang rŏ kơ inh jah pơ̆k huŏng, na khan: “Rŏ lăng đe gô pơhlŭ sư, lu bơ̆n gơh pơm kơ sư, na gô jei bơ̆n.

English: But the LORD is with me as a mighty, awesome One. Therefore my persecutors will stumble, and will not prevail. They will be greatly ashamed, for they will not prosper. Their everlasting confusion will never be forgotten.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang oei hơdai inh, thoi minh 'nu bơngai linh nuih kơtang; Na lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh gô pơ̆k huŏng, ưh kĕ kơ jei lu sư, yua kơ lu sư oei arih sa ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu tih, mơlâu ling-lang hlŏng hloi ưh kơ đei layơ hiơt.

English: But, O LORD of hosts, You who test the righteous, And see the mind and heart, Let me see Your vengeance on them; For I have pleaded my cause before You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh! Ih boih Tơ'ngla pơlong lăng lu bơngai tơpăt, lăng 'bôh đĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m klơm klak lăm kơ̆l 'ngok, Ăn bĕ kơ inh 'bôh tơdrong Ih wă pơm 'mong kơ lu sư, Yua kơ inh jao boih tơdrong inh kơ Ih.

English: Sing to the LORD! Praise the LORD! For He has delivered the life of the poor From the hand of evildoers.
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang, Kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, Yua kơ Sư dŏng pơklaih boih lu bơngai dơnuh hin Đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Cursed be the day in which I was born! Let the day not be blessed in which my mother bore me!
Bahnar: Hiap bĕ năr mă tơpŭ kơ inh! Năr mĕ inh hơiơch kơ inh pơm liơ mă gơh hiôk?

English: Let the man be cursed Who brought news to my father, saying, “A male child has been born to you!” Making him very glad.
Bahnar: Hiap bĕ bơngai bu mă năm roi kơ 'bă inh khan: “Đe tơpŭ kơ ih minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo!” Pih pang pơm kơ 'bă chhôk chơt.

English: And let that man be like the cities Which the LORD overthrew, and did not relent; Let him hear the cry in the morning And the shouting at noon
Bahnar: Ăn kơ bơngai noh thoi lu pơlei Kră Yang pơrăm boih ưh pă đei mơnat! Ăn kơ sư kơtơ̆ng tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi gah pơgê hrôih, 'năr dơ̆ng kơtơ̆ng đe ôr krao tơdrong tơblah.

English: Because he did not kill me from the womb, That my mother might have been my grave, And her womb always enlarged with me.
Bahnar: Liơ mă inh ưh kơ lôch kơplah inh oei lăm klak mĕ inh sơ̆; Tơpu kon lăm mĕ inh jah jing pơm bơsat inh, Jah đei anăp kơ inh hlŏng hloi.

English: Why did I come forth from the womb to see labor and sorrow, That my days should be consumed with shame?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ đei tơpŭ kơ inh wă kơ inh pơmat-tat, gleh glăn, đĭ chăl arih inh mơlâu ling-lang?

English: The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi, kơplah pơtao Sêđekia wơh Phashur, kon drŏ-nglo Malkija păng 'bok soi Sephania kon drŏ-nglo Maaseia năm tơ Jêrêmi khan

English: “Please inquire of the LORD for us, for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon makes war against us. Perhaps the LORD will deal with us according to all His wonderful works, that the king may go away from us.”
Bahnar: “Apinh ih krao apinh bĕ Kră Yang tơgŭm lu nhôn, yua kơ Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn oei năm wang blah lu nhôn. Rŏ lăng băt Kră Yang pơm tơdrong mơsêh kơ nhôn kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong mơsêh Sư pơm sơ̆, pơm ăn kơ pơtao Babilôn kơdŭn weh đơ̆ng lu nhôn.”

English: Then Jeremiah said to them, “Thus you shall say to Zedekiah
Bahnar: Jêrêmi tơl: “Lu iĕm athei năm khan kơ pơtao Sêđekia

English: ‘Thus says the LORD God of Israel: “Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you fight against the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the walls; and I will assemble them in the midst of this city.
Bahnar: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael khan: Âu Inh gô tơwih plơ̆, dôm lu đao kơtuang iĕm oei chĕp lăm ti wă blah puh pơtao Babilôn păng bơngai Kalđê dang ei oei wang tăp tơ đaih kơ dur pơlei, Inh gô akŭm lu sư lăm tŏk-bŏk pơlei tih âu.

English: I Myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger and fury and great wrath.
Bahnar: Kơdih kâu Inh gô blah lu iĕm, Inh tôi kơkŏng hiŏng ti pran kơtang hăm tơdrong ơh blĕk hil mĭl dêh.

English: I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast; they shall die of a great pestilence.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơlôch pơrăm lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei âu, kon bơngai păng đĭ lu sem dơrong gô lôch kơ toi hơbuh krưp tơpă.

English: And afterward,” says the LORD, “I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, his servants and the people, and such as are left in this city from the pestilence and the sword and the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life; and he shall strike them with the edge of the sword. He shall not spare them, or have pity or mercy.” ’
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, Kră Yang khan: Inh gô jao Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa păng yŏng pơgơ̆r, hăm lu, kon pơlei sư mă oei arih lăm pơlei tih âu; oei arih huay kơ lôch rŭng, đơ̆ng đao gưm, hăm klaih đơ̆ng lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, Inh gô jao lu sư lăm ti Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn, lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt chă wă 'maih pơlôch lu sư. Pơtao Babilôn gô koh lu sư hăm đao gưm, pă đei mơnat, pă 'mêm kư̆m pă lăng lu sư boih.”

English: “Now you shall say to this people, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan dơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei âu: Kră Yang khan: Âu, Inh dan lê̆ boih trong tơdrong arih păng trong ba tơdrong lôch 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: He who remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but he who goes out and defects to the Chaldeans who besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be as a prize to him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă oei oei lăm pơlei âu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm, lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, lôch kơ jĭ hơbuh, mă-lei bu kơdâu lĕch yơ̆r ti tơkan tơ bơngai Kalđê mă oei wang iĕm gô arih, kư̆m gô pơklaih akâu sư kơdih.

English: For I have set My face against this city for adversity and not for good,” says the LORD. “It shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.” ’
Bahnar: Inh wă pơrăm pơlei âu, ưh kơ wă ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư ôh. Kră Yang khan. Inh gô jao pơlei âu lăm ti pơtao Babilôn; sư gô soh pơrăm pơlei âu hăm ŭnh.

English: “And concerning the house of the king of Judah, say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ anih hnam pơtao Juđa, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: O house of David! Thus says the LORD: “Execute judgment in the morning; And deliver him who is plundered Out of the hand of the oppressor, Lest My fury go forth like fire And burn so that no one can quench it, Because of the evil of your doings.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ adrĕch Đawit, Pơm bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hơnơ̆ng rim pơgê hrôih, Dŏng pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai đe sa pơgâm, đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep, Kơnh hli kơ Inh hil khơ̆ng thoi ŭnh, ưh kơ đei bu kĕ pĭt, Yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong lu iĕm đei pơm yoch kơnê̆.”

English: “Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley, And rock of the plain,” says the LORD, “Who say, ‘Who shall come down against us? Or who shall enter our dwellings?’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh wă blah lu iĕm, ơ pơlei tih Jêrusalem, oei kơpal tơmo tih dơnă lăm anih groi kông, lăng tơ bơngai oei lăm thŭng, Lu iĕm khan, ‘Bơngai bu gơh năm blah bơ̆n? Bơngai bu kĕ mơ̆t lăm anih kơjăp bơ̆n kơ'nơp?’ ”

English: But I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings,” says the LORD; “I will kindle a fire in its forest, And it shall devour all things around it.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô phak lu iĕm kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong yoch lu iĕm đei pơm. Inh gô prah ŭnh tơ hnam pơtao iĕm ŭnh gô sa pơđĭ tơmam tăp dă.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and there speak this word
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Jur năm bĕ tơ hnam pơtao Juđa, roi kơ sư tơdrong âu

English: and say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David, you and your servants and your people who enter these gates!
Bahnar: ‘Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan ơ pơtao Juđa, bơngai mă hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit, ih, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu kon pơlei ih mơ̆t lĕch trong 'măng jang âu.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Execute judgment and righteousness, and deliver the plundered out of the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong and do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, or the widow, nor shed innocent blood in this place.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Pơm bĕ dôm tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng tơdrong trŏ; pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai mă đe rôp đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep. Lê̆ kơ rôp pơgŏ păng kư̆m 'nĕ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơmoi, lu kon mơti 'bă păng lu yă adro 'Nĕ kơ pơlôch tuh pham kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ yoch tơ anih âu.

English: For if you indeed do this thing, then shall enter the gates of this house, riding on horses and in chariots, accompanied by servants and people, kings who sit on the throne of David.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm đĭ jơhngơ̆m chu pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu, na iĕm gô đei pơtao pơtrơp hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit hao gre aseh păng hao aseh hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu kon pơlei ih gô mơ̆t lĕch rok trong 'măng jang hnam pơtao 'nâu.

English: But if you will not hear these words, I swear by Myself,” says the LORD, “that this house shall become a desolation.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu, Kră Yang khan: Inh pơkă hăm anăn Inh kơdih, hnam pơtao âu gô jing juơ.’ ”

English: For thus says the LORD to the house of the king of Judah: “You are Gilead to Me, The head of Lebanon; Yet I surely will make you a wilderness, Cities which are not inhabited.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan gah hnam pơtao Juđa: “Mă khan Inh lăng ih thoi char Gileat, kư̆m rŏ krưp thoi kơ̆l kông Liban, Mă-lei Inh pơkă wă pơm kơ ih jing thoi char glă, lu pơlei ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: I will prepare destroyers against you, Everyone with his weapons; They shall cut down your choice cedars And cast them into the fire.
Bahnar: Inh gô wơh lu linh năm pơrăm ih, lu sư chĕp sung tơgăk; lu sư gô ret lê̆ hơpok tơpơng 'lơ̆ng mă lu ih đei rơih, păng klơ̆m lê̆ lăm ŭnh.

English: And many nations will pass by this city; and everyone will say to his neighbor, ‘Why has the LORD done so to this great city?’
Bahnar: Đei kon pơlei đơ̆ng lơ teh đak gô năm rok trong pơlei âu, tơpinh băl: ‘Liơ Kră Yang pơm kơ pơlei tih âu mah thoi noh?’

English: Then they will answer, ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD their God, and worshiped other gods and served them.’ ”
Bahnar: Gô đei bơngai tơl khan: ‘‘Noh yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei âu achăng lê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih, na bơwih bơwăn păng kơkuh kơ yang nai.’ ”

English: Weep not for the dead, nor bemoan him; Weep bitterly for him who goes away, For he shall return no more, Nor see his native country.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hmoi kơ pơtao lôch păng kư̆m 'nĕ pă nhơ̆m hmach kơ sư, jah nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ kơ pơtao mă đe rôp pơm bơnă đơ̆ng iĕm, yua kơ sư ưh pă wih brŏk tơ iĕm dơ̆ng. Ưh pă wă 'bôh dêh char sư âu dơ̆ng.

English: For thus says the LORD concerning Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, who went from this place: “He shall not return here anymore
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan thoi âu gah Salum pơtao đe Juđa kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơgơ̆r tơplih 'bă sư Jôsia păng kư̆m weh boih đơ̆ng anih âu: “Sư ưh pă đei chuêt brŏk tơ âu dơ̆ng.

English: but he shall die in the place where they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.
Bahnar: Na gô lôch hloi tơ lăm char mă đe chông ba, ưh pă 'bôh teh đak 'nâu đơ̆ng.” Roi gah Jêhôiakim

English: “Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness And his chambers by injustice, Who uses his neighbor’s service without wages And gives him nothing for his work
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ bơngai bu mă pơdơ̆ng hnam pơtao sư hăm tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ păng pơm anih tơ kơpal hăm tơdrong ưh kơ tơpăt hơnơ̆ng rôp lu bơngai rông 'bôt sư jang hoh; ưh kơ đei apah lu sư

English: Who says, ‘I will build myself a wide house with spacious chambers, And cut out windows for it, Paneling it with cedar And painting it with vermilion.’
Bahnar: Khan thoi âu: “Inh gô pơm hnam pơtao inh mă tih să, đei lơ tăl tơ kơpal rơhơi rơhŏ; Na sư gô pơm lu 'măng-'mŏk hơdah pơ̆ng tơnăr sư hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo pik bah đak 'brê.

English: “Shall you reign because you enclose yourself in cedar? Did not your father eat and drink, And do justice and righteousness? Then it was well with him.
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ ih tơchĕng ih pơm pơtao, yua kơ ih pơm hnam hăm 'long hơngo 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đe? Hăm trŏ kơ 'bă ih sơ̆ đei sŏng sa đak nhă? Sư pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt, na đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ kơ sư.

English: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; Then it was well. Was not this knowing Me?” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư sek tơdrong tơpăt kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin hăm lu bơngai pơmat-tat, na sư đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk. Hăm trŏ sư pơm thoi noh wă khan sư băt kơ Inh? Noh Kră Yang khan

English: “Yet your eyes and your heart are for nothing but your covetousness, For shedding innocent blood, And practicing oppression and violence.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei măt păng jơhngơ̆m ih 'maih chă lơi, pơlôch lu bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch, păng 'maih chă rôp pơgŏ pơjuă pơđep pơm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: Therefore thus says the LORD concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah: “They shall not lament for him, Saying, ‘Alas, my brother!’ or ‘Alas, my sister!’ They shall not lament for him, Saying, ‘Alas, master!’ or ‘Alas, his glory!’
Bahnar: Thoi noh, 'nâu Kră Yang khan gah Jêhôiakim, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơtao đe Juđa: Ưh kơ đei bu nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư khan: Hô̆ lah 'nhŏng inh! Hô̆ lah mŏ inh! Ưh kơ đei bu nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư khan: Hô̆ lah yŏng inh kah, hô̆ lah pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ inh kah!

English: He shall be buried with the burial of a donkey, Dragged and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đe gô 'bŭ sư thoi đe 'bŭ aseh iĕ, đe gô hor sư tơ 'nguaih, păng klơ̆m lê̆ sư tơ ataih kơ 'măng jang pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: “Go up to Lebanon, and cry out, And lift up your voice in Bashan; Cry from Abarim, For all your lovers are destroyed.
Bahnar: Tŏk năm bĕ tơ char Liban păng krao ôr, nhơ̆m hmoi ôr mă re tơ groi Basan krao ôr mă re kơtang dơ̆ng kông Abarim. Yua kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mă pơgơ̆p hăm ih lôch đĭ boih.

English: I spoke to you in your prosperity, But you said, ‘I will not hear.’ This has been your manner from your youth, That you did not obey My voice.
Bahnar: Inh đei bơtho khan boih kơ ih kơplah ih hiôk jơnap, mă-lei ih khan Inh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh. 'Nâu tơdrong ih đei pơm boih đơ̆ng ih oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆, ih oei ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh.

English: The wind shall eat up all your rulers, And your lovers shall go into captivity; Surely then you will be ashamed and humiliated For all your wickedness.
Bahnar: Kial gô puh pơđông lê̆ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai wei triu ih, păng lu bơngai mă pơgơ̆p hăm ih gô jing bơnă, kơplah noh ih gô mơlâu păng hlơ̆l lĕm, yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ đêl ih pơm boih.

English: O inhabitant of Lebanon, Making your nest in the cedars, How gracious will you be when pangs come upon you, Like the pain of a woman in labor?
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai oei lăm char Liban, pơm anih oei lăm kơdrơ̆ng 'long hơngo, ih gô tơngưih dêh kơplah đei tơdrong jĭ tuĕnh truh kơ ih, thoi lu bơngai drŏ-kăn jĭ wă hơiơch!

English: “As I live,” says the LORD, “though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were the signet on My right hand, yet I would pluck you off
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Sĭt thoi Inh arih, mă khan Jêhôiachin kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim pơtao đe Juđa, thoi tơkhiĕn tơdra 'bot 'bơ̆t hơnglâu ti 'ma Inh, tơpă Inh kư̆m oei plôh lê̆.

English: and I will give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of those whose face you fear—the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of the Chaldeans.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơjao lê̆ ih kơ lu bơngai mă 'maih pơrăm tơdrong arih ih tơ lăm ti lu bơngai mă ih hli dêh, lăm ti Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn păng lăm ti lu bơngai Kalđê.

English: So I will cast you out, and your mother who bore you, into another country where you were not born; and there you shall die.
Bahnar: Inh gô puh lê̆ ih hăm mĕ ih tơ dêh nai, ưh kơ trŏ kơ dêh char mă đêl tơpŭ kơ ih păng măr iĕm gô lôch tơ noh.

English: But to the land to which they desire to return, there they shall not return.
Bahnar: Măr iĕm ưh pă đei brŏk boih tơ char mă măr iĕm rơnguơ̆ rŏ kơ 'maih brŏk.”

English: “Is this man Coniah a despised, broken idol— A vessel in which is no pleasure? Why are they cast out, he and his descendants, And cast into a land which they do not know?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Jêhôiachin jing bô̆i teh pơchah boih, mă đe areh? Minh pôm bô̆i teh ưh kơ đei bu wă? Liơ sư hăm lu adrĕch adrung sư đe klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ ataih, tơ char mă lu sư ưh kơ băt?

English: O earth, earth, earth, Hear the word of the LORD!
Bahnar: Ơ dêh char, dêh char, dêh char! Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Thus says the LORD: ‘Write this man down as childless, A man who shall not prosper in his days; For none of his descendants shall prosper, Sitting on the throne of David, And ruling anymore in Judah.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Chih jô̆ bĕ bơngai 'nâu hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ đei hơ'lơ̆p, ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk jơnap kơplah sư oei arih; Yua kơ lu kon sâu sư ưh kơ đei bu pŭn hiôk jơnap, gơh hơ-oei tơ tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit, păng gơh pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch Juđa dơ̆ng!”

English: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture!” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Răm-'băm tơpă kơ lu bơngai wei triu, pơrăm păng pơm kơ triu Inh tơklah tơklang đơ̆ng tơmăn 'nhĕt Inh.”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD God of Israel against the shepherds who feed My people: “You have scattered My flock, driven them away, and not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for the evil of your doings,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na, Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan kơ lu bơngai wei triu, wei-lăng kon pơlei Inh. “Lu iĕm pơm kơ triu Inh tơklah tơklang, pơpuh tơweh tơ nai ưh kơ wei rong lu sư, Kră Yang khan. 'Nâu Inh gô phak lu iĕm yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm pơm.”

English: “But I will gather the remnant of My flock out of all countries where I have driven them, and bring them back to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
Bahnar: “Noh Inh wă akŭm lu triu Inh mă oei arih đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char mă Inh đei pơpuh lu sư. Inh gô chông anhăk lu sư mơ̆t tơ lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt lu sư; lu sư gô chek lar rai lơ.

English: I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, nor shall they be lacking,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô chă lu bơngai wei rong lu sư; lu sư ưh pă hli kơ kiơ dơ̆ng păng ưh kơ đei hiong minh pôm ayơ,” noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “That I will raise to David a Branch of righteousness; A King shall reign and prosper, And execute judgment and righteousness in the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Năr gô truh tơ anăp âu, Inh gô tơiung đei minh pôm dơng tơpăt chăt đơ̆ng adrĕch Đawit, Sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r gơh hơgei, pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hơnơ̆ng lăm teh đak.

English: In His days Judah will be saved, And Israel will dwell safely; Now this is His name by which He will be called: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
Bahnar: Lăm chăl Sư pơgơ̆r khŭl bơngai Juđa gô đei dŏng pơklaih; păng bơngai Isơrael đei arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng. 'Nâu anăn đe gô krao Sư: ‘Kră Yang boih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt lu nhôn.’ ”

English: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “that they shall no longer say, ‘As the LORD lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lei na gô đei năr truh tơ anăp, kơplah noh đe ưh pă đei pơma pơkăm pơkă thoi âu dơ̆ng: ‘Sĭt tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih, Kră Yang mă đei pơklaih adrĕch adrung Isơrael đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.’

English: but, ‘As the LORD lives who brought up and led the descendants of the house of Israel from the north country and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ And they shall dwell in their own land.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đe gô khan: Sĭt tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih, Kră Yang mă đei dŏng pơklaih adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, păng lu char mă lu sư oei đơ̆ng Kră Yang puh lu sư sơ̆.’ Lu sư gô wih brŏk oei tơ dêh char lu sư kơdih.

English: My heart within me is broken Because of the prophets; All my bones shake. I am like a drunken man, And like a man whom wine has overcome, Because of the LORD, And because of His holy words.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: Jơhngơ̆m inh pơchah boih lăm inh, kơting inh đĭ tơtơ̆, inh thoi bơngai suai kơ sik, thoi bơngai wing măt yua kơ sik pơm kơ sư, đơ̆ng Kră Yang hăm đơ̆ng nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư.

English: For the land is full of adulterers; For because of a curse the land mourns. The pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up. Their course of life is evil, And their might is not right.
Bahnar: ‘Dêh char âu 'bĕnh kơ lu bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, Yua kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang hiap pơtê̆, teh hrĕng kro, tơmăn 'nhĕt tơ char glă kro đĭ. Lu sư kơdâu kiơ̆ trong kơnê̆; yua iŏk tơdrong gơh kĕ ưh kơ trŏ.’ ”

English: “For both prophet and priest are profane; Yes, in My house I have found their wickedness,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Đĭ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hăm đĭ lu 'bok soi tă kơ pơm kơnê̆ dêh, Inh 'bôh boih lu sư pơm kơnê̆ truh tơ lăm hnam Inh hloi.” Noh Kră Yang khan

English: “Therefore their way shall be to them Like slippery ways; In the darkness they shall be driven on And fall in them; For I will bring disaster on them, The year of their punishment,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Thoi noh trong lu sư yak jing rơbơ̆r, Inh gô pơpuh lu sư tơ lăm măng mu, păng gô pơ̆k 'bĭch hloi tơ noh. Truh boih sơnăm Inh wă sek phak lu sư, Inh pơrăm lu sư.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria: They prophesied by Baal And caused My people Israel to err.
Bahnar: “Inh 'bôh hơđăl boih tơdrong glăi yoch krưp, lăm bơngai khan lê̆ adrol char Samari; Lu sư yua anăn yang Baal na khan lê̆ adrol, ba bơngai Isơrael Inh wơ̆l jrok.

English: Also I have seen a horrible thing in the prophets of Jerusalem: They commit adultery and walk in lies; They also strengthen the hands of evildoers, So that no one turns back from his wickedness. All of them are like Sodom to Me, And her inhabitants like Gomorrah.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh lăm lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lăm pơlei Jêrusalem pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dêh; Lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă păng yak kiơ̆ trong hơlĕnh pơdăr; lu sư pơdrŭt bơngai pơm kơnê̆ rai dêh, na lu sư ưh pă đei bu 'maih lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆. Inh lăng rim kơ lu sư thoi pơlei Sôđôm, păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem nhen thoi pơlei Gômôrơ.”

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts concerning the prophets: ‘Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, And make them drink the water of gall; For from the prophets of Jerusalem Profaneness has gone out into all the land.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan gah lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh: “Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư sa 'long tăng păng nhă đak hơkăm, yua kơ đơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, tơdrong pơm yoch kơnê̆ dêh rai jơ̆p kơ dêh char.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you. They make you worthless; They speak a vision of their own heart, Not from the mouth of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “'Nĕ pă mơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh roi kơ iĕm. Lu sư roi ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong hơmĕng ưh kơ đei, lu sư khan lê̆ adrol kiơ̆ thoi lu sư chă đon kơdih, ưh kơ trŏ kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho khan ôh.

English: They continually say to those who despise Me, ‘The LORD has said, “You shall have peace” ’; And to everyone who walks according to the dictates of his own heart, they say, ‘No evil shall come upon you.’ ”
Bahnar: Lu sư hrăn pơma roi kơ lu bơngai areh kơ Inh: ‘Kră Yang khan: Lu iĕm gô đei hiôk-hian.’ Lu sư pơma roi kơ đĭ lu bơngai arăng kơ̆l kiơ̆ thoi lu sư wă kơdih. ‘Ưh kơ đei tơdrong răm kiơ truh kơ iĕm ôh.’

English: For who has stood in the counsel of the LORD, And has perceived and heard His word? Who has marked His word and heard it?
Bahnar: Mă-lei bu đei dơ̆ng boih lăm khŭl Kră Yang, wă kơ mơ̆ng lăng nơ̆r Sư? Bu mơ̆ng hơlen boih păng wă kơ băt nơ̆r Sư?

English: Behold, a whirlwind of the LORD has gone forth in fury— A violent whirlwind! It will fall violently on the head of the wicked.
Bahnar: To kial hơbŭt đơ̆ng Kră Yang lĕch boih, tơdrong Sư hil thoi phŭt huơ̆r, huơ̆r tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: The anger of the LORD will not turn back Until He has executed and performed the thoughts of His heart. In the latter days you will understand it perfectly.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Kră Yang hil ưh kơ ngach ôh, dĭng mă Sư pơm pơkeh thoi Sư tơchĕng wă. Lăm năr ei kơnh lu iĕm gô băt hơdah tơdrong noh.

English: “I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran. I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei wơh lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh, mă-lei lu sư oei năm chă roi nơ̆r Sư kơdih. Inh ưh kơ đei athei lu sư mă-lei lu sư oei khan lê̆ adrol.

English: But if they had stood in My counsel, And had caused My people to hear My words, Then they would have turned them from their evil way And from the evil of their doings.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu sư đơ̆ng lăm khŭl Inh, lei lu sư kư̆m roi boih nơ̆r Inh kơ lu kon pơlei pơla Inh, pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei Inh weh đơ̆ng trong kơnê̆, đơ̆ng tơdrong pơm kư̆ kă.”

English: “Am I a God near at hand,” says the LORD, “And not a God afar off?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh hăm trŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei jê̆ đĕch, mă ưh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei ataih?”

English: Can anyone hide himself in secret places, So I shall not see him?” says the LORD; “Do I not fill heaven and earth?” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hăm đei bu gơh ôn hlơp akâu sư, mă Inh ưh kơ 'bôh? Kră Yang khan: Hăm trŏ kơ Inh oei tơ jơ̆p-jang kơpal plĕnh 'bĕnh kơ teh đak âu?

English: “I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in My name, saying, ‘I have dreamed, I have dreamed!’
Bahnar: Inh đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh yua anăn Inh khan! ‘Inh apo 'bôh, inh apo 'bôh.’

English: How long will this be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies? Indeed they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nâu oei đei lăm jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh, pơma kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư kơdih, dĭng dang yơ?

English: who try to make My people forget My name by their dreams which everyone tells his neighbor, as their fathers forgot My name for Baal.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơchĕng chă đon roi tơdrong lu sư apo kơ lu buăl sư mơ̆ng na wă kơ kon pơlei Inh hiơt kơ anăn Inh thoi lu 'bok yă sư hiơt kơ anăn Inh kiơ̆ yang Baal.

English: “The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; And he who has My word, let him speak My word faithfully. What is the chaff to the wheat?” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ayơ đei apo 'bôh, roi bĕ tơdrong sư apo, na bơngai bu mă đei iŏk boih nơ̆r đơ̆ng Inh ră roi bĕ mă tơpăt!” Kră Yang khan: Hơnong 'ba hăm gơh yua tơplih kơ găr 'ba?

English: “Is not My word like a fire?” says the LORD, “And like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Inh hăm trŏ thoi ŭnh? Thoi mut teh tơmo pơchah? Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” says the LORD, “who steal My words every one from his neighbor.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan. Thoi noh na 'nâu Inh gô blah lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă tơtông iŏk băl nơ̆r inh đơ̆ng tơduă lu sư na khan nơ̆r Inh.

English: Behold, I am against the prophets,” says the LORD, “who use their tongues and say, ‘He says.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô blah lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, mă yua hơpiĕt lu sư kơdih khan: ‘'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan!’

English: Behold, I am against those who prophesy false dreams,” says the LORD, “and tell them, and cause My people to err by their lies and by their recklessness. Yet I did not send them or command them; therefore they shall not profit this people at all,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơpă Inh gô blah lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol yua nơ̆r hơlĕnh roi tơdrong apo pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla Inh jrok kiơ̆ nơ̆r hơlĕnh kư̆ kă. Inh ưh kơ đei wơh păng ưh kơ đei athei lu sư ôh. Tơpă lu sư ưh kơ đei tơgŭm kiơ kơ kon pơlei pơla âu.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “So when these people or the prophet or the priest ask you, saying, ‘What is the oracle of the LORD?’ you shall then say to them, ‘What oracle?’ I will even forsake you,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Dah kon pơlei 'nâu, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, lu 'bok soi jet ih: ‘Tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang noh kiơ?’ Ih athei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Lu iĕm boih tơdrong trăp. Inh gô tŭk lê̆ iĕm,’ ” Kră Yang khan.

English: “And as for the prophet and the priest and the people who say, ‘The oracle of the LORD!’ I will even punish that man and his house.
Bahnar: Dah 'bok soi, dah 'bok khan lê̆ adrol dah minh 'nu lăm lu kon pơlei khan: ‘'Nâu tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang,’ Inh gô phak bơngai noh hăm hnam dơnŏ sư hai.

English: Thus every one of you shall say to his neighbor, and every one to his brother, ‘What has the LORD answered?’ and, ‘What has the LORD spoken?’
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong lu iĕm gô pơma tơjet băl tơduă, bơngai âu jet bơngai to: ‘Kră Yang đei tơl thoi yơ?’ Dah ‘Đei bơtho khan tơdrong kiơ?’

English: And the oracle of the LORD you shall mention no more. For every man’s word will be his oracle, for you have perverted the words of the living God, the LORD of hosts, our God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm 'nĕ pă pơma 'bơm kơ tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang dơ̆ng, yua kơ tơdrong pŭ trăp noh boih nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r rim 'nu pơma, păng lu iĕm đei pơm glăi boih kơ dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang, Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: Thus you shall say to the prophet, ‘What has the LORD answered you?’ and, ‘What has the LORD spoken?’
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong iĕm jet bĕ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol: ‘Kră Yang tơl ih liơ boih?’ Dah ‘Kră Yang pơma bơtho ih tơdrong kiơ?’

English: But since you say, ‘The oracle of the LORD!’ therefore thus says the LORD: ‘Because you say this word, “The oracle of the LORD!” and I have sent to you, saying, “Do not say, ‘The oracle of the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm oei khan: ‘'Nâu boih tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang,’ na Kră Yang khan: ‘Yua kơ lu iĕm pơma nơ̆r 'nâu. 'Nâu boih tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang,’ kơplah Inh đei wơh bơngai năm bơtho kơ iĕm 'nĕ pă pơma: ‘'Nâu tơdrong trăp đơ̆ng Kră Yang.’

English: therefore behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you and forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and will cast you out of My presence.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, na 'nâu, sĭt tơpă Inh gô hiơt kơ lu iĕm păng Inh gô hŭt lê̆ iĕm đơ̆ng hơdai hăm pơlei tih mă Inh ăn boih kơ iĕm păng lu 'bok iĕm.

English: And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm mơlâu kơ đe ling-lang hlŏng hloi, ưh kơ đei bu gơh hiơt.”

English: The LORD showed me, and there were two baskets of figs set before the temple of the LORD, after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
Bahnar: 'Noh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Nebukatnessar, pơtao đe Babilôn rôp Jêkônia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim, pơtao đe Juđa, hăm rôp lu kră pơgơ̆r lăm char Juđa, hơdai hăm lu bơngai thơ̆ hơgei, thơ̆ hơjơ̆m hling đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem chông ba tơ char Babilôn pơm bơnă, Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh đei 'bar tŏ bai plei 'long hơra dan 'bơ̆t anăp hnam Kră Yang.

English: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs which could not be eaten, they were so bad.
Bahnar: Minh pôm bai tah lu plei hơra 'lơ̆ng thoi plei đum blŭng-a lăm bơyan, bai mă minh pôm noh dơ̆ng tah plei hơra kơnê̆ ngăl, ưh pă gơh sa boih.

English: Then the LORD said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” And I said, “Figs, the good figs, very good; and the bad, very bad, which cannot be eaten, they are so bad.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet inh: “Ơ Jêrêmi, ih 'bôh kiơ?” Inh tơl: “Inh 'bôh plei 'long hơra, lu plei hơra 'lơ̆ng, 'lơ̆ng dêh, lu plei kơnê̆, kơnê̆ tơpă, plei kơnê̆ noh đĭ mah pă gơh sa.”

English: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: ‘Like these good figs, so will I acknowledge those who are carried away captive from Judah, whom I have sent out of this place for their own good, into the land of the Chaldeans.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: ‘Thoi plei hơra 'lơ̆ng 'nâu mơ̆n Inh gô jô̆ lu bơngai bơnă đơ̆ng dêh char Juđa mă Inh puh lu sư năm tơ char Kalđê.

English: For I will set My eyes on them for good, and I will bring them back to this land; I will build them and not pull them down, and I will plant them and not pluck them up.
Bahnar: Inh oei răp lăng wă pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu sư, Inh gô chông lu sư wih brŏk tơ char âu, Inh gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng ming păng ưh pă pơrăm lu sư dơ̆ng, Inh wă pơtăm ưh kơ wă buch.

English: Then I will give them a heart to know Me, that I am the LORD; and they shall be My people, and I will be their God, for they shall return to Me with their whole heart.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang. Lu sư gô jing kon pơlei Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, yua kơ lu sư gô đĭ jơhngơ̆m wih brŏk tơ Inh.’ ”

English: ‘And as the bad figs which cannot be eaten, they are so bad’—surely thus says the LORD—‘so will I give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, his princes, the residue of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Bĕ lu plei hơra kơnê̆ dêh noh mah pă gơh sa, kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n Inh gô pơm kơ Sêđekia pơtao đe Juđa, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu bơngai oei arih đơ̆ng lăm pơlei Jêrusalem mă oei oei lăm char 'nâu, dah oei lăm char Êyiptơ.

English: I will deliver them to trouble into all the kingdoms of the earth, for their harm, to be a reproach and a byword, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I shall drive them.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char lăm teh đak lăng 'brơ̆ krưp kơ lu sư. Lăng lu sư đei đe blei hiap, đe pơ'brơh, đe pơjăm pơjuă, tơ jơ̆p lăm dêh char mă Inh đei pơpuh lu sư tơ noh.

English: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence among them, till they are consumed from the land that I gave to them and their fathers.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư lôch kơ đao gưm, lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, lôch hơbuh, pơrăm pơlôch pơgoh lu sư đơ̆ng lăm teh mă Inh đei ăn kơ lu sư păng lu 'bok yă lu sư sơ̆.”

English: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon)
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi gah tơdrong wă truh kơ adrĕch adrung Juđa lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl Jêhôiakim, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơtao đe Juđa, noh lăm sơnăm blŭng-a chăl Nebukatnessar pơm pơtao dêh char Babilôn.

English: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying
Bahnar: Na Jêrêmi 'bok khan lê̆ adrol roi tơbăt nơ̆r 'nâu 'bơ̆t anăp adrĕch bơngai Juđa hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Jêrusalem

English: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even to this day, this is the twenty-third year in which the word of the LORD has come to me; and I have spoken to you, rising early and speaking, but you have not listened.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng sơnăm mă mơjĭt-pêng lăm chăl Jôsia, kon drŏ-nglo Ammôn, pơtao đe Juđa dĭng truh dang ei đei 'bar-jĭt pêng sơnăm, nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma hăm inh. Đơ̆ng năr noh, inh iung đơ̆ng hrôih ling-lang roi tơbăt kơ iĕm, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng.

English: And the LORD has sent to you all His servants the prophets, rising early and sending them, but you have not listened nor inclined your ear to hear.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei gô wơh đĭch đam sư, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, năm roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu iĕm, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng, kư̆m ưh kơ 'maih wă pơgling đon mơ̆ng.

English: They said, ‘Repent now everyone of his evil way and his evil doings, and dwell in the land that the LORD has given to you and your fathers forever and ever.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: ‘Rim 'nu kơ lu iĕm athei weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆, achăng lê̆ bĕ tơdrong pơm yoch kơnê̆, na lu iĕm gô oei lăm teh đak Kră Yang ăn boih kơ lu iĕm păng lu 'bok yă iĕm sơ̆ khơ̆ ning-mônh hlŏng hloi.

English: Do not go after other gods to serve them and worship them, and do not provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands; and I will not harm you.’
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ kiơ̆ kơkuh păng jang kơ lu yang nai, 'nĕ iŏk tơmam iĕm chă pơm păng ti na tơblĕk Inh dơ̆ng, lei Inh huay kơ ăn tơdrong răm truh kơ iĕm.’

English: Yet you have not listened to Me,” says the LORD, “that you might provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: ‘Mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, rai tơblĕk Inh hăm tơmam đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm pơm na pŭ iŏk tơdrong pơrăm iĕm kơdih.’

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Because you have not heard My words
Bahnar: Thoi noh na, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: ‘Yua kơ lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh

English: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north,’ says the LORD, ‘and Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land, against its inhabitants, and against these nations all around, and will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, a hissing, and perpetual desolations.
Bahnar: 'nâu, Inh gô krao đĭ adrĕch adrung gah yă-nơ̆m păng đĭch đam Inh Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn,’ Kră Yang khan: ‘Inh gô ba lu sư blah iŏk dêh char âu hăm lu kon pơlei oei lăm char âu păng pơm kơ lu kon pơlei oei tăp dăr kơ char âu hai. Inh gô pơrăm đĭ lu sư, pơm kơ lu sư đe lăng 'brơ̆ krưp, đe pơjăm păng hiong răm hlŏng hloi.

English: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones and the light of the lamp.
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh, Inh gô pơm ăn kơ lu sư pă đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đe hơri chơt hiôk, pă đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r keng đe hlôm pơchơt păng pă đei nơ̆r hiĕk chhôk chă klo akăn, kư̆m pă đei kơtơ̆ng re tơpăl đe peh 'ba păng kư̆m pă đei hơdah ŭnh kơđeng.

English: And this whole land shall be a desolation and an astonishment, and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p kơ teh âu jing juơ, đĭ kon pơlei lăm dêh char âu gô bơ̆jang kơ pơtao Babilôn lăm tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm.”

English: ‘Then it will come to pass, when seventy years are completed, that I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their iniquity,’ says the LORD; ‘and I will make it a perpetual desolation.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Mưh đĭ kơ tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm noh boih, Inh gô phak pơtao Babilôn păng kon bơngai lăm char noh, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư. Inh gô phak char bơngai Kalđê pơm ăn kơ char noh jing juơ hlŏng hloi.

English: So I will bring on that land all My words which I have pronounced against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied concerning all the nations.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ char noh thoi nơ̆r Inh đei pơma, nơ̆r mă đei chih răk boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu, noh đơ̆ng nơ̆r Jêrêmi khan lê̆ adrol pơm kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch.

English: (For many nations and great kings shall be served by them also; and I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the works of their own hands.)’ ”
Bahnar: ‘Mă lu sư kư̆m gô pơm đĭch kơ lu dêh char pran kơtang lu pơtao tih mơng Inh gô pơm tơwih kơ lu sư thoi lu sư đei pơm păng kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti lu sư pơm.”

English: For thus says the LORD God of Israel to me: “Take this wine cup of fury from My hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send you, to drink it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan kơ inh: “Iŏk bĕ kơchŏk 'bĕnh kơ sik Inh mĭl đơ̆ng ti Inh, pơhuch bĕ đĭ-đăng kơ adrĕch adrung mă Inh wơh ih năm tơ yơ athei huch sik noh.

English: And they will drink and stagger and go mad because of the sword that I will send among them.”
Bahnar: Lu sư gô huch, suai wơnh yak nơnăm mơngưt mơngat, yua kơ đao gưm mă Inh đei ăn truh tơ lăm lu sư.”

English: Then I took the cup from the LORD’s hand, and made all the nations drink, to whom the LORD had sent me
Bahnar: Thoi ei na inh iŏk kơchŏk sik đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang păng pơhuch ăn kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung mă Kră Yang wơh inh năm huch sik lăm kơchŏk noh

English: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and its princes, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is this day
Bahnar: Pơlei tih Jêrusalem păng lu pơlei lăm char Juđa, ăn kơ lu pơtao lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, pơm ăn kơ lu sư răm jing rơ̆m rĕk, đe pơjăm đe blei hiap, đe lăng lu sư 'brơ̆ krưp thoi hrei 'nâu.

English: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his princes, and all his people
Bahnar: Pharaôn, pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam sư, đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r păng lu kon pơlei sư.

English: all the mixed multitude, all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the land of the Philistines (namely, Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod)
Bahnar: Păng đĭ-đăng kơ lu tơmoi lăm char noh lu pơtao char Us, ăn kơ lu pơtao char Philistin, lăm noh đei pơlei Askalon, pơlei Gasa, Ekrôn păng lu bơngai mă oei arih lăm pơlei Asdôt.

English: Edom, Moab, and the people of Ammon
Bahnar: Char Eđôm, char Môap ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Ammôn.

English: all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the coastlands which are across the sea
Bahnar: Ăn đĭ kơ lu pơtao Tirơ, kơ lu pơtao oei lăm Siđôn păng kơ lu pơtao oei lăm bŏl đak dơsĭ.

English: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who are in the farthest corners
Bahnar: Ăn đĭ kơ pơlei Đêdan, Têma, kơ Bus, ăn kơ lu bơngai hơkôih sŏk kơ̆l.

English: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed multitude who dwell in the desert
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu pơtao Arâp, ăn kơ lu pơtao rim dêh char nai oei hơbĭ lăm char glă.

English: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes
Bahnar: Ăn đĭ kơ rim pơtao Simri, đĭ-đăng pơtao char Êlam, ăn kơ lu pơtao char Mêđi.

English: all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world which are on the face of the earth. Also the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
Bahnar: Ăn đĭ kơ pơtao gah yă-nơ̆m, oei jê̆ dah ataih, ăn kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char kơpal teh. Đơ̆ng noh ăn kơ Pơtao Sêsach kư̆m huch sik lăm kơchŏk noh.

English: “Therefore you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Drink, be drunk, and vomit! Fall and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.” ’
Bahnar: “Ih khan bĕ kơ lu sư: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: ‘Huch bĕ mă suai, hăk lê̆, pơ̆k lê̆ pă iung, yua kơ đao gưm Inh ăn truh tơ lu iĕm!

English: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “You shall certainly drink!
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu sư ưh kơ chu iŏk kơchŏk sik đơ̆ng ti ih na huch, lei ih khan kơ lu sư: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Iĕm athei huch!

English: For behold, I begin to bring calamity on the city which is called by My name, and should you be utterly unpunished? You shall not be unpunished, for I will call for a sword on all the inhabitants of the earth,” says the LORD of hosts.’
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh wă ăn tơdrong gleh truh kơ pơlei tih krao anăn Inh. Bĕ lu iĕm, Inh wă lê̆ kơ phak hă? Ưh ôh! Inh gô phak lu iĕm, yua kơ Inh gô ăn đao hơlă truh tơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung oei kơpal teh,’ ” Noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan.

English: “Therefore prophesy against them all these words, and say to them: ‘The LORD will roar from on high, And utter His voice from His holy habitation; He will roar mightily against His fold. He will give a shout, as those who tread the grapes, Against all the inhabitants of the earth.
Bahnar: “Gah ih, roi tơbăt lê̆ bĕ dôm nơ̆r wă blah lu sư âu păng khan: ‘Kră Yang gô ôr tơkĕch đơ̆ng anih tơ kơpal; đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư, sư gô ôr kơtang wă pơm kơ teh Sư, ôr jreo tơkĕch thoi đe pơjuă plei hơmu, Sư blah pơm kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai oei kơpal teh đak âu.

English: A noise will come to the ends of the earth— For the LORD has a controversy with the nations; He will plead His case with all flesh. He will give those who are wicked to the sword,’ says the LORD.”
Bahnar: Đe gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r tơjrông tơjrang tơ tôch kơ teh, yua kơ Kră Yang gô sek đĭ kơ adrĕch adrung, Sư wă phak đĭ-đăng kon bơngai, Sư pơjao ăn lu bơngai kơnê̆ lôch kơ đao gưm.’ ” 'Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Behold, disaster shall go forth From nation to nation, And a great whirlwind shall be raised up From the farthest parts of the earth.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “'Nâu, tơdrong pơrăm truh tơ jơ̆p-jang đơ̆ng dêh char âu truh tơ dêh char nai; hơbŭt hơbang tih lĕch đơ̆ng anih tôch kơ teh đak.”

English: And at that day the slain of the LORD shall be from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth. They shall not be lamented, or gathered, or buried; they shall become refuse on the ground.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh akâu atâu bơngai mă Kră Yang pơlôch 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p kơ teh đơ̆ng gah âu truh tơ gah to, ưh kơ đei bu hmoi, ưh kơ đei bu 'bŭ hơmet, gô pơm mơ̆r kơ teh!

English: “Wail, shepherds, and cry! Roll about in the ashes, You leaders of the flock! For the days of your slaughter and your dispersions are fulfilled; You shall fall like a precious vessel.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai wei triu, nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ, ôr krao bĕ! Ơ tơ'ngla triu tơgrŏl pơpơ̆ bĕ yua kơ truh boih năr đe pơlôch lu iĕm, lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch thoi gŏ teh gĭt pơchah.

English: And the shepherds will have no way to flee, Nor the leaders of the flock to escape.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei triu ưh pă đei trong ayơ gơh klĕnh, Lu tơ'ngla triu kư̆m ưh pă đei trong ayơ gơh klaih.

English: A voice of the cry of the shepherds, And a wailing of the leaders to the flock will be heard. For the LORD has plundered their pasture
Bahnar: Ei! Lu bơngai wei triu ôr, lu tơ'ngla triu nhơ̆m hmoi; Kră Yang pơrăm lê̆ goh tơmăn 'nhĕt lu sư.

English: And the peaceful dwellings are cut down Because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
Bahnar: Hơdrong triu hiôk-hian kư̆m pơrăm đĭ, đơ̆ng tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl.

English: He has left His lair like the lion; For their land is desolate Because of the fierceness of the Oppressor, And because of His fierce anger.”
Bahnar: Thoi dăm-brang sư lĕch boih đơ̆ng anih sư. Teh đak lu sư gô jing juơ, yua kơ đao gưm han tơpă pơm kơ lu sư. Păng yua kơ tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl.

English: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêhôiakim, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơtao đe Juđa, pơtơm pơgơ̆r, Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi nơ̆r 'nâu.

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘Stand in the court of the LORD’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the LORD’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Do not diminish a word.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ih athei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cham hnam Kră Yang, roi tơbăt ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai đơ̆ng lu pơlei Juđa năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang tơ hnam akŭm; roi tôm nơ̆r Inh đei roi tơbăt kơ ih, ih 'nĕ kơ hŭt lê̆ minh nơ̆r ayơ.

English: Perhaps everyone will listen and turn from his evil way, that I may relent concerning the calamity which I purpose to bring on them because of the evil of their doings.’
Bahnar: Băt lu sư gô mơ̆ng ih, na rim 'nu gô weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ wih tơ Inh, na Inh gô tơplih đon tơdrong Inh wă pơrăm lu sư, yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư pơm.

English: And you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD: “If you will not listen to Me, to walk in My law which I have set before you
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ lu sư: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Tơdah iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh păng kuă kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Inh đei ăn boih kơ lu iĕm

English: to heed the words of My servants the prophets whom I sent to you, both rising up early and sending them (but you have not heeded)
Bahnar: păng tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng lu đĭch đam Inh, mă lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Inh ling-lang wơh lu sư năm truh tơ iĕm, mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m kuă kơ mơ̆ng lu sư,’ ”

English: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.” ’ ”
Bahnar: na Inh gô pơm ăn kơ hnam akŭm âu thoi Inh đei pơm boih kơ pơlei Silô, na đĭ-đăng dêh char lăm teh gô hiap pơlei Inh âu.

English: So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng Jêrêmi khan roi dôm tơdrong noh lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now it happened, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the LORD had commanded him to speak to all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You will surely die!
Bahnar: Đang kơ Jêrêmi roi tơbăt dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang athei sư roi tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla, lu 'bok soi lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol păng lu kon pơlei rôp sư păng khan: Ih trŏ kơ lôch!

English: Why have you prophesied in the name of the LORD, saying, ‘This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without an inhabitant’?” And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: “Liơ ih pơ̆n yua anăn Kră Yang pơma lê̆ adrol khan: Hnam akŭm âu gô thoi Silô, pơlei âu gô juơ ưh kơ đei bơngai oei?” Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei akŭm wang Jêrêmi lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the LORD and sat down in the entry of the New Gate of the LORD’s house.
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r dêh Juđa kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, lĕch đơ̆ng hnam pơtao năm tơ hnam Kră Yang păng hơ-oei sek tơlang 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang 'Nao hnam Kră Yang.

English: And the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and all the people, saying, “This man deserves to die! For he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, pơma hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla khan: Bơngai âu trŏ kơ pơlôch, yua kơ sư đei pơma khan lê̆ adrol wă pơm kơ pơlei âu, đon lu iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng boih.

English: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and all the people, saying: “The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city with all the words that you have heard.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi tơl lu kră pơgơ̆r păng lu kon pơlei: “Noh jơ̆ đơ̆ng Kră Yang wơh athei inh năm roi khan lê̆ adrol kơ tơdrong wă pơm kơ hnam akŭm păng pơlei tih âu, mă iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng boih.

English: Now therefore, amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the LORD your God; then the LORD will relent concerning the doom that He has pronounced against you.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm athei tơplih tơdrong arih iĕm păng tơdrong jang iĕm, mơ̆ng kiơ̆ bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, na Kră Yang gô tơplih đon tơdrong wă pơm kơ lu iĕm. Sư đei khan lê̆ adrol kơ lu iĕm băt.

English: As for me, here I am, in your hand; do with me as seems good and proper to you.
Bahnar: Bĕ gah inh, inh âu, lăm tơpang ti lu iĕm, pơm bĕ kơ inh kiơ̆ thoi lu iĕm khan trŏ khan lăp.

English: But know for certain that if you put me to death, you will surely bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for truly the LORD has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.”
Bahnar: Iĕm athei băt mă tơpă dah lu iĕm pơlôch inh lu iĕm, pơlei tih âu, đĭ kon pơlei pơla oei lăm pơlei tih âu gô pŭ pham inh mă ưh kơ đei yoch âu. Yua kơ Kră Yang tơpă mă đei wơh inh năm tơ iĕm, ăn kơ inh roi tơbăt dôm lu nơ̆r âu tơ lăm đon iĕm kơtơ̆ng.”

English: So the princes and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, “This man does not deserve to die. For he has spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God.”
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r păng đĭ kon pơlei pơla khan hloi kơ 'bok soi hăm 'bok khan lê̆ adrol: “Ưh kơ gơh pơlôch bơngai âu, yua kơ sư yua anăn Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n roi tơbăt kơ bơ̆n.”

English: Then certain of the elders of the land rose up and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying
Bahnar: Đei lu mơ'nah lăm lu kră wei-lăng lăm char ei kư̆m iung pơma khan kơ đĭ-đăng tơpôl mă oei akŭm băl.

English: “Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Zion shall be plowed like a field, Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins, And the mountain of the temple Like the bare hills of the forest.” ’
Bahnar: Mika pơlei Môrêsêt, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lăm chăl Hesekia, pơtao đe Juđa, kư̆m đei khan lê̆ adrol hăm lu bơngai Juđa: ‘Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Siôn đe gô choh rơuơ thoi chŭn, Jêrusalem gô pơchah răm jing juơ, păng kông đe man hnam akŭm jing bri kơdrơ̆ng.’

English: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah ever put him to death? Did he not fear the LORD and seek the LORD’s favor? And the LORD relented concerning the doom which He had pronounced against them. But we are doing great evil against ourselves.”
Bahnar: ‘Hesekia, pơtao đe Juđa păng đĭ kon pơlei Juđa wă pơlôch Mika mơ̆n hă? Ưh kơ trŏ yua kơ pơtao hli yom kơ Kră Yang, na krao apinh Kră Yang mơnat ăn; na Kră Yang tơplih đon huay kơ pơrăm lu sư thoi Kră Yang pơkă wă pơrăm lu sư. Bĕ lu bơ̆n 'nâu pă 'biơ̆ wă pŭ iŏk tơdrong pơrăm kơ lu bơ̆n kơdih.’ ”

English: Now there was also a man who prophesied in the name of the LORD, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath Jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng kư̆m yua anăn Kră Yang khan lê̆ adrol; noh Uri, kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia đơ̆ng pơlei Kiriat Jêrim. Kŭm đei khan lê̆ adrol kơ tơdrong wă pơrăm pơlei tih păng char âu trŏ thoi nơ̆r Jêrêmi đei khan.

English: And when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid and fled, and went to Egypt.
Bahnar: Pơtao Jêhôiakim, đĭ-đăng yŏng linh păng lu kră pơgơ̆r đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Uri boih, pơtao wă pơlôch sư; mă-lei Uri kơtơ̆ng, hli dêh na kơdâu ôn tơ char Êyiptơ.

English: Then Jehoiakim the king sent men to Egypt: Elnathan the son of Achbor, and other men who went with him to Egypt.
Bahnar: Pơtao Jêhôiakim wơh Êlnathan kon drŏ-nglo Akbôr hăm lu bơngai nai năm hơdai sư tơ dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: And they brought Urijah from Egypt and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
Bahnar: Lu sư rôp anhăk Uri đơ̆ng Êyiptơ ba tơ pơtao Jêhôiakim. Pơtao pơlôch sư hăm đao gưm klơ̆m lê̆ atâu sư tơ bơsat kon pơlei hmă.

English: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ahikam kon drŏ-nglo Saphan pơma dŏng Jêrêmi, na đe ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei pơlôch ôh.

English: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Lăm chăl blŭng-a Sêđekia kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơtao đe Juđa pơgơ̆r, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Thus says the LORD to me: ‘Make for yourselves bonds and yokes, and put them on your neck
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Iŏk tơlei akar păng 'long pơm bĕ 'long ăt, na 'băk tơ ako ih.

English: and send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, by the hand of the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
Bahnar: Na, gơih nơ̆r âu ăn kơ lu pơtao char Eđôm, Môap, Ammôn, Tirơ păng pơtao char Siđôn, hơtă 'bơ̆t lu bơngai mă lu năm pơtao wơh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem tơ'bơ̆p Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa.

English: And command them to say to their masters, “Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel—thus you shall say to your masters
Bahnar: Pơkă athei lu sư năm roi kơ yŏng lu sư khan: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: Lu iĕm athei khan kơ yŏng iĕm

English: ‘I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are on the ground, by My great power and by My outstretched arm, and have given it to whom it seemed proper to Me.
Bahnar: Inh boih Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ teh, kon bơngai păng lu kon sem brem kơpal teh đơ̆ng tơdrong mơsêh mơyang păng đơ̆ng ti pran kơtang Inh. Inh ăn teh âu kơ bu mơ̆ng kơ Inh lăp.

English: And now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant; and the beasts of the field I have also given him to serve him.
Bahnar: Dang ei, Inh jao đĭ-đăng teh đak iĕm lăm ti Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, đĭch đam Inh; Inh kư̆m ăn đĭ lu sem bri chu kơ sư.

English: So all nations shall serve him and his son and his son’s son, until the time of his land comes; and then many nations and great kings shall make him serve them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm dêh char gô chu yom kơ sư, kơ kon, kơ sâu sư dĭng truh kơ năr lu dêh char păng lu pơtao tih mơng gô rôp sư pơm đĭch.’ ”

English: And it shall be, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and which will not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will punish,’ says the LORD, ‘with the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
Bahnar: “Tơdah khŭl bơngai ayơ, dêh char ayơ ưh kơ chu bơ̆jang kơ Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn păng ưh kơ wă 'băk 'long ăt pơtao Babilôn tơ ako sư,” Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Na Inh gô yua đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt, jĭ hơbuh, pơmat bơngai noh dĭng mă Inh ăn dêh char noh lăm ti pơtao Nebukatnessar pơrăm.

English: Therefore do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreamers, your soothsayers, or your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon.”
Bahnar: Bĕ iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ pă mơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol iĕm, lu pơjâu chă pơma hăm Yang păng pơjâu juăt tơlang tơdrong apo, lu pơjâu chă pơma hăm atâu, lu 'bok lăng tơdra sơnglŏng păng đĭ lu pơjâu hơlĕnh kơ lu iĕm khan: ‘Lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pơm đĭch bơ̆jang kơ pơtao Babilôn ôh.’

English: For they prophesy a lie to you, to remove you far from your land; and I will drive you out, and you will perish.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơtho khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh, tơdah lu iĕm lui kơ lu sư đe chông ba lu iĕm ataih đơ̆ng teh đak iĕm, na Inh pơpuh tơlĕch lu iĕm păng lu iĕm gô lôch hiong đĭ.

English: But the nations that bring their necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let them remain in their own land,’ says the LORD, ‘and they shall till it and dwell in it.’ ” ’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei adrĕch bơngai ayơ chu 'băk 'long ăt pơtao Babilôn păng chu yom kơ pơtao noh, na: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư oei kơtă lăm dêh char sư kơdih, wă kơ choh jang sa păng oei tơ noh.” Noh Kră Yang.

English: I also spoke to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live!
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m roi ăn dôm nơ̆r noh kơ Sêđekia pơtao đe Juđa. “Mơ̆t bĕ ako ih lăm 'long ăt pơtao Babilôn, chu kơ sư păng kon pơlei sư, lei na iĕm gơh arih.

English: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the LORD has spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ ih păng lu kon pơlei ih lê̆ đe pơlôch iĕm hăm đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt, lôch hơbuh thoi Kră Yang đei khan kơ dêh char ayơ mă ưh kơ wă chu kiơ̆ kơ pơtao Babilôn?

English: Therefore do not listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy a lie to you
Bahnar: Apinh iĕm 'nĕ kơ mơ̆ng hŏ dôm nơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol khan: ‘Lu iĕm huay kơ chu jang kơ pơtao Babilôn. Noh tơdrong hơlĕnh đĕch mă lu sư khan lê̆ adrol kơ lu iĕm.”

English: for I have not sent them,” says the LORD, “yet they prophesy a lie in My name, that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh ưh kơ đei wơh lu sư, lu sư yua anăn Inh khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh. Tơdah lui kơ lu sư Inh gô pơpuh tơweh lu iĕm păng pơlôch pơđĭ lu iĕm păng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh.”

English: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, “Behold, the vessels of the LORD’s house will now shortly be brought back from Babylon”; for they prophesy a lie to you.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m khan kơ lu 'bok soi păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei âu: “Kră Yang khan: ‘'Nĕ pă mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơ iĕm khan: Dôm lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang ưh pă đunh boih Babilôn gô pơdrâu tơwih tơ âu! Noh lu sư khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh kơ lu iĕm.

English: Do not listen to them; serve the king of Babylon, and live! Why should this city be laid waste?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă mơ̆ng lu đe noh, chu jang bĕ kơ pơtao Babilôn wă kơ iĕm gơh arih. Liơ pơlei tih âu pơchah răm?

English: But if they are prophets, and if the word of the LORD is with them, let them now make intercession to the LORD of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the LORD, in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, do not go to Babylon.’
Bahnar: Dah lu sư bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơpă păng đei nơ̆r Kră Yang, lei lê̆ lu sư krao khan apinh Kră Yang Tih Hloh, wă kơ tơmam gĭt oei oei lăm hnam Kră Yang, lăm hnam pơtao Juđa păng pơlei tih Jêrusalem, đe huay kơ iŏk ba tơ char Babilôn.

English: “For thus says the LORD of hosts concerning the pillars, concerning the Sea, concerning the carts, and concerning the remainder of the vessels that remain in this city
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan trŏ kơ lu jrăng păng kong, bơng đak tih krao dơsĭ kong, păng jơ̆ng hăm kong đei tang-wang wă tŭn lu bơng, păng dôm tơmam gĭt oei đei lăm pơlei

English: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem
Bahnar: lu tơmam mă Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn ưh kơ tung ba, kơplah sư rôp ba Jêkônia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim, pơtao đe Juđa, hơdai hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r char Juđa đơ̆ng pơlei tih Jêrusalem, ba tơ char Babilôn pơm bơnă

English: yes, thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the LORD, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan kơ tơmam gĭt oei oei lăm hnam akŭm, lăm hnam pơtao đe Juđa păng pơlei tih Jêrusalem

English: ‘They shall be carried to Babylon, and there they shall be until the day that I visit them,’ says the LORD. ‘Then I will bring them up and restore them to this place.’ ”
Bahnar: ‘Gô iŏk ba tơ char Babilôn păng 'măn lê̆ tơ noh dĭng truh năr Inh athei lu sư 'ba pơdrâu tơ anih 'nâu.” Noh Kră Yang khan!

English: And it happened in the same year, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the house of the LORD in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm noh mơ̆n wă khan, lăm chăl Sêđekia 'nao pơtơm pơm pơtao đe Juđa, lăm khei pơđăm sơnăm mă puăn, Hanania kon drŏ-nglo Asur, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng pơlei Gibeôn, pơma hăm inh lăm hnam Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp lu 'bok soi păng đĭ kon pơlei

English: “Thus speaks the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “Inh gơ̆ lê̆ boih 'long ăt pơtao Babilôn.

English: Within two full years I will bring back to this place all the vessels of the LORD’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.
Bahnar: Lăm 'bar sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng, dôm tơmam gĭt lăm hnam Kră Yang mă đêl Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn iŏk đơ̆ng anih âu ba tơ char Babilôn, na Inh gô iŏk pơdrâu tơ anih âu.’ ”

English: And I will bring back to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah who went to Babylon,’ says the LORD, ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô ba brŏk Jêkônia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim pơtao đe Juđa păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđa mă đe rôp pơm bơnă tơ Babilôn, kư̆m brŏk tơ anih âu dơ̆ng; yua kơ Inh gơ̆ lê̆ boih 'long ăt pơtao Babilôn.”

English: Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and in the presence of all the people who stood in the house of the LORD
Bahnar: Na, Jêrêmi tơl hloi Hanania 'bok khan lê̆ adrol 'bơ̆t anăp lu 'bok soi păng kon pơlei oei dơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: and the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! The LORD do so; the LORD perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring back the vessels of the LORD’s house and all who were carried away captive, from Babylon to this place.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi 'bok khan lê̆ adrol khan: “Trŏ tơpă apinh Kră Yang pơm bĕ thoi noh; apinh Kră Yang pơm bĕ trŏ thoi nơ̆r ih đei khan lê̆ adrol wă iŏk pơdrâu đĭ đêl dôm tơmam gĭt lăm hnam Kră Yang păng chông ba brŏk đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđa đêl pơm bơnă đơ̆ng lăm char Babilôn wih tơ anih âu!

English: Nevertheless hear now this word that I speak in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people
Bahnar: Lei na mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh wă pơma hăm ih păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla âu.

English: The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries and great kingdoms—of war and disaster and pestilence.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, adrol kơ ih hăm adrol kơ inh, đơ̆ng sơ̆ lu sư khan lê̆ adrol boih kơ tơdrong tơblah wang, tơdrong pơrăm, jĭ lôch hơbuh, pơngot rơwĕt, truh tơ lơ dêh char păng tơ lăm dêh char tih.

English: As for the prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet comes to pass, the prophet will be known as one whom the LORD has truly sent.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok khan lê̆ adrol ayơ khan hiôk-hian rơnŭk rơnua, dah nơ̆r sư khan noh trŏ 'blep tơpă, 'bok noh đe băt kơ sư noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang wơh tơpă!”

English: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck and broke it.
Bahnar: Hanania 'bok khan lê̆ adrol plôh iŏk 'long ăt đơ̆ng ako Jêrêmi 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng gơ̆ lê̆.

English: And Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Even so I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years.’ ” And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Hanania tơbăt 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ kon pơlei: “Kră Yang khan: 'Blep lăm 'bar sơnăm Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ 'long ăt Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn đơ̆ng ako rim kơ adrĕch adrung.’ ” Jêrêmi 'bok khan lê̆ adrol yak brŏk.

English: Now the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Hanania plôh lê̆ boih 'long ăt đơ̆ng ako Jêrêmi, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Go and tell Hananiah, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “You have broken the yokes of wood, but you have made in their place yokes of iron.”
Bahnar: Ih năm khan bĕ kơ Hanania: Kră Yang khan: Ih gơ̆ lê̆ boih 'long ăt pơm păng 'long đơ̆ng Jêrêmi mă-lei Inh gô tơ'băk ăn kôih 'long ăt pơm păng bơsei.”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him. I have given him the beasts of the field also.” ’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: Inh gô tơ'băk 'long ăt păng bơsei tơ ako rim adrĕch adrung âu, wă kơ lu sư pơm đĭch kơ Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn păng chu jang kơ sư, mă lu sem bri Inh kư̆m đei jao boih kơ sư.”

English: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Hear now, Hananiah, the LORD has not sent you, but you make this people trust in a lie.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Jêrêmi 'bok khan lê̆ adrol khan kơ Hanania 'bok khan lê̆ adrol: “Ơ Hanania, mơ̆ng bĕ, Kră Yang ưh kơ đei wơh ih ôh, mă-lei ih pơm kơ kon pơlei 'nâu gơnang kơ nơ̆r ih hơlĕnh.

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will cast you from the face of the earth. This year you shall die, because you have taught rebellion against the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu; Inh gô ba ih weh đơ̆ng kơpal teh âu; sơnăm âu ih gô lôch; yua kơ ih đei pơma iung blah hăm Kră Yang.”

English: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm noh hloi khei tơpơh, Hanania 'bok khan lê̆ adrol lôch.

English: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remainder of the elders who were carried away captive—to the priests, the prophets, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Jêrêmi đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem chih gơih kơ lu đe kră mă oei arih, lu đe 'bok soi, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei mă pơtao Nebukatnessar rôp đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem ba tơ char Babilôn pơm bơnă.

English: (This happened after Jeconiah the king, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the smiths had departed from Jerusalem.)
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơtao Jêkônia, mĕ pơtao, lu bơngai jang lăm hnam pơtao, lu kră pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng Juđa păng Jêrusalem, lu thơ̆ hơgei gơh pơm lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem boih

English: The letter was sent by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, saying
Bahnar: kơthơ noh Jêrêmi hơtă ăn kơ bre Êlasa kon drŏ-nglo Saphan păng Gêmaria kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia mă Sêđekia pơtao đe Juđa wơh bre sư năm tơ char Babilôn tơ'bơ̆p Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn. Kơthơ noh chih khan

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, to all who were carried away captive, whom I have caused to be carried away from Jerusalem to Babylon
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan kơ lu bơngai mă Inh ăn đe rôp pơm bơnă đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem ba tơ Babilôn

English: Build houses and dwell in them; plant gardens and eat their fruit.
Bahnar: “Pơm bĕ hnam oei, pơtăm bĕ 'long sa plei lăm mir pơgar, na phĕ sa plei sư.

English: Take wives and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands, so that they may bear sons and daughters—that you may be increased there, and not diminished.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ klo akăn, na pơjing kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn; chă ăn bĕ kơ lu kon tơdăm iĕm akăn, ăn bĕ kơ lu kon adruh iĕm đei klo, wă kơ lu sư pơjing kon hơ'lơ̆p, drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, wă kơ đei kon sâu rai lơ tơ noh, 'nĕ pă hrŏ hiong.

English: And seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to the LORD for it; for in its peace you will have peace.
Bahnar: Chă bĕ tơdrong hiôk-hian jơnap kơ pơlei tih mă Inh đei ăn kơ lu iĕm oei tơ noh pơm bơnă; krao apinh Kră Yang bĕ; yua kơ lu iĕm đei hiôk jơnap noh đơ̆ng pơlei noh hiôk jơnap.”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Do not let your prophets and your diviners who are in your midst deceive you, nor listen to your dreams which you cause to be dreamed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “'Nĕ pă lê̆ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng lu pơjâu oei hơdai iĕm chă hơlĕnh kơ iĕm; păng kư̆m 'nĕ pă hlŭ mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r lu sư apo

English: For they prophesy falsely to you in My name; I have not sent them, says the LORD.
Bahnar: yua kơ lu sư khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh hăm anăn Inh. Inh ưh kơ đei wơh lu sư ôh.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: For thus says the LORD: After seventy years are completed at Babylon, I will visit you and perform My good word toward you, and cause you to return to this place.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Layơ tôm tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm ăn kơ Babilôn pơgơ̆r, Inh gô năm hơpong tơ lu iĕm, Inh gô pơm trŏ thoi nơ̆r pơkă 'lơ̆ng rŏ Inh, gô chông ba lu iĕm brŏk tơ teh đak âu.”

English: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says the LORD, thoughts of peace and not of evil, to give you a future and a hope.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ Inh băt tơdrong kiơ Inh pơkă wă pơm kơ lu iĕm. Inh đei pơkă ăn tơdrong hiôk-hian phĭ jơnap ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong kơnê̆ răm ôh, wă kơ lu iĕm đei tơdrong gơnang hơmĕng.

English: Then you will call upon Me and go and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm năm krao chă Inh, krao apinh Inh, Inh gô tơl tơwih.

English: And you will seek Me and find Me, when you search for Me with all your heart.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô chă Inh păng gơh tơ'bơ̆p tơdah lu iĕm chă Inh hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m.”

English: I will be found by you, says the LORD, and I will bring you back from your captivity; I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places where I have driven you, says the LORD, and I will bring you to the place from which I cause you to be carried away captive.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm tơ'bơ̆p Inh păng Inh gô iŏk chông anhăk pơdrâu lu iĕm brŏk đơ̆ng pơm bơnă.” Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô akŭm pơđĭ lu iĕm đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char, đơ̆ng rim pơlei pơla mă Inh đei puh lu iĕm tơ noh păng gô iŏk anhăk lu iĕm wih brŏk tơ teh đak mă đêl Inh puh iĕm đơ̆ng noh sơ̆.”

English: Because you have said, “The LORD has raised up prophets for us in Babylon”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: “Kră Yang đei ăn boih kơ lu bơ̆n 'bok khan lê̆ adrol tơ char Babilôn!”

English: therefore thus says the LORD concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, concerning all the people who dwell in this city, and concerning your brethren who have not gone out with you into captivity
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan gah pơtao mă oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit păng lu kon pơlei mă oei lăm pơlei âu, lu bơngai mă huay kơ năm pơm bơnă hơdai lu iĕm

English: thus says the LORD of hosts: Behold, I will send on them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like rotten figs that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.
Bahnar: lei, na 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô ăn đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt păng tơdrong lôch hơbuh truh tơ lu sư, pơm ăn kơ lu sư thoi plei hơra ôm kơnê̆ dĭng mah đe pă gơh sa.

English: And I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence; and I will deliver them to trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth—to be a curse, an astonishment, a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt păng jĭ hơbuh druh pơrăm lu sư, đe gô puh lê̆ lu sư tơ to tơ âu. Tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char lăm teh đak âu, lăng krưp, lu sư pŭ hơngiap đe blei hiap, đe che bơle, đe pơjăm pơjuă lu sư tơ rim adrĕch adrung mă Inh đei pơpuh lê̆ lu sư tơ noh.”

English: because they have not heeded My words, says the LORD, which I sent to them by My servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; neither would you heed, says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Noh yua kơ lu sư kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, Inh chơ̆n oei wơh lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, lu đĭch đam Inh năm tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư nơ̆r Inh; mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m kuă kơ mơ̆ng lei-lăi.

English: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, all you of the captivity, whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai bơnă mă Inh đei puh đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem năm tơ char Babilôn, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in My name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall slay them before your eyes.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan thoi âu gah Ahap, kon drŏ-nglo Kôlaia păng Sêđekia, kon drŏ-nglo Maaseia, bơngai mă yua anăn Inh khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh: “Inh gô jao lu sư kơ Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, sư gô pơlôch bre noh 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: And because of them a curse shall be taken up by all the captivity of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, “The LORD make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa pơm bơnă lăm char Babilôn gô iŏk yua anăn 'bar 'nu bơngai 'nâu hiap tơhuăi, thoi âu: “Apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ iĕm kư̆m thoi Sêđekia păng Ahap, mă pơtao Babilôn đei phang lăm ŭnh,’

English: because they have done disgraceful things in Israel, have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken lying words in My name, which I have not commanded them. Indeed I know, and am a witness, says the LORD.
Bahnar: yua kơ lu sư đei pơm yoch bơlŭk kơnê̆ boih lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, pơm yoch ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă hăm akăn lu bơngai rông 'bôt sư kơdih păng pơma hơlĕnh mă Inh ưh kơ đei athei lu sư. Inh băt păng pơm kơdranh kơ tơdrong noh. Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: You shall also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ Sêmaia bơngai Nêhelam

English: Thus speaks the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: You have sent letters in your name to all the people who are at Jerusalem, to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying
Bahnar: “'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘Ih đei gơih boih hla bơar kơ đĭ kon pơlei Jêrusalem, kơ 'bok soi Sephania kon drŏ-nglo Maaseia păng kơ đĭ-đăng lu 'bok soi nai khan

English: “The LORD has made you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest, so that there should be officers in the house of the LORD over every man who is demented and considers himself a prophet, that you should put him in prison and in the stocks.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei jao ăn kơ ih boih pơm 'bok soi tơplih kơ Jêhôiada wă pơgơ̆r wei-lăng hnam akŭm Kră Yang Ih gơh athei đe rôp hơnuh ako, rôp jơlŏng lê̆ jơ̆ng, tơdah bu mă wơnh khan lê̆ adrol

English: Now therefore, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth who makes himself a prophet to you?
Bahnar: Lei liơ ih ưh kơ rôp chrih kơ Jêrêmi pơlei Anathôt, sư oei khan lê̆ adrol, tơ lăm lu iĕm?

English: For he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, ‘This captivity is long; build houses and dwell in them, and plant gardens and eat their fruit.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư boih, pơ̆n gơih kơ lu nhôn nơ̆r tơ lăm char Babilôn khan: Tơdrong pơm bơnă oei đunh năr; pơm bĕ hnam oei; pơtăm bĕ 'long sa plei lăm mir pơgar na sa plei sư.”

English: Now Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.
Bahnar: Sephania 'bok soi đŏk kơthơ noh tơm măt Jêrêmi bơngai khăn lê̆ adrol mơ̆ng.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: Send to all those in captivity, saying, Thus says the LORD concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I have not sent him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie
