Bahnar: “Chih roi bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei pơm bơnă: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan gah Sêmaia bơngai Nêhelam: ‘Yua kơ Sêmaia khan lê̆ adrol kơ lu iĕm boih, mă Inh ưh kơ athei sư khan păng sư kư̆m pơm kơ iĕm lui kơ nơ̆r sư hơlĕnh.’

English: therefore thus says the LORD: Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his family: he shall not have anyone to dwell among this people, nor shall he see the good that I will do for My people, says the LORD, because he has taught rebellion against the LORD.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô phak Sêmaia, bơngai Nêhelam păng adrĕch adrung sư hai dơ̆ng. Gah adrĕch sư, ưh kơ đei bu mă oei arih hơdai hăm kon pơlei 'nâu; kơdih akâu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei 'bôh tơdrong hiôk mă Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei Inh, yua kơ sư pơma blơ̆ plơ̆ Inh.’ ” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Thus speaks the LORD God of Israel, saying: ‘Write in a book for yourself all the words that I have spoken to you.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “Chih răk bĕ lăm sơnôm hla bơar nơ̆r Inh đei bơtho khan kơ ih boih.”

English: For behold, the days are coming,’ says the LORD, ‘that I will bring back from captivity My people Israel and Judah,’ says the LORD. ‘And I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gô đei năr, Inh gô chông ba kon pơlei Inh bơngai Juđa păng Isơrael wih brŏk đơ̆ng pơm bơnă. Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô ba lu sư brŏk iŏk teh đak mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ lu yă 'bok lu sư.”

English: Now these are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan gah bơngai Isơrael păng Juđa.

English: “For thus says the LORD: ‘We have heard a voice of trembling, Of fear, and not of peace.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Inh đei kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r ôr krao hli tơrơ, ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian.

English: Ask now, and see, Whether a man is ever in labor with child? So why do I see every man with his hands on his loins Like a woman in labor, And all faces turned pale?
Bahnar: Jet lăng: Hăm trŏ kơ bơngai drŏ-nglo tơpŭ kon hơ'lơ̆p? Lei liơ mă Inh 'bôh bơngai drŏ-nglo kơ'mĭn klak thoi drŏ-kăn wă tơpŭ? Liơ mă muh măt lu sư dreng hơ'blă?

English: Alas! For that day is great, So that none is like it; And it is the time of Jacob’s trouble, But he shall be saved out of it.
Bahnar: Ô! Năr noh kơnê̆ krưp tih tơpă, mă ning-mônh kư̆m ưh kơ đei năr kơnê̆ dêh thoi noh. Noh boih năr truh răm kơ Jakôp! Mă-lei Inh gô dŏng lu sư klaih đơ̆ng noh.”

English: ‘For it shall come to pass in that day,’ Says the LORD of hosts, ‘That I will break his yoke from your neck, And will burst your bonds; Foreigners shall no more enslave them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lăm năr noh Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ 'long ăt đơ̆ng ako lu sư; păng hrĕch lê̆ tơlei đêl đe chô̆ lu sư, ưh pă pơm đĭch kơ dêh tơmoi dơ̆ng

English: But they shall serve the LORD their God, And David their king, Whom I will raise up for them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư gô chu yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, păng Đawit pơtao lu sư, Inh gô atŏk ăn.”

English: ‘Therefore do not fear, O My servant Jacob,’ says the LORD, ‘Nor be dismayed, O Israel; For behold, I will save you from afar, And your seed from the land of their captivity. Jacob shall return, have rest and be quiet, And no one shall make him afraid.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ Jakôp, ih boih đĭch đam Inh, 'nĕ kơ hli. Ơ Isơrael, 'nĕ pă tơrơ! Inh gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng dêh ataih, đơ̆ng teh đak iĕm pơm bơnă. Jakôp gô brŏk hiôk-hian, rơnŭk rơnua jang sa, ưh kơ đei hli tơrơ kơ bu dơ̆ng.”

English: For I am with you,’ says the LORD, ‘to save you; Though I make a full end of all nations where I have scattered you, Yet I will not make a complete end of you. But I will correct you in justice, And will not let you go altogether unpunished.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh oei păng iĕm, wă dŏng pơklaih iĕm. Inh gô pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu dêh char, mă Inh đei puh iĕm tơklah tơklang lăm noh, mă-lei Inh huay kơ pơlôch iĕm. Inh gô phak bơtho lu iĕm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong trŏ, Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh phak bơtho lu iĕm.”

English: “For thus says the LORD: ‘Your affliction is incurable, Your wound is severe.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơdrong jĭ rơka iĕm ưh pă gơh klaih boih; rơka jĭ iĕm jrŭ dêh.

English: There is no one to plead your cause, That you may be bound up; You have no healing medicines.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm iĕm, ưh kơ đei pơgang kiơ wă kơ iĕm huay kơ jĭ, rơka jĭ iĕm ưh pă tơsir boih.

English: All your lovers have forgotten you; They do not seek you; For I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, With the chastisement of a cruel one, For the multitude of your iniquities, Because your sins have increased.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă pơgơ̆p hăm iĕm hiơt kơ iĕm boih, lu sư ưh pă hiơ̆k kơ iĕm boih, Inh teh iĕm rơka thoi lu ayăt teh. Inh teh phak lu iĕm kư̆m thoi lu bơngai kơnê̆ phak, Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm trăp tơpă, tơdrong yoch iĕm lơ dêh.

English: Why do you cry about your affliction? Your sorrow is incurable. Because of the multitude of your iniquities, Because your sins have increased, I have done these things to you.
Bahnar: Liơ iĕm oei ôr krao yua kơ rơka iĕm? Tơdrong jĭ iĕm hơmet pă gơh klaih boih. Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm trăp dêh, tơdrong yoch iĕm lơ dêh; noh Inh pơm kơ iĕm.

English: ‘Therefore all those who devour you shall be devoured; And all your adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; Those who plunder you shall become plunder, And all who prey upon you I will make a prey.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đe bu kăp sa iĕm đe gô kăp sa lu sư; lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm gô jing bơnă; bu mă tơgar iŏk tơtông tơmam đơ̆ng iĕm, đe kư̆m gô blah tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư.”

English: For I will restore health to you And heal you of your wounds,’ says the LORD, ‘Because they called you an outcast saying: “This is Zion; No one seeks her.” ’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Mă khan đe jô̆ iĕm thoi Siôn, đe pă wă lăng. Ưh pă đei bu hiơ̆k. Mă-lei Inh gô pơklaih rơka iĕm. Inh gô hơmet pơklaih rơka jĭ iĕm.

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will bring back the captivity of Jacob’s tents, And have mercy on his dwelling places; The city shall be built upon its own mound, And the palace shall remain according to its own plan.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô iŏk tơwih bơsŭn anih hnam Jakôp đơ̆ng lu sư pơm bơnă, Inh gô mơnat ăn kơ sơnăm dơnŏ lu sư; pơlei tơm tih đe gô pơdơ̆ng tơ đêl teh so sơ̆, hnam pơtao đe gô pơdơ̆ng trŏ 'bơ̆t anih so sơ̆.

English: Then out of them shall proceed thanksgiving And the voice of those who make merry; I will multiply them, and they shall not diminish; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
Bahnar: Gô đei nơ̆r hơri bơnê păng chơt hiôk đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu sư. Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư rai lơ, ưh pă tŏ sĕt thoi sơ̆. Inh kư̆m ăn kơ đe ư-ang kơ lu sư; ưh pă pơjăm boih.

English: Their children also shall be as before, And their congregation shall be established before Me; And I will punish all who oppress them.
Bahnar: Kon hơ'lơ̆p lu sư kư̆m thoi sơ̆; khŭl adrĕch lu sư gô dơ̆ng kơjăp 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, Inh gô phak pơmat lu bơngai mă pơgŏ pơđep lu sư.

English: Their nobles shall be from among them, And their governor shall come from their midst; Then I will cause him to draw near, And he shall approach Me; For who is this who pledged his heart to approach Me?’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô đei pơtao lĕch đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung lu sư, Kră pơgơ̆r lu sư kư̆m đei đơ̆ng lăm lu sư. Inh gô krao sư năm jê̆ Inh, wă kơ sư năm jê̆ Inh; yua kơ ưh kơ đei bơngai bu nuih pơ̆n năm jê̆ Inh.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: ‘You shall be My people, And I will be your God.’ ”
Bahnar: “Thoi ei, na lu iĕm gô jing kon pơlei pơla Inh, Inh gô pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: Behold, the whirlwind of the LORD Goes forth with fury, A continuing whirlwind; It will fall violently on the head of the wicked.
Bahnar: To hơbŭt đơ̆ng Kră Yang, tơdrong Sư hil mĭl, thoi kial hơbŭt tih bah huơ̆r truh tơ kơ̆l lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: The fierce anger of the LORD will not return until He has done it, And until He has performed the intents of His heart. In the latter days you will consider it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil ưh kơ ngach dĭng mă truh tơ Sư pơm keh dôm tơdrong mă Sư wă pơm. Lăm năr tôch kơnh, lu iĕm gô băt hlôh hơđăl tơdrong 'nâu.”

English: “At the same time,” says the LORD, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be My people.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Kơplah noh kơnh, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch Isơrael; păng lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “The people who survived the sword Found grace in the wilderness— Israel, when I went to give him rest.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Minh adrĕch adrung klaih đơ̆ng đao gưm đei boih pŭn hiôk lăm char glă, kơplah Inh ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael pơdơh hiôk-hian.”

English: The LORD has appeared of old to me, saying: “Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love; Therefore with lovingkindness I have drawn you.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Kră Yang tơ'bôh boih kơ bơ̆n khan: “Inh 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm hăm tơdrong 'mêm ling-lang hlŏng hloi, Thoi noh na Inh oei wei kơjăp 'mêm kơ iĕm.

English: Again I will build you, and you shall be rebuilt, O virgin of Israel! You shall again be adorned with your tambourines, And shall go forth in the dances of those who rejoice.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơdơ̆ng ming iĕm, na lu iĕm gô đei dơ̆ng, ơ bơngai Isơrael 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Lu iĕm gô iŏk hơgơ̆r iĕ tơdŭ suang thoi sơ̆ hơdai hăm lu bơngai chơt hiôk.

English: You shall yet plant vines on the mountains of Samaria; The planters shall plant and eat them as ordinary food.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô pơtăm tơm hơmu tơ kông groi Samari, thoi sơ̆ lu iĕm pơtăm, gô phĕ sa plei.

English: For there shall be a day When the watchmen will cry on Mount Ephraim, ‘Arise, and let us go up to Zion, To the LORD our God.’ ”
Bahnar: Gô đei năr lu bơngai gak tơ kơpal kông Êphraim ôr krao: Iung bĕ bơ̆n tŏk tơ kông Siôn, năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n!’ ”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Sing with gladness for Jacob, And shout among the chief of the nations; Proclaim, give praise, and say, ‘O LORD, save Your people, The remnant of Israel!’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Bĕ bơ̆n hơri chơt hiôk kơ Jakôp; tơkĕch tơjroh bĕ kơ lu adrĕch adrung gĭt kăl, pôk bơnê pơyom bĕ na khan: ‘Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih boih kon pơlei pơla Sư, lu kon pơlei Isơrael mă oei arih.’

English: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, And gather them from the ends of the earth, Among them the blind and the lame, The woman with child And the one who labors with child, together; A great throng shall return there.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh gô chông lu sư brŏk đơ̆ng char gah yă-nơ̆m, Inh akŭm pơpôi lu sư đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak. Lăm lu sư đei bơngai măt tol, bơngai hơwen, lu drŏ-kăn oei anăp păng drŏ-kăn wă tơpŭ, minh khŭl tơpôl lơlap tơpă gô wih brŏk tơ âu.

English: They shall come with weeping, And with supplications I will lead them. I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters, In a straight way in which they shall not stumble; For I am a Father to Israel, And Ephraim is My firstborn.
Bahnar: Lu sư brŏk hăm nhơ̆m hmoi, păng krao khan, Inh gô pơlung păng chông ba lu sư, Inh gô bơrơng lu sư rok cheng đak glung, rok trong dơhnă, lu sư huay kơtơih pơ̆k, yua kơ Inh boih 'bă kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael, păng Êphraim kon kơdră Inh.

English: “Hear the word of the LORD, O nations, And declare it in the isles afar off, and say, ‘He who scattered Israel will gather him, And keep him as a shepherd does his flock.’
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang, ơ kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ dêh char; Ră roi bĕ nơ̆r âu tơ jơ̆p pơlei lăm bŏl đak dơsĭ ataih khan: ‘Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă pơm ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael tơklah tơklang, Sư wă akŭm pơpôi ba wih brŏk dơ̆ng, Sư gô wei thoi bơngai wei khŭl triu sư.’

English: For the LORD has redeemed Jacob, And ransomed him from the hand of one stronger than he.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang đei huai iŏk boih Jakôp păng dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pran kơtang hloh.

English: Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, Streaming to the goodness of the LORD— For wheat and new wine and oil, For the young of the flock and the herd; Their souls shall be like a well-watered garden, And they shall sorrow no more at all.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô năm hơri hiôk chơt tơ anih kơjung kơpal kông Siôn; muh măt lu sư chơt hiôk đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk rơkah rơkai: 'Ba mi, sik hơmu, đak rơmă ôliwơ, kon triu, bơbe, sem dơrong, Jơhngơ̆m lu sư thoi pơgar đak hngôm hơiuh, ưh pă đei sơ'ngon kơ kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: “Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, And the young men and the old, together; For I will turn their mourning to joy, Will comfort them, And make them rejoice rather than sorrow.
Bahnar: Lu adruh hle chơt hiôk suang pơplŏng, lu tơdăm păng lu kră drŏ-nglo kư̆m wang chơt hiôk; Inh gô tơplih tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon lu sư jing tơdrong chơt hiôk, Inh gô pơlung lu sư ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong chơt hiôk tơplih kơ tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon.”

English: I will satiate the soul of the priests with abundance, And My people shall be satisfied with My goodness, says the LORD.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu 'bok soi đei tôm tơmam kăl yua, Lu kon pơlei Inh gô đei tôm tơmam kăl yua rơkah rơkai” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Thus says the LORD: “A voice was heard in Ramah, Lamentation and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children, Refusing to be comforted for her children, Because they are no more.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơ pơlei Rama đei kơtơ̆ng nhơ̆m hmoi, nhơ̆m ơh sơ'ngon, noh Rachel nhơ̆m hmoi kơ lu kon sư, hmoi ơh ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơlung sư gah lu kon sư, yua kơ lu kon sư ưh pă đei arih boih.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Refrain your voice from weeping, And your eyes from tears; For your work shall be rewarded, says the LORD, And they shall come back from the land of the enemy.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nĕ pă nhơ̆m dơ̆ng, lê̆ pă lĕch đak măt, yua kơ tơdrong jang iĕm gô đei apah;” Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm gô wih brŏk đơ̆ng char lu bơngai ayăt,”

English: There is hope in your future, says the LORD, That your children shall come back to their own border.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gô đei hơmĕng kơ kon sâu đơ̆ng rŏng, kon sâu lu iĕm gô brŏk tơ char kơdih.

English: “I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself: ‘You have chastised me, and I was chastised, Like an untrained bull; Restore me, and I will return, For You are the LORD my God.
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng boih bơngai Êphraim nhơ̆m hmoi: ‘Ih phak bơtho inh boih, thoi đe pơjuăt kon rơmo mă tam biơh tah 'long ăt, inh pŭ iŏk boih. Apinh Ih iŏk inh brŏk bĕ, na inh gơh brŏk đei hiôk-hian, yua kơ Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh

English: Surely, after my turning, I repented; And after I was instructed, I struck myself on the thigh; I was ashamed, yes, even humiliated, Because I bore the reproach of my youth.’
Bahnar: Tơpă, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh weh đơ̆ng Kră Yang, inh tơbral boih; đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh băt hlôh, inh tŭr kơtơh hmach. Inh mơlâu dêh, Inh pŭ tơdrong mơlâu đơ̆ng pơm yoch đơ̆ng oei tơdăm mơlôh.”

English: Is Ephraim My dear son? Is he a pleasant child? For though I spoke against him, I earnestly remember him still; Therefore My heart yearns for him; I will surely have mercy on him, says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Hăm trŏ Êphraim kon Inh mă 'mêm? Kon inh kơeng? Mă khan dôm wơ̆t boih inh hil kơ sư; inh oei 'blŏk 'brơ̆k mơnat, Tơpă Inh gô mơnat kơ sư.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Set up signposts, Make landmarks; Set your heart toward the highway, The way in which you went. Turn back, O virgin of Israel, Turn back to these your cities.
Bahnar: “Pơdơ̆ng bĕ jrăng tơmo wă kơnăl; pơdơ̆ng bĕ gơ'bang wă tơ'bôh trong: Lăng bĕ kơ trong tih, trong noh boih mă lu iĕm yak kiơ̆. Wih brŏk bĕ, ơ bơngai Isơrael, brŏk hơlơ̆k bĕ tơ lu pơlei iĕm!

English: How long will you gad about, O you backsliding daughter? For the LORD has created a new thing in the earth— A woman shall encompass a man.”
Bahnar: Oei pă dang yơ dơ̆ng lu iĕm oei thông mang. Ơ kon adruh ưh kơ 'blep? Kră Yang đei pơjing boih minh tơdrong 'nao plơ̆ng lăm teh đak: Bơngai drŏ-kăn wei wêr bơngai drŏ-nglo.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “They shall again use this speech in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I bring back their captivity: ‘The LORD bless you, O home of justice, and mountain of holiness!’
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “Kơplah Inh chông tơwih bơngai bơnă brŏk, lăm char Juđa păng tơ rim pơlei gô khan: ‘Ơ lu anih mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Kră Yang, kông rơgoh, apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ anih âu pŭn hiôk!’

English: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all its cities together, farmers and those going out with flocks.
Bahnar: Lăm char Juđa păng đĭ-đăng lu pơlei lu sư oei hơdai tơ noh, lu bơngai bơ̆jang mir 'ba hăm lu bơngai wei triu.

English: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu bơngai gleh lap klaih rơhing păng lu bơngai pă kĕ sa phĭ mah.”

English: After this I awoke and looked around, and my sleep was sweet to me.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh inh hơđơ̆r lăng inh tep hiôk-hian.

English: “Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and the seed of beast.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr tơ anăp âu kơnh Inh gô rei adrĕch kon bơngai hăm adrĕch sem dơrong lăm char Isơrael păng char Juđa.

English: And it shall come to pass, that as I have watched over them to pluck up, to break down, to throw down, to destroy, and to afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, says the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi Inh wei boih lu sư trŏ kơ buch lê̆, pơrăm lê̆, pơlôch păng pơm kơ sư pơmat-tat, Inh gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng gô pơtăm ming.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: In those days they shall say no more: ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, And the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh đe ưh pă đei khan: ‘'Bă sa plei hơmu iŭ, na kon sâu sư hơker hơnĕnh.’

English: But every one shall die for his own iniquity; every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
Bahnar: Mă-lei rim 'nu gô lôch yua kơ yoch sư kơdih; bơngai bu sa plei hơmu iŭ, sư kư̆m hơker mơ̆n.”

English: “Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Khei 'năr gô truh, kơplah noh Inh gô pơgơ̆p 'nao hăm lu bơngai Isơrael păng lu adrĕch Juđa.

English: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, My covenant which they broke, though I was a husband to them, says the LORD.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơgơ̆p 'nâu ưh kơ trŏ thoi nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh hăm lu 'bok yă lu sư lăm năr mă Inh rôp ti dui tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ sơ̆, yua kơ lu sư pơrăm lê̆ boih tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh, mă Inh thoi klo lu sư ră.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the LORD: I will put My law in their minds, and write it on their hearts; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
Bahnar: “'Nâu mă nơ̆r Inh gô pơgơ̆p hăm adrĕch Isơrael đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr noh kơnh,” Kră Yang khan. “Inh gô 'măn tơdrong juăt Inh tơ lăm kơ̆l 'ngok lu sư; păng chih tơdrong juăt Inh tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư. Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư na lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.”

English: No more shall every man teach his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD,’ for they all shall know Me, from the least of them to the greatest of them, says the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin I will remember no more.”
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei pơhrăm băl boih lu rông 'bôt sư; păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư khan: Athei băt kơ Kră Yang! Yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu sư gô băt kơ Inh, bơngai pơm iĕ truh tơ bơngai pơm tih Kră Yang khan: “Inh ưh pă jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong lu sư pơm kơnê̆, păng kư̆m ưh pă 'blŏk kơ yoch glăi đêl lu sư pơm.”

English: Thus says the LORD, Who gives the sun for a light by day, The ordinances of the moon and the stars for a light by night, Who disturbs the sea, And its waves roar (The LORD of hosts is His name)
Bahnar: Kră Yang; Tơ'ngla mă ăn măt 'năr pơchrang hơdah kơ'năr, ăn măt khei sơnglŏng pơchrang gah kơmăng, pơm kơ đak dơsĭ pơpơ̆ poh-yă hơlôk hơlak.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh noh anăn Sư.

English: “If those ordinances depart From before Me, says the LORD, Then the seed of Israel shall also cease From being a nation before Me forever.”
Bahnar: “Tơdah layơ tơdrong juăt âu hiong đơ̆ng anăp Inh, na kơplah noh adrĕch adrung Isơrael kư̆m hiong hlŏng hloi ưh pă jô̆ minh adrĕch 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Thus says the LORD: “If heaven above can be measured, And the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, I will also cast off all the seed of Israel For all that they have done, says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Tơdah đei bu gơh pơtŏ lu tăl plĕnh tơ kơpal ti dah gơh lăng băt kơ hơnă tơ ala plei teh sŭng, na kơplah noh, Inh gô achăng lê̆ adrĕch adrung Isơrael, yua kơ tơdrong yoch mă lu sư pơm.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, that the city shall be built for the LORD from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gô đei 'năr, pơlei tih đe gô pơdơ̆ng dơ̆ng kơ Inh đơ̆ng Hnam Thôt Hananêl truh tơ 'Măng Jang Mum.

English: The surveyor’s line shall again extend straight forward over the hill Gareb; then it shall turn toward Goath.
Bahnar: Tơlei đe pơtŏ gô dăng tơpăt groi Garet păng dăr truh tơ groi Gôa.

English: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields as far as the Brook Kidron, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, shall be holy to the LORD. It shall not be plucked up or thrown down anymore forever.”
Bahnar: Jơ̆p lăm thŭng atâu đe lôch păng rơnok kơting, đĭ-đăng chŭn dĭng truh tơ thong đak Kidrôn păng truh tơ mum 'Măng Jang Aseh gah hơlĕch, dôm lu 'noh gô klah 'măn lê̆ pha 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang păng pơlei oei oei ling-lang ưh kơ đei bu buch lê̆ păng pơrăm dơ̆ng.”

English: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt chăl Sêđekia pơm pơtao đe Juđa, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi. Noh jơ̆ sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơhngam lăm chăl pơtao Nebukatnessar pơgơ̆r.

English: For then the king of Babylon’s army besieged Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu linh pơtao Babilôn wang pơlei tih Jêrusalem; gah Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol đe rôp phak lăm anih cham lu linh gak hnam pơtao Juđa.

English: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it
Bahnar: Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa, rôp chĭt Jêrêmi, pơtao jet: “Liơ ih khan lê̆ adrol khan:” Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô jao pơlei tih 'nâu lăm ti pơtao Babilôn, sư gô blah iŏk.

English: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape from the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him face to face, and see him eye to eye
Bahnar: Gah Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa, sư ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai Kalđê, sĭt tơpă pơtao Babilôn gô rôp phak sư, sư gô pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao 'bơ̆t tơm măt sư 'bôh hăm măt sư kơdih.

English: then he shall lead Zedekiah to Babylon, and there he shall be until I visit him,” says the LORD; “though you fight with the Chaldeans, you shall not succeed” ’?”
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn gô rôp anhăk ba pơtao Sêđekia tơ Babilôn, sư gô oei tơ noh truh tơ Inh hơmet sư, tơdah Lu iĕm tơblah hăm bơngai Kalđê, ưh kơ đei jei iĕm ôh?”

English: And Jeremiah said, “The word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan: “Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you, saying, “Buy my field which is in Anathoth, for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.” ’
Bahnar: ‘'Nâu, Hanamel kon drŏ-nglo Salum ma ih gô năm truh khan kơ ih: Răt bĕ mir na inh tơ Anathôt: Yua kơ ih kơtum jê̆ trŏ lăp kơ huai iŏk.’ ”

English: Then Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the LORD, and said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the country of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption yours; buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that this was the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Hanamel, kon drŏ-nglo ma inh, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan năm tơ'bơ̆p inh tơ anih cham lu linh gak păng khan: “Apinh ih huai iŏk mir na inh tơ Anathôt, lăm char Bênjamin, yua kơ ih trŏ kơ gơh răt iŏk mir noh. Ih răt iŏk bĕ.” Na inh băt noh jĭ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: So I bought the field from Hanamel, the son of my uncle who was in Anathoth, and weighed out to him the money—seventeen shekels of silver.
Bahnar: Na inh răt mir na tơ Anathôt đơ̆ng Hanamel, kon drŏ-nglo ma inh păng inh kŏng ăn kơ sư mơjĭt-tơpơh sêikơl jên hu.

English: And I signed the deed and sealed it, took witnesses, and weighed the money on the scales.
Bahnar: Inh chih kĭ anăn tơ lăm hla bơar răt, chơ̆m pơsĭt, kư̆m đei bơngai kơdranh wă pơsĭt păng kŏng ăn tôm jên noh.

English: So I took the purchase deed, both that which was sealed according to the law and custom, and that which was open
Bahnar: Inh iŏk hloi hla bơar tĕch hla bơar inh 'nao kĭ răt kiơ̆ kơ khôi juăt păng hla bơar chih rok hai.

English: and I gave the purchase deed to Baruch the son of Neriah, son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses who signed the purchase deed, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the prison.
Bahnar: Inh jao ăn hla bơar răt noh kơ Baruk, kon drŏ-nglo Nêria, sâu Mahseia, 'bơ̆t anăp Hanamel, kon drŏ-nglo ma inh păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai kơdranh đei kĭ anăn lăm noh, kư̆m 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Juđa oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cham anih lu linh gak.

English: “Then I charged Baruch before them, saying
Bahnar: Na inh pơkă kơ Baruk 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư khan

English: ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Take these deeds, both this purchase deed which is sealed and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may last many days.”
Bahnar: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘Iŏk bĕ dôm hla bơar pơsĭt hla bơar kĭ răt păng hla bơar chih rok, tah bĕ tơ lăm bô̆i teh, wă kơ hla bơar noh gơh răk đunh.”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.” ’
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: Đe gô tĕch răt hnam, mir chŭn, pơgar hơmu lăm char âu.’

English: “Now when I had delivered the purchase deed to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Đang kơ inh jao hla bơar răt noh kơ Baruk kon drŏ-nglo Nêria, inh krao khan apinh Kră Yang

English: ‘Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for You.
Bahnar: “Ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih Tơ'ngla yơ̆r ti man pơjing kơ plĕnh hăm teh âu hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tih Ih. Ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ mă tơnat 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: You show lovingkindness to thousands, and repay the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them—the Great, the Mighty God, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Ih tơ'bôh boih tơdrong Ih 'mêm rơbâu rơngan jơhnơr, mă-lei gô phak tơpŭ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng 'bă kơ lu kon sâu sư đơ̆ng rŏng. Ih boih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei, Tơ'ngla mơsêh mơyang tih, anăn Ih Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: You are great in counsel and mighty in work, for Your eyes are open to all the ways of the sons of men, to give everyone according to his ways and according to the fruit of his doings.
Bahnar: Ih đei tơdă tih, mơsêh mơyang gơh pơm tôm tơdrong. Măt Ih lăng 'bôh đĭ-đăng kơ trong kon bơngai. Ih phak apah kơ rim 'nu kiơ̆ tơdrong arih sa sư păng kiơ̆ đêl tơdrong jang lu sư pơm.

English: You have set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, to this day, and in Israel and among other men; and You have made Yourself a name, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Ih đei pơm boih tơdrong hlĭch chrơp tơ lăm char Êyiptơ sơ̆ mă khơ̆ dang ei lăm lu bơngai Isơrael păng lăm lu bơngai nai, anăn Ih đei ư-ang boih thoi kư̆m đei ư-ang dang ei.

English: You have brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror
Bahnar: Ih đei yua boih dôm tơdra hlĭch, tơdrong chrơp, pơklaih bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ hăm ti pran kơtang hăm tơdrong hli krưp wă chông kon pơlei pơla Ih, Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: You have given them this land, of which You swore to their fathers to give them—“a land flowing with milk and honey.”
Bahnar: Ih jao ăn kơ lu sư teh đak âu, teh đak 'bĕnh kơ đak toh păng đak sut, mă Ih đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu yă 'bok lu sư sơ̆.

English: And they came in and took possession of it, but they have not obeyed Your voice or walked in Your law. They have done nothing of all that You commanded them to do; therefore You have caused all this calamity to come upon them.
Bahnar: Lu sư iŏk boih teh đak âu jang sa mă-lei ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Ih, ưh kơ arih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Ih păng ưh kơ pơm dôm tơdrong kiơ mă Ih đei bơtho tơtă wă kơ pơm. Yua kơ thoi noh na Ih đei ăn tơdrong gleh âu truh tơ lu sư.

English: ‘Look, the siege mounds! They have come to the city to take it; and the city has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword and famine and pestilence. What You have spoken has happened; there You see it!
Bahnar: To lu linh Kalđê wang blah pơlei; lu sư oei bơ̆ teh wă tŏk blah iŏk pơlei. Pơlei âu gô huŏng lăm ti lu sư, kơplah oei tơblah, đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, tơdrong jĭ apoh. Tơdrong Ih khan truh boih, 'nâu âu, Ih 'bôh boih.

English: And You have said to me, O Lord GOD, “Buy the field for money, and take witnesses”!—yet the city has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’ ”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih khan boih kơ inh: ‘Yua bĕ jên hu ih răt mir na âu păng chă đei bơngai kơdranh pơsĭt, na to pơlei tih âu jao boih lăm ti lu bơngai Kalđê.’ ” Lei liơ?

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for Me?
Bahnar: “'Nâu, Inh boih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai. Hăm đei tơdrong kiơ mă hơnat kơ Inh?”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô jao pơlei tih âu tơ lăm ti lu bơngai Kalđê, lăm ti Nebukatnessar pơtao đe Babilôn sư gô blah iŏk.

English: And the Chaldeans who fight against this city shall come and set fire to this city and burn it, with the houses on whose roofs they have offered incense to Baal and poured out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke Me to anger
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Kalđê oei wang blah pơlei tih âu, gô iŏk ŭnh soh pơđĭ hnam anih dĭng truh tơ bơbŭng hnam mă đe pơyơ̆r tơmam 'bâu phu ăn kơ yang Baal păng đe đei soi pơyơ̆r tơmam huch boih kơ lu yang nai hai, lu sư pơm yoch hăm Inh wă tơblĕk Inh.

English: because the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only evil before Me from their youth. For the children of Israel have provoked Me only to anger with the work of their hands,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kon sâu bơngai Isơrael păng kon sâu Juđa, iŏk đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p, tă kơ pơm kơnê̆ ngăl 'bơ̆t anăp Inh. Kon sâu Isơrael iŏk dôm tơmam jang păng ti kơdih sư na tơblĕk Inh.” Kră Yang khan

English: ‘For this city has been to Me a provocation of My anger and My fury from the day that they built it, even to this day; so I will remove it from before My face
Bahnar: “Iŏk đơ̆ng năr đe pơdơ̆ng sư sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei pơlei tih âu tơblĕk wă kơ Inh hil, dĭng Inh mah pơrăm lê̆ sư đơ̆ng anăp Inh.

English: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke Me to anger—they, their kings, their princes, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă kon sâu Isơrael păng kon sâu Juđa pơm boih wă kơ tơblĕk Inh, đei lu sư, lu pơtao, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu 'bok soi, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lu sư, hơdai hăm lu bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And they have turned to Me the back, and not the face; though I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not listened to receive instruction.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ hue lăng Inh, tơwih kơ Inh rŏng. Mă khan Inh oei adrin bơtho lu sư, mă-lei lu sư kuă kơ mơ̆ng, kuă kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh bơtho khan.

English: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by My name, to defile it.
Bahnar: Lu sư tah 'măn boih rup yang kơnê̆ 'mê̆ krưp tơ lăm hnam mă đe anăn măt Inh, pơm mơgrĭ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And they built the high places of Baal which are in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire to Molech, which I did not command them, nor did it come into My mind that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.’
Bahnar: Lu sư man pơdơ̆ng boih anih tih kơjung kơ yang Baal lăm Thŭng Ben Hinôm, wă pơyơ̆r kơ yang Mơlek lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư, noh tơdrong mă Inh ưh kơ đei bơtho; Inh ưh kơ đei tơchĕng. Lu sư mă đei pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach thoi noh na pơm kơ adrĕch Juđa yoch.

English: “Now therefore, thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning this city of which you say, ‘It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence’
Bahnar: Ih đei khan gah pơlei tih âu pơlei noh pơjao boih lăm ti pơtao Babilôn hăm đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt, jĭ apoh, mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan

English: Behold, I will gather them out of all countries where I have driven them in My anger, in My fury, and in great wrath; I will bring them back to this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely.
Bahnar: “'Nâu, Inh gô hơrui akŭm lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char mă đơ̆ng Inh hil mĭl dêh na mă Inh pơpuh lê̆ lu sư tơ noh; Inh gô chông tơwih lu sư brŏk tơ anih 'nâu, wă kơ lu sư oei jang sa rơnŭk rơnua.

English: They shall be My people, and I will be their God
Bahnar: Lu sư gô jing kon pơlei pơla Inh păng Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: then I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear Me forever, for the good of them and their children after them.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư jing minh đon minh jơhngơ̆m minh trong lei-lăi, wă kơ lu sư hli yom kơ Inh ling-lang, wă kơ lu sư păng kon sâu lu sư đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: And I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from doing them good; but I will put My fear in their hearts so that they will not depart from Me.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi; Inh ưh pă wă lê̆, dah lu sư ưh pă ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư; Inh kư̆m wă pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư băt hli yom kơ Inh, wă kơ lu sư ưh pă achăng lê̆ Inh.

English: Yes, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will assuredly plant them in this land, with all My heart and with all My soul.’
Bahnar: Na jơhngơ̆m Inh hiôk ăn kơ lu sư pŭn hiôk, hăm đĭ tơdrong tơpăt lăm jơhngơ̆m Inh wă pơtăm lu sư lăm teh đak âu.”

English: “For thus says the LORD: ‘Just as I have brought all this great calamity on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Thoi Inh ăn boih tơdrong pơrăm tih kơ kon pơlei 'nâu, Inh kư̆m gô ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk mă Inh đei pơkă boih hăm lu sư năr âu.

English: And fields will be bought in this land of which you say, “It is desolate, without man or beast; it has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”
Bahnar: Lu đe gô tĕch dah răt teh mir na lăm char 'nâu char mă ih đei khan: “Sư jing bri brah ưh kơ đei bơngai oei, kon sem brem kư̆m ưh kơ đei, đei jao boih tơ lăm ti lu bơngai Kalđê.’

English: Men will buy fields for money, sign deeds and seal them, and take witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South; for I will cause their captives to return,’ says the LORD.”
Bahnar: Lu đe gô yua jên hu răt mir na, chih hla bơar tĕch, chơ̆m pơsĭt, chih pơklep chă bơngai kơdranh pơsĭt kơ đơ̆ng lăm char Bênjamin, lăm lu anih tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih Jêrusalem, lăm pơlei Juđa păng lăm lu pơlei tơ kông groi dah lăm tơring lăm thŭng păng lu pơlei gah gơal, yua kơ Inh gô chông anhăk bơnă wih brŏk hiôk-hian jơnap.” Noh Kră Yang khan.”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still shut up in the court of the prison, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêrêmi đe phak tơ lăm cham lu linh gak, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ sư wơ̆t mă 'bar.

English: “Thus says the LORD who made it, the LORD who formed it to establish it (the LORD is His name)
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan, Sư boih Tơ'ngla pơjing teh đak păng pơm pơdơ̆ng tôm tơmam ăn kơ lu sư kơjăp; anăn Sư Kră Yang

English: ‘Call to Me, and I will answer you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know.’
Bahnar: Krao apinh Inh bĕ, Inh gô tơl tơwih; Inh gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih tơdrong tih jrŭ păng tơnat kơ hlôh, dôm tơdrong mă ih ưh tam mă băt.”

English: “For thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the houses of the kings of Judah, which have been pulled down to fortify against the siege mounds and the sword
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Gah lu hnam lăm pơlei tih, hnam pơtao đe Juđa, pơrăm lê̆ boih, wă yua găn tơblah hăm đao gưm lu bơngai Babilôn.

English: ‘They come to fight with the Chaldeans, but only to fill their places with the dead bodies of men whom I will slay in My anger and My fury, all for whose wickedness I have hidden My face from this city.
Bahnar: Tơblah hăm lu bơngai Kalđê, lu hnam 'nâu 'bĕnh kơ atâu akâu bơngai Inh pơlôch lăm năr Inh hil, lăm năr Inh mĭl. Yua kơ lu kon pơlei âu pơm yoch na Inh ôn boih muh măt Inh đơ̆ng pơlei âu.

English: Behold, I will bring it health and healing; I will heal them and reveal to them the abundance of peace and truth.
Bahnar: “Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư pran kơtang păng ăn kơ lu sư klaih rơngơp; Inh gô pơklaih pơlei âu, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư hiôk-hian chơt 'nă hal tơpă.

English: And I will cause the captives of Judah and the captives of Israel to return, and will rebuild those places as at the first.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ bơngai Juđa păng Isơrael đei hiôk jơnap, Inh gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng teh đak lu sư thoi sơ̆.

English: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against Me, and I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned and by which they have transgressed against Me.
Bahnar: Inh gô sŭt rơgoh tơdrong yoch mă đêl lu sư pơm boih hăm Inh; Inh huay pă jô̆ boih dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă lu sư blah Inh

English: Then it shall be to Me a name of joy, a praise, and an honor before all nations of the earth, who shall hear all the good that I do to them; they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and all the prosperity that I provide for it.’
Bahnar: Pơlei âu gô ba anăn Inh đei ư-ang hiôk chơt, tơdrong bơnê, 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai lăm teh đak; lu sư gô kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng mă Inh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu bơngai Juđa păng bơngai Isơrael. Lu dêh noh gô tơrơ lăng krưp kơ tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng tơdrong hiôk-hian Inh ăn kơ pơlei âu.”

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘Again there shall be heard in this place—of which you say, “It is desolate, without man and without beast”—in the cities of Judah, in the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without beast
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Ih khan gah anih 'nâu: ‘Anih noh juơ ưh kơ đei bơngai oei, kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon sem bri.’ Lăm đĭ-đăng pơlei tih char Juđa păng trong tih pơlei Jêrusalem, dang ei jing anih rơ̆m rĕk, ưh kơ đei bơngai oei păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei sem brem trŏ tơpă.

English: the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who will say: “Praise the LORD of hosts, For the LORD is good, For His mercy endures forever”— and of those who will bring the sacrifice of praise into the house of the LORD. For I will cause the captives of the land to return as at the first,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đe gô kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng nơ̆r hiĕk chhôk 'nă hal tơ noh, nơ̆r bre ŏng mai hle, nơ̆r đe hơri rah chĕp tơmam pơyơ̆r bơnê mơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang: ‘Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Sư oei oei ling-lang! Yua kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng Sư.’ ” Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ Inh gô ăn kơ dêh char âu hiôk jơnap, kư̆m thoi adrol sơ̆,”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘In this place which is desolate, without man and without beast, and in all its cities, there shall again be a dwelling place of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lăm anih juơ 'nâu, ưh kơ đei kon bơngai oei păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei sem bri păng tơ rim pơlei, gô đei tơmăn 'nhĕt ăn kơ lu bơngai wei triu ăn kơ triu sư 'bĭch pơdơh.

English: In the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks shall again pass under the hands of him who counts them,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm lu pơlei tơring groi kông păng lu pơlei lăm tơring groi gah bơmơ̆t, lăm lu tơring glă gah gơal, lăm teh đak Bênjamin, tơ lăm rim anih tăp dăr Jêrusalem păng lăm pơlei char Juđa, khŭl triu gô yak rok ala ti đe gô jô̆ lu sư.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: ‘Behold, the days are coming,’ says the LORD, ‘that I will perform that good thing which I have promised to the house of Israel and to the house of Judah
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp, Inh gô pơsĭt nơ̆r Inh pơkă 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă Inh đei pơkă hăm adrĕch Isơrael păng adrĕch Juđa.”

English: ‘In those days and at that time I will cause to grow up to David A Branch of righteousness; He shall execute judgment and righteousness in the earth.
Bahnar: “Lăm lu 'năr noh păng kơplah ei kơnh, Inh gô ăn đei minh pôm dơng tơpăt sĭt chăt đơ̆ng adrĕch Đawit. 'Bok noh gô pơm tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng lăm teh đak.

English: In those days Judah will be saved, And Jerusalem will dwell safely. And this is the name by which she will be called: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.’
Bahnar: Lăm lu năr noh; adrĕch Juđa gô đei dŏng pơklaih; Jêrusalem gô oei hiôk-hian păng gô krao anăn Kră Yang boih tơpăt hơnơ̆ng lu nhôn.’ ”

English: “For thus says the LORD: ‘David shall never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan: “Adrĕch Đawit ưh kơ đei khăi ôh bơngai drŏ-nglo pơtrơp oei tơ tang-dŏ pơtao adrĕch Isơrael.

English: nor shall the priests, the Levites, lack a man to offer burnt offerings before Me, to kindle grain offerings, and to sacrifice continually.’ ”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi kư̆m ưh kơ khăi ôh wă dơ̆ng soh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, păng tơmam soh pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r nai 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: And the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘If you can break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that there will not be day and night in their season
Bahnar: “'Nâu Kră Yang khan: Tơdah tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p kơ'năr dah kơmăng, gơh pơrăm dĭng mah 'năr păng măng pă đei truh thoi đêl pơkă

English: then My covenant may also be broken with David My servant, so that he shall not have a son to reign on his throne, and with the Levites, the priests, My ministers.
Bahnar: lei na gơh pơrăm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh hăm Đawit, đĭch đam Inh, wă khan sư ưh pă đei kon sâu drŏ-nglo wă pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r dơ̆ng păng pơrăm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh hăm lu 'Bok soi, bơngai Lêwi, lu bơngai jang kơ Inh kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, nor the sand of the sea measured, so will I multiply the descendants of David My servant and the Levites who minister to Me.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch Đawit, đĭch đam Inh păng ăn kơ lu bơngai Lêwi jang kơ Inh, Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch adrung sư lơ thoi sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh, thoi chuơh cheng đak dơsĭ ưh kơ đei bu kĕ jô̆.”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Have you not considered what these people have spoken, saying, ‘The two families which the LORD has chosen, He has also cast them off’? Thus they have despised My people, as if they should no more be a nation before them.
Bahnar: “Ih hăm đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu kon pơlei 'nâu pơma: Lu sư khan: ‘'Bar tŏ adrĕch adrung mă Kră Yang rơih boih, na achăng lê̆ dơ̆ng. Lu sư pơjăm kon pơlei Inh, ưh kơ lăng kon pơlei Inh thoi minh pôm dêh char dơ̆ng.”

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘If My covenant is not with day and night, and if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơdah Inh ưh kơ pơgơ̆p hăm kơ'năr kơmăng, păng Inh ưh kơ đei ăn tơdrong juăt wei-lăng plĕnh păng teh.

English: then I will cast away the descendants of Jacob and David My servant, so that I will not take any of his descendants to be rulers over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will cause their captives to return, and will have mercy on them.’ ”
Bahnar: Lei Inh gô achăng lê̆ adrĕch adrung Jakôp păng Đawit, đĭch đam Inh, na Inh ưh kơ đei rơih bu lăm kon sâu drŏ-nglo sư wă pơgơ̆r kon sâu Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp. Tơpă Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư đei pŭn hiôk jơnap păng Inh gô 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư.”

English: The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army, all the kingdoms of the earth under his dominion, and all the people, fought against Jerusalem and all its cities, saying
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi, kơplah Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn, hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh sư, đĭ-đăng kơ lu teh đak chu kơ nơ̆r sư oei wang blah pơlei tih Jêrusalem păng lu pơlei nai tăp dăr.

English: “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: ‘Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Năm roi bĕ kơ Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa, 'nâu Kră Yang khan: Inh wă jê̆ jao pơlei tih âu lăm ti pơtao Babilôn, sư gô iŏk ŭnh soh pơlei.

English: And you shall not escape from his hand, but shall surely be taken and delivered into his hand; your eyes shall see the eyes of the king of Babylon, he shall speak with you face to face, and you shall go to Babylon.’ ” ’
Bahnar: Bĕ ih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng ti sư; đe gô rôp ih, jao ih lăm ti sư. Ih gô 'bôh tơm măt pơtao Babilôn păng kư̆m gô pơma dơnuh hăm sư, đe gô chông ba ih tơ char Babilôn.

English: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah! Thus says the LORD concerning you: ‘You shall not die by the sword.
Bahnar: Lei na mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma. Ơ Sêđekia pơtao đe Juđa. Kră Yang pơma roi gah ih: Ih huay kơ lôch kơ đao gưm ôh.

English: You shall die in peace; as in the ceremonies of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they shall burn incense for you and lament for you, saying, “Alas, lord!” For I have pronounced the word, says the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih gô lôch lăm tơdrong hiôk-hian, đe gô soh kơ ih pơgang 'bâu phu kư̆m thoi đe soh boih kơ 'bok ih, lu pơtao adrol kơ ih; păng đe gô nhơ̆m hmoi kơ ih: Ơ yŏng inh hô̆ lah! Inh đei khan pơkă boih nơ̆r âu.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol roi đĭ-đăng tơdrong noh kơ Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem

English: when the king of Babylon’s army fought against Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and Azekah; for only these fortified cities remained of the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: kơplah lu linh pơtao Babilôn oei blah pơlei Jêrusalem păng đĭ lu pơlei lăm char Juđa, mă oei đei, lăp pơlei Lakis păng pơlei Asêka; đĕch noh 'bar tŏ pơlei tih đei dur kơjăp mă oei đei lăm char Juđa.

English: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem to proclaim liberty to them
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơtao Sêđekia pơm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla tơ Jêrusalem, roi tơbăt ăn rơngei kơ lu đĭch.

English: that every man should set free his male and female slave—a Hebrew man or woman—that no one should keep a Jewish brother in bondage.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu athei ăn kơ lu đĭch bơngai Hêbrơ rơngei, drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn; ưh kơ gơh rôp 'nhŏng dah oh lu iĕm bơngai Juđa pơm đĭch ôh.

English: Now when all the princes and all the people, who had entered into the covenant, heard that everyone should set free his male and female slaves, that no one should keep them in bondage anymore, they obeyed and let them go.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei chu drơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r đei pơgơ̆p noh, ăn lu đĭch drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn klaih rơngei. Ưh pă đei rôp bu pơm đĭch dơ̆ng. Lu sư chu kiơ̆ ăn kơ đĭch đam gơh klaih rơngei.

English: But afterward they changed their minds and made the male and female slaves return, whom they had set free, and brought them into subjection as male and female slaves.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư tơplih đon; hơlơ̆k rôp lu đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn mă đêl lu sư 'nao achăng noh wơ̆t jang pơm đĭch đam dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: ‘I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, khan: Inh đei nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm lu 'bok yă iĕm lăm năr mă Inh đei chông anhăk lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ sơ̆, klaih rơngei đơ̆ng pơm đĭch, Inh khan

English: “At the end of seven years let every man set free his Hebrew brother, who has been sold to him; and when he has served you six years, you shall let him go free from you.” But your fathers did not obey Me nor incline their ear.
Bahnar: Sơnăm tơpơh đĭ-đăng lăm lu iĕm athei ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm bơngai Hêbrơ rơngei, mă sư đei tĕch kơdih sư tơ lu iĕm. Mă đei bơ̆jang pơm đĭch iĕm lăm tơdrâu sơnăm boih, lu iĕm athei ăn kơ sư rơngei. Mă-lei lu 'bok yă iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh, kư̆m kuă kơ pơgling đon lu sư.

English: Then you recently turned and did what was right in My sight—every man proclaiming liberty to his neighbor; and you made a covenant before Me in the house which is called by My name.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đunh ki iĕm 'nao tơbral pơm tơdrong trŏ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, lu iĕm kư̆m đei tơbăt ăn kơ rim 'nu athei ăn kơ 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n đêl pơm đĭch rơngei. Lu iĕm đei boih nơ̆r pơgơ̆p 'bơ̆t anăp Inh lăm hnam krao anăn Inh.

English: Then you turned around and profaned My name, and every one of you brought back his male and female slaves, whom you had set at liberty, at their pleasure, and brought them back into subjection, to be your male and female slaves.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm đei đon tơplih; pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anăn Inh; rim 'nu lu iĕm hơlơ̆k rôp dơ̆ng lu đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn mă đơ̆ng lu iĕm 'nao achăng ăn kơ lu sư rơngei mơ̆ng kơ lu sư wă năm tơ yơ ră, rôp pơgŏ lu sư pơm đĭch iĕm dơ̆ng.”

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD: ‘You have not obeyed Me in proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother and every one to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim liberty to you,’ says the LORD—‘to the sword, to pestilence, and to famine! And I will deliver you to trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, lu iĕm ưh kơ roi ăn kơ rim 'nu athei ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh, lu rông 'bôt iĕm gơh rơngei. Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu Inh ăn kơ iĕm rơngei, năm tơ đao gưm, jĭ hơbuh pơngot rơwĕt, Inh gô pơm ăn kơ iĕm jing bơngai đe lăng 'mê̆ krưp lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh char lăm teh âu.

English: And I will give the men who have transgressed My covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between the parts of it
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă đei pơm yoch hăm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh, ưh kơ kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r pơgơ̆p mă lu sư đei pơkă boih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư thoi kon rơmo blah phơ̆ tŏk-bŏk, na yak rok sơlam 'bar pah 'nhĕm noh

English: the princes of Judah, the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđa păng Jêrusalem lu bơngai jang lăm hnam pơtao, 'bok soi păng lu kon pơlei năm yak rok sơlam lu 'nhĕm rơmo blah noh.

English: I will give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life. Their dead bodies shall be for meat for the birds of the heaven and the beasts of the earth.
Bahnar: Inh jao lu sư tơ lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư, lu bơngai 'maih wă pơlôch pơrăm lu sư. Atâu akâu lu sư lôch gô ăn kơ sem grơ̆ păng sem bri sa.

English: And I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes into the hand of their enemies, into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army which has gone back from you.
Bahnar: Sêđekia pơtao đe Juđa păng kră pơgơ̆r sư Inh gô jao ăn tơ lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt kơ sư lu bơngai 'maih wă pơlôch lu sư, lăm ti lu linh pơtao Babilôn 'nao weh đơ̆ng lu iĕm.”

English: Behold, I will command,’ says the LORD, ‘and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it and take it and burn it with fire; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without inhabitant.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô chông lu sư brŏk hơlơ̆k blah pơlei âu; lu sư gô soh pơlei 'nâu, Inh gô ăn đĭ-đăng lu pơlei lăm char Juđa jing juơ, ưh kơ đei bơngai oei.”

English: The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi lăm chăl Jêhôiakim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơtao đe Juđa.

English: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, speak to them, and bring them into the house of the LORD, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.”
Bahnar: “Năm bĕ tơ lu adrĕch bơngai Rêkap, khan kơ lu sư; chông ba lu sư năm tơ hnam Kră Yang mơ̆t tơ lăm minh anih păng ăn kơ lu sư huch sik.

English: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, his brothers and all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh năm tơ Jaasania kon drŏ-nglo Jêrêmi, sâu Habasinia, lu 'nhŏng oh sư păng đĭ-đăng adrĕch lu bơngai Rêkap.

English: and I brought them into the house of the LORD, into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, a man of God, which was by the chamber of the princes, above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the door.
Bahnar: Inh chông ba lu sư năm tơ hnam Kră Yang mơ̆t lăm anih lu kon drŏ-nglo Hanan kon drŏ-nglo Idalia, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Anih noh jê̆ anih lu yŏng păng anih kơpal kơ Maaseia kon drŏ-nglo Salum, bơngai gak 'măng.

English: Then I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites bowls full of wine, and cups; and I said to them, “Drink wine.”
Bahnar: Inh hơmet lu get 'bĕnh kơ sik hơmu păng kơchŏk dan 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Rêkap; păng khan kơ lu sư: “Huch sik âu bĕ!”

English: But they said, “We will drink no wine, for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, ‘You shall drink no wine, you nor your sons, forever.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư tơl: “Lu nhôn ưh kơ lah huch sik ôh; yua kơ 'bok lu nhôn Jônađap, kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap đei bơtho khan kơ lu nhôn: Lu iĕm păng đĭ kơ lu sâu se iĕm ning-mônh 'nĕ kơ et sik.

English: You shall not build a house, sow seed, plant a vineyard, nor have any of these; but all your days you shall dwell in tents, that you may live many days in the land where you are sojourners.’
Bahnar: ‘Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm hnam, 'nĕ kơ rei, 'nĕ kơ pơtăm păng 'nĕ kơ pơm mir hơmu; iĕm 'nĕ kơ đei dôm lu tơmam noh. Mă-lei lu iĕm oei bơsŭn đĕch đĭ chăl arih iĕm, wă kơ iĕm arih sot lăm teh đak mă iĕm oei dang ei iĕm thoi bơngai tơmoi.’

English: Thus we have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, or our daughters
Bahnar: Lu nhôn chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Jônađap kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap 'bok lu nhôn lăm rim tơdrong sư đei bơtho pơkă boih kơ lu nhôn, lăm đĭ chăl arih lu nhôn, truh tơ kon akăn, kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu nhôn, ưh kơ et sik.

English: nor to build ourselves houses to dwell in; nor do we have vineyard, field, or seed.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơm hnam oei, ưh kơ pơm pơgar hơmu, mir chŭn, wă rei pơtăm

English: But we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
Bahnar: kư̆ oei lăm bơsŭn, lu nhôn mơ̆ng kiơ̆ boih đĭ-đăng tơdrong Jônađap 'bok lu nhôn pơkă boih.

English: But it came to pass, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, that we said, ‘Come, let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans and for fear of the army of the Syrians.’ So we dwell at Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn năm blah char nhôn, lu nhôn pơtơm băl: ‘Bĕ lu bơ̆n năm mơ̆t tơ pơlei tih Jêrusalem, wă klaih đơ̆ng lu linh bơngai Kalđê păng linh Aram.’ Lei na lu nhôn oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.”

English: Then came the word of the LORD to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, “Will you not receive instruction to obey My words?” says the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: “Năm khan bĕ kơ bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem: Kră Yang khan: ‘Lu iĕm ưh kơ wă chu iŏk tơdrong Inh bơtho păng kư̆m kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh mơ̆n hă?

English: “The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, which he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; for to this day they drink none, and obey their father’s commandment. But although I have spoken to you, rising early and speaking, you did not obey Me.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Jônađap, kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap bơtho khan kơ kon sâu sư, 'nĕ kơ et huch sik hơmu ôh, lu sư chu boih, truh tơ dang ei lu sư ưh dah huch sik đak hơmu ôh. Lu sư chu kiơ̆ kơ 'bok lu sư pơkă. Bĕ Inh pơma bơtho lu iĕm ling-lang, mă-lei lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng Inh.

English: I have also sent to you all My servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, ‘Turn now everyone from his evil way, amend your doings, and do not go after other gods to serve them; then you will dwell in the land which I have given you and your fathers.’ But you have not inclined your ear, nor obeyed Me.
Bahnar: Inh đei lơ wơ̆t boih wơh đĭch đam Inh, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm khan kơ lu iĕm: Dang ei ăn đĭ kơ lu iĕm weh bĕ đơ̆ng yoch, tơplih bĕ tơdrong lu iĕm pơm; păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ kiơ̆ lu yang nai, lei na lu iĕm gơh mơ̆t oei tơ lăm char mă Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm păng kơ 'bok lu iĕm. Mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă pơgling đon mơ̆ng kiơ̆ Inh.

English: Surely the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father, which he commanded them, but this people has not obeyed Me.” ’
Bahnar: Tơpă kon sâu Jônađap, kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap mơ̆ng boih dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bok lu sư bơtho khan, mă-lei lu kon pơlei 'nâu ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh ôh.’

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will bring on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the doom that I have pronounced against them; because I have spoken to them but they have not heard, and I have called to them but they have not answered.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang Tih Hloh. 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘'Nâu, Inh gô ăn đĭ lu tơdrong răm truh kơ Juđa păng lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem mă Inh khan lê̆ adrol, Inh đei bơtho tơ'bôh boih kơ lu sư; mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, Inh krao lu sư boih mă-lei lu sư kuă kơ tơl.’ ”

English: And Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, “Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Because you have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts and done according to all that he commanded you
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan kơ adrĕch bơngai Rêkap: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: Yua kơ lu iĕm chu kiơ̆ mơ̆ng boih nơ̆r 'bok lu iĕm Jônađap, wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r sư đei bơtho tơtă.

English: therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not lack a man to stand before Me forever.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘Adrĕch adrung Jônađap kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap gô đei ling-lang bơngai jang kơ Inh.’ ”

English: Now it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, that this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl Jêhôiakim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơtao Juđa Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Take a scroll of a book and write on it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah even to this day.
Bahnar: “Iŏk bĕ minh sơnôm hla bơar chih bĕ lăm noh dôm tơdrong Inh đei bơtho khan kơ ih gah bơngai Juđa, Isơrael păng đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung nai, iŏk đơ̆ng chăl Jôsia, dĭng truh kơ năr 'nâu.

English: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the adversities which I purpose to bring upon them, that everyone may turn from his evil way, that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
Bahnar: Mưh lu bơngai Juđa kơtơ̆ng đĭ-đăng tơdrong răm Inh wă pơm kơ lu sư, rŏ lăng lu sư gô tơbral achăng lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư kơdih, na Inh huay jô̆ yo tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư.”

English: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote on a scroll of a book, at the instruction of Jeremiah, all the words of the LORD which He had spoken to him.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi krao Baruk kon drŏ-nglo Nêria, Baruk chih tơ lăm sơnôm hla bơar kiơ̆ thoi Jêrêmi roi ăn kơ sư đĭ-đăng dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang khan.

English: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am confined, I cannot go into the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan kơ Baruk: “Đe khă inh, ưh kơ gơh năm tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: You go, therefore, and read from the scroll which you have written at my instruction, the words of the LORD, in the hearing of the people in the LORD’s house on the day of fasting. And you shall also read them in the hearing of all Judah who come from their cities.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei năm mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam Kră Yang, lăm năr đe ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa, đŏk kơ kon pơlei pơla mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang, inh roi ăn kơ ih chih tơ lăm sơnôm hla bơar noh. Ih kư̆m athei đŏk ăn kơ kon pơlei Juđa mă 'nao truh đơ̆ng pơlei lu sư mơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: It may be that they will present their supplication before the LORD, and everyone will turn from his evil way. For great is the anger and the fury that the LORD has pronounced against this people.”
Bahnar: Rŏ lăng lu sư gô krao apinh Kră Yang păng tơbral păng weh đơ̆ng trong pơm kơnê̆ yua kơ tơdrong hil Kră Yang wă pơm kơ kon pơlei 'nâu tih dêh tơpă.”

English: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading from the book the words of the LORD in the LORD’s house.
Bahnar: Baruk, kon drŏ-nglo Nêria pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Jêrêmi đei roi, đŏk nơ̆r Kră Yang sư đei chih lăm sơnôm hla bơar noh lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the LORD to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm khei tơsĭn sơnăm mă pơđăm chăl Jêhôiakim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơtao đe Juđa, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei đơ̆ng pơlei nai dơ̆ng lăm char Juđa, năm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, pơm giĕng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then Baruch read from the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the LORD, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court at the entry of the New Gate of the LORD’s house, in the hearing of all the people.
Bahnar: Baruk đŏk dôm nơ̆r Jêrêmi lăm sơnôm hla bơar ăn kơ đĭ kon pơlei mơ̆ng, Banik lăm hnam Kră Yang, lăm anih Gêmaria kon drŏ-nglo Saphan bơngai chih hla bơar, 'bơ̆t cham kơpal, jê̆ 'Măng Jang 'Nao trong mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm.

English: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the LORD from the book
Bahnar: Wă Mikaia kon drŏ-nglo Gêmaria sâu Saphan kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang đei chih lăm sơnôm hla bơar

English: he then went down to the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber; and there all the princes were sitting—Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
Bahnar: sư jur năm tơ hnam pơtao, mơ̆t tơ lăm anih 'bok chih hla bơar; tơ'bơ̆p lu yŏng pơgơ̆r oei ngôi lăm noh, lu sư đei Êlisama; 'bok chih hla bơar, Đêlaia kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia, Êlnathan kon drŏ-nglo Akbôr, Gêmaria kon Saphan, Sêđekia, kon Hanania păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r nai.

English: Then Michaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard when Baruch read the book in the hearing of the people.
Bahnar: Mikaia roi ăn kơ lu sư dôm nơ̆r mă sư kơtơ̆ng Baruk đŏk ăn kơ lu kon pơlei mơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm sơnôm hla bơar noh.

English: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll from which you have read in the hearing of the people, and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand and came to them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu yŏng pơgơ̆r wơh Jêhuđi kon drŏ-nglo Nethania sâu Sêlemia sâu i Kusi năm krao Baruk khan: “Chĕp ba sơnôm hla bơar mă ih đei đŏk ăn kơ kon pơlei mơ̆ng noh năm kiơ̆ inh.” Na Baruk kon drŏ-nglo Nêria chĕp sơnôm hla bơar noh năm tơ'bơ̆p lu sư.

English: And they said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.
Bahnar: Đe noh khan kơ sư: “Hơ-oei păng đŏk ăn kơ nhôn mơ̆ng bĕ. Na Baruk đŏk ăn kơ lu sư mơ̆ng.

English: Now it happened, when they had heard all the words, that they looked in fear from one to another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”
Bahnar: Lu sư 'nao mơ̆ng đĭ dôm nơ̆r noh, na lu sư hli pơglăn băl păng khan kơ Baruk: “Lu nhôn gô khŏm chĕp ba nơ̆r âu năm roi kơ pơtao.”

English: And they asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words—at his instruction?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư apinh Baruk: “Roi ăn kơ lu nhôn liơ mă ih gơh chih dôm nơ̆r 'nâu. Hăm trŏ kơ Jêrêmi đŏk na ih chih?”

English: So Baruch answered them, “He proclaimed with his mouth all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”
Bahnar: Baruk tơl: “Sư roi kơ inh dôm nơ̆r noh na inh iŏk 'long chih đak mơ̆k chih lăm sơnôm hla bơar âu.”

English: Then the princes said to Baruch, “Go and hide, you and Jeremiah; and let no one know where you are.”
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r noh pơma hăm Baruk: “Ih hăm Jêrêmi năm ôn bĕ, 'nĕ ăn kơ bu băt anih măr iĕm oei.”

English: And they went to the king, into the court; but they stored the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the hearing of the king.
Bahnar: Na lu yŏng pơgơ̆r ôn lê̆ sơnôm hla bơar noh tơ lăm anih Êlisama 'bok chih hla bơar; lu sư năm tơ hnam pơtao, na roi ăn kơ pơtao mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r noh.

English: So the king sent Jehudi to bring the scroll, and he took it from Elishama the scribe’s chamber. And Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.
Bahnar: Pơtao wơh Jêhuđi năm iŏk sơnôm hla bơar; na Jêhuđi năm iŏk hla bơar noh đơ̆ng lăm anih Êlisama 'bok chih hla bơar, na đŏk ăn kơ pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r mă oei tăp kơ pơtao wang mơ̆ng.

English: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month, with a fire burning on the hearth before him.
Bahnar: Năr noh khei tơsĭn; pơtao oei ngôi lăm hnam sư bơyan puih, đei tơnuh đe tơkuh ŭnh ngar ngŭr 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao.

English: And it happened, when Jehudi had read three or four columns, that the king cut it with the scribe’s knife and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêhuđi oei đŏk 'nao pêng puăn trong lăm sơnôm hla bơar noh 'bok pơtao iŏk săng iĕ rek kơtĕch klơ̆m lăm ŭnh mă đe tơkuh noh dĭng mă ŭnh sa pơđĭ hloi sơnôm hla bơar noh.

English: Yet they were not afraid, nor did they tear their garments, the king nor any of his servants who heard all these words.
Bahnar: Pơtao păng lu 'bok pơgơ̆r kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r noh, mă-lei ưh kơ hli ưh kơ hek ao lu sư kơdih.

English: Nevertheless Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah implored the king not to burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.
Bahnar: Mă khan Êlnathan, Đêlaia păng Gêmaria apinh lung ră 'nĕ kơ soh sơnôm hla bơar noh mă-lei pơtao ưh kơ mơ̆ng.

English: And the king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet, but the LORD hid them.
Bahnar: Pơtao rai wơh Jêrahmêel kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, Sêraia kon drŏ-nglo Asriel păng Sêlemia kon drŏ-nglo Apđeel năm wă rôp chô̆ Baruk 'bok chih hla bơar păng Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol. Mă-lei Kră Yang ôn lê̆ bre sư.

English: Now after the king had burned the scroll with the words which Baruch had written at the instruction of Jeremiah, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơtao soh sơnôm hla bơar mă đơ̆ng Baruk chih đơ̆ng nơ̆r Jêrêmi roi đêl nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Take yet another scroll, and write on it all the former words that were in the first scroll which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.
Bahnar: Iŏk minh sơnôm plơ̆ng dơ̆ng bĕ, chih rok thoi sơnôm hla bơar adrol mă Jêhôiakim pơtao đe Juđa soh boih.

English: And you shall say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, ‘Thus says the LORD: “You have burned this scroll, saying, ‘Why have you written in it that the king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and cause man and beast to cease from here?’ ”
Bahnar: Kŭm roi ăn kơ Jêhôiakim pơtao đe Juđa, 'nâu Kră Yang khan: ‘Ih soh boih sơnôm hla bơar âu păng jet: Liơ ih pơ̆n chih khan pơtao Babilôn gô truh, pơrăm dêh char âu păng pơlôch kon bơngai hăm sem dơrong.’

English: Therefore thus says the LORD concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He shall have no one to sit on the throne of David, and his dead body shall be cast out to the heat of the day and the frost of the night.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan gah Jêhôiakim, pơtao đe Juđa: Kon sâu sư ưh kơ đei bu hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit; akâu atâu sư lôch đe gô klơ̆m lê̆ tơ 'nguaih sơ̆k tơtŏ kơ'năr păng lê̆ tơtŭk tơngiĕt kơmăng.

English: I will punish him, his family, and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah all the doom that I have pronounced against them; but they did not heed.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô phak sư, phak lu kon sâu sư păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư. Inh gô ăn tơdrong truh kơ lu sư, lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem păng bơngai Juđa, tơdrong phak pơrăm Inh đei khan tơbăt lê̆ kơ lu sư adrol boih, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng.”

English: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote on it at the instruction of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And besides, there were added to them many similar words.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi iŏk minh sơnôm hla bơar plơ̆ng dơ̆ng ăn kơ Baruk bơngai chih hla bơar kon drŏ-nglo Nêria; Jêrêmi roi ăn dơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r thoi lăm sơnôm hla bơar mă Jêhôiakim, pơtao đe Juđa soh boih. Sư kư̆m roi thim nơ̆r plơ̆ng dơ̆ng. Kŭm lei-lăi thoi noh.

English: Now King Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
Bahnar: Sêđekia kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơgơ̆r tơplih Jêhôiachin, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim, yua kơ đơ̆ng Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn pôk sư pơm pơtao đe Juđa.

English: But neither he nor his servants nor the people of the land gave heed to the words of the LORD which He spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm dêh Juđa kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan boih kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol.

English: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to the LORD our God for us.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia wơh Jêhukal kon drŏ-nglo Sêlemia păng Sephania 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Maaseia, năm tơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol păng khan: “Apinh ih krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n tơgŭm lu nhôn.”

English: Now Jeremiah was coming and going among the people, for they had not yet put him in prison.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Jêrêmi oei chă yak ngôi tơ lăm kon pơlei, đe tam mă rôp phak sư ôh.

English: Then Pharaoh’s army came up from Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they departed from Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu linh Pharaôn lĕch đơ̆ng Êyiptơ. Lu bơngai Kalđê oei wang pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng tơdrong ei, na lu sư kơdâu weh đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol

English: “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, ‘Thus you shall say to the king of Judah, who sent you to Me to inquire of Me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army which has come up to help you will return to Egypt, to their own land.
Bahnar: “'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, khan: Iĕm khan kơ pơtao Juđa, tơ'ngla mă wơh iĕm năm apinh Inh, khan: ‘Lu linh Pharaôn năm wă dŏng iĕm wih brŏk tơ char sư Êyiptơ boih.’

English: And the Chaldeans shall come back and fight against this city, and take it and burn it with fire.” ’
Bahnar: Lu linh Kalđê gô hơlơ̆k tơ âu, wang blah pơlei âu, lu sư blah iŏk pơlei âu păng soh pơlei âu.

English: Thus says the LORD: ‘Do not deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely depart from us,” for they will not depart.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm 'nĕ chă hơlĕnh kơdih khan: ‘Bơngai Kalđê khan gô weh ataih đơ̆ng lu bơ̆n; lu sư ưh kơ weh ôh.’

English: For though you had defeated the whole army of the Chaldeans who fight against you, and there remained only wounded men among them, they would rise up, every man in his tent, and burn the city with fire.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă khan lu iĕm tơblah hăm lu linh Kalđê, jei lu iĕm ră mă lăm lu sư oei pă dôm 'nu lu bơngai rơka đĕch, lu sư gô lĕch dơ̆ng lăm bơsŭn iŏk ŭnh soh pơlei 'nâu.”

English: And it happened, when the army of the Chaldeans left the siege of Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu linh bơngai Kalđê lĕch weh đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem, yua kơ hli kơ lu linh Pharaôn.

English: that Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin to claim his property there among the people.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi wă lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem yak năm tơ char Bênjamin, wă iŏk klah asong hơnam sư đŏng lăm kon pơlei tơ noh.

English: And when he was in the Gate of Benjamin, a captain of the guard was there whose name was Irijah the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp sư truh tơ 'Măng Jang Bênjamin đei minh 'nu yŏng lu linh bơngai gak anăn sư Irijah, kon drŏ-nglo Sêlemia, sâu Hanania, oei gak tơ noh; rôp Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol khan: “Ih kơdâu lê̆ bơngai Juđa mơ̆t kiơ̆ lu bơngai Kalđê.”

English: Then Jeremiah said, “False! I am not defecting to the Chaldeans.” But he did not listen to him. So Irijah seized Jeremiah and brought him to the princes.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi tơl: “Ưh kơ trŏ.” Inh ưh kơ mơ̆t bơngai Kalđê ôh.” Mă-lei Irijah ưh kơ mơ̆ng, rôp Jêrêmi năm ba tơ lu kră pơgơ̆r.

English: Therefore the princes were angry with Jeremiah, and they struck him and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe. For they had made that the prison.
Bahnar: Lu Kră pơgơ̆r hil kơ Jêrêmi teh tôn păng chĭt phak tơ lăm hnam Jônathan bơngai chih hla bơar; yua kơ đe iŏk hnam noh pơm hnam phak.

English: When Jeremiah entered the dungeon and the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days
Bahnar: Jêrêmi đe chĭt phak, lăm sơlŭng măng mu, sư oei tơ noh đunh năr.

English: then Zedekiah the king sent and took him out. The king asked him secretly in his house, and said, “Is there any word from the LORD?” And Jeremiah said, “There is.” Then he said, “You shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon!”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia wơh đe năm krao Jêrêmi ba tơ hnam pơtao, sư jet Jêrêmi hơdrô̆ lăm hnam sư: “Kră Yang hăm đei khan kiơ?” Jêrêmi tơl: “Đei mơ̆n, đe gô jao ih tơ lăm ti pơtao Babilôn.”

English: Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “What offense have I committed against you, against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Jêrêmi khan kơ pơtao Sêđekia: “Inh hăm đei pơm glăi hăm ih, hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r, dah hăm kon pơlei âu, na ih mah rôp tah inh tơ lăm hnam phak?

English: Where now are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or against this land’?
Bahnar: Tơ yơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol roi kơ ih khan: Pơtao Babilôn ưh kơ năm blah pơtao păng teh đak 'nâu?

English: Therefore please hear now, O my lord the king. Please, let my petition be accepted before you, and do not make me return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.”
Bahnar: Ơ 'bok yŏng pơtao inh, dang ei, mơ̆ng bĕ! Inh apinh lung ih, 'nĕ pă ba inh wih dơ̆ng tơ hnam Jônathan bơngai chih hla bơar, hơmơt kơnh inh lôch tơ noh.’ ”

English: Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah to the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread from the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia tơtă athei đe ba Jêrêmi tơ cham hnam anih đe gak, ăn kơ sư rim năr minh pôm 'bĕng mi, đơ̆ng hnam đe pơm 'bĕng lăm pơlei tih ei dĭng truh tơ tơpŭng 'bĕng lăm pơlei noh đĭ. Jêrêmi đe chĭt tơ cham hnam anih linh gak.

English: Now Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah had spoken to all the people, saying
Bahnar: Sêphatia, kon drŏ-nglo Mattan, Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Pashur, Jêhukal kon drŏ-nglo Sêlemia păng Pashur kon drŏ-nglo Malkija kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Jêrêmi bơtho kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei.

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘He who remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but he who goes over to the Chaldeans shall live; his life shall be as a prize to him, and he shall live.’
Bahnar: “'Nâu Kră Yang khan: ‘Bơngai bu oei lăm pơlei âu gô lôch kơ đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt dah lôch hơbuh. Mă-lei bơngai bu lĕch yơ̆r ti kơ lu bơngai Kalđê gô arih, sư gô pơklaih tơdrong arih sư.’ ”
