English: Thus says the LORD: ‘This city shall surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, which shall take it.’ ”
Bahnar: Păng 'nâu Kră Yang khan: “Pơlei tih âu gô pơjao tơ lăm ti lu linh pơtao Babilôn lu sư gô blah iŏk.”

English: Therefore the princes said to the king, “Please, let this man be put to death, for thus he weakens the hands of the men of war who remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, by speaking such words to them. For this man does not seek the welfare of this people, but their harm.”
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r khan kơ pơtao: “Pơlôch bĕ bơngai 'nâu, yua kơ sư pơma thoi noh, pơm ăn kơ đon lu linh mă oei oei lăm pơlei âu păng pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m kon pơlei rơdu. Bơngai âu ưh kơ chă trong wă pơklaih kon pơlei ôh, mă-lei chă trong wă pơrăm.”

English: Then Zedekiah the king said, “Look, he is in your hand. For the king can do nothing against you.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia khan: “Âu, inh jao sư kơ iĕm; inh pơtao ưh kơ gơh găn lu iĕm ôh.”

English: So they took Jeremiah and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the king’s son, which was in the court of the prison, and they let Jeremiah down with ropes. And in the dungeon there was no water, but mire. So Jeremiah sank in the mire.
Bahnar: Lei lu sư rôp Jêrêmi tah lê̆ lăm sơlŭng đak Malkija kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, sơlŭng 'nâu lăm anih cham linh gak, lu sư tơjur Jêrêmi hăm tơlei giĕn, sơlŭng âu ưh pă đei đak boih, oei đei hlŭt đĕch, na Jêrêmi đom jrŭ lăm hlŭt noh.

English: Now Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, one of the eunuchs, who was in the king’s house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon. When the king was sitting at the Gate of Benjamin
Bahnar: Êbet Mêlek bơngai Êthiôpi, sư khŭl linh bơngai jang oei wei lăm hnam pơtao kơtơ̆ng khan đe tah lê̆ Jêrêmi lăm sơlŭng đak, kơplah noh pơtao oei ngôi 'bơ̆t 'Măng Jang Bênjamin.

English: Ebed-Melech went out of the king’s house and spoke to the king, saying
Bahnar: Êbet Mêlek lĕch đơ̆ng lăm hnam pơtao, năm khan kơ pơtao.

English: “My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon, and he is likely to die from hunger in the place where he is. For there is no more bread in the city.”
Bahnar: “Ơ yŏng tơ'ngla pơtao inh. Lu đe noh pơm kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơnê̆ dêh, tah lê̆ sư lăm sơlŭng. Sư gô lôch pơngot tơ noh, mưh tơmam sa lăm pơlei âu ưh pă đei boih.”

English: Then the king commanded Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, saying, “Take from here thirty men with you, and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon before he dies.”
Bahnar: Pơtao athei Êbet Mêlek bơngai Êthiôpi: “Chă bĕ pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng âu năm hơdai ih năm dui hơtŏk Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng đak, adrol kơ sư lôch.”

English: So Ebed-Melech took the men with him and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took from there old clothes and old rags, and let them down by ropes into the dungeon to Jeremiah.
Bahnar: Na Êbet Mêlek chông bơngai năm hơdai sư truh tơ anih đe tah che hơbĕn ao hiah, sư iŏk che păng ao so tơjur hăm tơlei ăn kơ Jêrêmi lăm sơlŭng.

English: Then Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, “Please put these old clothes and rags under your armpits, under the ropes.” And Jeremiah did so.
Bahnar: Êbet Mêlek bơngai Êthiôpi, khan kơ Jêrêmi: “Iŏk che hiah hăm ao so noh pôn tơlei giĕn na dan ala pŏk-ak ih.” Jêrêmi pơm thoi noh.

English: So they pulled Jeremiah up with ropes and lifted him out of the dungeon. And Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
Bahnar: Na lu sư dui hơtŏk Jêrêmi đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng; na Jêrêmi oei chĭt lăm cham anih lu linh gak.

English: Then Zedekiah the king sent and had Jeremiah the prophet brought to him at the third entrance of the house of the LORD. And the king said to Jeremiah, “I will ask you something. Hide nothing from me.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia athei đe năm krao Jêrêmi păng chông ba sư mơ̆t trong 'măng mă pêng mơ̆t tơ hnam Kră Yang. Pơtao khan kơ Jêrêmi: “Inh đei minh tơdrong wă jet ih; 'nĕ ôn kơ inh.”

English: Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I declare it to you, will you not surely put me to death? And if I give you advice, you will not listen to me.”
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan kơ pơtao Sêđekia. “Tơdah inh roi kơ ih tơpăt ih gô pơlôch inh tơpă? Tơdah inh chă pơđâu hăm ih, ih kuă kơ mơ̆ng mơ̆n.”

English: So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying, “As the LORD lives, who made our very souls, I will not put you to death, nor will I give you into the hand of these men who seek your life.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao Sêđekia pơkă hlơp hơdrô̆ hăm Jêrêmi: “Sĭt tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih, Tơ'ngla pơjing boih tơdrong arih lu bơ̆n, inh pơkă, inh ưh kơ pơlôch ih ôh, inh kư̆m ưh kơ pơjao ih kơ lu bơngai 'maih wă pơlôch ih!”

English: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “Thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘If you surely surrender to the king of Babylon’s princes, then your soul shall live; this city shall not be burned with fire, and you and your house shall live.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi tơl pơtao: “'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan: ‘Tơdah ih lĕch yơ̆r ti kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r Babilôn lei ih gô arih păng pơlei tih âu đe huay kơ soh pơrăm; ih păng hnam ih gô arih.

English: But if you do not surrender to the king of Babylon’s princes, then this city shall be given into the hand of the Chaldeans; they shall burn it with fire, and you shall not escape from their hand.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah ih ưh kơ lĕch yơ̆r ti kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r Babilôn, lei pơlei tih âu lu bơngai Kalđê gô soh păng ih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng ti lu sư.

English: And Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have defected to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they abuse me.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sêđekia khan kơ Jêrêmi. Inh hli kơ bơngai Juđa mơ̆t bơngai Kalđê boih, na gô jao inh tơ lăm ti lu sư, pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh.’ ”

English: But Jeremiah said, “They shall not deliver you. Please, obey the voice of the LORD which I speak to you. So it shall be well with you, and your soul shall live.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan: Đe ưh kơ pơjao ih kơ lu sư ôh. Apinh ih mơ̆ng kiơ̆ bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang, mă inh đei roi kơ ih, wă kơ ih đei pŭn hiôk păng arih.

English: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the word that the LORD has shown me
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah ih sơngah kuă kơ mơ̆t kiơ̆ ôh lu bơngai Kalđê, lei 'nâu boih tơdrong Kră Yang tơ'bôh kơ inh.

English: ‘Now behold, all the women who are left in the king of Judah’s house shall be surrendered to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women shall say: “Your close friends have set upon you And prevailed against you; Your feet have sunk in the mire, And they have turned away again.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn oei oei lăm hnam pơtao Juđa đe gô ba lu sư ăn kơ bơngai pơgơ̆r linh pơtao Babilôn; lu bơngai drŏ-kăn noh gô khan yak rah pơma rah: ‘Dôm lu buăl juăt pơtao pơhlŭ pơtao jei boih; jơ̆ng ih đom lăm hlŭt boih, lu buăl ih kơdŭn achăng lê̆ ih.’

English: ‘So they shall surrender all your wives and children to the Chaldeans. You shall not escape from their hand, but shall be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon. And you shall cause this city to be burned with fire.’ ”
Bahnar: Đĭ lu akăn tơm akăn kơnhŏng lu kon ih đe gô chông anhăk pơjao lu sư tơ bơngai Kalđê. Ih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng ti lu sư, đe gô jao ih kơ pơtao Babilôn na pơlei tih âu đe gô soh pơrăm.”

English: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Let no one know of these words, and you shall not die.
Bahnar: Sêđekia khan kơ Jêrêmi: “Ih 'nĕ ăn bu băt dôm nơ̆r 'nâu, lei ih huay kơ lôch.

English: But if the princes hear that I have talked with you, and they come to you and say to you, ‘Declare to us now what you have said to the king, and also what the king said to you; do not hide it from us, and we will not put you to death,’
Bahnar: Tơdah lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kơtơ̆ng khan inh đei pơma dơnuh hăm ih na jet: ‘Roi ăn kơ nhôn ih pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao kiơ; păng pơtao đei pơma kiơ hăm ih; 'nĕ ôn kơ lu nhôn, lei lu nhôn huay kơ pơlôch ih.’

English: then you shall say to them, ‘I presented my request before the king, that he would not make me return to Jonathan’s house to die there.’ ”
Bahnar: Lei ih tơl bĕ lu sư: ‘Inh đei apinh pơtao, khan 'nĕ pă ba inh tơ hnam Jônathan, kơnh hli kơ inh lôch tơ noh.’ ”

English: Then all the princes came to Jeremiah and asked him. And he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they stopped speaking with him, for the conversation had not been heard.
Bahnar: Wă đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r năm chă apinh jet Jêrêmi, na sư roi ăn kơ đe noh thoi pơtao đei pơkă kơ sư, lu sư pă jet dơ̆ng yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma noh.

English: Now Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison until the day that Jerusalem was taken. And he was there when Jerusalem was taken.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi đe chĭt lăm cham anih lu linh gak dĭng truh tơ năr đe blah iŏk pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem, and besieged it.
Bahnar: Lăm khei mơjĭt sơnăm mă tơsĭn, chăl Sêđekia, pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r teh đak Juđa, Nebukatnessar, pơtao dêh Babilôn, hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh sư năm wang blah pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the city was penetrated.
Bahnar: Lăm năr tơsĭn khei puăn sơnăm mơjĭt-mônh chăl Sêđekia pơgơ̆r dur pơchah tơblŭt.

English: Then all the princes of the king of Babylon came in and sat in the Middle Gate: Nergal-Sharezer, Samgar-Nebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergal-Sarezer, Rabmag, with the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.
Bahnar: Kơplah pơlei Jêrusalem đe blah iŏk đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kiơ̆ gah pơtao Babilôn mơ̆t hơ-oei 'bơ̆t 'măng jang Tŏk-Bŏk, đei Nergal Sareser, đơ̆ng Samgar, Nêbô Sarsêkim yŏng pơgơ̆r linh, Nergal Sareser yŏng pơgơ̆r tih păng đĭ-đăng lu yŏng nai gah pơtao Babilôn.

English: So it was, when Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, that they fled and went out of the city by night, by way of the king’s garden, by the gate between the two walls. And he went out by way of the plain.
Bahnar: Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa, hăm lu linh tơblah 'bôh tơdrong noh lu sư kơdâu lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei, kơmăng rok trong pơgar 'nhot pơtao, lĕch trong 'măng jang sơlam dur, lu sư yak tơpăt tơ Araba.

English: But the Chaldean army pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. And when they had captured him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, to Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu linh bơngai Kalđê druh lu sư păng tam Sêđekia lăm tơmăn jê̆ pơlei Jêrikô; rôp chông ba sư tơ Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, sek tơlang sư tơ pơlei Riblah, lăm tơring Hamat.

English: Then the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes in Riblah; the king of Babylon also killed all the nobles of Judah.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn pơlôch lu kon drŏ-nglo Sêđekia lăm pơlei Riblah, tơm măt Sêđekia; pơtao Babilôn kư̆m pơlôch đĭ-đăng lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch Juđa kiơ̆ kơ pơtao athei.

English: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, and bound him with bronze fetters to carry him off to Babylon.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn kuek lê̆ 'bar pah măt pơtao Sêđekia păng chô̆ hăm glang kong, chông ba tơ char Babilôn.

English: And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house and the houses of the people with fire, and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Bơngai Kalđê iŏk ŭnh soh hnam pơtao, đĭ hnam kon pơlei păng teh pơchah lê̆ dur pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive to Babylon the remnant of the people who remained in the city and those who defected to him, with the rest of the people who remained.
Bahnar: Nebusaradan yŏng lu linh gak pơtao, athei rôp lu kon pơlei mă oei oei lăm pơlei păng lu bơngai lĕch yơ̆r ti kiơ̆ sư păng lu thơ̆ tuh hling, hơjơ̆m chông ba pơm bơnă tơ char Babilôn.

English: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left in the land of Judah the poor people, who had nothing, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
Bahnar: Nebusaradan, yŏng lu linh gak ưh kơ rôp ba ôh mơ'nah lăm lu kon pơlei dơnuh hin dêh, mir chŭn ưh kơ đei lê̆ lu sư oei kơtă lăm char Juđa, asong ăn kơ lu sư chŭn mir pơgar hơmu.

English: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying
Bahnar: Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn athei tơtă kơ Nebusaradan yŏng lu linh gak pơtao, gah Jêrêmi khan

English: “Take him and look after him, and do him no harm; but do to him just as he says to you.”
Bahnar: “Iŏk sư bĕ, wei-lăng sư pơ'lơ̆ng 'nĕ kơ pơrăm sư, mă-lei pơm kiơ̆ bĕ thoi sư wă.”

English: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent Nebushasban, Rabsaris, Nergal-Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the king of Babylon’s chief officers
Bahnar: Na Nebusaradan, yŏng lu linh gak, pơtao hăm Nebusasban pơgơ̆r tơm linh tơblah, Negai Sareser yŏng tih păng đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r hăm pơtao Babilôn.

English: then they sent someone to take Jeremiah from the court of the prison, and committed him to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should take him home. So he dwelt among the people.
Bahnar: Athei chă Jêrêmi ba sư lĕch đơ̆ng anih cham lu linh gak, jao Jêrêmi ăn kơ Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam, sâu Saphan, wă kơ ba Jêrêmi năm tơ hnam sư. Sư oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei sư.

English: Meanwhile the word of the LORD had come to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the court of the prison, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi kơplah đe oei phak sư lăm anih cham lu linh gak

English: “Go and speak to Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will bring My words upon this city for adversity and not for good, and they shall be performed in that day before you.
Bahnar: “Ih năm khan bĕ kơ Êbet Mêlek, bơngai Êthiôpi: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: 'Nâu Inh gô pơrăm ưh kơ trŏ ăn pŭn hiôk ôh kơ pơlei âu kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Inh đei pơkă boih. Kơplah ei kơnh ih gô 'bôh tơm măt.’ ”

English: But I will deliver you in that day,” says the LORD, “and you shall not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Mă-lei kơplah noh Inh gô pơklaih ih. Đe ưh pă pơjao ih lăm ti lu bơngai mă ih oei hli.

English: For I will surely deliver you, and you shall not fall by the sword; but your life shall be as a prize to you, because you have put your trust in Me,” says the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơklaih ih tơpă, ih huay kơ pơ̆k lôch kơ đao gưm; mă-lei ih gô arih yua kơ ih gơnang kơ Inh Kră Yang khan:”

English: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him bound in chains among all who were carried away captive from Jerusalem and Judah, who were carried away captive to Babylon.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Nebusaradan yŏng lu linh gak pơtao tơlĕch sư tơ pơlei Rama; kơplah noh, Jêrêmi đe oei chô̆ sư păng glang hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei đơ̆ng Jêrusalem păng char Juđa, rok trong đe chông ba năm tơ char Babilôn.

English: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him: “The LORD your God has pronounced this doom on this place.
Bahnar: Yŏng lu linh gak 'bôh păng chông Jêrêmi trong pha păng khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih đei khan boih wă pơrăm anih 'nâu.

English: Now the LORD has brought it, and has done just as He said. Because you people have sinned against the LORD, and not obeyed His voice, therefore this thing has come upon you.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang pơm tơpă thoi sư đei khan boih, yua kơ lu iĕm pơm yoch sơngah kơ Kră Yang păng kuă kơ kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư. Lei na tơdrong 'nâu truh tơ lu iĕm.

English: And now look, I free you this day from the chains that were on your hand. If it seems good to you to come with me to Babylon, come, and I will look after you. But if it seems wrong for you to come with me to Babylon, remain here. See, all the land is before you; wherever it seems good and convenient for you to go, go there.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh plôh lê̆ glang đơ̆ng ti ih, tơdah ih wă năm hơdai nhôn tơ char Babilôn, năm bĕ inh gô wei-lăng ih. Tơdah ih ưh kơ wă năm tơ char Babilôn ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ lei lê̆. Ih lăng tơ dêh char âu oei 'bơ̆t anăp ih. Ih rơngei boih wă năm tơ yơ mơ̆ng kơ Ih wă.”

English: Now while Jeremiah had not yet gone back, Nebuzaradan said, “Go back to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people. Or go wherever it seems convenient for you to go.” So the captain of the guard gave him rations and a gift and let him go.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi oei tam mă drơ̆ng Nebusaradan khan dơ̆ng: “Dah ih wă brŏk oei hơdai hăm Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam sâu Saphan bơngai mă pơtao Babilôn pôk sư pơm yŏng lu pơlei lăm dêh char Juđa, oei hơdai bĕ hăm lu kon pơlei, dah wă năm oei tơ yơ, ih kư̆ năm tơ noh.” Đơ̆ng noh 'bok yŏng linh ăn kơ sư tơmam lăng jơ̆ng ti tơmam sa na lê̆ sư yak năm.

English: Then Jeremiah went to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, to Mizpah, and dwelt with him among the people who were left in the land.
Bahnar: Na Jêrêmi sư năm oei hơdai Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam, tơ pơlei Mispa, oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei mă đe oei lê̆ lăm teh đak noh.

English: And when all the captains of the armies who were in the fields, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed to him men, women, children, and the poorest of the land who had not been carried away captive to Babylon
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu linh păng lu yŏng linh sư mă oei tơ bri kông kơtơ̆ng 'bok pơtao Babilôn pôk ăn Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm char păng kư̆m kơtơ̆ng pơtao jao ăn kơ sư pơgơ̆r wei-lăng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai drŏ-nglo, lu drŏ-kăn, lu hơ'lơ̆p, lu bơngai dơnuh hloh mă đe oei lê̆ oei lăm char Juđa, ưh kơ chông ba pơm đĭch tơ char Babilôn.

English: then they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ'bơ̆p Gêđalia tơ pơlei Mispa, đei Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, Jôhanan păng Jônathan lu kon drŏ-nglo Karea, Sêraia kon drŏ-nglo Tanhumet, lu kon drŏ-nglo Êphai kon pơlei bơngai Nêtophai, Jêsania bơngai Maakat păng đĭ-đăng lu linh năm hơdai sư.

English: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, took an oath before them and their men, saying, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.
Bahnar: Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam, sâu Saphan, sư pơkă pơkăm pơlung lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli ôh bơ̆jang bĕ kơ lu bơngai Kalđê. Oei bĕ lăm dêh char âu, na awih awăn ăn kơ pơtao Babilôn. Na lu iĕm gô arih jang sa hiôk-hian.

English: As for me, I will indeed dwell at Mizpah and serve the Chaldeans who come to us. But you, gather wine and summer fruit and oil, put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken.”
Bahnar: Inh athei oei lăm pơlei Mispa, tang măt kơ lu iĕm chă pơma dơnuh hăm lu bơngai Kalđê dah lu sư truh tơ bơ̆n; gah lu iĕm gơh chă phĕ plei hơmu, plei đum bơyan phang păng plei ôliwơ, na hmĕt đak sư mong lăm ge, na oei bĕ lăm pơlei mă iĕm đei oei boih.”

English: Likewise, when all the Jews who were in Moab, among the Ammonites, in Edom, and who were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa oei lăm char Môap, Ammôn, lăm char Eđôm păng oei lăm dêh char nai kư̆m kơtơ̆ng pơtao Babilôn kư̆m oei lê̆ kon pơlei oei lăm char Juđa, na pơtao pôk Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam sâu Saphan, pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they had been driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruit in abundance.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa 'nâu tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ dêh char wih brŏk tơ char Juđa, tơ Gêđalia tơ pơlei Mispa. Na lu sư phĕ mong plei hơmu plei 'long bơyan phang lơ dêh.

English: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields came to Gedaliah at Mizpah
Bahnar: Jôhanan kon drŏ-nglo Karea păng đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh mă oei tơ rim pơlei năm tơ'bơ̆p Gêđalia tơ pơlei Mispa

English: and said to him, “Do you certainly know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to murder you?” But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam did not believe them.
Bahnar: khan kơ sư: “Ih hăm băt Baalis pơtao Ammôn wơh Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania năm pơlôch ih?” Mă-lei Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam, ưh kơ lui kơ nơ̆r lu sư.

English: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke secretly to Gedaliah in Mizpah, saying, “Let me go, please, and I will kill Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no one will know it. Why should he murder you, so that all the Jews who are gathered to you would be scattered, and the remnant in Judah perish?”
Bahnar: Jôhanan kon drŏ-nglo Karea pơma ôn hơdrô̆ hăm Gêđalia tơ pơlei Mispa: “Lê̆ kơ inh năm pơlôch Ismael kon Nethania, ưh kơ đei bu băt ôh tơdrong noh. Lê̆ kơ kiơ sư pơlôch ih, na lu bơngai Juđa mă oei hơdai ih gô kơdâu tơklah tơklang. Păng lu bơngai Juđa mă oei lăm char âu kư̆m lôch đĭ.”

English: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “You shall not do this thing, for you speak falsely concerning Ishmael.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam khan kơ Jôhanan kon drŏ-nglo Karea: “Ih 'nĕ kơ pơm tơdrong noh; tơdrong ih khan gah Ismael noh ưh kơ trŏ ôh.

English: Now it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal family and of the officers of the king, came with ten men to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, at Mizpah. And there they ate bread together in Mizpah.
Bahnar: Lăm khei tơpơh Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania sâu Êlisama adrĕch pơtao, sư minh lăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh pơtao, chông ba mơjĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo năm tơ Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam tơ pơlei Mispa. Kơplah lu sư oei sŏng sa hơdai tơ noh.

English: Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and the ten men who were with him, arose and struck Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword, and killed him whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
Bahnar: Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania hăm lu mơjĭt 'nu kiơ̆ sư iung pơlôch Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam sâu Saphan hăm đao gưm, bơngai mă pơtao Babilôn pôk sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđa.

English: Ishmael also struck down all the Jews who were with him, that is, with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there, the men of war.
Bahnar: Ismael kư̆m pơlôch hloi lu bơngai Juđa mă oei bơ̆jang hăm Gêđalia lăm pơlei Mispa păng kư̆m pơlôch lu linh Kalđê mă oei hơdai tơ noh.

English: And it happened, on the second day after he had killed Gedaliah, when as yet no one knew it
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơlôch Gêđalia, tim mă đei bu băt ôh tơdrong noh

English: that certain men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, eighty men with their beards shaved and their clothes torn, having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: đei tơhngam-jĭt 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo hơkôih sŏk kang hek hơbĕn ao, raih akâu lu sư kơdih hăm săng, lu sư năm đơ̆ng pơlei Sichem, Silô păng Samari, chĕp ba lu tơmam phe 'ba păng lu tơmam 'bâu phu wă năm pơyơ̆r tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went along; and it happened as he met them that he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam!”
Bahnar: Ismael, kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, đơ̆ng Mispa năm sơng lu sư, yak rah nhơ̆m rah. Wă tơ'bơ̆p lu sư pơma tơm: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm tơ'bơ̆p Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam.”

English: So it was, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah killed them and cast them into the midst of a pit, he and the men who were with him.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư năm wă tŏk-bŏk pơlei, Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, pơlôch đe noh păng klơ̆m hŭt akâu lôch lăm sơlŭng đak.

English: But ten men were found among them who said to Ishmael, “Do not kill us, for we have treasures of wheat, barley, oil, and honey in the field.” So he desisted and did not kill them among their brethren.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mơjĭt 'nu lăm lu sư khan kơ Ismael: “'Nĕ pơlôch lu nhôn yua kơ lu nhôn đei phe 'ba tơmam sa ôn lê̆ tơ lăm mir: 'Ba mi, 'ba tơ'bâu, đak rơmă ôliwơ; đak sut.” Thoi noh Ismael ưh kơ pơlôch lu đe noh hơdai hăm khŭl sư.

English: Now the pit into which Ishmael had cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had slain, because of Gedaliah, was the same one Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel. Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.
Bahnar: Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, klơ̆m lê̆ akâu lu bơngai sư pơlôch tơ lăm sơlŭng Gêđalia mă pơtao Asa sir, wă găn Baasa, pơtao Isơrael. Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania klơ̆m lu akâu bơngai mă đêl sư pơlôch, 'bĕnh kơ sơlŭng să noh.

English: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, the king’s daughters and all the people who remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive and departed to go over to the Ammonites.
Bahnar: Ismael rôp pơđĭ kon bơngai mă oei arih lăm pơlei Mispa, lu kon drŏ-kăn pơtao păng lu kon pơlei mă oei lê̆ tơ lăm pơlei Mispa mă Nebusaradan yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh gak pơtao jao boih kơ Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam. Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, rôp lu bơngai noh chông ba, năm tơ gah char Ammôn.

English: But when Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces that were with him heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done
Bahnar: Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea hăm đĭ-đăng lu yŏng linh kiơ̆ sư kơtơ̆ng đĭ tơdrong kơnê̆ Ismael kon drŏ-nglo Nethania pơm boih.

English: they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah; and they found him by the great pool that is in Gibeon.
Bahnar: Lu sư akŭm đĭ lu linh năm blah Ismael, kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, druh tam tơ jê̆ đak dơnâu tih tơ pơlei Gibeôn.

English: So it was, when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, that they were glad.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei mă Ismael rôp chông ba 'bôh Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea hăm đĭ-đăng lu yŏng linh năm hơdai sư, lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: Then all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned around and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei mă Ismael đei rôp chông ba đơ̆ng pơlei Mispa kơdâu wih tơ Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea.

English: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to the Ammonites.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ismael, kon drŏ-nglo Nethania klaih đơ̆ng Jôhanan hơdai hăm tơhngam 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, lu sư kơdâu ôn tơ char Ammôn.

English: Then Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, took from Mizpah all the rest of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah after he had murdered Gedaliah the son of Ahikam—the mighty men of war and the women and the children and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
Bahnar: Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea, hơdai hăm lu yŏng linh năm hơdai sư, dŏng chông ba lu khŭl kon pơlei Mispa đơ̆ng ti Ismael, kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, đang kơ Ismael, pơlôch Gêđalia kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam; sư rôp ba lu linh, lu drŏ-kăn, lu hơ'lơ̆p lu bơngai jang lăm hnam pơtao, Jôhanan chông ba lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Gibeôn.

English: And they departed and dwelt in the habitation of Chimham, which is near Bethlehem, as they went on their way to Egypt
Bahnar: Lu sư yak oei pơdơh 'bơ̆t pơlei Gêrut Kimham jê̆ pơlei Betlehem, trong năm tơ char Êyiptơ.

English: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had murdered Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had made governor in the land.
Bahnar: Lu sư hli kơ bơngai Kalđê; yua kơ Ismael, kon drŏ-nglo Nethania, pơlôch boih Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam, bơngai mă pơtao Babilôn pôk sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r dêh char.

English: Now all the captains of the forces, Johanan the son of Kareah, Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people, from the least to the greatest, came near
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu yŏng linh 'bih Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea, Jêsania, kon drŏ-nglo Hôsaia păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei, đơ̆ng bơngai pơm tih truh tơ bơngai pơm iĕm

English: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please, let our petition be acceptable to you, and pray for us to the LORD your God, for all this remnant (since we are left but a few of many, as you can see)
Bahnar: năm apinh lung Jêrêmi: “Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r lu nhôn apinh ih krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih tơgŭm lu nhôn, lu bơngai mă oei oei âu. Sơ̆ lu nhôn oei lơ kơdrâ̆m, dang ei oei pă tŏ sĕt, thoi ih 'bôh âu.

English: that the LORD your God may show us the way in which we should walk and the thing we should do.”
Bahnar: Wă kơ ih krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, tơhlâu tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu nhôn trong ayơ wă kơ lu nhôn rok kiơ̆ păng pơm tơdrong kiơ.”

English: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard. Indeed, I will pray to the LORD your God according to your words, and it shall be, that whatever the LORD answers you, I will declare it to you. I will keep nothing back from you.”
Bahnar: Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơl: “Inh kơtơ̆ng boih, 'nâu, inh gô krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, wă kơ băt tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang bơtho khan, inh gô roi ăn kơ lu iĕm băt, ưh kơ đei ôn ôh.”

English: So they said to Jeremiah, “Let the LORD be a true and faithful witness between us, if we do not do according to everything which the LORD your God sends us by you.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơkă hloi khan kơ Jêrêmi: “Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang lăng lu nhôn mă tơpăt sĭt phak lu nhôn tơdah lu nhôn ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih đei wơh ih roi tơbăt kơ lu nhôn.

English: Whether it is pleasing or displeasing, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God to whom we send you, that it may be well with us when we obey the voice of the LORD our God.”
Bahnar: Mă 'lơ̆ng dah kơnê̆, lu nhôn pơkă gô pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang lu nhôn, wă kơ đei pŭn hiôk. Tơpă lu nhôn gô chu yom nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.”

English: And it happened after ten days that the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.
Bahnar: Mơjĭt năr đơ̆ng rŏng, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi.

English: Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, all the captains of the forces which were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest
Bahnar: Sư krao Jôhanan kon drŏ-nglo Karea hăm đĭ-đăng lu yŏng linh mă oei hơdai hăm sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei đơ̆ng pơm tih truh tơ pơm iĕ.

English: and said to them, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your petition before Him
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu sư: “'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, mă lu iĕm wơh athei inh krao apinh khan

English: ‘If you will still remain in this land, then I will build you and not pull you down, and I will plant you and not pluck you up. For I relent concerning the disaster that I have brought upon you.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm kư̆ oei tơ lăm teh đak âu, Inh gô tơiung lu iĕm ưh kơ pơrăm lu iĕm ôh, gô bơ̆ pơpôi pơtăm ưh kơ buch lê̆ ôh; Inh ưh kơ hiôk kơ tơdrong Inh pơrăm lu iĕm boih.

English: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid; do not be afraid of him,’ says the LORD, ‘for I am with you, to save you and deliver you from his hand.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli kơ pơtao Babilôn, bơngai mă lu iĕm oei hli.’ ” Kră Yang khan: “'Nĕ pă hli dơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng ti sư.

English: And I will show you mercy, that he may have mercy on you and cause you to return to your own land.’
Bahnar: Inh gô mơnat kơ lu iĕm, ăn kơ pơtao kư̆m mơnat kơ lu iĕm păng ăn kơ lu iĕm gơh oei tơ lăm teh đak lu iĕm kơdih.

English: “But if you say, ‘We will not dwell in this land,’ disobeying the voice of the LORD your God
Bahnar: Lei tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ wă chu nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, tơdah lu iĕm oei khan: ‘Lu nhôn ưh kơ wă oei lăm teh đak âu

English: saying, ‘No, but we will go to the land of Egypt where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor be hungry for bread, and there we will dwell’
Bahnar: na khan: “Ưh lu nhôn gô jur năm tơ dêh char Êyiptơ, tơ noh lu nhôn gô ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong tơblah wang păng ưh kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng dơ̆ng; tơ noh lu nhôn ưh kơ pơngot rơwĕt; lu nhôn gô năm oei tơ noh.’

English: Then hear now the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah! Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘If you wholly set your faces to enter Egypt, and go to dwell there
Bahnar: Ơ lu iĕm bơngai Juđa mă oei oei, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: ‘Tơdah lu iĕm wă 'maih năm oei ngei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ

English: then it shall be that the sword which you feared shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt; the famine of which you were afraid shall follow close after you there in Egypt; and there you shall die.
Bahnar: na đao gưm mă lu iĕm hli dêh gô druh tam lu iĕm lăm teh đak Êyiptơ, tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt mă lu iĕm hli tơtăm kư̆m druh kiơ̆ iĕm năm tơ Êyiptơ păng lu iĕm gô lôch tơ noh.

English: So shall it be with all the men who set their faces to go to Egypt to dwell there. They shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. And none of them shall remain or escape from the disaster that I will bring upon them.’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă wă năm tơ Êyiptơ oei tơ noh, gô lôch kơ đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt, lôch hơbuh. Ưh kơ đei bu arih; kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong răm mă Inh ăn.’ ”

English: “For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘As My anger and My fury have been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My fury be poured out on you when you enter Egypt. And you shall be an oath, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach; and you shall see this place no more.’
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Thoi Inh tuh boih tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơ lăm lu kon pơlei lăm Jêrusalem thoi yơ, Inh gô tuh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơ lu bơngai bu mă năm oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ kư̆m thoi noh. Đe gô blei hiap, đe lăng 'brơ̆, đe hiĕk achơ̆; lu iĕm ưh pă đei layơ 'bôh anih âu dơ̆ng.

English: “The LORD has said concerning you, O remnant of Judah, ‘Do not go to Egypt!’ Know certainly that I have admonished you this day.
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơtho khan boih kơ lu iĕm, lu bơngai mă oei oei lăm dêh char Juđa: ‘'Nĕ kơ năm ôh tơ char Êyiptơ,’ lu iĕm băt boih năr 'nâu Inh đei roi tơbăt kơ lu iĕm

English: For you were hypocrites in your hearts when you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the LORD our God, and according to all that the LORD your God says, so declare to us and we will do it.’
Bahnar: lu iĕm pơrơ̆ng pơprơ̆n wơh inh năm krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, khan: Krao apinh bĕ Kră Yang bơ̆n tơgŭm nhôn păng roi ăn kơ lu nhôn băt Kră Yang bơtho khan lu nhôn liơ; lu nhôn gô pơm kiơ̆.

English: And I have this day declared it to you, but you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God, or anything which He has sent you by me.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu inh đei roi boih kơ lu iĕm, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, ưh kơ wă pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong mă Kră Yang đei athei inh roi ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: Now therefore, know certainly that you shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence in the place where you desire to go to dwell.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei lu iĕm athei băt lu iĕm gô lôch kơ đao gưm, lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, lôch hơbuh, tơ lăm anih dêh char mă lu iĕm 'maih năm oei noh.

English: Now it happened, when Jeremiah had stopped speaking to all the people all the words of the LORD their God, for which the LORD their God had sent him to them, all these words
Bahnar: Đang kơ Jêrêmi roi đĭ kơ kon pơlei dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang lu sư, mă wơh sư năm roi ăn

English: that Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men spoke, saying to Jeremiah, “You speak falsely! The LORD our God has not sent you to say, ‘Do not go to Egypt to dwell there.’
Bahnar: Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Hôsaia păng Jôhanan kon drŏ-nglo Karea păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơang khan kơ Jêrêmi: “Ih hơlĕnh! Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn ưh kơ đei layơ athei ih năm roi ăn kơ lu nhôn. ‘Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ năm jur oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ.’

English: But Baruch the son of Neriah has set you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death or carry us away captive to Babylon.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei noh đơ̆ng Baruk kon drŏ-nglo Nêria, pơtrŭt ih pơm kơ lu nhôn jao lu nhôn ăn kơ lu bơngai Kalđê wă pơlôch dah ba lu nhôn pơm bơnă tơ char Babilôn.

English: So Johanan the son of Kareah, all the captains of the forces, and all the people would not obey the voice of the LORD, to remain in the land of Judah.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na, Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho athei oei lăm char Juđa đĕch.”

English: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces took all the remnant of Judah who had returned to dwell in the land of Judah, from all nations where they had been driven
Bahnar: Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Karea păng đĭ-đăng lu yŏng linh chông hăm lu kon pơlei Juđa mă oei đei, mă 'nao wih đơ̆ng dêh char nai brŏk wih oei jang sa lăm dêh char Juđa

English: men, women, children, the king’s daughters, and every person whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch the son of Neriah.
Bahnar: sư kư̆m chông ba lu drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn, lu kon hơ'lơ̆p păng kon adruh pơtao dôm lu bơngai mă Nebusaradan, bơngai yŏng lu linh gak, pơtao oei lê̆ lu sư oei hơdai Gêđalia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahikam sâu Saphan kư̆m đei Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hăm Baruk kon drŏ-nglo Nêria.

English: So they went to the land of Egypt, for they did not obey the voice of the LORD. And they went as far as Tahpanhes.
Bahnar: Na lu sư jur năm tơ char Êyiptơ, truh tơ pơlei Tahpanhes. Lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei Tahpanhes đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi

English: “Take large stones in your hand, and hide them in the sight of the men of Judah, in the clay in the brick courtyard which is at the entrance to Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes
Bahnar: “Dônh bĕ mă lu tơmo tih noh, na 'bŭ tơmo noh tơ lăm teh lơ̆n tơ lăm gŏch 'bơ̆t trong 'măng mơ̆t tơ hnam Pharaôn tơ pơlei Tahpanhes, 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu bơngai Juđa 'bôh.

English: and say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will send and bring Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and will set his throne above these stones that I have hidden. And he will spread his royal pavilion over them.
Bahnar: Na ih tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: “'Nâu Inh gô wơh păng krao đĭch đam Inh Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn păng Inh gô pơdơ̆ng tang-dŏ pơtao sư tơ kơpal tơmo 'nâu, mă Inh 'nao 'bŭ; pơtao noh gô dăng bơlang che sư pơm bơsŭn kơpal noh.

English: When he comes, he shall strike the land of Egypt and deliver to death those appointed for death, and to captivity those appointed for captivity, and to the sword those appointed for the sword.
Bahnar: Pơtao noh gô năm blah iŏk dêh char Êyiptơ, gô pơlôch lu bơngai mă trŏ kơ pơlôch, rôp pơm bơnă lu bơngai mă trŏ rôp kơ pơm bơnă, lu bơngai mă trŏ wă pơlôch hăm đao gưm đe gô pơlôch hăm đao gưm.

English: I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away captive. And he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd puts on his garment, and he shall go out from there in peace.
Bahnar: Nebukatnessar gô soh hnam kơkuh kơ lu rup yang Êyiptơ; sư gô soh pơrăm lu rup yang păng chĕp ba tơ nai. Sư iŏk pơgoh char Êyiptơ thoi lu bơngai wei triu dônh pơgoh hrŏk đơ̆ng ao lu sư, pơtao noh sư lĕch brŏk hiôk-hian.”

English: He shall also break the sacred pillars of Beth Shemesh that are in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians he shall burn with fire.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Sư gô teh pơchah lê̆ jrăng gơ̆ng đe man kơkuh kơ yang măt 'năr tơ Bet Semes lăm char Êyiptơ; klaih kơ noh sư gô soh pơđĭ hnam lu rup yang lăm dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who dwell in the land of Egypt, who dwell at Migdol, at Tahpanhes, at Noph, and in the country of Pathros, saying
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi gah lu bơngai Juđa oei lăm teh đak Êyiptơ, tơ pơlei Mikdôl, pơlei Tahpanhes, pơlei Memphis păng tơring char Patrôs.

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘You have seen all the calamity that I have brought on Jerusalem and on all the cities of Judah; and behold, this day they are a desolation, and no one dwells in them
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: “Ih 'bôh boih tơdrong răm mă Inh tuh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng lu pơlei lăm dêh char Juđa. Lăng to lu pơlei noh dang ei oei jing bri juơ ưh kơ đei bơngai oei

English: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke Me to anger, in that they went to burn incense and to serve other gods whom they did not know, they nor you nor your fathers.
Bahnar: yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kon pơlei pơm wă tơblĕk Inh. Lu sư soh nhang păng kơkuh kơ lu rup yang nai, mă lu sư dah ih dah lu 'bok yă iĕm ưh tam băt ôh.

English: However I have sent to you all My servants the prophets, rising early and sending them, saying, “Oh, do not do this abominable thing that I hate!”
Bahnar: Mă khan lei, Inh kư̆m oei wơh lu đĭch đam Inh, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, năm tơbăt kơ lu sư: ‘'Nĕ kơ pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ mă Inh areh 'nâu.’

English: But they did not listen or incline their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense to other gods.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng păng kư̆m kuă kơ pơgling đon mơ̆n, ưh kơ wă weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ păng kư̆m oei soh nhang 'bâu phu ăn kơ yang nai.

English: So My fury and My anger were poured out and kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is this day.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh tuh boih tơdrong hil mĭl Inh thoi ŭnh khơ̆ng tơ lăm lu pơlei dêh Juđa păng tơ rok trong lăm pơlei Jêrusalem; năr 'nâu lu pơlei noh oei jing bri juơ tơtŭng.”

English: “Now therefore, thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Why do you commit this great evil against yourselves, to cut off from you man and woman, child and infant, out of Judah, leaving none to remain
Bahnar: Dang ei, 'nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: “Liơ lu iĕm pơm wă pơrăm chăl arih akâu kơdih, wă tơhiong đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn, hơ'lơ̆p, nge oei mŏm, đơ̆ng lăm dêh Juđa, dĭng mah kon pơlei goh 'biao pă đei bu oei arih?

English: in that you provoke Me to wrath with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have gone to dwell, that you may cut yourselves off and be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm tơblĕk inh hăm ti lu iĕm pơm, soh nhang 'bâu phu ăn kơ lu yang nai lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, dêh char mă lu iĕm 'nao năm oei, pŭ iŏk tơdrong pơrăm kơdih akâu, pơm kơ đe che bơle, blei hiap tơ lăm jơ̆p-jang adrĕch adrung lăm teh đak?

English: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, the wickedness of the kings of Judah, the wickedness of their wives, your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đĭ hiơt boih hă tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu 'bok yă iĕm, tơdrong kơnê̆ lu pơtao Juđa păng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu akăn lu sư, tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu iĕm păng akăn lu iĕm đei pơm lăm dêh Juđa păng tơ rok trong lăm pơlei Jêrusalem?

English: They have not been humbled, to this day, nor have they feared; they have not walked in My law or in My statutes that I set before you and your fathers.’
Bahnar: Dĭng truh tơ năr 'nâu lu sư ưh kơ wă chu tơbral, ưh kơ hli yom, ưh kơ wă arih kiơ̆ khôi juăt păng tơdrong juăt Inh mă đei ăn boih kơ lu iĕm hăm lu 'bok yă lu iĕm.”

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will set My face against you for catastrophe and for cutting off all Judah.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: “'Nâu Inh gô ăn tơdrong răm truh păng pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu iĕm bơngai Juđa.

English: And I will take the remnant of Judah who have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to dwell there, and they shall all be consumed and fall in the land of Egypt. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine. They shall die, from the least to the greatest, by the sword and by famine; and they shall be an oath, an astonishment, a curse and a reproach!
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm lu kon pơlei bơngai Juđa oei oei, mă năm boih tơ char Êyiptơ păng oei tơ noh; lu sư gô lôch đĭ tơ noh lu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm pơngot rơwĕt tih, lăm dêh Êyiptơ. Lu pơm tih pơm iĕ gô lôch đĭ kơ đao gưm pơngot rơwĕt; pơm kơ đe blei hiap, che bơle hiĕk achơ̆, đe lăng 'brơ̆ krưp.

English: For I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence
Bahnar: Inh gô phak lu bơngai mă oei tơ lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, kư̆m thoi Inh đei phak pơlei Jêrusalem hăm đao gưm, pơngot rơwĕt lôch hơbuh pă đei minh 'nu

English: so that none of the remnant of Judah who have gone into the land of Egypt to dwell there shall escape or survive, lest they return to the land of Judah, to which they desire to return and dwell. For none shall return except those who escape.’ ”
Bahnar: lăm lu bơngai Juđa oei arih mă năm oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ ưh gơh klaih gơh hlot, wă brŏk wih dơ̆ng tơ char Juđa, anih mă lu sư hơpơi 'maih wih brŏk oei. Lu sư ưh kơ gơh wih brŏk, lăp lu kơdâu klĕnh đĕch klaih klăi.”

English: Then all the men who knew that their wives had burned incense to other gods, with all the women who stood by, a great multitude, and all the people who dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying
Bahnar: Lei na đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo băt boih kơ akăn lu sư soh nhang 'bâu phu ăn kơ yang nai, đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-kăn oei tơ noh akŭm băl minh tơpôl lơ păng đĭ lu bơngai mă oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, tơring char Patrôs, tơl nơ̆r Jêrêmi khan

English: “As for the word that you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you!
Bahnar: “Gah tơdrong ih yua anăn Kră Yang khan kơ lu nhôn, lu nhôn ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh.

English: But we will certainly do whatever has gone out of our own mouth, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty of food, were well-off, and saw no trouble.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu nhôn gô pơm keh dôm nơ̆r lu nhôn pơkă boih, lu nhôn gô soh nhang 'bâu phu kơ Pơtao Drŏ-kăn kơpal Plĕnh păng tuh sik pơyơ̆r ăn kơ sư, thoi lu nhôn đei pơm boih, lu 'bok yă lu nhôn, lu pơtao nhôn, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r lu nhôn lăm lu pơlei lăm dêh char Juđa păng tơ rok trong lăm pơlei tih Jêrusalem; kơplah noh lu nhôn đei tơmam sa phĭ rơkah rơkai, jang sa hiôk-hian ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ truh.

English: But since we stopped burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been consumed by the sword and by famine.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng năr lu nhôn ưh pă soh nhang 'bâu phu ăn kơ Pơtao Drŏ-kăn kơpal plĕnh păng tuh pơyơ̆r sik ăn kơ sư, lu nhôn kơ'bah kơ'bôch tôm tơdrong, rai lôch răm kơ đao gưm pơngot rơwĕt!”

English: The women also said, “And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make cakes for her, to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her without our husbands’ permission?”
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-kăn khan: “Kơplah lu nhôn soh nhang 'bâu phu kơ pơtao Drŏ-kăn kơpal plĕnh tuh pơyơ̆r sik ăn kơ sư, lei na klo lu nhôn ưh kơ lăp ôh hă, lei liơ lu nhôn pơ̆n man 'bĕng pơtŏ pơm thoi rup yang pơtao Drŏ-kăn kơpal plĕnh na pơyơ̆r sik tơmam huch ăn kơ yang pơtao Drŏ-kăn tơ plĕnh?”

English: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the people—the men, the women, and all the people who had given him that answer—saying
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, drŏ-nglo păng drŏ-kăn, lu bơngai mă 'nao tơl sư thoi kơpal noh hei

English: “The incense that you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, did not the LORD remember them, and did it not come into His mind?
Bahnar: “Tơdrong lu iĕm, 'bok yă iĕm, lu pơtao, lu 'bok yŏng pơgơ̆r iĕm păng kon pơlei lăm deh char, soh boih nhang 'bâu phu lăm rim pơlei char Juđa păng tơ rok trong pơlei Jêrusalem, Kră Yang ưh kơ 'blŏk ưh kơ tơchĕng hă?

English: So the LORD could no longer bear it, because of the evil of your doings and because of the abominations which you committed. Therefore your land is a desolation, an astonishment, a curse, and without an inhabitant, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ kĕ ĕnh boih tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm, tơdrong 'mê̆ krưp lu iĕm pơm, na teh đak lu iĕm jing juơ, pŭ hơngiap, blei hiap, ưh kơ đei bu oei truh tơ năr 'nâu.

English: Because you have burned incense and because you have sinned against the LORD, and have not obeyed the voice of the LORD or walked in His law, in His statutes or in His testimonies, therefore this calamity has happened to you, as at this day.”
Bahnar: Noh yua kơ đơ̆ng lu iĕm soh nhang kơ yang nai, pơm kơnê̆ blah Kră Yang, yua kơ đơ̆ng lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang, ưh kơ kiơ̆ khôi juăt, tơdrong juăt păng ưh kơ wă chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư bơtho khan, lei na đei tơdrong gleh truh kơ lu iĕm, thoi năr 'nâu.”

English: Moreover Jeremiah said to all the people and to all the women, “Hear the word of the LORD, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt!
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan dơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei kư̆m đei lu bơngai drŏ-kăn: “Ơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđa hrei âu oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: ‘You and your wives have spoken with your mouths and fulfilled with your hands, saying, “We will surely keep our vows that we have made, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her.” You will surely keep your vows and perform your vows!’
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: Lu iĕm păng akăn lu iĕm đei pơm tơpă kiơ̆ thoi 'bơ̆r iĕm khan: ‘Wă pơm pơkeh dôm tơdrong mă đêl pơkă boih: Soh nhang păng pơyơ̆r sik ăn kơ yang Drŏ-kăn pơtao kơpal plĕnh.’ Lei pơm pơkeh bĕ dôm nơ̆r mă lu iĕm pơkă. Wei mă 'blep bĕ đêl nơ̆r iĕm pơkă.

English: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, all Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: ‘Behold, I have sworn by My great name,’ says the LORD, ‘that My name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, “The Lord GOD lives.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa hrei âu oei oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang, khan: ‘'Nâu Inh yua anăn mơsêh tih Inh na pơkă, lăm dêh char Êyiptơ gô ưh pă đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđa ayơ mă gơh ha 'bơ̆r krao apinh anăn Inh dơ̆ng: Sĭt tơpă thoi Kră Yang arih!’

English: Behold, I will watch over them for adversity and not for good. And all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, until there is an end to them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, dang ei Inh răp lăng, wă ăn tơdrong pơmat truh tơ lu sư, ưh kơ trŏ ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk ôh; đĭ lu bơngai Juđa mă oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ gô lôch kơ đao gưm pơngot rơwĕt.

English: Yet a small number who escape the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah; and all the remnant of Judah, who have gone to the land of Egypt to dwell there, shall know whose words will stand, Mine or theirs.
Bahnar: Gô đei lăp tŏ sĕt bơngai đĕch gơh klaih kơ đao gưm, đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ wih brŏk tơ teh đak Juđa. Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđa mă oei oei mă jur năm oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ, gô băt nơ̆r pơma bu sĭt, nơ̆r Inh dah nơ̆r lu sư.”

English: And this shall be a sign to you,’ says the LORD, ‘that I will punish you in this place, that you may know that My words will surely stand against you for adversity.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu boih tơdra Inh wă phak iĕm lăm anih 'nâu, wă kơ lu iĕm băt Inh sĭt tơpă gô ăn tơdrong răm truh tơ lu iĕm.”

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, his enemy who sought his life.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô jao Pharaôn Hôphra, pơtao đe Êyiptơ, lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt kơ sư păng lu bơngai chă wă pơlôch sư, thoi Inh đei jao boih Sêđekia, pơtao đe Juđa, lăm ti Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn, bơngai mă ayăt kơ sư păng wă pơlôch sư.”

English: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the instruction of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying
Bahnar: Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol roi ăn kơ Baruk, kon Nêrêa, lăm sơnôm hla bơar dôm nơ̆r Jêrêmi đŏk; dơ̆ng rŏng kơ Baruk chih pơtao Juđa lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl Jêhôiakim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia pơtao Juđa

English: “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to you, O Baruch
Bahnar: Ơ Baruk! Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ ih thoi âu

English: ‘You said, “Woe is me now! For the LORD has added grief to my sorrow. I fainted in my sighing, and I find no rest.” ’
Bahnar: Ih khan boih ‘răm-'băm kơ inh, yua kơ Kră Yang pơthim ăn kơ inh tơdrong sơ'ngon, tơdrong ơh inh; inh lap dêh yua kơ tơtok tơtăm pă đei pơdơh.’

English: “Thus you shall say to him, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Behold, what I have built I will break down, and what I have planted I will pluck up, that is, this whole land.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ Baruk: ‘Kră Yang khan: Tơmam kiơ Inh pơjing boih Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ sư, kiơ mă Inh đei pơtăm boih Inh gô buch lê̆ sư. Inh gô pơm thoi noh tơ jơ̆p-jang lăm dêh Juđa âu.

English: And do you seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them; for behold, I will bring adversity on all flesh,” says the LORD. “But I will give your life to you as a prize in all places, wherever you go.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lei na, ih oei chă tơdrong plơ̆ng dah kiơ? 'Nĕ kơ chơchă, âu Inh gô ăn tơdrong răm truh kơ đĭ kon bơngai; mă-lei ih, Inh gô ăn kơ ih arih, tơ rim anih ayơ mă ih năm, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.’

English: The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the nations.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol roi gah lu dêh char.

English: Against Egypt. Concerning the army of Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt, which was by the River Euphrates in Carchemish, and which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah
Bahnar: Gah dêh Êyiptơ: Nơ̆r roi gah lu linh Pharaôn Nekô pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, oei cheng Krong Ơphrat tơ pơlei Karchêmis; lu linh mă đơ̆ng tơblah thuơ kơ Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl Jêhôiakim, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia, pơm pơtao đe Juđa.

English: “Order the buckler and shield, And draw near to battle!
Bahnar: “Hơmet bĕ khêl tih iĕ, năm tơblah!

English: Harness the horses, And mount up, you horsemen! Stand forth with your helmets, Polish the spears, Put on the armor!
Bahnar: Ơ lu linh hao aseh, tah bĕ an, hao bĕ! Yơ̆l bĕ môk bơsei, năm săp pơrĕng; pat bĕ tơju, hrŭk ao mam!

English: Why have I seen them dismayed and turned back? Their mighty ones are beaten down; They have speedily fled, And did not look back, For fear was all around,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Liơ inh 'bôh? Lu sư hli tơrơ kơdŭn đĭ tơ rŏng, lu linh tơblah, thuơ kơdâu tơklah tơklang. Pă pơ̆n hue-huo. Tơdrong hli krưp puăn pah!” Noh Kră Yang khan

English: “Do not let the swift flee away, Nor the mighty man escape; They will stumble and fall Toward the north, by the River Euphrates.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơbĕch hơbal kư̆m kơdâu ôn ưh kơ tam, Lu bơngai pran kơtang kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih. Lăm char gah yă-nơ̆m, jê̆ Krong Ơphrat, Lu sư kơtơih pơ̆k!

English: “Who is this coming up like a flood, Whose waters move like the rivers?
Bahnar: Bơngai bu noh, tŏk hơlôk thoi đak Krong Nil, thoi đak krong tih ro hơlôk hơlak?

English: Egypt rises up like a flood, And its waters move like the rivers; And he says, ‘I will go up and cover the earth, I will destroy the city and its inhabitants.’
Bahnar: Noh dêh char Êyiptơ tŏk hơlôk thoi đak Krong Nil, thoi đak krong tih ro hơlôk hơlak. Êyiptơ khan: Inh gô tŏk lơ̆p đĭ teh đak; ‘Inh gô pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei păng kon pơlei lăm noh.’

English: Come up, O horses, and rage, O chariots! And let the mighty men come forth: The Ethiopians and the Libyans who handle the shield, And the Lydians who handle and bend the bow.
Bahnar: Drong tơ anăp bĕ, ơ aseh! Puh mă tĕnh bĕ ơ lu bơngai hao gre aseh! Lu linh năm tơblah yak năm tơ anăp: Lu linh char Êthiôpi păng lu linh char Phut chĕp khêl. Lu linh char Liđi prah hră đam.

English: For this is the day of the Lord GOD of hosts, A day of vengeance, That He may avenge Himself on His adversaries. The sword shall devour; It shall be satiated and made drunk with their blood; For the Lord GOD of hosts has a sacrifice In the north country by the River Euphrates.
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr noh năr Kră Yang; năr Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơm 'mong kơ lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Sư. Đao gưm đe yua koh pơlôch dĭng hrăp huch pham dĭng klaih rơhing; Yua kơ noh Kră Yang Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Pơm giĕng soi pơyơ̆r Tơ lăm char gah yă-nơ̆m cheng Krong Ơphrat.

English: “Go up to Gilead and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of Egypt; In vain you will use many medicines; You shall not be cured.
Bahnar: Ơ adruh hơlai kon adruh Êyiptơ, Năm tŏk bĕ tơ char Gileat iŏk đak pơgang pik; mă ih yua lơ pơgang kư̆m; ưh kơ klaih! Rơka ih hơkar kư̆m ưh kơ tơsir.

English: The nations have heard of your shame, And your cry has filled the land; For the mighty man has stumbled against the mighty; They both have fallen together.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dêh char nai gô kơtơ̆ng ang lu iĕm đei tơdrong mơlâu. Tơ lăm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak gô kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong lu iĕm ôr krao dŏng; linh âu kơtơih kơ linh nai. Bre sư gô pơ̆k pơđĭ.”

English: The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon would come and strike the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơ tơdrong Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn wă năm blah dêh char Êyiptơ

English: “Declare in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol; Proclaim in Noph and in Tahpanhes; Say, ‘Stand fast and prepare yourselves, For the sword devours all around you.’
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, khan bĕ kơ pơlei Mikdôl, pơlei Memphis păng Tahpanhes: ‘Hơmet kơchăng bĕ kơ tơdrong tơblah, đao gưm koh pơlôch puăn pah wang tăp kơ iĕm.’

English: Why are your valiant men swept away? They did not stand Because the LORD drove them away.
Bahnar: Liơ yang Apis mă pran kơtang ih kơdâu boih? Yang rơmo tơno ih ưh kơ kĕ kơ dơ̆ng, yua kơ Kră Yang tơlơ̆ lê̆ sư.

English: He made many fall; Yes, one fell upon another. And they said, ‘Arise! Let us go back to our own people And to the land of our nativity From the oppressing sword.’
Bahnar: Lu sư gô kơtơih pơ̆k. Lu sư gô pơ̆k hơtŭt tơduă lu sư. Lu sư khan: ‘Iung wih brŏk bĕ tơ adrĕch adrung lu bơ̆n, tơ char mă mĕ tơpŭ kơ bơ̆n, weh đơ̆ng đao gưm đe pơjuă pơđep!’

English: They cried there, ‘Pharaoh, king of Egypt, is but a noise. He has passed by the appointed time!’
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu sư gô krao: ‘Pharaôn pơtao Êyiptơ lăp pơma re đĕch. Sư hiong boih tơdrong gơh jei sư.’ ” Sĭt tơpă thoi

English: “As I live,” says the King, Whose name is the LORD of hosts, “Surely as Tabor is among the mountains And as Carmel by the sea, so he shall come.
Bahnar: “Inh arih.” Pơtao, anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh, khan: “Minh 'nu gô truh thoi Kông Tabôr tŏk-bŏk lu kông nai, thoi Kông Karmel cheng dơsĭ.

English: O you daughter dwelling in Egypt, Prepare yourself to go into captivity! For Noph shall be waste and desolate, without inhabitant.
Bahnar: Hơmet bĕ lu tơmam yua năm pơm bơnă. Ơ lu bơngai oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, Yua kơ pơlei Memphis gô jing juơ; đe gô soh pơrăm, ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: “Egypt is a very pretty heifer, But destruction comes, it comes from the north.
Bahnar: Êyiptơ thoi rơmo adruh 'lơ̆ng hơiă, Mă-lei gô đei minh khŭl jop blư bla truh đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m kăp sư.

English: Also her mercenaries are in her midst like fat bulls, For they also are turned back, They have fled away together. They did not stand, For the day of their calamity had come upon them, The time of their punishment.
Bahnar: Mă lu linh sư mưng oei hơdai sư, thoi kon rơmo bek 'lơ̆ng, kư̆m kơdâu tơklah ưh kơ kĕ dơ̆ng ôh. Yua kơ tơdrong răm truh tơ lu sư, trŏ năr phak lu sư boih.

English: Her noise shall go like a serpent, For they shall march with an army And come against her with axes, Like those who chop wood.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơdâu re thoi 'bih hro; yua kơ lu linh ayăt kơ sư truh pran kơtang, chĕp sung năm blah sư, thoi bơngai kăl 'long.

English: “They shall cut down her forest,” says the LORD, “Though it cannot be searched, Because they are innumerable, And more numerous than grasshoppers.
Bahnar: Lu linh ayăt gô năm kăl 'long bri sư,” Kră Yang khan: “Mă khan bri kơdrơ̆ng să. Lu sư lơ thoi lep 'ba, ưh pă kĕ jô̆.

English: The daughter of Egypt shall be ashamed; She shall be delivered into the hand Of the people of the north.”
Bahnar: Lu adruh bơngai Êyiptơ gô mơlâu, Đe gô jao lăm ti kon pơlei gah yă-nơ̆m.”

English: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring punishment on Amon of No, and Pharaoh and Egypt, with their gods and their kings—Pharaoh and those who trust in him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “'Nâu Inh gô phak yang Ammôn, tơ pơlei Thêbes, pơtao Pharaôn, dêh char Êyiptơ păng lu rup yang, lu pơtao sư păng lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Pharaôn.

English: And I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of his servants. Afterward it shall be inhabited as in the days of old,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô jao lu sư lăm ti lu bơngai 'maih chă pơlôch lu sư, lăm ti Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn păng lăm ti lu yŏng linh. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, dêh char Êyiptơ gô đei kon pơlei oei lơ thoi sơ̆,” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “But do not fear, O My servant Jacob, And do not be dismayed, O Israel! For behold, I will save you from afar, And your offspring from the land of their captivity; Jacob shall return, have rest and be at ease; No one shall make him afraid.
Bahnar: “Ơ Jakôp đĭch đam Inh, 'nĕ kơ hli! Ơ Isơrael 'nĕ tơrơ tăr wăr! Inh gô pơklaih ih đơ̆ng anih ataih hơtŏ, dŏng pơklaih adrĕch adrung ih đơ̆ng dêh char mă oei pơm đĭch. Jakôp gô wih brŏk arih jang sa hiôk-hian, ưh pă đei hli kơ bu dơ̆ng.”

English: Do not fear, O Jacob My servant,” says the LORD, “For I am with you; For I will make a complete end of all the nations To which I have driven you, But I will not make a complete end of you. I will rightly correct you, For I will not leave you wholly unpunished.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ Jakôp đĭch đam Inh, ih 'nĕ kơ hli, Inh oei hơdai ih, Inh gô pơrăm đĭ lu dêh char mă Inh đei puh iĕm tơ noh; bĕ gah lu iĕm Inh ưh kơ pơlôch đĭ, mă-lei gô phak bơtho iĕm trŏ tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, ưh kơ đei lê̆ ôh tơdrong phak bơtho iĕm.”

English: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah bơngai Philistin adrol kơ Pharaôn wă blah Gasa.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Behold, waters rise out of the north, And shall be an overflowing flood; They shall overflow the land and all that is in it, The city and those who dwell within; Then the men shall cry, And all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: Đak tŏk đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, jing thoi đak krong ro, lơ̆p jơ̆p kơ dêh char păng đĭ-đăng tơmam lăm teh, lơ̆p lu pơlei păng lơ̆p đĭ kon pơlei oei lăm noh, kon pơlei gô ôr krao, đĭ kon pơlei lăm dêh char gô nhơ̆m hmoi

English: At the noise of the stamping hooves of his strong horses, At the rushing of his chariots, At the rumbling of his wheels, The fathers will not look back for their children, Lacking courage
Bahnar: Lăp kơtơ̆ng jơ̆ng aseh kơdâu re mơdrâp mơdrăp, Gre aseh lu ayăt jơwa ơ-ŭr ơ-ăr, Jơ̆ng gre aseh re dơdĭng dơdăng. Mĕ 'bă pă wêr kon sâu lu sư, lu sư jơ̆ng ti lu sư tơtơ̆ tơtuei tơtuônh.

English: Because of the day that comes to plunder all the Philistines, To cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper who remains; For the LORD shall plunder the Philistines, The remnant of the country of Caphtor.
Bahnar: Yua kơ năr truh boih, wă pơrăm đĭ-đăng bơngai Philistin, wă pơrăm pơlôch lu bơngai mă oei oei. Ưh kơ gơh tơgŭm kon pơlei Tirơ, păng kon pơlei Siđôn. Kră Yang gô pơlôch pơrăm bơngai Philistin lu bơngai mă oei oei lăm bŏl đak Kaptôr.

English: Baldness has come upon Gaza, Ashkelon is cut off With the remnant of their valley. How long will you cut yourself?
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Gasa sơ'ngon gô hơkôih sŏk kơ̆l; kon pơlei Askalon ngăn đĭ, Ơ lu kon pơlei Anakim mă oei oei lăm tơmăn dơnă, lu iĕm wă raih chrek akâu iĕm dĭng dang yơ?

English: “O you sword of the LORD, How long until you are quiet? Put yourself up into your scabbard, Rest and be still!
Bahnar: Ơ đao gưm Kră Yang, dang yơ e wă pơdơh? Dui tơmơ̆t bĕ lăm hơnglop; pơdơh, oei hơđơ̆ng bĕ.

English: How can it be quiet, Seeing the LORD has given it a charge Against Ashkelon and against the seashore? There He has appointed it.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei liơ sư gơh pơdơh. Mưh Kră Yang athei boih. Mưh Kră Yang jao kơ sư athei phak Askalon păng lu pơlei oei cheng đak dơsĭ?”

English: Against Moab. Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Woe to Nebo! For it is plundered, Kirjathaim is shamed and taken; The high stronghold is shamed and dismayed
Bahnar: Gah dêh char Môap. 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, khan: “Mơnat tơpă kơ pơlei Nêbô, đe gô pơrăm sư! Pơlei Kiriathaim mơlâu tơpă đe gô rôp blah iŏk. Pơlei kơjăp gô mơlâu dêh pơchah răm đĭ.

English: No more praise of Moab. In Heshbon they have devised evil against her: ‘Come, and let us cut her off as a nation.’ You also shall be cut down, O Madmen! The sword shall pursue you
Bahnar: Đe ang kơ char Môap ưh pă đei boih; tơ pơlei Hesbôn, lu sư pơđâu wă pơrăm Môap: ‘Bĕ bơ̆n năm pơrăm kon pơlei 'nâu, sŭt lê̆ dĭng pă đei jô̆ Môap lăm lu dêh char dơ̆ng! Ơ pơlei Matmen, ih kư̆m lei-lăi, ăn kơ ih ngăn hreh; đao gưm gô druh kiơ̆ ih.

English: A voice of crying shall be from Horonaim: ‘Plundering and great destruction!’
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r đe ôr đơ̆ng pơlei Hôrônaim: ‘Tơdrong đe pơrăm tih jing juơ rơhiăng!’

English: “Moab is destroyed; Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard
Bahnar: Char Môap đe gô pơrăm. Đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r hmoi ôr tơ pơlei Soar!

English: For in the Ascent of Luhith they ascend with continual weeping; For in the descent of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
Bahnar: Rok trong suăn tŏk tơ pơlei Luhit, lu sư tŏk nhơ̆m hmoi rah; jur tơ krang năm tơ pơlei Hôrônaim, kơtơ̆ng đe nhơ̆m hmoi kơ tơdrong pơrăm.

English: “Flee, save your lives! And be like the juniper in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Kơdâu ôn bĕ, pơklaih kơdih akâu, thoi aseh iĕ lăm char glă!

English: For because you have trusted in your works and your treasures, You also shall be taken. And Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, His priests and his princes together.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih gơnang kơ tơdrong jang păng mŭk tơmam lu iĕm kơdih, Đe kư̆m wă rôp ih hai pơm bơnă, Yang Kêmôs, lu 'bok soi păng lu yŏng lu sư dai năm pơm bơnă.

English: And the plunderer shall come against every city; No one shall escape. The valley also shall perish, And the plain shall be destroyed, As the LORD has spoken.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai chă pơrăm năm tơ jơ̆p pơlei, ưh kơ đei minh pôm pơlei ayơ gơh klaih; đe gô pơrăm tơ kơpal dơnă goh 'biao, kơpal groi kông kư̆m pơchah pơchek. Thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan boih.

English: “Give wings to Moab, That she may flee and get away; For her cities shall be desolate, Without any to dwell in them.
Bahnar: Prôi bĕ 'boh kơ char Môap yua kơ sư gô răm đĭ; lu pơlei gô juơ rơhiăng, ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: Cursed is he who does the work of the LORD deceitfully, And cursed is he who keeps back his sword from blood.
Bahnar: Hiap bĕ lu bơngai jang kơ Kră Yang mă hơlĕnh pơdăr. Hiap bĕ lu bơngai ưh kơ yua đao gưm sư pơlôch đe!

English: “Moab has been at ease from his youth; He has settled on his dregs, And has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, Nor has he gone into captivity. Therefore his taste remained in him, And his scent has not changed.
Bahnar: Môap juăt kơ oei arih hiôk-hian đơ̆ng sơ̆, thoi sik hơmu oei lăm ge, đe ưh tam đei tuh ôh sư đơ̆ng ge 'nâu tơ ge nai; kư̆m tam đei pơm bơnă; lei na hơkăm sư oei hơnơ̆ng huay kơ sap. Thoi sik hơmu 'bâu phu sư ưh kơ tơplih ôh.”

English: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “That I shall send him wine-workers Who will tip him over And empty his vessels And break the bottles.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gô đei năr Inh gô wơh bơngai năm tuh lê̆ lu sư dĭng đĭ, na iŏk teh pơchah lê̆ ge noh.

English: Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, As the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
Bahnar: Bơngai Môap gô mơlâu kơ yang Kêmôs, kư̆m thoi adrĕch bơngai Isơrael mơlâu boih kơ yang Bethel mă lu sư gơnang.

English: “How can you say, ‘We are mighty And strong men for the war’?
Bahnar: Liơ ih pơ̆n pơang khan: ‘Nhôn lu linh nuih păng lu linh pran kơtang lăm anih tơblah?’

English: Moab is plundered and gone up from her cities; Her chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter,” says the King, Whose name is the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Môap đe gô năm pơrăm đĭ păng lu pơlei; lu bơngai tơdăm hơgei hloh đe gô pơlôch đĭ, 'Bok pơtao anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan.

English: “The calamity of Moab is near at hand, And his affliction comes quickly.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơrăm char Môap wă jê̆ boih; tơdrong pơmat-tat truh tĕnh.

English: Bemoan him, all you who are around him; And all you who know his name, Say, ‘How the strong staff is broken, The beautiful rod!’
Bahnar: Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ kơ sư, ơ lu dêh char oei tăp dăr kơ sư, đĭ-đăng bơngai kơtơ̆ng ang anăn sư; khan bĕ; liơ 'long jra pơtao pran kơtang tơgơ̆ boih, 'long jra mă đe ư-ang noh tơgơ̆ răm!

English: “O daughter inhabiting Dibon, Come down from your glory, And sit in thirst; For the plunderer of Moab has come against you, He has destroyed your strongholds.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Dibôn; Jur bĕ đơ̆ng anih ư-ang ih, na hơ-oei tơ teh hrĕng kro. Bơngai pơrăm char Môap gô truh wă pơrăm ih, pơrăm kơđông kơjăp ih.

English: O inhabitant of Aroer, Stand by the way and watch; Ask him who flees And her who escapes; Say, ‘What has happened?’
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Arôe, Răp ngôi lăng bĕ 'bơ̆t cheng trong. Jet bĕ bơngai drŏ-nglo bơngai drŏ-kăn kơdâu hlôi: ‘Đei tơdrong kiơ truh?’

English: Moab is shamed, for he is broken down. Wail and cry! Tell it in Arnon, that Moab is plundered.
Bahnar: Đe hiĕk ăr kơ char Môap, yua kơ sư pơchah boih. Ôr hmoi bĕ! Roi tơbăt bĕ tơ jơ̆p tơring krong Arnôn, char Môap pơrăm đĭ boih.

English: “And judgment has come on the plain country: On Holon and Jahzah and Mephaath
Bahnar: Tơdrong phak truh boih tơ teh dơnă char groi kông: Tơ pơlei Hôlôn, pơlei Jasa, pơlei Mêphaat.

English: On Dibon and Nebo and Beth Diblathaim
Bahnar: Pơlei Dibôn, pơlei Nêbô păng pơlei Bet Diblathaim.

English: On Kirjathaim and Beth Gamul and Beth Meon
Bahnar: Pơlei Kiriathaim, pơlei Bet Gamul păng pơlei Bet Mêôn

English: On Kerioth and Bozrah, On all the cities of the land of Moab, Far or near.
Bahnar: Pơlei Kêriôt, pơlei Bôsra: Đĭ-đăng pơlei tih lăm char Môap jê̆ dah ataih.”

English: The horn of Moab is cut off, And his arm is broken,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hơke Môap chơ̆ng lê̆ boih, kơkŏng ti sư tơgơ̆ boih.

English: “Make him drunk, Because he exalted himself against the LORD. Moab shall wallow in his vomit, And he shall also be in derision.
Bahnar: Pơhuch bĕ kơ lu sư dĭng suai, yua kơ pôk hơtŏk lu sư kơdih wă blah Kră Yang. Môap gô tơgrŏl lăm hăk lu sư kơdih, đe gô hiĕk ăr kơ lu sư.

English: For was not Israel a derision to you? Was he found among thieves? For whenever you speak of him, You shake your head in scorn.
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ lu iĕm sơ̆ kư̆m hiĕk ăr kơ Isơrael? Tam đei đe tơ'bơ̆p rôp Isơrael hơdai hăm lu bơngai tơtông ưh? Lei liơ mah mưh iĕm pơma 'bơm sư iĕm tơtreh kơ̆l che bơle?

English: You who dwell in Moab, Leave the cities and dwell in the rock, And be like the dove which makes her nest In the sides of the cave’s mouth.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei oei lăm char Môap, weh bĕ đơ̆ng pơlei tih, năm oei tơ lăm hơgơp tơmo thoi sem pơgâm 'nơ̆m pơm tơpu lăm trôm kông.

English: “We have heard the pride of Moab (He is exceedingly proud), Of his loftiness and arrogance and pride, And of the haughtiness of his heart.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn kơtơ̆ng boih char Môap pơang dêh, pơrŏ dêh pơm khuơ̆ 'mơng, pơang pơrŏ, pôk kơdih akâu,”

English: “I know his wrath,” says the LORD, “But it is not right; His lies have made nothing right.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh băt kơ tơdrong kơchu sư, pơang tơdrong kơ đei. Tơdrong sư pơm ưh kơ đei yua kiơ.

English: Therefore I will wail for Moab, And I will cry out for all Moab; I will mourn for the men of Kir Heres.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh gô nhơ̆m hmoi kơ char Môap, Inh nhơ̆m ôr yua kơ kon pơlei Môap. Inh nhơ̆m hơdrĭ ơh sơ'ngon kơ kon pơlei Kir Hareset.

English: O vine of Sibmah! I will weep for you with the weeping of Jazer. Your plants have gone over the sea, They reach to the sea of Jazer. The plunderer has fallen on your summer fruit and your vintage.
Bahnar: Ơ tơm hơmu Sipma! Inh nhơ̆m hmoi kơ ih hloh kơ inh đei nhơ̆m hmoi pơlei Jaser. Dơng ih prơng ataih truh tơ dơsĭ. Dĭng truh tơ pơlei Jaser; bơngai năm pơrăm plei 'long bơyan phang păng plei hơmu ih đum lăm bơyan.

English: Joy and gladness are taken From the plentiful field And from the land of Moab; I have caused wine to fail from the winepresses; No one will tread with joyous shouting— Not joyous shouting!
Bahnar: Tơdrong chơt hiôk 'nă hal đơ̆ng lăm mir chŭn ưh pă đei boih lăm char Môap. Inh pơhrơ̆ lê̆ đak sik plei hơmu đơ̆ng lăm anih đe hmĕt. Ưh pă đei bu hiĕk chơt hmĕt plei hơmu dơ̆ng: Tơdrong lu sư hiĕk chơt hiôk ưh pă đei hiôk chơt boih.

English: “From the cry of Heshbon to Elealeh and to Jahaz They have uttered their voice, From Zoar to Horonaim, Like a three-year-old heifer; For the waters of Nimrim also shall be desolate.
Bahnar: Hmoi ôr đơ̆ng pơlei Hesbôn kơtơ̆ng truh tơ pơlei Êlêaleh păng pơlei Jahas, đơ̆ng pơlei Soar dĭng truh tơ pơlei Hôrônaim păng pơlei Êglat Sêlisia. Mă đak glung Nimrim kư̆m hrơ̆ boih.”

English: “Moreover,” says the LORD, “I will cause to cease in Moab The one who offers sacrifices in the high places And burns incense to his gods.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ lăm char Môap lu bơngai pơyơ̆r tơmam soi pơm yang tơ anih kơjung, păng soh nhang 'bâu phu kơ rup yang.

English: Therefore My heart shall wail like flutes for Moab, And like flutes My heart shall wail For the men of Kir Heres. Therefore the riches they have acquired have perished.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, jơhngơ̆m Inh hmoi ôr re thoi 'lal yua kơ char Môap; Inh kư̆m hmoi ôr re thoi 'lal kơ lu kon pơlei Kir Hareset, mŭk tơmam lu sư mong răk hiong đĭ boih.

English: “For every head shall be bald, and every beard clipped; On all the hands shall be cuts, and on the loins sackcloth
Bahnar: Rim 'nu hơkôih boih kơ̆l 'ngôch, hơkôih boih sŏk kang, raih chrek ti rơka, tơ̆n ao 'bi tơ kơiĕng.

English: A general lamentation On all the housetops of Moab, And in its streets; For I have broken Moab like a vessel in which is no pleasure,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơ rim bơbŭng hnam, păng tơ anih đe juăt akŭm lăm pơlei, tă kơ nhơ̆m hmoi ngăl lăm char Môap Inh teh pơchah boih char Môap, thoi ge ưh kơ đei bu wă,” Kră Yang khan

English: “They shall wail: ‘How she is broken down! How Moab has turned her back with shame!’ So Moab shall be a derision And a dismay to all those about her.”
Bahnar: “To, Môap pơchah pơchek boih! Lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ol! Môap tơwih rŏng mơlâu dêh tơpă boih! Lei na char Môap pơm kơ đe hiĕk ăr, pơm kơ đĭ lu dêh char tăp dăr kơ sư lăng 'brơ̆ krưp dêh.”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Behold, one shall fly like an eagle, And spread his wings over Moab.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “To, minh 'nu ayăt gô păr jruh thoi klang, bơyar pơnăr sư pơm kơ char Môap.

English: Kerioth is taken, And the strongholds are surprised; The mighty men’s hearts in Moab on that day shall be Like the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
Bahnar: Pơlei Kêriôt đe gô blah iŏk, lu kơđông kơjăp đe iŏk; lăm năr noh lu linh nuih kơtang char Môap jơhngơ̆m lu sư thoi drŏ-kăn hơiơch.

English: And Moab shall be destroyed as a people, Because he exalted himself against the LORD.
Bahnar: Char Môap đe gô pơrăm, sư ưh pă jing kon pơlei pơla dơ̆ng; yua kơ lu sư pơang pôk hơtŏk lu sư kơdih blah Kră Yang.”

English: Fear and the pit and the snare shall be upon you, O inhabitant of Moab,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ kon pơlei Môap! Tơdrong kơnê̆ hli krưp sơlŭng jrŭ, hơđong đăk lê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp ih.

English: “He who flees from the fear shall fall into the pit, And he who gets out of the pit shall be caught in the snare. For upon Moab, upon it I will bring The year of their punishment,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kơdâu hlôi đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ hli dêh gô huŏng lăm sơlŭng jrŭ. Bơngai bu tŏk hlôi đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ gô 'leh hơđong, yua kơ Inh wă ăn tơdrong noh kơ char Môap, lăm sơnăm Inh phak lu sư.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Those who fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon Because of exhaustion. But a fire shall come out of Heshbon, A flame from the midst of Sihon, And shall devour the brow of Moab, The crown of the head of the sons of tumult.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơdâu klĕnh lap rơmơ̆n lu sư ôn pơdơh lăm yơ̆p pơlei Hesbôn; ưh pă đei bu gơh tơgŭm yua kơ đei ŭnh sa lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Hesbôn, pla ŭnh đơ̆ng hnam pơtao Sihôn; ŭnh noh soh pơrăm đĭ char Môap, păng sa kơting kơ̆l lu bơngai jreo tơkĕch kơ chu, pơang dih kâu.

English: Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh perish; For your sons have been taken captive, And your daughters captive.
Bahnar: Ơ char Môap, răm-'băm kơ ih! Kon pơlei kơkuh kơ yang Kêmôs pơlôch tơhiong đĭ boih, lu kon drŏ-nglo ih đe rôp chông ba, kon drŏ-kăn ih đe rôp pơm bơnă boih.

English: “Yet I will bring back the captives of Moab In the latter days,” says the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
Bahnar: Mă-lei truh năr hơtuch kơnh Inh gô pơdrâu iŏk lu bơngai bơnă char Môap brŏk,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh. Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol kơ bơngai Môap tôch đĭ 'bơ̆t dâu.

English: Against the Ammonites. Thus says the LORD: “Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then does Milcom inherit Gad, And his people dwell in its cities?
