Bahnar: Gah dêh char Ammôn! Kră Yang khan: “Bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo hă? Ưh pă đei kon wă pơtrơp ioi hă? Liơ mă lê̆ kơ bơngai Amnôn mă kơkuh kơ yang Molek tơgar iŏk char Gat, kon pơlei sư oei lăm lu pơlei Gat?

English: Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “That I will cause to be heard an alarm of war In Rabbah of the Ammonites; It shall be a desolate mound, And her villages shall be burned with fire. Then Israel shall take possession of his inheritance,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr gô truh, Kră Yang khan; “Inh gô ăn nơ̆r ôr krao tơdrong tơblah tơ pơlei tih Rapba lăm char kon pơlei Ammôn; pơlei noh gô jing pôi rơ̆m rĕk. Lu pơlei iĕ tăp dăr kơ sư đe gô soh kơplah noh, lu bơngai Isơrael gô druh blah lu linh mă đêl druh blah lu sư, Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is plundered! Cry, you daughters of Rabbah, Gird yourselves with sackcloth! Lament and run to and fro by the walls; For Milcom shall go into captivity With his priests and his princes together.
Bahnar: “Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ! Ơ pơlei Hesbôn, yua kơ đe pơrăm boih pơlei Ahi! Nhơ̆m bĕ, ơ kon pơlei Rapba! Ôr krao bĕ, hrŭk bĕ ao 'bi, tŭr kơtơh, raih akâu bĕ na kơdâu tơ âu tơ noh! Yua kơ yang Molek gô chĕp ba, hơdai hăm lu 'bok soi, hăm lu yŏng sư, năm pơm bơnă đe.

English: Why do you boast in the valleys, Your flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? Who trusted in her treasures, saying, ‘Who will come against me?’
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei ưh kơ tơpăt, liơ lu iĕm pơư kơdih anih thŭng, khan teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng? Gơnang kơ mŭk tơmam kơdih păng khan: ‘Bu pơ̆n pơm kơ inh?’ ”

English: Behold, I will bring fear upon you,” Says the Lord GOD of hosts, “From all those who are around you; You shall be driven out, everyone headlong, And no one will gather those who wander off.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô tuh ăn tơdrong kơnê̆ hli krưp truh tơ lu iĕm, đơ̆ng rim dêh char mă oei tăp dăr, lu iĕm gô kơdâu tơklah tơklang, ưh kơ đei bu gô akŭm lu bơngai mă kơdâu ôn

English: But afterward I will bring back The captives of the people of Ammon,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: mă-lei dơning dơmônh Inh gô iŏk tơwih lu kon sâu Ammôn brŏk đơ̆ng pơm đĭch, bơnă đe. Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Against Edom. Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Is wisdom no more in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?
Bahnar: Gah dêh char Eđôm: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lăm pơlei Têman ưh pă đei bơngai gơh hơgei boih hă? Lu bơngai gơh hơgei ưh pă đei đon pơđâu boih hă? Tơdrong hơgei sư hiong đĭ boih hă?

English: Flee, turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan! For I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, The time that I will punish him.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei oei lăm plei Đêdan! Bơkuĕch kơdâu bĕ, oei bĕ tơ lăm trôm kông jrŭ; Inh wă ăn tơdrong truh pơrăm Êsâu. Lăm năr Inh phak sư.

English: If grape-gatherers came to you, Would they not leave some gleaning grapes? If thieves by night, Would they not destroy until they have enough?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai phĕ hơmu truh tơ mir iĕm, hăm trŏ lu sư phĕ oei lê̆ plei tŏ sĕt ưh? Lu bơngai phĕ tơtông kơmăng, hăm trŏ lu sư phĕ tơtông lăp mah kơ lu sư đĕch?

English: But I have made Esau bare; I have uncovered his secret places, And he shall not be able to hide himself. His descendants are plundered, His brethren and his neighbors, And he is no more.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô iŏk đĭ mŭk tơmam Êsâu, Inh pơih pơdah đĭ boih anih lu sư ôn, na kơ lu sư ưh pă gơh ôn đơ̆ng. Đe pơrăm pơlôch đĭ boih lu kon sâu sư, 'nhŏng oh sư, lu bơngai rông 'bôt sư, lu sư ưh pă đei bu oei arih. Ưh kơ đei bu chro ti dŏng tơgŭma

English: Leave your fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; And let your widows trust in Me.”
Bahnar: Lê̆ bĕ lu kon mơti iĕm kơ inh; Inh gô wei rong lu sư; Lu drŏ-kăn adro kư̆m gơh lui gơnang kơ inh.’ ”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Behold, those whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunk. And are you the one who will altogether go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, but you shall surely drink of it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơdah lu bơngai mă ưh kơ trŏ huch pơnhan 'nâu, athei huch; lei liơ ih hăm gơh klaih đơ̆ng phak ưh? Ih ưh kơ gơh klaih ôh đơ̆ng tơdrong phak. Sĭt tơpă ih gô huch pơnhan 'nâu.”

English: For I have sworn by Myself,” says the LORD, “that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. And all its cities shall be perpetual wastes.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh pơkă hăm anăn Inh kơdih, pơlei Bôsra gô jing rơ̆m rĕk, đe lăng 'brơ̆ krưp, đe hiĕk ăr, blei hiap păng pŭ hơngiap, lu pơlei sư gô jing rơ̆m rĕk, pơchah răm ling-lang hloi.”

English: I have heard a message from the LORD, And an ambassador has been sent to the nations: “Gather together, come against her, And rise up to battle!
Bahnar: Tơdrong inh 'nao kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang, Sư ăn boih minh 'nu bơngai năm roi tơbăt tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak: “Akŭm băl bĕ wă blah sư, iung hơmet năm tơblah bĕ!

English: “For indeed, I will make you small among nations, Despised among men.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh gô pơm kơ ih jing iĕ tơrăn hloh kơ lu dêh char, păng đe gơ̆ pơjăm.

English: Your fierceness has deceived you, The pride of your heart, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, Who hold the height of the hill! Though you make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ đe hli tơrơ, tơdrong kơnê̆ ih, tơdrong ih pơang blơ̆ ih boih; ơ bơngai mă oei lăm hơgơp tơmo. Oei kơpal wĕch kông; mă khan ih pơm tơpu kơjung thoi sem klang.” Inh gô tơhuŏng ih đơ̆ng noh, Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Edom also shall be an astonishment; Everyone who goes by it will be astonished And will hiss at all its plagues.
Bahnar: Pơlei Eđôm gô jing rơ̆m rĕk; rim 'nu yak trong 'nâu tă kơ jăng krưp. Yua kơ 'bôh tơdrong truh tih krưp tơpă.

English: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah And their neighbors,” says the LORD, “No one shall remain there, Nor shall a son of man dwell in it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Êđôm đe kư̆m gô pơrăm thoi pơlei Sôđôm Gômôrơ, păng lu pơlei tăp dăr. Gô ưh pă đei bơngai bu oei lăm noh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu chă oei pơdơh tơ noh mơ̆n.

English: “Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan Against the dwelling place of the strong; But I will suddenly make him run away from her. And who is a chosen man that I may appoint over her? For who is like Me? Who will arraign Me? And who is that shepherd Who will withstand Me?”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, thoi dăm-brang đơ̆ng bri brah Krong Jôrđăn năm mơ̆t lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt hơdrih 'lơ̆ng, Inh gô puh hloi lu bơngai Êđôm, Inh gô ăn yŏng pơgơ̆r sư kiơ̆ kơ Inh rơih iŏk, Bu thoi Inh? Bu pơ̆n athei Inh? Bơngai wei triu bu pơ̆n blah Inh?

English: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD that He has taken against Edom, And His purposes that He has proposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out; Surely He shall make their dwelling places desolate with them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh mơ̆ng bĕ Kră Yang wă pơm kơ char Eđôm, păng tơdrong sư pơkă wă pơm kơ kon pơlei Têman: Mă lu kon triu oei iĕ đe gô rôp ba pơđĭ, Tơpă sư gô pơrăm lê̆ tơmăn 'nhĕt lu sư.

English: The earth shakes at the noise of their fall; At the cry its noise is heard at the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Tơdah kơtơ̆ng lu sư pơchah răm, lăm teh đak pơpơ̆; kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr krao truh tơ Dơsĭ 'Brê.

English: Behold, He shall come up and fly like the eagle, And spread His wings over Bozrah; The heart of the mighty men of Edom in that day shall be Like the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, lu ayăt thoi sem klang păr jruh, Bơyar pơnăr sư pơm kơ pơlei Bôsra, Lăm năr noh jơhngơ̆m lu drŏ-nglo nuih pran char Eđôm nhen thoi jơhngơ̆m bơngai drŏ-kăn oei tŏk-bŏk hơiơch.”

English: Against Damascus. “Hamath and Arpad are shamed, For they have heard bad news. They are fainthearted; There is trouble on the sea; It cannot be quiet.
Bahnar: Khan lê̆ adrol gah pơlei Đamas: Pơlei Hamat păng pơlei Arpat hli tơrơ; yua kơ lu sư 'nao kơtơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆; lu sư tơtăm hơwơ̆l hơwang, thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă.

English: Damascus has grown feeble; She turns to flee, And fear has seized her. Anguish and sorrows have taken her like a woman in labor.
Bahnar: Pơlei Đamas jơhngơ̆m rơdu boih, kơdŭn kơdâu ôn; hli tơrơ. Jĭ tuĕnh, thoi drŏ-kăn tŏk-bŏk oei hơiơch.

English: Why is the city of praise not deserted, the city of My joy?
Bahnar: Ô pơlei đe ư-ang, pơlei tih hiôk chơt Đê̆ hiơt đĭ boih

English: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, And all the men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Thoi ei, na lu kon tơdăm iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch rok trong tih lăm pơlei lăm năr noh. Păng đĭ-đăng lu linh iĕm gô pơ̆k pă đei pơpơ̆

English: “I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, And it shall consume the palaces of Ben-Hadad.”
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk ŭnh soh dur pơlei Đamas, Ŭnh gô sa truh tơ hnam kơjăp pơtao Ben Hadat.

English: Against Kedar and against the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon shall strike. Thus says the LORD: “Arise, go up to Kedar, And devastate the men of the East!
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai Kêdar păng kon pơlei tơring char Hasor mă Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn blah iŏk boih. 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Iung bĕ, năm blah lu bơngai Kêdar, Pơrăm lu kon pơlei gah hơlĕch.

English: Their tents and their flocks they shall take away. They shall take for themselves their curtains, All their vessels and their camels; And they shall cry out to them, ‘Fear is on every side!’
Bahnar: Đe gô iŏk đĭ bơsŭn păng puh ba lu kon sem dơrong lu sư, pơk hnam păng đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam lu sư. Đe gô puh ba đĭ lu aseh lăk-đa lu sư. Lu bơngai drŏ-nglo ôr krao. ‘Đei tơdrong hli krưp tăp tang!’

English: “Flee, get far away! Dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Hazor!” says the LORD. “For Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, And has conceived a plan against you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ lu kon pơlei oei lăm tơring char Hasor, kơdâu ôn bĕ, kơdâu mă ataih: Oei bĕ lăm trôm kông jrŭ. Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn hơmet wă tơblah păng iĕm bơih; lu sư pơkă wă pơrăm lu iĕm.”

English: “Arise, go up to the wealthy nation that dwells securely,” says the LORD, “Which has neither gates nor bars, Dwelling alone.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Iung blah bĕ, kon pơlei mă oei hiôk-hian, kon pơlei noh ưh kơ đei 'măng jang, păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei 'long chơkăl păng oei adrô̆.

English: Their camels shall be for booty, And the multitude of their cattle for plunder. I will scatter to all winds those in the farthest corners, And I will bring their calamity from all its sides,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Plah tơgar iŏk, lu lăk-đa lu sư đe gô Kŭm plah tơgar iŏk lơ sem dơrong, triu lu sư. Inh gô pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai hơkôih sŏk kơ̆l, tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p-jang puăn pah teh đak. Inh gô ăn tơdrong truh pơrăm lu sư, đơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ lu sư. Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Hazor shall be a dwelling for jackals, a desolation forever; No one shall reside there, Nor son of man dwell in it.”
Bahnar: “Tơring char Hasor jing anih ăn kơ kŏ bri oei ling-lang, Jing juơ tơtŭng hlŏng hloi. Ưh kơ đei bu oei tơ noh, ưh pă đei bơngai bu dơ̆ng pơm anih oei tơ noh!

English: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah dêh char Êlam, kơplah Sêđekia pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh Juđa.

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, The foremost of their might.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “'Nâu, Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ hră char Êlam, 'Nâu boih mă tơdrong pran kơtang tơm lu sư.

English: Against Elam I will bring the four winds From the four quarters of heaven, And scatter them toward all those winds; There shall be no nations where the outcasts of Elam will not go.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn đei puăn trong kial đơ̆ng puăn pah bah blah char Êlam; Inh gô săi lu sư tơklah tơklang kiơ̆ kơ puăn trong kial noh; dĭng ưh pă đei char ayơ mă ưh kơ đei bơngai Êlam năm oei.

English: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies And before those who seek their life. I will bring disaster upon them, My fierce anger,’ says the LORD; ‘And I will send the sword after them Until I have consumed them.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ bơngai Êlam hli tơrơ 'bơ̆t anăp lu ayăt kơ sư, 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai wă pơlôch lu sư.” Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô ăn tơdrong răm truh, ăn tơdrong Inh hil mĭl tơtŏ, tuh tơ kơpal lu sư; Inh gô ăn đao gưm druh lu sư, dĭng truh tơ Inh pơlôch pơrăm lu sư.”

English: I will set My throne in Elam, And will destroy from there the king and the princes,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô pơdơ̆ng tang-dŏ pơtao Inh lăm Êlam. Pơrăm pơlôch lu pơtao păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r sư.

English: ‘But it shall come to pass in the latter days: I will bring back the captives of Elam,’ says the LORD.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm chăl đơ̆ng rŏng, inh gô tơiung lu bơngai Êlam wih brŏk đơ̆ng pơm bơnă. Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: The word that the LORD spoke against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol khan gah Babilôn păng teh đak bơngai Kalđê

English: “Declare among the nations, Proclaim, and set up a standard; Proclaim—do not conceal it— Say, ‘Babylon is taken, Bel is shamed. Merodach is broken in pieces; Her idols are humiliated, Her images are broken in pieces.’
Bahnar: “Roi pơdah bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char, tơbăt bĕ, hơtŏk hla-kơ păng tơbăt bĕ, 'nĕ kơ ôn ôh tơdrong 'noh, tơbăt bĕ: ‘Đe gô iŏk Babilôn, đe pơm kơ yang Bel mơlâu, yang Mêrôđak 'bĕnh kơ hli tơrơ. Đĭ lu rup yang mơlâu, lu rup yang hli tơrơ.

English: For out of the north a nation comes up against her, Which shall make her land desolate, And no one shall dwell therein. They shall move, they shall depart, Both man and beast.
Bahnar: Đei dêh char đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m blah sư, Pơm kơ dêh char noh jing juơ tơtŭng. Tơ noh pă đei bơngai oei, Mă kon bơngai păng lu kon sem brem kơdâu jăk đĭ.”

English: “In those days and in that time,” says the LORD, “The children of Israel shall come, They and the children of Judah together; With continual weeping they shall come, And seek the LORD their God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm lu năr noh, lăm kơplah noh, bơngai Isơrael păng bơngai Juđa năm hơdai, yak rah nhơ̆m rah, Chơchă Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: They shall ask the way to Zion, With their faces toward it, saying, ‘Come and let us join ourselves to the LORD In a perpetual covenant That will not be forgotten.’
Bahnar: Lu sư jet chă trong năm tơ pơlei Siôn, Lu sư tơwih anăp tơklă tơ pơlei noh: ‘Bĕ bơ̆n yak, truh tơ noh wă pơkă hăm Kră Yang. Hăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ hiơt.’ ”

English: “My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds have led them astray; They have turned them away on the mountains. They have gone from mountain to hill; They have forgotten their resting place.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh thoi khŭl triu lôch hiong boih; Lu bơngai wei triu ba lu sư wơ̆l jrok, Achăng lê̆ lu sư jrok kơpal kông, lu sư chă sa đơ̆ng kông păng tơ groi, Pă băt boih trong wih tơ hơdrong kơdih.

English: All who found them have devoured them; And their adversaries said, ‘We have not offended, Because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, The LORD, the hope of their fathers.’
Bahnar: Đe bu tơ'bơ̆p lu sư rôp 'buh sa; Lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư khan. ‘Lu nhôn ưh kơ pơm yoch ôh, Lu sư pơm yoch boih hăm Kră Yang, Sư boih mă tơmăn 'nhĕt tơpă. Păng tơm tơdrong 'bok yă lu sư gơnang, Sư boih Kră Yang.’

English: “Move from the midst of Babylon, Go out of the land of the Chaldeans; And be like the rams before the flocks.
Bahnar: Kơdâu bĕ đơ̆ng dêh char Babilôn, Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng char bơngai Kalđê, Pơm thoi bơbe bram chông khŭl bơbe.

English: For behold, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon An assembly of great nations from the north country, And they shall array themselves against her; From there she shall be captured. Their arrows shall be like those of an expert warrior; None shall return in vain.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh gô tơiung lơ dêh char pơgơ̆p băl đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, lu sư gô mơ̆t blah dêh char Babilôn, Lu sư dă linh wă blah iŏk; 'brơ̆m lu sư prah thoi 'brơ̆m lu linh tơblah hơgei, ưh kơ đei brŏk hoh.”

English: And Chaldea shall become plunder; All who plunder her shall be satisfied,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Dêh char Kalđê đe gô blah tơgar iŏk, Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă blah iŏk lu sư noh gô phĭ hrăp, Kră Yang khan.

English: “Because you were glad, because you rejoiced, You destroyers of My heritage, Because you have grown fat like a heifer threshing grain, And you bellow like bulls
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai mă blah iŏk mŭk tơmam Inh. Mă lu iĕm chơt hiôk 'nă hal, Mă lu iĕm pơplŏng thoi kon rơmo adruh lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt.a Hmoi thoi aseh tơno.

English: Your mother shall be deeply ashamed; She who bore you shall be ashamed. Behold, the least of the nations shall be a wilderness, A dry land and a desert.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă mĕ lu iĕm gô mơlâu dêh, bơngai tơpŭ kơ iĕm gô pŭ mơlâu, 'Nâu teh đak gô kơlĕl lŭch, Minh anih glă teh hrĕng kro jing juơ.

English: Because of the wrath of the LORD She shall not be inhabited, But she shall be wholly desolate. Everyone who goes by Babylon shall be horrified And hiss at all her plagues.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang hil mĭl, Jơ̆p kơ dêh char noh jing juơ tơtŭng, ưh kơ đei bơngai oei, na lu bơngai yak năm rok trong Babilôn lăng hlĭch krưp păng che bơle, Yua kơ pơchah răm đĭ 'biao.

English: “Put yourselves in array against Babylon all around, All you who bend the bow; Shoot at her, spare no arrows, For she has sinned against the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai chĕp hră, Dă bĕ lu iĕm tăp dăr dêh char Babilôn, Prah bĕ 'nĕ 'mêm kơ 'brơ̆m, Yua kơ sư pơm yoch blah Kră Yang.

English: Shout against her all around; She has given her hand, Her foundations have fallen, Her walls are thrown down; For it is the vengeance of the LORD. Take vengeance on her. As she has done, so do to her.
Bahnar: Jreo tơkĕch bĕ tăp dăr puăn pah. Sư yơ̆r ti thuơ boih, Lu hnam gak pơchah boih, Dur pơlei teh pơchah hơlih boih: Noh tơdrong Kră Yang pơm 'mong! Pơm 'mong bĕ! Pơm 'mong kơ sư thoi sư đei pơm boih kơ đe.

English: Cut off the sower from Babylon, And him who handles the sickle at harvest time. For fear of the oppressing sword Everyone shall turn to his own people, And everyone shall flee to his own land.
Bahnar: Pơrăm bĕ bơngai rei adrĕch đơ̆ng lăm dêh char Babilôn hăm bơngai mă chĕp săng kô bơyan yuă; yua kơ đao lu bơngai wă blah pơrăm, ăn kơ rim 'nu brŏk tơ kon pơlei sư kơdih rim 'nu kơdâu brŏk tơ char sư kơdih.

English: “Israel is like scattered sheep; The lions have driven him away. First the king of Assyria devoured him; Now at last this Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.”
Bahnar: Isơrael boih khŭl triu jrok, Đei dăm-brang druh rôp. Adrol sơ̆ pơtao Asiri hek sa lu sư boih; Đơ̆ng rŏng Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, kăp rĕn kơting sư.”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, As I have punished the king of Assyria.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “'Nâu Inh gô phak pơtao Babilôn păng dêh char sư, Kŭm thoi inh phak boih pơtao Asiri.

English: But I will bring back Israel to his home, And he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan; His soul shall be satisfied on Mount Ephraim and Gilead.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô chông bơngai Isơrael brŏk tơ anih 'nhĕt sư. Lu sư gô sa 'nhĕt tơ kông Karmel păng lăm groi Basan, lu sư gô sa phĭ hrăp tơ groi Êphraim păng lăm char Gileat.”

English: In those days and in that time,” says the LORD, “The iniquity of Israel shall be sought, but there shall be none; And the sins of Judah, but they shall not be found; For I will pardon those whom I preserve.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh, kơplah noh. Đe chă tơdrong glăi lăm lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ 'bôh ôh. Đe chă tơdrong yoch lăm lu bơngai Juđa kư̆m ưh kơ đei. Yua kơ Inh mơnat ăn huay pă jô̆ boih kơ lu bơngai, mă Inh oei 'măn lê̆ arih.”

English: “Go up against the land of Merathaim, against it, And against the inhabitants of Pekod. Waste and utterly destroy them,” says the LORD, “And do according to all that I have commanded you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Năm tŏk blah bĕ kon pơlei Mêrathaim păng pơm kơ lu bơngai oei lăm char Pêkôt. Pơlôch pơrăm đĭ-đăng lu sư, Pơm bĕ đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong Inh đei tơtă boih kơ iĕm.

English: A sound of battle is in the land, And of great destruction.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng re đe krao ôr tơdrong tơblah lăm char, Đe pơrăm tih tơpă jơ̆p-jang anih.

English: How the hammer of the whole earth has been cut apart and broken! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
Bahnar: Ô lăng deh, đe teh tơgơ̆ pơchah boih Babilôn sư thoi mut teh pơrăm jơ̆p kơ teh đak! Babilôn jing juơ rơ̆m rĕk lăm teh đak, lăng krưp.

English: I have laid a snare for you; You have indeed been trapped, O Babylon, And you were not aware; You have been found and also caught, Because you have contended against the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ Babilôn, Inh hơ'năk boih hơđong kơ ih. Ih 'leh boih hơđong, ơ Babilôn, mă-lei ih ưh kơ băt. Đe chă wă rôp ih boih; Yua kơ ih blah Kră Yang.

English: The LORD has opened His armory, And has brought out the weapons of His indignation; For this is the work of the Lord GOD of hosts In the land of the Chaldeans.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơih boih hnam tah tơmam tơblah Sư, Klơ̆m tơ 'nguaih boih tơmam tơblah Sư hil mĭl; Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei minh tơdrong athei pơm, Lăm teh đak bơngai Kalđê.

English: Come against her from the farthest border; Open her storehouses; Cast her up as heaps of ruins, And destroy her utterly; Let nothing of her be left.
Bahnar: Năm pơm bĕ kơ sư đơ̆ng rim anih ataih, pơih bĕ pơk 'ba sư; pơpôi đĭ minh 'bôt thoi pôi 'ba. Pơlôch pơgoh bĕ, 'Nĕ pă lê̆ minh 'nu bu!

English: Slay all her bulls, Let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them! For their day has come, the time of their punishment.
Bahnar: 'Bet pơlôch bĕ đĭ-đăng rơmo tơno sư; ba tơ anih đe pơm 'nhĕm! Răm-'băm tơpă kơ lu sư, truh boih năr mă phak lu sư.

English: The voice of those who flee and escape from the land of Babylon Declares in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, The vengeance of His temple.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ, nơ̆r krao ôr đơ̆ng lu bơngai kơdâu klaih hlôi đơ̆ng dêh char Babilôn, Roi tơbăt lăm pơlei Siôn. Tơdrong Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, Sư pơm 'mong hnam Sư.

English: “Call together the archers against Babylon. All you who bend the bow, encamp against it all around; Let none of them escape. Repay her according to her work; According to all she has done, do to her; For she has been proud against the LORD, Against the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Krao bĕ lu bơngai chĕp hră, Blah prah pơlei Babilôn; Wang tăp dăr kơ pơlei; 'nĕ ăn kơ minh 'nu klaih! Pơm bĕ kơ sư thoi sư đei pơm kơ đe, pơm 'mong tơwih kơ sư thoi sư đei pơm boih; Yua kơ sư pơang blah plơ̆ Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: Therefore her young men shall fall in the streets, And all her men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu kon tơdăm sư gô lôch pơ̆k tơ rok trong pơlei; Păng lăm năr noh, lu linh tơblah gô lôch đĭ.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Behold, I am against you, O most haughty one!” says the Lord GOD of hosts; “For your day has come, The time that I will punish you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Ơ dêh char pơang, 'nâu inh hil blah ih! Năr ih truh boih, Năr jơ Inh wă phak pơmat ih truh boih.

English: The most proud shall stumble and fall, And no one will raise him up; I will kindle a fire in his cities, And it will devour all around him.”
Bahnar: Dêh char pơang gô kơtơih păng pơ̆k, Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tơiung sư, Inh gô iŏk ŭnh soh lu pơlei sư, Ŭnh gô sa đĭ-đăng tơmam tăp dăr kơ sư.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “The children of Israel were oppressed, Along with the children of Judah; All who took them captive have held them fast; They have refused to let them go.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Kon pơlei Isơrael đe pơjuă pơđep păng Juđa kư̆m lei-lăi, Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă rôp lu sư, Rôp pơkơ̆ng lu sư kơjăp ưh kơ wă achăng lu sư.

English: Their Redeemer is strong; The LORD of hosts is His name. He will thoroughly plead their case, That He may give rest to the land, And disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Tơ'ngla mă dŏng pơklaih lu sư pran kơtang tơpă; anăn sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Sư gô dŏng lu sư tơpă, Ăn jơ̆p kơ teh đak sư hiôk-hian, Mă-lei kon pơlei Babilôn đei chhŭr nuih.”

English: “A sword is against the Chaldeans,” says the LORD, “Against the inhabitants of Babylon, And against her princes and her wise men.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đao gưm gô blah plơ̆ bơngai Kalđê, lu kon pơlei oei lăm Babilôn, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu bơngai hơgei lăm char sư.

English: A sword is against the soothsayers, and they will be fools. A sword is against her mighty men, and they will be dismayed.
Bahnar: Đao gưm pơm kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ô hơlĕnh, Lu sư gô jing bơngai kơwao! Đao gưm blah plơ̆ lu linh pran kơtang, lu sư gô hli tơrơ.

English: A sword is against their horses, Against their chariots, And against all the mixed peoples who are in her midst; And they will become like women. A sword is against her treasures, and they will be robbed.
Bahnar: Đao gưm blah plơ̆ lu aseh păng gre aseh, Păng đĭ-đăng lu linh đơ̆ng tơmoi, Pơm kơ lu sư gô jing thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn! Đao gưm blah lu hnam mong mŭk tơmam gĭt ăn kơ đe tơgar iŏk đĭ mŭk tơmam lu sư.

English: A drought is against her waters, and they will be dried up. For it is the land of carved images, And they are insane with their idols.
Bahnar: Phang-ang, pơhrơ̆ đĭ rim đak! Ăn kơ rim đak hrĕng kro. Yua kơ char noh kơkuh kơ rup yang, Yua kơ kiơ̆ lu rup yang noh na lu sư jing wơnh.

English: “Therefore the wild desert beasts shall dwell there with the jackals, And the ostriches shall dwell in it. It shall be inhabited no more forever, Nor shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na sem bri, kŏ-so, bơrơ̆m oei lăm noh; Ưh pă đei bu oei tơ noh dơ̆ng, đơ̆ng chăl âu truh tơ chăl nai. Pă đei bơngai oei boih.”

English: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah And their neighbors,” says the LORD, “So no one shall reside there, Nor son of man dwell in it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Thoi kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm pơlei Sôđôm, Gômôrơ păng lu pơlei tăp dăr kơ sư, gô ưh pă đei bơngai oei tơ noh. Kŭm ưh pă đei bu pơm pơlei oei tơ noh.

English: “Behold, a people shall come from the north, And a great nation and many kings Shall be raised up from the ends of the earth.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, đei minh khŭl kon pơlei truh đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m, minh pôm dêh char tih pran kơtang. Păng đei lơ pơtao iung năm đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh.

English: They shall hold the bow and the lance; They are cruel and shall not show mercy. Their voice shall roar like the sea; They shall ride on horses, Set in array, like a man for the battle, Against you, O daughter of Babylon.
Bahnar: Lu sư chĕp hră, tơju, khĕnh dêh ưh kơ đei băt mơnat. Jơwa re lu sư thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă; lu sư hao aseh. Lu sư hơmet lê̆ thoi linh năm tơblah wă tơblah hăm ih. Ơ kon adruh Babilôn.

English: “The king of Babylon has heard the report about them, And his hands grow feeble; Anguish has taken hold of him, Pangs as of a woman in childbirth.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn kơtơ̆ng ang gah lu sư, na ti sư rơdu rơreh rơrônh; Pơtao hli tơrơ, jơhngơ̆m sư jĭ tuĕnh thoi drŏ-kăn jĭ tơpŭ.

English: “Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan Against the dwelling place of the strong; But I will make them suddenly run away from her. And who is a chosen man that I may appoint over her? For who is like Me? Who will arraign Me? And who is that shepherd Who will withstand Me?”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, thoi dăm-brang lĕch dơng bri kơdrơ̆ng đak Krong Jôrđăn, drong blah anih tơmăn 'nhĕt 'lơ̆ng. Pă 'biơ̆, Inh gô puh lu bơngai Kalđê lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char. Ưh kơ tam băt Inh gô pôk bơngai pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư kiơ̆ thoi Inh lăp đon. Hăm đei bu thoi Inh, bu kĕ blah Inh? Bơngai wei triu ayơ pơ̆n blah Inh?

English: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD that He has taken against Babylon, And His purposes that He has proposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out; Surely He will make their dwelling place desolate with them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, mơ̆ng bĕ tơdă Kră Yang đei hơmet boih wă pơrăm dêh char Babilôn, păng tơdrong sư pơkă wă pơm kơ dêh char bơngai Kalđê. Mă lu kon triu iĕ đe kư̆m rôp ba đĭ đe gô pơrăm đĭ tơmăn 'nhĕt jing bri.

English: At the noise of the taking of Babylon The earth trembles, And the cry is heard among the nations.
Bahnar: Tơdah kơtơ̆ng ang đe blah iŏk dêh char Babilôn, teh pơpơ̆, Kơtơ̆ng krao ôr dêh tơ jơ̆p kơ dêh char.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, Against those who dwell in Leb Kamai, A destroying wind.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô puh kial năm pơlôch pơrăm dêh char Babilôn, hăm lu bơngai oei lăm char Lep Kamai.a

English: And I will send winnowers to Babylon, Who shall winnow her and empty her land. For in the day of doom They shall be against her all around.
Bahnar: Inh gô wơh lu bơngai tơmoi năm um hŭt Babilôn. Lu sư pơrăm char noh pơchah pơchek. Lu sư năm wang blah Babilôn dơ̆ng puăn pah, lăm năr pơmat-tat.

English: Against her let the archer bend his bow, And lift himself up against her in his armor. Do not spare her young men; Utterly destroy all her army.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ linh chĕp hră gŭt hră sư, 'nĕ ăn kơ sư hrŭk hơmet ao mam. 'Nĕ mơnat kơ lu tơdăm; athei pơlôch pơrăm bĕ đĭ-đăng lu linh sư.

English: Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, And those thrust through in her streets.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch lăm char bơngai Kalđê, bơngai rơka pơ̆k lôch tơ rok trong pơlei.

English: For Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah, By his God, the LORD of hosts, Though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh ưh kơ achăng lê̆ ôh lu bơngai Isơrael hăm lu bơngai Juđa. Mă-lei char Babilônb 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong yoch blah plơ̆ Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: Flee from the midst of Babylon, And every one save his life! Do not be cut off in her iniquity, For this is the time of the LORD’s vengeance; He shall recompense her.
Bahnar: Kơdâu lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng dêh char Babilôn, rim 'nu athei kơdâu wă pơklaih tơdrong arih kơdih akâu. 'Nĕ kơ lôch răm ôh yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư. Yua kơ trŏ boih năr Kră Yang pơm tơwih, Sư gô pơm tơwih trŏ thoi đe noh pơm boih

English: Babylon was a golden cup in the LORD’s hand, That made all the earth drunk. The nations drank her wine; Therefore the nations are deranged.
Bahnar: Babilôn jơ̆ minh kơchŏk maih lăm ti Kră Yang, Pơm ăn jơ̆p kơ teh đak suai; Lu dêh char huch sik hơmu Babilôn, thoi noh lu sư jing wơnh.

English: Babylon has suddenly fallen and been destroyed. Wail for her! Take balm for her pain; Perhaps she may be healed.
Bahnar: Ưh tam kơ băt dêh char Babilôn hơlih păk pơchah. Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ kơ sư! Iŏk bĕ pơgang pik kơ rơka sư, rŏ lăng sư gô klaih.

English: We would have healed Babylon, But she is not healed. Forsake her, and let us go everyone to his own country; For her judgment reaches to heaven and is lifted up to the skies.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n adrin ming pơklaih dêh char Babilôn, Mă-lei sư ưh kơ kĕ klaih. Lê̆ sư loh, lu bơ̆n bu bu brŏk bĕ tơ char kơdih, tơdrong phak sư tih dêh tŏk truh tơ plĕnh, Kơjung truh tơ hơmơ̆l kok.

English: The LORD has revealed our righteousness. Come and let us declare in Zion the work of the LORD our God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm tơwih ăn boih kơ bơ̆n. Năm bĕ bơ̆n athei ră roi tơ lăm Siôn, Tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n pơm!

English: Make the arrows bright! Gather the shields! The LORD has raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes. For His plan is against Babylon to destroy it, Because it is the vengeance of the LORD, The vengeance for His temple.
Bahnar: Maih bĕ 'brơ̆m tah 'bĕnh kơ jŏ chĕp bĕ khêl, Kră Yang pơdrŭt jơhngơ̆m lu pơtao char Mêđi, Iung blah dêh char Babilôn, Trŏ kơ Kră Yang pơlôch pơrăm sư. 'Nâu boih Kră Yang pơm tơwih. Sư pơm 'mong kơ hnam Sư.

English: Set up the standard on the walls of Babylon; Make the guard strong, Set up the watchmen, Prepare the ambushes. For the LORD has both devised and done What He spoke against the inhabitants of Babylon.
Bahnar: Hơtŏk hla-kơ iung blah dur pơlei tih Babilôn. Ăn thim bĕ linh gak tơ rim anih gak Ăn bĕ kơ lu linh răp! Kră Yang pơkă boih wă pơm, Sư gô pơm tơdrong kiơ Sư khan boih kơ koh char Babilôn.

English: O you who dwell by many waters, Abundant in treasures, Your end has come, The measure of your covetousness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei jê̆ tơ lơ thong đak krong. Iĕm mơdrŏng đei lơ hnam tah tơmam gĭt, Năr tôch kơ ih truh boih, trŏ boih kơ chăl đe wă pơrăm chăl arih ih, khei 'năr ih arih kơtĕch boih.

English: The LORD of hosts has sworn by Himself: “Surely I will fill you with men, as with locusts, And they shall lift up a shout against you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh yua anăn Sư kơdih na pơkă pơkăm: “Inh gô ăn sĭt lu linh 'bĕnh-'bang kơ dêh char thoi lep tung-nut, Lu sư ôr tơkĕch jreo jei boih tơ jơ̆p-jang anih.

English: He has made the earth by His power; He has established the world by His wisdom, And stretched out the heaven by His understanding.
Bahnar: Kră Yang boih Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ teh hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư. Sư yua tơdrong hơgei Sư pơjing kơ teh đak kơjăp păng yua tơdrong gơh băt sư bơyar plĕnh.

English: When He utters His voice— There is a multitude of waters in the heavens: “He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; He makes lightnings for the rain; He brings the wind out of His treasuries.”
Bahnar: Tơdah Sư pơma, đei jơwa lu đak tơ plĕnh pơpơ̆; Sư ăn kơ hơyuh đak tŏk đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh. Sư ăn kơmlat hơdai hăm đak 'mi, tơlĕch kial đơ̆ng lăm anih 'mong sư.

English: Everyone is dull-hearted, without knowledge; Every metalsmith is put to shame by the carved image; For his molded image is falsehood, And there is no breath in them.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu bơngai jing bơlŭk ưh kơ băt tơdrong kiơ: Lu bơngai hling rup yang hăm maih gô mơlâu đơ̆ng rup yang sư, yua kơ rup lu sư man ưh kơ sĭt chă hơlĕnh đĕch, ưh kơ đei kial dui jơhngơ̆m.

English: They are futile, a work of errors; In the time of their punishment they shall perish.
Bahnar: Lu rup mă ưh kơ yua, noh tơmam hiap pơtê̆ chă hơlĕnh đĕch; truh năr sek tơlang gô pơrăm.

English: The Portion of Jacob is not like them, For He is the Maker of all things; And Israel is the tribe of His inheritance. The LORD of hosts is His name.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp ưh kơ thoi lu noh, yua kơ Sư boih Tơ'ngla pơjing tôm tơmam. Adrĕch adrung Isơrael jing tơmam gĭt Sư. Anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: “You are My battle-ax and weapons of war: For with you I will break the nation in pieces; With you I will destroy kingdoms
Bahnar: Ih boih mut, tơmam Inh yua wă tơblah, Inh yua ih wă teh pơchah lu kon pơlei păng pơrăm đĭ dêh char.

English: With you I will break in pieces the horse and its rider; With you I will break in pieces the chariot and its rider
Bahnar: Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu linh hao aseh păng aseh, wă teh pơrăm gre aseh păng bơngai hao.

English: With you also I will break in pieces man and woman; With you I will break in pieces old and young; With you I will break in pieces the young man and the maiden
Bahnar: Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu kră drŏ-nglo păng lu drŏ-nglo mơlôh. Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu tơdăm păng lu hơdruh.

English: With you also I will break in pieces the shepherd and his flock; With you I will break in pieces the farmer and his yoke of oxen; And with you I will break in pieces governors and rulers.
Bahnar: Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm bơngai wei triu păng khŭl triu sư, Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu bơngai choh mir păng đôi rơmo sư. Inh yua ih wă teh pơrăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r tơring.

English: “And I will repay Babylon And all the inhabitants of Chaldea For all the evil they have done In Zion in your sight,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm tơwih kơ dêh char Babilôn păng đĭ-đăng bơngai oei lăm char Kalđê 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm yua kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm boih lăm pơlei Siôn.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain, Who destroys all the earth,” says the LORD. “And I will stretch out My hand against you, Roll you down from the rocks, And make you a burnt mountain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ kông ngăl pơrăm, 'nâu Inh pơrăm ih, ih boih mă pơrăm đĭ-đăng teh đak! Inh gô yơ̆r ti pơm kơ ih, tơlơ̆ ih đơ̆ng tơmo cheng kông, pơm ăn kơ ih jing thoi kông ŭnh sa khôi ngơr.

English: They shall not take from you a stone for a corner Nor a stone for a foundation, But you shall be desolate forever,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu iŏk minh pôm tơmo tih đơ̆ng ih wă pơm jrăng mum hnam, dah tuh pơm hơnă, Ih gô jing juơ tơtŭng ling-lang hlŏng hloi. Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: Set up a banner in the land, Blow the trumpet among the nations! Prepare the nations against her, Call the kingdoms together against her: Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz. Appoint a general against her; Cause the horses to come up like the bristling locusts.
Bahnar: Hơtol bĕ hla-kơ tơ lăm lu teh đak; hlôm bĕ tơgiĕp tơ jơ̆p kơ dêh char; Hơmet dêh char năm blah sư, Krao pơtơm bĕ lu dêh char Ararat, Mini păng Askenas năm blah sư. Pôk pơjing bĕ yŏng linh! Chông ba bĕ aseh mă lơ năm blah thoi lep tung-nut jơ̆p kơ teh.

English: Prepare against her the nations, With the kings of the Medes, Its governors and all its rulers, All the land of his dominion.
Bahnar: Hơmet krao bĕ lu dêh char năm blah sư, Lu pơtao dêh char Mêđi hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, lu kuan tih păng đĭ-đăng lu dêh char mă lu sư pơgơ̆r!

English: And the land will tremble and sorrow; For every purpose of the LORD shall be performed against Babylon, To make the land of Babylon a desolation without inhabitant.
Bahnar: Teh đak pơpơ̆ pơpol, yua kơ Kră Yang wă pơm. Pơm kơ dêh char Babilôn jing char glă, Ưh pă đei bơngai oei.

English: The mighty men of Babylon have ceased fighting, They have remained in their strongholds; Their might has failed, They became like women; They have burned her dwelling places, The bars of her gate are broken.
Bahnar: Lu linh dêh char Babilôn pơdơh tơblah, ôn akâu lu sư lăm kơđông kơjăp. Lu sư rơmơ̆n, jing thoi drŏ-kăn. Hnam lu sư đe soh đĭ, chơkăl 'măng jang lu pơlei sư tơgơ̆ boih.

English: One runner will run to meet another, And one messenger to meet another, To show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on all sides
Bahnar: Bơngai năm roi kơdâu năm tơ'bơ̆p bơngai năm roi. Minh 'nu bơngai năm tơbăt tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai tơbăt, Roi tơbăt ăn kơ pơtao Babilôn khan pơlei tih pơtao đe blah iŏk boih.

English: The passages are blocked, The reeds they have burned with fire, And the men of war are terrified.
Bahnar: Đak krong, lu anih đơ̆ng juăt tŏk đe blah iŏk boih, lu anih trâp hlŭt đe soh boih, Lu linh tơblah hli tơrơ.”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor When it is time to thresh her; Yet a little while And the time of her harvest will come.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Đĭ-đăng bơngai Babilôn thoi dơnih đe pơjuă 'ba, trŏ bơyan đe pơjuă 'ba; ưh pă đunh boih bơyan yuă 'ba wă truh kơ sư.

English: “Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon Has devoured me, he has crushed me; He has made me an empty vessel, He has swallowed me up like a monster; He has filled his stomach with my delicacies, He has spit me out.
Bahnar: Nebukatnessar pơtao Babilôn luăn sa inh boih, sư pơjuă inh hĕch hoch; sư huet inh 'biao thoi gŏ hoh, Luăn sa inh thoi yă-grai sa tơmam 'lơ̆ng inh 'bĕnh kơ klak sư; Na hăk lê̆ inh.

English: Let the violence done to me and my flesh be upon Babylon,” The inhabitant of Zion will say; “And my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea!” Jerusalem will say.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Siôn khan: ‘Rŏ kơ tơdrong mă đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh păng adrĕch adrung inh tuh kơ Babilôn.’ Kon pơlei Jêrusalem khan: ‘Rŏ kơ pham inh tuh tơ kon pơlei Kalđê!’ ”

English: Therefore thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will plead your case and take vengeance for you. I will dry up her sea and make her springs dry.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang khan: “'Nâu Inh gô dŏng ih, Inh pơm tơwih kơ lu ayăt kơ ih. Inh gô pơhrơ̆ lê̆ đak dơsĭ sư, Ăn kơ rim tu đak sư hrơ̆ kro.

English: Babylon shall become a heap, A dwelling place for jackals, An astonishment and a hissing, Without an inhabitant.
Bahnar: Babilôn gô jing rơ̆m rĕch, Jing anih kơ lu kŏ bri oei, Anih juơ rơhiăng, ưh pă đei bơngai oei tơ noh. Bu rok trong noh lăng krưp chơbơle.

English: They shall roar together like lions, They shall growl like lions’ whelps.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei ôr hơdai thoi dăm-brang, grĕnh thoi dăm-brang kon.”

English: In their excitement I will prepare their feasts; I will make them drunk, That they may rejoice, And sleep a perpetual sleep And not awake,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Kơplah lu sư grĕnh hơnganh dêh, Inh gô hơmet ăn kơ lu sư sŏng sa tih, et suai, hiôk chơt, lê̆ lu sư tep hiôk hloi ling-lang, ưh pă hơdrơ̆r dơ̆ng: Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: “I will bring them down Like lambs to the slaughter, Like rams with male goats.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông ba lu sư tơ anih đe 'bet pơlôch pơm 'nhĕm, thoi triu tơno thoi bơbe tơno.

English: “Oh, how Sheshach is taken! Oh, how the praise of the whole earth is seized! How Babylon has become desolate among the nations!
Bahnar: Sêsach đe blah iŏk boih pơlei tih mă đĭ-đăng teh đak ư-ang đe kư̆m blah iŏk boih! Babilôn jing juơ tơtŭng kơ lu dêh char, lăng krưp.

English: The sea has come up over Babylon; She is covered with the multitude of its waves.
Bahnar: Đak dơsĭ tŏk; đak dơsĭ poh-yă lơ̆p klơ̆p đĭ boih Babilôn.

English: Her cities are a desolation, A dry land and a wilderness, A land where no one dwells, Through which no son of man passes.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei sư jing juơ, Teh đak Babilôn hrĕng kro jing juơ ưh pă đei bơngai oei, Kŭm ưh kơ đei bơngai bu chă yak drong găn.

English: I will punish Bel in Babylon, And I will bring out of his mouth what he has swallowed; And the nations shall not stream to him anymore. Yes, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
Bahnar: Inh gô phak yang Bel lăm pơlei Babilôn, athei sư hăk lê̆ tơmam mă đêl sư luăn boih; Lu kon pơlei ưh pă đei pơtơm băl năm kơkuh dơ̆ng, Mă dur Babilôn gô hơlih pơchah đĭ!

English: “My people, go out of the midst of her! And let everyone deliver himself from the fierce anger of the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Inh, kơdâu lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng Babilôn pơklaih kơdih akâu bĕ, weh đơ̆ng tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl!

English: And lest your heart faint, And you fear for the rumor that will be heard in the land (A rumor will come one year, And after that, in another year A rumor will come, And violence in the land, Ruler against ruler)
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ ơh klai, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hli tơrơ mă kơtơ̆ng đe roi lăm teh đak âu. Sơnăm âu, đe roi thoi âu sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng kơtơ̆ng đe roi thoi to. Tơdrong pơm tơwih băl lăm teh đak, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r gô tơgar băl pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r tơ'bet pơlôch băl.

English: Therefore behold, the days are coming That I will bring judgment on the carved images of Babylon; Her whole land shall be ashamed, And all her slain shall fall in her midst.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, gô đei năr, Inh phak lu rup yang dêh char Babilôn; jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô mơlâu kơdơ̆; lu bơngai đe gô 'bet pơlôch pơ̆k lăm đĭ dêh char.

English: Then the heavens and the earth and all that is in them Shall sing joyously over Babylon; For the plunderers shall come to her from the north,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh plĕnh, teh păng đĭ-đăng tơmam tơ plĕnh lăm teh, gô hơri chơt hiôk kơ Babilôn, yua kơ linh pơlôch pơrăm năm đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m wă năm blah pơrăm dêh char Babilôn,” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: As Babylon has caused the slain of Israel to fall, So at Babylon the slain of all the earth shall fall.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Babilôn gô pơ̆k lôch yua kơ sư 'bet pơlôch boih kon pơlei Isơrael. Kŭm thoi, sư 'bet pơlôch kon pơlei pơ̆k tơ jơ̆p lăm teh đak.

English: You who have escaped the sword, Get away! Do not stand still! Remember the LORD afar off, And let Jerusalem come to your mind.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm klaih boih đơ̆ng đao gưm, kơdâu bĕ, 'nĕ pă dơ̆ng! 'Blŏk bĕ kơ Kră Yang đơ̆ng dêh char ataih, tơchĕng 'blŏk bĕ kơ pơlei Jêrusalem lăm kơ̆l 'ngok.

English: We are ashamed because we have heard reproach. Shame has covered our faces, For strangers have come into the sanctuaries of the LORD’s house.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn mơlâu dêh, yua kơ đe pơjăm pơjuă lu nhôn, tơdrong mơlâu gom 'bĕnh kơ muh măt lu nhôn. Yua kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mơ̆t boih lăm Anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Kră Yang.”

English: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “That I will bring judgment on her carved images, And throughout all her land the wounded shall groan.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gô đei năr, truh tơpă Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô phak pơrăm lu rup yang đe Babilôn, jơ̆p kơ teh đak, lu bơngai rơka gô ôr tơngưih.

English: Though Babylon were to mount up to heaven, And though she were to fortify the height of her strength, Yet from Me plunderers would come to her,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă khan dêh char Babilôn tih kơjung hơtŏ kơ plĕnh, mă sư man dur pơm kơđông kơjăp. Inh gô ăn lu bơngai năm blah pơrăm pơlôch sư.” Noh Kră Yang khan.

English: The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, And great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans
Bahnar: “Mơ̆ng bĕ! Đei nơ̆r ôr hmoi đơ̆ng dêh char Babilôn! Nơ̆r jơwa re đe pơrăm tih dêh đơ̆ng char Kalđê.

English: Because the LORD is plundering Babylon And silencing her loud voice, Though her waves roar like great waters, And the noise of their voice is uttered
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơlôch pơrăm dêh char Babilôn, jơwa re lu bơngai ayăt truh thoi jơwa đak tih. Đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư ôr kơtang dêh.

English: Because the plunderer comes against her, against Babylon, And her mighty men are taken. Every one of their bows is broken; For the LORD is the God of recompense, He will surely repay.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơlôch pơrăm năm blah boih pơlei Babilôn; đe rôp boih lu linh pran kơtang sư, hră lu sư gơ̆ lê̆ rơkhai; Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơwih trŏ thoi tơdrong lu sư pơm boih, Kră Yang gô pơm tơwih tơpă.

English: “And I will make drunk Her princes and wise men, Her governors, her deputies, and her mighty men. And they shall sleep a perpetual sleep And not awake,” says the King, Whose name is the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Yŏng Pơtao, anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô ăn kơ lu yŏng wei-lăng păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r hơgei, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char păng yŏng pơgơ̆r tơring hăm lu linh sư gô suai sik, tep ling-lang, ưh pă kĕ iung dơ̆ng.”

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: “The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, And her high gates shall be burned with fire; The people will labor in vain, And the nations, because of the fire; And they shall be weary.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Dur pơlei Babilôn hơ'bơ̆l, đe gô teh tơlơ̆ hơlih păk đĭ tơ teh, Lu 'măng jang sư kơjung ră, đe gô soh sa đĭ; kon pơlei gleh hrat mă ưh kơ yua kiơ, lu adrĕch adrung bơ̆jang gleh lap ăn kơ ŭnh sa đĕch.”

English: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And Seraiah was the quartermaster.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Jêrêmi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơtă ăn kơ Sêraia, kon drŏ-nglo Nêria, sâu Mahseia kơplah sư năm tơ char Babilôn hơdai hăm Sêđekia, pơtao dêh char Juđa lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl sư pơgơ̆r. Kơplah noh Sêraia bơngai tơgŭm pơtao.

English: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that would come upon Babylon, all these words that are written against Babylon.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi chih lăm minh sơnôm hla bơar dôm tơdrong răm wă truh kơ dêh char Babilôn, chih dôm nơ̆r roi gah dêh char Babilôn.

English: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you arrive in Babylon and see it, and read all these words
Bahnar: Jêrêmi khan kơ Sêraia: Tơdah ih truh tơ char Babilôn, ih athei đŏk mă re nơ̆r 'nâu.

English: then you shall say, ‘O LORD, You have spoken against this place to cut it off, so that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but it shall be desolate forever.’
Bahnar: Na ih athei krao khan: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, Ih khan boih Ih wă pơlôch pơrăm dêh char 'nâu, dĭng mă ưh pă đei bơngai oei dơ̆ng, mă lu kon sem brem kư̆m ưh, na anih 'nâu gô jing juơ ling-lang.’

English: Now it shall be, when you have finished reading this book, that you shall tie a stone to it and throw it out into the Euphrates.
Bahnar: Mưh ih đŏk sơnôm hla bơar 'nâu đang boih ih iŏk minh pôm tơmo chô̆ lăm hơdai sơnôm hla bơar 'nâu na klơ̆m sư tơ lăm đak Krong Ơphrat.

English: Then you shall say, ‘Thus Babylon shall sink and not rise from the catastrophe that I will bring upon her. And they shall be weary.’ ” Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
Bahnar: Păng athei khan: Dêh char Babilôn gô huŏng môch thoi noh! Ưh pă đei layơ đông dơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh ăn tơdrong truh pơrăm sư, lu kon pơlei gô pơ̆k huŏng.’ ” Nơ̆r Jêrêmi pơma tôch 'bơ̆t dâu.

English: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Bahnar: Sêđekia pơtơm pơm pơtao kơplah sư 'bar-jĭt mônh sơnăm; sư pơgơ̆r mơjĭt-mônh sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem. Mĕ sư anăn Hamuta kon drŏ-kăn Jêrêmi đơ̆ng pơlei Lipna.

English: He also did evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơnê̆ dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi Jêhôiakim đei pơm.

English: For because of the anger of the LORD this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, till He finally cast them out from His presence. Then Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Bahnar: Noh Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư pơm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng tơ lăm dêh char Juđa, na Sư puh tơweh lu pơtao noh đơ̆ng anăp Sư. Sêđekia iung blah pơtao Babilôn.

English: Now it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem and encamped against it; and they built a siege wall against it all around.
Bahnar: Na năr mơjĭt khei mơjĭt, lăm sơnăm mă tơsĭn chăl Sêđekia pơgơ̆r, Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, chông ba đĭ linh sư năm blah Jêrusalem, lu sư pơm bơsŭn, lu sư bơ̆ teh wă tŏk wang tăp wă blah iŏk pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: So the city was besieged until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
Bahnar: Đe wang pơlei Jêrusalem ling-lang dĭng truh sơnăm mă mơjĭt-mônh chăl pơtao Sêđekia pơgơ̆r.

English: By the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the famine had become so severe in the city that there was no food for the people of the land.
Bahnar: Truh năr tơsĭn khei puăn lăm sơnăm noh, đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt tih lăm pơlei truh tơ kon pơlei oei lăm noh tơmam sa pă đei.

English: Then the city wall was broken through, and all the men of war fled and went out of the city at night by way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden, even though the Chaldeans were near the city all around. And they went by way of the plain.
Bahnar: Dur pơlei đe bŏk bơlih hlôh, Sêđekia 'bôh sư hăm lu linh sư kơdâu klĕnh kơmăng lĕch rok trong 'măng jang sơlam dur jê̆ pơgar pơkao pơtao; kơplah lu bơngai Kalđê oei wang pơlei, lu sư kơdâu lĕch yak klă tơ gah thŭng Arabah.

English: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and they overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. All his army was scattered from him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu linh bơngai Kalđê druh pơtao Sêđekia tam rôp sư tơ lăm tơmăn dơnă Jêrikô, na lu linh sư kơdâu tơklah tơklang achăng lê̆ pơtao hơdrô̆.

English: So they took the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, and he pronounced judgment on him.
Bahnar: Lu linh bơngai Kalđê rôp pơtao Sêđekia păng năm ba tơ pơtao Babilôn, tơ pơlei Riblah, lăm tơring Hamat, tơ noh pơtao Babilôn sek tơlang sư.

English: Then the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. And he killed all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn pơlôch lu kon drŏ-nglo Sêđekia 'bơ̆t tơm măt sư păng kư̆m pơlôch lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char Juđa mă kiơ̆ sư 'bơ̆t pơlei Riblah.

English: He also put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in bronze fetters, took him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao Babilôn kuek lê̆ 'bar pah măt Sêđekia, chô̆ sư hăm glang kong, chông ba sư tơ Babilôn, tah sư lăm hnam phak dĭng truh năr sư lôch.

English: Now in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month (which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon), Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, who served the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Năr mơjĭt khei pơđăm, lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơsĭn chăl Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, na Nêbusar Adan, yŏng pơgơ̆r linh gak pơtao Babilôn, mơ̆t lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: He burned the house of the LORD and the king’s house; all the houses of Jerusalem, that is, all the houses of the great, he burned with fire.
Bahnar: Sư athei đe soh hnam Kră Yang, hăm hnam pơtao păng đĭ-đăng hnam lăm pơlei Jêrusalem. Mă lu hnam kuan tih oei ŭnh sa đĭ.

English: And all the army of the Chaldeans who were with the captain of the guard broke down all the walls of Jerusalem all around.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Kalđê mă năm hơdai yŏng linh gak pơtao, năm pơrăm teh pơchah đĭ dur tăp pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive some of the poor people, the rest of the people who remained in the city, the defectors who had deserted to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the craftsmen.
Bahnar: Nêbusar Adan yŏng linh gak pơtao chông ba pơm bơnă lu bơngai dơnuh hin lu kon pơlei mă oei arih lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng bơngai kơdâu mơ̆t tơ gah pơtao Babilôn; păng đĭ lu thơ̆ hơgei oei arih.

English: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left some of the poor of the land as vinedressers and farmers.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Nêbusar Adan, yŏng linh gak, pơtao oei lê̆ lăi lu bơngai dơnuh hin tơ lăm teh đak sư, wă kơ lu sư pơtăm wei-lăng mir hơmu păng jang mir 'ba.

English: The bronze pillars that were in the house of the LORD, and the carts and the bronze Sea that were in the house of the LORD, the Chaldeans broke in pieces, and carried all their bronze to Babylon.
Bahnar: Linh bơngai Kalđê teh pơrăm đĭ jrăng kong lăm hnam Kră Yang, bơng đak tih đe krao dơsĭ hling păng kong hăm jơ̆ng đei tang-wang wă tŭn sư đơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang, đơ̆ng noh chĕp ba đĭ kong noh tơ char Babilôn.

English: They also took away the pots, the shovels, the trimmers, the bowls, the spoons, and all the bronze utensils with which the priests ministered.
Bahnar: Lu gŏ, gơ'bênh, săng kep, pơnhan, mong pham chơ'mŏng păng lu tơmam yua nai pơm păng kong yua lăm hnam Kră Yang lu sư kư̆m tung ba đĭ.

English: The basins, the firepans, the bowls, the pots, the lampstands, the spoons, and the cups, whatever was solid gold and whatever was solid silver, the captain of the guard took away.
Bahnar: Nêbusar Adan yŏng linh kư̆m iŏk lu pơnhan mong pham wă tơtreh, chhĕr dan ngar, kơthao, gŏ, chhĕr dan tơmam 'bâu phu, gơhnŏk wă huch sa tơmam pơyơ̆r, đĭ-đăng tơmam noh đe pơm păng maih rơgoh păng hu rơgoh.

English: The two pillars, one Sea, the twelve bronze bulls which were under it, and the carts, which King Solomon had made for the house of the LORD—the bronze of all these articles was beyond measure.
Bahnar: Bĕ kơ 'bar tŏ jrăng kong, bơng đak đak dơsĭ păng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rup rơmo tơno pơm păng kong tơ ala, jơ̆ng dan bơng đei tang-wang wă tŭn mă pơtao Sôlômôn pơm lăm hnam Kră Yang. Kong mă đe pơm đĭ-đăng lu tơmam noh ưh pă kĕ kŏng ôh.

English: Now concerning the pillars: the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits, a measuring line of twelve cubits could measure its circumference, and its thickness was four fingers; it was hollow.
Bahnar: Jrăng kơjung sư mơjĭt-tơhngam hơgăt, tih hơpôm sư mơjĭt-'bar hơgăt; đei trôm tŏk-bŏk, hơ'bơ̆l sư puăn kơpơ̆t.

English: A capital of bronze was on it; and the height of one capital was five cubits, with a network and pomegranates all around the capital, all of bronze. The second pillar, with pomegranates was the same.
Bahnar: Đe pơm kơ̆l jrăng păng kong, kơjung pơđăm hơgăt. Tăp dăr sư chuă hơdrao păng hling rup plei gărnăt, đĭ-đăng đe hling păng đak kong ngăl; kơ̆l jrăng mă minh kơ̆l jrăng mă 'bar đe pơm lei-lăi, kư̆m đei hling plei gărnăt.

English: There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; all the pomegranates, all around on the network, were one hundred.
Bahnar: Tăp dăr puăn pah đei tơsĭn-jĭt tơdrâu tŏ rup plei gărnăt jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu rup plei gărnăt tăp dăr đei minh-hrĕng tŏ rok trong hơdrao đe chuă.

English: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the second priest, and the three doorkeepers.
Bahnar: Yŏng linh gak pơtao rôp Sêraia 'bok soi tơm, Sephania 'bok soi mă 'bar păng pêng 'nu yŏng wei 'măng jang hnam kơ Kră Yang.

English: He also took out of the city an officer who had charge of the men of war, seven men of the king’s close associates who were found in the city, the principal scribe of the army who mustered the people of the land, and sixty men of the people of the land who were found in the midst of the city.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei rôp lăm pơlei minh 'nu yŏng linh tơblah, tơpơh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo jang pơđâu hơdai pơtao, minh 'nu chih hla bơar kơ yŏng khŭl linh, păng đei tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu kon pơlei Juđa đơ̆ng hai, kư̆m 'bôh lăm pơlei ei.

English: And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took these and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
Bahnar: Nêbusar Adan yŏng linh gak pơtao rôp lu bơngai âu păng chông ba lu sư tơ pơtao Babilôn tơ pơlei Riblah.

English: Then the king of Babylon struck them and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. Thus Judah was carried away captive from its own land.
Bahnar: Pơtao Babilôn athei đe pơlôch lu sư tơ pơlei Riblah lăm tơring Hamat. Thoi noh boih đe rôp chông ba lu bơngai Juđa pơm bơnă lăm char đe nai.

English: These are the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year, three thousand and twenty-three Jews
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon pơlei mă Nebukatnessar rôp chông ba pơm bơnă; pêng-rơbâu 'bar-jĭt pêng 'nu bơngai Juđa lăm sơnăm mă tơpơh.

English: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred and thirty-two persons
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơhngam chăl Nebukatnessar pơgơ̆r, sư rôp chông ba pơm bơnă đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem tơhngam-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred and forty-five persons. All the persons were four thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt pêng chăl pơtao Nebukatnessar pơgơ̆r, Nêbusar Adan yŏng linh gak pơtao rôp chông ba pơm bơnă tơpơh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm 'nu bơngai Juđa, jô̆ đĭ-đăng noh puăn-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai.

English: Now it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of the month, that Evil-Merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah and brought him out of prison.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pêng-jĭt tơpơh sơnăm Jêhôiachin pơtao Juđa pơm bơnă, lăm năr 'bar-jĭt pơđăm, khei mơjĭt-'bar Êwil Mêrôđak pơtao Babilôn lăm sơnăm sư 'nao pơgơ̆r, plôh tơlĕch Jêhôiachin pơtao đe Juđa đơ̆ng hnam bơnă.

English: And he spoke kindly to him and gave him a more prominent seat than those of the kings who were with him in Babylon.
Bahnar: Sư pơma rơngơp hăm Jêhôiachin, pôk sư hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anih pơyom hloh kơ lu pơtao nai oei hơdai hăm sư lăm char Babilôn.

English: So Jehoiachin changed from his prison garments, and he ate bread regularly before the king all the days of his life.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Jêhôiachin plôh lê̆ ao bơnă sư, kơplah sư oei arih sư sŏng sa hơdai ling-lang hăm pơtao.

English: And as for his provisions, there was a regular ration given him by the king of Babylon, a portion for each day until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
Bahnar: Gah tơmam sư, pơtao ăn kơ sư tôm mah rim năr truh tơ sư lôch. Jêhôiachin oei arih dang yơ, lei pơtao Babilôn ăn tơmam kăl yua ling-lang, dĭng đĭ chăl arih sư.
